revision.text:
{{SpoilH|3}}{{Item|title=1965 Harley Davidson|image=543066377o.jpg|type=Vehicle|source=Earth|imagecaption=A genuine 1965 Harley Davidson FLH Electra Glide}} When [[Carl]] was a kid, [[Carl's Father]]'s most prized possession was a red and beige '''1965 Harley Davidson FLH Panhead Electra Glide''' motorcycle with a small dent on the gas tank. ==Story== The same specific 1965 Harley Davidson motorcycle appears on Chaco's [[Prize Carousel|Prize Carousel]] on the [[Fourth Floor|fourth floor]]. Carl is unable to focus on the other prizes as he remembers how he had slipped on the driveway and accidentally dented the motorcycle's tank, and how his father had lashed him bloody with a belt in retaliation. Ultimately, Carl selects a different prize.{{ref|3|7}} {{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler = Carl and [[Donut]] find the same motorcycle outside his father's trailer on the [[Eighth Floor]]. The leather seat is cracked and the Georgia plates are years out of date, but the tank is full. Carl adds both the motorcycle and its keys to his inventory.{{Ref|6|45}} }} ==References== [[Category:Vehicles]]
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Earth Items]]

{{Citation}} {{Group|image1=File:00401.jpg|part_of=Dungeion [[Third Floor]]|type=Cult|base_location=The Over City|first=Book 2|members=* Vincente * Salvatore * Carmine}} '''The 201st Security Group Militia''' is a [[Elf|City Elf]] organisation dedicated to [[Apito|Apito]] the Oak Mother. They run the Apito Education Centre and in their off time double as door guards.
They believed that [[Donut]] is the Oakfel, Apito's version of the Anti-Christ that is prophesied to unravel the heavens and kill all the gods, all because she was wearing the [[Enchanted Anklet of the Fallen Oak]]. They also mistakenly believe the [[Skyfowl]] are angels and worship them accordingly.
They tortured and murdered [[GumGum]] after she investigated the dead prostitutes that started appearing.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Dungeon Organizations]] [[Category:Floor 3]]

'''Acute Ears''' is a skill and crawler interface enhancement for the Minimap. At base level, it improves a crawler's hearing and allows the crawler to see more mobs on their minimap.
At level 3, when the crawler sees a red dot on the minimap, the crawler can identify (with "somewhat-reliable" accuracy) the mob's size and whether it's a type of mob they've seen before.<ref>{{ref|2|13}}</ref>
<small><references/></small> [[Category:Skills]][[Category:Donut]][[Category:Interface Enhancements]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}{{Character_info | origin = [[Dungeon]] | first_appearance = Book 6, Prologue | species = God }}
In [[Dungeon]] lore, '''Adad''' is a mountainous storm god capable of summoning clouds of lightning-shooting bugs.<ref name=":0">{{ref|6|prologue}}</ref>
== History == During [[Mordecai]]'s crawl, he used a [[Summoning Box]] to summon [[Dodola]] and Adad on the Tenth Floor. Adad was AI controlled.<ref name=":0"/>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Deities]][[Category:Characters]]

{{SpoilH | 6}} An '''Adjutant''' is a neutral third-party consultant and referee for [[Ninth Floor]] Faction Wars teams.<ref name=":0"/>
== Description == Each Faction has an adjutant, who in turn has open communications with other teams' adjutants. Their participation is generally symbolic; they are typically flashy, famous characters like [[Odette]] who are there to give a running commentary to viewers during their daily, on-air recaps.<ref name=":0">{{ref|6|21}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{ref|6|35}}</ref>
Adjutants have access to the expanded ruleset and limited ability to call out rule violations, although their behavior is heavily policed by the [[System AI]].<ref name=":2">{{ref|6|36}}</ref> While they are physically on the battlegrounds and can accompany the Warlords into battle, [[Zev]] believes that all adjutants are constantly under an invulnerability spell.<ref name=":0"/><ref name=":1"/>
Adjutants must pass a referee exam to be eligible.<ref name=":2"/>
== Known Adjutants (Current, Former, and Aspiring) == * [[Baroness Victory]] * [[Drick]] - aspiring. * [[Odette]] - former. * [[Ripper Wonton]]
== References == <references />
[[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]][[Category:Floor 9]]

{{Item|title=Adventurer's Box|type=Loot Box|source=Achievements}}
The Adventurer Box is a common [[:Category:Loot Boxes|loot box]] containing standard adventuring gear.
Bronze and Silver Adventurer Boxes are liberally distributed on the first two floors, and typically contained potions and bandages. Beginning on the [[Third Floor|Third]] or [[Fourth Floor]], "low-tier adventurer boxes" also began to include gold coins, clothing items, and unenchanted weapons.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 2).</ref> On the [[Fifth Floor]], [[Carl]] begins receiving hobgoblin dynamite and "[[Good Healing Potions]]" instead of standard potions in low-tier adventurer boxes.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'' (chapter 28).</ref>
==Bronze Adventurer Box== Bronze-colored and about half the size of a military foot locker, Bronze Adventurer Boxes are a common award for achievements. They typically contain two line items of loot.
===Sample Loot=== * Common Fingerless Gloves<ref name=":1">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 5).</ref> *Cowboy Hat<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 25).</ref> *[[Healing Potion|Potion of Healing]] x 1 <ref name=":1" /> *[[Healing Potion|Potion of Healing]] x 2 <ref name=":1" /> *[[Potion of Mana]] / Mana Restoration Potion *Torch (item, not spell) *Bandages, which stop '''bleed''' effect.<ref name=":2">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 25).</ref>
===Related Achievements===
*[[Empty Pockets|Empty pockets!]] *[[You’ve killed a mob a higher level than yourself!|You've killed a mob a higher level than yourself!]] *[[Oooh, Magic|Oooh, Magic!]] *unnamed achievement for looting a corpse for the first time<ref name=":3">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 8).</ref> *unnamed achievement for sharing experience<ref name=":3" />
==Silver Adventurer Box== Slightly larger than the Bronze Box and made of silver, the Silver Adventurer Box is a common award for achievements.
===Sample Loot ===
*Bracelet of +2 DEX<ref name=":2" /> *Crawler Biscuit x 100 <ref name=":1" /> *Pet Biscuits x 100 (quantity assumed) <ref name=":4">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 7).</ref> *Poison Antidote x 2 <ref name=":1" /> *Ring of +1 CON<ref name=":5" /> *[[Magic Missile|Tome of Magic Missile]] <ref name=":4" /> *Torch (item) x 20 <ref name=":1" />
=== Sample Loot (Floor 5+)=== *Good Healing Potion *Good Mana Potion *[[Potion of Invisibility|Invisibility Potion]] <ref name=":0" /> *[[Potion of Dinosaur Repellent|Potion of Dinosaur Repellant]] <ref name=":0" /> *[[Size up potion|Size-Up Potion]]<ref name=":6" />
=== Related Achievements===
*[[Early Adopter]] *unnamed achievement for finding your first safe room<ref name=":5">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 9).</ref> *sustaining damage while invulnerable<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'' (chapter 32).</ref>
==Gold Adventurer Box== '''This section does not contain spoilers for book 6, but may link to pages that do contain spoilers.'''
Carl does not specifically mention receiving a Gold Adventurer Box until ''[[The Eye of the Bedlam Bride (Book)|The Eye of the Bedlam Bride]]''. In the same book, Bronze and Silver Adventurer Boxes begin including [[Scroll of Build Trench|Scrolls of Build Trenches]] and [[Size up potion|Size-up Potions]].<ref name=":6">Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (chapter 49).</ref>
=== Sample Loot ===
*[[Good Healing Potion]] *[[Good Mana Potion]] *[[Potion of Phase Through Wall]] *[[Potion of Invisibility|Invisibility Potion]]
==Platinum Adventurer Box== A Platinum Adventure Box may be received up to (3) times by cashing in [[PVP Coupon|PVP coupons]].<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 18).</ref>
==References== <references />
[[Category:Loot Boxes]] {{Navbox Items}}

{{Character info | image1 = 00820.jpg | crawler_id = Agatha | crawler_# = 7,450. | class = None | species = Human | age = approx. 70 | aliases = Agent 22 | origin = Earth: Wenatchee, WA | occupation = None | first_appearance = Book 1, Chapter 22 | status = Alive (Presumed) | party = None | allies = [[Alexandro]] | eyes = Black | level = 4 | skills = * Invisibility * Intangibility | gear = * Shopping Cart * IKEA Bag * [[Valtay]] Trans Tunnel 7C Orator Relay (inter-tunnel communication device) * Valtay Perso-Shield Platinum Edition (personal tech shield) * Mag 3040 Valtay Pulse Pistol }}{{Quote | quote = “No need to fix m’squeak, boy. Them critters already know I’m here. They just don’t know what to do about it. You worry about you, and I worry about me."Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 426). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.}} '''Agatha''' appears to be a homeless human woman pushing a loaded-down shopping cart through the [[Dungeon]]. ==Description== Agatha entered the [[Dungeon]] in Wenatchee, WA, after starting a fire that forced the [[Meadow Lark]] eldercare facility to evacuate. As a result of the fire, some 250 emergency responders and Meadow Lark staff and residents survived the [[Transformation]] and entered the Dungeon.{{ref|1|22}} Although Agatha refuses to take the [[Tutorial]] or formally join the party, she hangs around the Meadow Lark survivors on the [[First Floor]] and even inserts herself into the Boss Battle against the [[Ball of Swine]]. [[Carl]] takes her shopping cart into his inventory for the duration of the fight. Irregularities crop up around her. She is deliberately edited out of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World: Earth]]'', and the camera feeds glitch when she's around. She refuses to take the [[Tutorial]] and, as Carl realizes when he examines his Inventory's "History" tab, has a shopping cart full of [[Valtay]] technology.{{ref|1|47}} ==Appearance== Agatha's skin is deeply wrinkled and her rheumy eyes are black. She is "wrapped head to toe in an endless amount of scarves," and a red-checkered trapper hat with ear flaps sits askew on her head. Her shopping cart appears to be brimming with blankets, clothing, spray paint, an IKEA bag, and a plastic pink flamingo with an arrow stuck in its head. The wheel squeaks slightly. ==History== {{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler =

A [[Residual]], Agent 22 peeled away from the collective and traveled to Earth with [[Alexandro | Agent 21]] ten years ago. She killed an [[Apothecary]] residual already on earth and assumed control of its body to secure access to the Apothecary's information feeds and equipment. For years now, she has gone by her human name, "Agatha."{{ref|6|epilogue}}

Agatha had planned to reach Seattle before the Transformation, but lingered in Wenatchee because she liked the Meadow Lark staff. [[Brandon An]] would share his lunch with her on occasion, and [[Chris Andrews]] had tried to bring her inside before the winter storm swept the area. She sets the fire deliberately to ensure that Meadow Lark vacates the building and a [[Dungeon Entrance]] would populate in the area.

Contrary to her fond feelings for Meadow Lark, Agatha's wants to sweep the universe "clean of biological life."

}} ==References== [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

[[File:00192.jpg|thumb|Agent Provocateur]] This is [[Carl]]'s 6th floor specialization class.
== AI Description == The mysterious Agent Provocateur prides himself in being invisible. This class specialty focuses on being the ultimate saboteur. These wily troublemakers emphasize less on individual traps and fighting in the street and instead focus on mass-casualty bombs and bomb-making.
An Agent Provocateur receives the following benefits:
*An additional +1 to intelligence upon level-up *+1 skill level to a Sapper’s table. *+2 to Explosives Handling. *Access to the advanced Bomb Maker’s Workshop. *Faster explosives training.
[[Category:Class]]

revision.comment: Created page with "An Agony Urchin is a class, the details aren't known but it alters the way you look and can help keep you safe. [[Category:Class]]"

{{SpoilH | 5}} {{Character_info | origin = Earth | first_appearance = Book 5, Chapter 1 | class = [[Prodromoi]] | species = [[Human]] | level = 29 | injuries = Lost bottom half of left leg. }}'''Ajib''' is an Earth crawler and presumably a dexterity-themed fighter. He lost the bottom half of his left leg jumping through the [[Gate of the Feral Gods]] on the [[Fifth Floor]].
==Story== [[Carl]] exchanges fist-bumps with Ajib while in line for Sixth Floor [[Class]] Selection, and offers to build Ajib a prosthetic. Ajib replies that his team is already on it before hopping away.<ref>{{ref|5|1}}</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

{{SpoilH | 5}}{{Character_info | class = [[Artillery Specialist]] | species = Moon [[Elf]] | occupation = Accountant | first_appearance = Book 5, Chapter 22 | status = Deceased | gear_hands = * [[Enchanted Obsidian Bracelet of the Raggle Rouser]] * Bracelet of CON +10 | party = | organizations = The [[Dream]] | level = 51 | highest_stat = Constitution | image1 = 01035.png }}{{Quote | quote = CARL HURRY UP. YOU’RE DOING THE BAD GUY SOLILOQUY THING. YOU ALWAYS SAY TO NEVER DO THE SOLILOQUY THING. <small>--[[Donut]]<ref>Dinniman, Matt. The Butcher's Masquerade: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 5 (p. 214). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref></small>}} '''Akland''' was an accountant and a hunter on the [[Sixth Floor]] Hunting Grounds.
==Description == As an accountant for the [[Dream]], Akland worked with soy crop shipping manifests. When the Dream rented out the [[Fantasy Hunter Camp]] as a sort of employee retreat, he performed well and won a spot in the Dream's [[Ninth Floor | Faction Wars]] army. The Dream offered him money to participate, and more money to travel down to the Sixth Floor Hunting Grounds and hunt [[Louis]]. Akland claimed to have a family.<ref>{{ref|5|22}}</ref>
He was captured by [[Carl]] and [[Samantha]], and briefly interrogated. Carl marked him with the [[Enchanted Night Wyrm’s Ring of Divine Suffering|Enchanted Night Wyrm's Ring of Divine Suffering]] and killed him, leveling up the ring and boosting Carl to level 55.<ref>{{ref|5|23}}</ref>
==Gear== * [[Enchanted Obsidian Bracelet of the Raggle Rouser]] - Given to Donut. * Bracelet of CON +10 * [[Arrow of Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea]] x 1
== References == <references />
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Hunters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{Quote | quote = I started pulling everything from my inventory in the alchemy category, which was a lot of stuff, from rat meat to that chest of supplies we’d bought from the drug dealer. By the time I was done, the simple table now looked as if a mad scientist had set up shop at a swap meet.
-- Book 3, Chapter 4 }}{{Item|title=Alchemy Table|type=Crafting Table}} The '''Alchemy Table''' is a crafting workbench that allows crawlers to transform various Dungeon loot such as organs and skins into potions. Although the table includes tools and resources, it does not necessarily include recipes. ==Level Up== At Level 1, the table looks like an ordinary crafting table. At Level 3, it has expanded to three times its base size and includes a faucet as well as layers of shelves and drawers.{{ref|3|7}} Alchemy Tables increase one level each time the crawler descends to a new floor. Alchemy Tables can be specialized.{{Ref|3|30}} ==References== [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Crafting Tables]] [[Category:Crafting]] {{Navbox Items}}

:<big>'''Admin Notice. This article contains unmarked spoilers for Book 6.'''</big> :'''System Message. Posting Book 7 spoilers will result in "acceleration" per [[Dungeon Crawler Carl Wiki:Wiki rules | this wiki's rules]].''' {{Character_info | aliases = Agent 21 Parvati | first_appearance = Book 6, Epilogue | species = [[Residual]] (assumed) | allies = [[Agatha]] | status = Alive }}{{Quote | quote = 21. My strength will remain depleted for some time, but I will feign it is as fatigue. My name is no longer Parvati. I am now Alexandro. -- <small>Book 6, Epilogue</small> }}
==Description== Agent 21 peeled away from the collective and traveled to Earth with [[Agatha]] ten years ago. Like Agatha, they killed an [[The Apothecary|Apothecary]] residual already on earth and assumed control of its body to secure access to the Apothecary's information feeds and equipment. For years now, they have gone by their human name "Parvati."
Parvati was investigating Borant's mapping activity in Mumbai, India, shortly before the [[The Transformation|transformation]]. They took a significant risk by killing one Borant employee and fully infiltrating another Borant-employed human, assuming the new identity of '''Alexandro'''.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (epilogue).</ref>
Alexandro is now [[Lucia Mar]]'s [[Youth Assistant|youth assistant]]. When Lucia Mar and Donut fight, he insists that Lucia should kill Donut for the experience points. Although Lucia tells Donut Alexandro's name and role, this dialogue is omitted from the recap episode.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''The Butcher's Masquerade'' (chapter 37).</ref>
== Speculation ==
* As a youth assistant, Alexandro is presumably based at the [[Kinder Facility|kinder facility]] in Mumba.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (chapter 19).</ref> * Alexandro may be messaging Lucia or may be present in the Dungeon; Lucia specifically looks backward when interacting with him while talking to Donut, and appears to be talking to someone behind her shoulder when interacting with Florin and Ifechi.<ref name=":0" /><ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'' (chapter 4).</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Syndicate Citizens]] [[Category:Dungeon Admins]]

God of pain.
== Notable followers ==
* [[Maggie My]]

{{SpoilR}}
== Description == Author of the 13th Edition of The [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]], which appears to him as a T'Ghee deck of cards.
== Cookbook Entries == There is no longer a 15-second waiting period for removing items from inventory, so [[Rosetta|this advice]] is mostly moot. I can confirm that backpacks do still maintain stability. They weigh you down, however, and don't work as well as inventory. (Chapter 13, Book 3)
I don't know if this is the cause, but this appears to be [[Batbilge]]'s last entry into the Cookbook. I've been leaving the cards casually on my bed whenever I use the marketplace. Make sure you don't have it on you to be safe. (Chapter 3, Book 4)
[[Vampire|Vampires]]. We have them in my culture, but they are not the same as the ones here in the dungeon, although they are similar. My T'Ghee deck contains two vampiric forms. The Plague Bearer and the Blood Hunter. Both represent death. Both represent the end of days. But one is considered deliberate, thirst-based evil, and the other, the Plague Bearer, is a study on how one='s poor actions can ripple through time and become amplified and doom of all. The vampires here on this seventh floor are a combination of the two. It is strange that our traditions are so different yet the same. I have not met any fellow crawlers cursed with vampirism, but I have met my fair share of vampire mobs and NPCs. The monster ones cannot be reasoned with. They are fast. Faster than you think. They are insatiable. They are strong. Yet they are not mindless. In fact, I believe the curse of vampirism greatly increases their intelligence. They cast spells. They wish to surround themselves with protectors. Do not underestimate them. Do not rely solely on your own mythology to defeat them. My best advice is to avoid them, and if they've moved into an area you occupy, move away as quickly as you can. (Chapter 45, Book 5)
The Semeru Dwarves of the ninth floor all only worship a single [[Ysalte|goddess]], who inevitably makes an appearance near the end of the battles as the final teams approach the gates of the castle of [[Larracos]]. She only has a single temple in the entire dungeon. I have never seen or heard of a crawler worshipping her. I don't know if that's even possible. She is also, apparently, used as a foil during the [[Celestial Ascendancy|Ascendancy]] battles as well. She is hated by both the gods and the demons, and she's said to be forever scheming, moving nations like pieces on a chessboard. Killing and resurrecting, all in her unknown cause. I've heard her described as a trickster. Insane. Jealous of mortals. The dwarves call her the Downward Spiral. An Earth and Water goddess who punishes those who abuse her world and the weakest within it. In my religion, we have a T'Ghee card that represents such a figure, called The Inevitable. Some say she is the reason for [[Scolopendra]]'s nine-tier attack. I've heard one dwarf say she is the daughter of the great centipede. Another say she's the sister. Another claimed she's the mother. I doubt any of those are true. Outside of Larracos, she is known by another name. She is called the Vinegar Bitch. (Chapter 64, Book 6) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{SpoilH | 6}} {{Item|title=Alpha Male Carl|image=00906.jpg|type=T'Ghee Card|effects=* Protective Shield * Hob-lobber * War Gauntlet}}{{Quote | quote = “You don’t need to hurt yourself to feel loved. Despite all of your failings...” Alpha Carl paused, looking over my shoulder. “All right. You’re gonna have to explain what that crab is doing.” Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (p. 638). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.}} '''Alpha Male Carl''' is a [[T'Ghee Card]] totem belonging to the [[Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance]].{{ref|6|46}} ==AI Description== '''Alpha Male Carl. Level 69.'''
'''Nice.''' ==Description== Alpha Male Carl is a masculine caricature of [[Carl]]. He has gelled-back hair that [[Donut]] says is better than Carl's, and a prominent bulge in his star-patterned boxers. His War Gauntlet is bone-white rather than black. His patch jacket has two buttons: "#1 Son" and "Brother of the Century." He speaks in [[Carl's Father]]'s voice. When summoned by the Hydra, he tosses hob-lobbers and follows up the explosions by dancing backward, pumping finger guns, and exclaiming, "Dance, baby!" [[King Croissant]] rides on his shoulder. ==References== {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:T'Ghee Card]][[Category:Floor 8]]

{{SpoilR}} Amayon is the youngest of the four crown princess’s of [[Sheol]]. He is associated with fire.
He was banished to the human realm by one of his brothers.
He knows exactly what happened to [[Emberus|Emberus's]] son, having witnessed the deal being signed. He agreed to tell him in exchange for help killing his three brothers.
[[Category:Dungeon Lore]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

{{Character_info| image1 = 00834.jpg|species=Quarter [[Naga]]|level=75|organizations=The [[Desperado Club]]}}
Male stripper in [[Desperado Club]], he is the brother of [[Damascus Steel]] and son of [[Astrid]]. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

{{Character_info | image1 = 00844.jpg | origin = Earth: Seattle, WA | first_appearance = Book 1, Chapter 13 | species = Cocker Spaniel Dog | enemies = [[Donut]] | status = Presumed Dead }}{{Quote | quote = “I once watched a cocker spaniel lick her own butthole for thirty minutes straight. That was more insightful than that question.” -- <small>[[Donut]] to the [[Maestro]] (Book 1, Chapter 43)</small> }} Angel was a female cocker spaniel living with an unidentified female owner in the Seattle, WA apartment next door to [[Carl]], [[Beatrice|Bea]], and [[Donut|Princess Donut]].<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 13).</ref> <ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 31).</ref>
==Description== Apparently unruly and undisciplined, Angel would occasionally burst -- barking -- into Carl's apartment, where she would pee on the floors while running in circles.<ref name=":0" /> Once, in the most upsetting moment of Princess Donut's pre-Dungeon life, Angel bit down on and broke one of Donut's toy jingly balls.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 19).</ref>
Although Bea was ''extremely'' friendly with Angel's owner, Carl knows little about her.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 20).</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

== Appearance == {{Character_info|crawler_#=8,199,451|class=[[Fugitive]]|species=[[Human]]|first_appearance=Chapter 5, Book 6|party=|allies=* [[Paz Lo]] * [[Sister Ines]]|gods=[[Ogun]]|level=47|title1=Anton Lopez}}He's a muscular bald man in a leather jacket, knee high boots and a black cape. Carries a crossbow and is covered in prison tattoos.
He has a pair of player killer skulls and a dagger icon over his dead.
== History == He killed two people from his group on the first or second floor after they tried to kill [[Sister Ines]].
He was killed by the god [[Ogun]] after failing one of his quests. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

Apito is the Oak Mother, the mother of all gods. She is the wife of [[Taranis]]. She is the founder of the Butcher's Masquerade and created the peace seal that is a part of the party. She delivers invitations to the [[Butcher's Masquerade]]. The grand prize at the Butcher's Masquerade is the Memorial Crystal of Apito. [[Mordecai]] notes that this is strange since a memorial crystal is usually only obtainable for deceased gods, and Apito is not deceased. Carl is given a quest by [[Emberus]] to obtain the Memorial Crystal of Apito.
She is worshiped by the [[Elves]] who have several stores about her including that to maintain the path to heaven her angels must remain free and alive and that she once called the [[skyfowl]] blessed. Their is also an apocryphal myth that says that only the angels are blessed, that people must stop any violence against angels and if it continues she will destroy all the worlds. [[Category:Deities]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]]
An icecream seller working at [[Grimaldi's Traveling Circus]]. Brother to [[Areson the Wise|Areson]] and [[Herman]], the three of them used to be a [[nodling]]. [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Floor 3]]

{{SpoilH|5 + 6}} {{Quote | quote = '''Hopefully you got some cool loot from the priests or monks or whatever because this box, while technically a prize, is sort of a good news/bad news thing.''' <small>--The [[System AI]] (Book 5, Chapter 36).</small> }}{{Item|title=Apostate Box|type=Loot Box|source=Achievements}} The '''Apostate Box''' is a rare [[:Category:Loot Boxes|Loot Box]] awarded for angering gods other than the god that you worship.
==Gold Apostate Box== ===Sample Loot=== *[[Enemy of the Church]] Tattoo, specifically for the god whose shrine was desecrated.
===Associated Achievements=== *[[Temple Defiler]]<ref>{{ref|5|36}}</ref>
==Platinum Apostate Box== ===Sample Loot=== *[[Enchanted Nipple Ring of the Defiler]]<ref>{{ref|6|3}}</ref>
===Associated Achievements=== *[[Marked for Life Achievement]]<ref>{{ref|6|2}}</ref>

{{Item|title=Apparel Box|image=File:00846.jpg|imagecaption=(Spoiler: Does not contain pants)|type=Loot Box|source=Achievement}}
''Apparel Boxes'' are a [[:Category:Loot Boxes|Loot Box]] most commonly distributed on [[First Floor|the first floor]].
==Gold Apparel Box== The Gold Apparel Box glows with a golden light and contains two items. A Gold Apparel Box may be rewarded by an Achievement or by cashing in a [[PVP Coupon]].<ref>{{ref|3|18}}</ref>
===Sample Loot=== *[[Enchanted Nightgaunt Cloak of Stoutness]] *[[Enchanted Trollskin Shirt of Pummeling]]<ref>{{ref|1|5}}</ref>
===Related Achievements=== *[[Why aren't you wearing pants?]]<ref>{{ref|1|2}}</ref>

== Description == An ranged attack class.
== Crawlers with this Class == [[Langley]] and the other used-car salesmen from Helsinki [[Category:Class]]

{{Character_info|occupation=Strongman|first_appearance=Chapter 13, Book 5|party=|level=45|allies=[[Tsarina Signet]]|species=[[Ogre]]}}Brother to [[Apollon]] and [[Herman]], the three of them used to be [[Nodling|nodlings]]. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

She entered the dungeon with [[Odette]] and got deep enougth that she managed to become a demigod attendant on the twelth floor.
She took part in the plan to bribe [[Huanxin Jinx|Huanxin]] acting as the go between her and Odette. The deal fell apart when Huanxin asked for more money and ended with the death of the god she was controlling, when she returned to the dungeon the first thing she did was kill Armita. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

{{SpoilH|5}}{{Item|title=Arrow of Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea|type=Consumable, Poison, Arrow|source=[[The Dream]] Hunters}}
Although it looks deceptively like a normal arrow, the '''Arrow of Enthusiastic Gonorrhea''' is tipped with a poison that inflicts [[Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea]].<ref name=":0" />
== AI Description== '''Arrow of Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea.'''
'''This is a regular arrow, but the tip is dipped in a poison that will inflict you with Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea.'''
'''Trust me on this. You don't want Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea.'''
'''It doesn't kill you, but you'll want it to. It sets your genitals aflame. Literally. And then it heals that area of your body over and over. The only way to remove the disease is to, uh, geld yourself. Or pass it on to someone else.<ref name=":0">{{ref|5|15}}</ref>'''
==Story== On [[Sixth Floor|The Hunting Grounds]], each member of [[The Dream]] carries at least one of these arrows in their inventories to use on [[Louis]] as revenge for disrespecting the Faction's leader, [[Epitome Noflex]].<ref name=":0" /> [[Carl]] collects several arrows as he cuts his way through the sixth floor and uses one to poison [[Vrah]], which compels her mother [[Circe Took]] to join the fray by sponsoring the gender-fluid goddess [[Diwata]].<ref>{{ref|5|35}}</ref><ref>{{ref|5|55}}</ref>
==References== <references />
[[Category:Items]] [[Category:Weapon Ammunition]]
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Consumable Items]]

Princess Donut chose this class as her [[Former Child Actor|Specialty]] on the Third Floor. She got the all the benefits except the Pathfinder skill, Shield spell and 25% discount.
== AI Description == This Charisma and Intelligence-based class is the modern-day merchant. Using your superior artistic talent to entertain and entice fellow nerds, the Artist Alley Mogul travels the world to sell her copyright-infringing wares. While not particularly menacing physically, this plucky merchant is extremely difficult to hurt.
Members of this class receive the following benefits:
* +5 Dexterity * Instant access to the level-5 Shield spell. * A 25% discount at all stores plus a 15% bonus to money earned from sales. * 10% Interest earned on all coins upon descent to the next level. * Level-5 Pathfinder skill * Access to Enhanced [[Dodge]], which allows the Dodge skill to train to level 20. * Level-5 Dodge skill
Additional subclasses become available on the sixth floor.
This is an Earth Class. As an incentive to choose an Earth Class, you will receive a Silver Earth Box upon choosing this class. [[Category:Class]]

{{Character_info|occupation=Hunter|first_appearance=Chapter 15, Book 5|status=Deceased, killed by [[Areson the Wise]] accidentally|party=[[The Dream]]}}Dropped [[Arrow of Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea]] intended for [[Louis]]. He also had a piece of paper list the territories of the different Hunters, their targets and various faction names.
== Gear == He was wearing a flowing enchanted robe that allowed him to move quickly and gave a small constitution buff and had a quiver full of un enchanted arrows. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Hunters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}
Asojano is the Lord of Smallpox.
[[Carl]], [[Donut]], [[Sister Ines]], [[Anton]] and [[Paz Lo|Paz]] get a quest in which they get the option to repair his shrine, repairing his shrine will not cause him to ascend.
== AI Description == {{Character_info|species=[[Orisha]]|first_appearance=Chapter 10, Book 6|level=130}} '''Asojano - Orisha. Level 130 City Boss. This is a non-corporeal spirit.'''
Also known as the Lord of Smallpox, Asojano is one of the most respected and feared of the Orishas, a former god made flesh upon the rise of the Ascendency.
As the worshippers of these gods grew more and more extinct, their temples crumbled, and the power of these former deities waned. Eventually, they faded into nothing, slipping away beyond the veil, becoming nothing more than any other ghommid, only able to visit the physical world on occasion.
One day, not so long ago, Asojano found himself here in this small town, visiting the world he once helped rule. There was no malice to his actions. He came just so he could look upon what he once had and what he had lost.
Still, power lingers, even in the most forgotten of shells.
Asojano is disease incarnate. He kills, and he heals. He is life, and he is death. He also wears a reed hat that makes it difficult to see where he's going, so he bumps into stuff a lot. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:City Boss]]

{{Item|title=Assassin's Box|type=Loot Box|source=Achievement}} The '''Assassin's Box''' is a [[Loot Boxes|Loot Box]] awarded for successfully assassinating NPCs.<ref name=":0">{{ref|2|22}}</ref>
==Bronze Assassin's Box== ===Sample Loot=== *[[Quiet Slippers]]<ref name=":0" /> *Antidotes <ref>{{ref|3|2}}</ref>
===Related Achievements=== *[[Assassin! Achievement]]<ref name=":0" />

revision.comment: Eekz moved page [[Assassin (achievement)]] to [[Assassin! Achievement]] without leaving a redirect
revision.text:
[[Carl]] killed Miss Quill.
==Description== You have killed a ranking NPC town official. *Sniff* It seems like just yesterday you were nothing but a scared, level-1 crawler with beautiful feet, pissing yourself as you faced down a rat. Now look at you. You've moved all the way up to political assassinations. What's next? Killing a god?
''Reward:'' You've received a Bronze [[Assasin's Box|Assassin's Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Item|title=Asshole's Box|type=Loot Box|source=Achievements}} '''Asshole's Boxes''' are [[:Category:Loot Boxes|Loot Boxes]] awarded for particularly ruthless actions.<ref name=":0">{{ref|1|19}}</ref> Unless a crawler is already affiliated with a club, they will most likely receive a [[Desperado Pass]] in their fist Asshole's Box.
==Bronze Asshole's Box== ===Sample Loot=== *[[Desperado Pass]] (first box)<ref name=":0" /> *Drink Ticket (X3) - Desperado Club. ''Redeem at the Desperado Club for a free "drink."''<ref>{{ref|1|30}}</ref>
===Related Achievements=== *[[You Monster!]] *[[Bully and a Thief]]
==Gold Asshole's Box== ===Sample Loot=== *[[Weapon oil: Weeping wound]]<ref name=":0" />
===Related Achievements=== *[[War Criminal]]
==Platinum Asshole's Box== ===Sample Loot=== *Spell Upgrade Potion <ref>{{ref|5|8}}</ref>
===Related Achievements=== *[[Mass Casualty Event]] <ref>{{ref|5|6}}</ref>
==References== <references />
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]
{{Navbox Items}}

[[File:00066.jpg|thumb|Astral Paw]] Astral Paw is a telekinesis spell that mimics the paw of an animal. At higher levels it becomes a potent attack spell. Obtained by [[Donut]] on [[Fifth Floor|Floor 5]] through her membership to the [[Dungeon Book of the Floor Club]]. ==Description== '''Cost''': unknown
'''Target''': empty space within spell radius, about 10 meters at level 1.
'''Duration''': unknown
Allows the caster to manipulate objects at a distance as if they were touching them with a paw. It can be used as a weapon and is stronger in that regard compared to Astral Hand because it lacks the latter's fine motor control. At level 5, it can grow claws. At level 10, it can be made much larger. At level 15, the caster's skills and abilities are translated directly into the paw. [[Category:Spells]]

{{Character_info | species = Bloodlust Sprite ([[Fairy]]) | image1 = 00817.jpg | first_appearance = Chapter 9, Book 3 | party = | level = 125 | class = Cardiovascular Mage | organizations = [[Desperado Club]] | skills = [[Cosmic Sense]] | status = Deceased, assassinated by Katia and Carl in Book 6 }}
Astrid is the Assistant Manager of the [[Desperado Club]]. Her sons are [[Damascus Steel]] and [[Anaconda]].
== Abilities == As a [[Blood Spirit]] she has access to powerful cardiovascular magic this includes spells that boil blood, deprive it of oxygen, turn your blood to acid and turn your heart into a mob. She has Cosmic Sense that warns her if a [[god]] or [[Demons|demon]] is present as well as psionic abilities. She can cast Summon Guard five times a day with no cool down, each casting summoning between one and three guards to her instantaneously. Her intelligence is 150.
== History == She gives [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] complimentary security after the failed assassination attempt by [[Ji-Hoon|Ji-Hoon.]]
{{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler = [[Katia Grim|Katia]] got a quest from the [[Guild of Suffering]] to assassinate her. Before she and Carl killed her she asked them to "save my children" and said that she "was almost done". }} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

Atoll are a tall, thin race with four arms and only three fingers on each hand, they have thin shovel like faces with high set eyes, all set into wrinkle ape like skin. They have no mouths but they do have about a dozen nostril holes. They speak using sign language. [[Category:Races]] [[Category:Syndicate Races]]

[[File:00606.jpg|thumb|Author Steve Rowland (I'm sorry)]] A [[troll]] stripper that works in the [[Desperado Club]]. He is armed with a club.
The name is a reference to a LitRPG author.
He was sucked into hell at the end of book 8. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

Admin Notice. This page may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Posting spoilers for Book 7 will result in “acceleration” per this wiki’s rules. ==Description== Author of the 17th Edition of The [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]. ==Cookbook Entries== Some NPCs are indestructible. You can kill them, and they regenerate in a matter of minutes. If you find one of those, it means they have something on them or they know something important. Big important. The trick is figuring out what that is. (Chapter 26, Book 3) This is [[Sinjin]]'s last entry. A person in my party was smote by his god, and it made his blindness debuff permanent. Stay the fuck away from gods. (Chapter 30, Book 4) Spiders. By the gods, why? In our world, they only exist in myth, but apparently they're a real thing and are common in the universe. What sort of nightmare must the Creators have been having to design such a thing? (Chapter 26, Book 6) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

[[Carl]] used the Venomous Elven Rock Chucker Trebuchet Device against an Odious Creeper.
==Description== You've used siege equipment to zero in and attack a boss monster from afar. That's cheating! It's like trying to kill someone with a bomb. What a bitch move!
''Reward:'' You've received a Silver [[Siege Master Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

== Mordecai's Description == It allows you to pick up a trap and deconstruct it. You'll be able to use the materials for your own purpose. The triggering mechanisms alone are quite valuable. You could make a living just by farming traps. [[Category:Skills]]
A race of two humped camels. [[Category:Races]] [[Category:Syndicate Races]]

{{Race Infobox | image1 = 00146.jpg|Fan DCC-AIT-S01E01-Thumbnail.jpg|SBT | type = Mob | floors = [[First Floor | first]] | height = 5' - 6' (1.52 - 1.83m) | weight = 250 - 450 lbs (113.4-204kg) | bonuses = Lava spit | penalties = its weakness is its throat | deities = [[Grull]] }}{{Quote | quote = Did we really just start a meth war between the [[Goblins | goblins]] and the llamas?
-- [[Donut | Princess Donut]] (Book 1, Chapter 16) }} [[Carl]] encounters low level, lava-spitting, meth-dealing '''bad llamas''' on the [[First Floor|first floor]].Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 8). ==AI Description== '''Bad Llama. Level 3.''' '''It’s a llama, but it’s bad. If he were human, he’d be covered in prison tattoos and would be hanging out in front of the Circle K hitting on 14-year-old girls. They might be willing to sell you something if you have good stuff to trade.''' '''You won’t want to get hit by their spit.'''Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (pp. 72-73; chapter 8). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. == Description == With giant yellow buckteeth and tan fur, Bad Llamas are approximately the size of a horse. According to the Denver Zoo, regular llamas are characterized by a small head, a split upper lip, large ears, and short tails.Denver Zoo. ''Llamas''. Retrieved from: [https://denverzoo.org/animals/llama/] A pouch in their throats allows them to spit red, baseball-sized gobs of scorching lava-spit from their mouths. It glows red when they prepare to spit; if the pouch is ruptured during this stage, it will burn the llama's throat and kill it. The lava spit smells of sulfur and cools from crimson to red. Beginning on the third floor, Bad Llamas may be worshippers of [[Grull]].Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 25). == Dropped Loot == On the [[First Floor|first floor]], bad llamas may drop: * Poor Llama skin * Uncooked Llama steaks X 2 * Baggie of trailer park-grade meth X 2 == References == [[Category:Mobs]][[Category:Races]][[Category:Floor 1]]

[[File:00497.jpg|thumb|[[Banana Farmer]]]]
== Description == A druid class that can shoot banana tree seeds from their hand.
== Crawlers with this Class ==
* [[Mike Barnes]] [[Category:Class]]

[[Quan Ch]] survived the quest [[Fools Who Broke the Glass|The Fools Who Broke the Glass]] and entered a saferoom .
==Description== Screw Hadji. Hadji was a little bitch, anyway. You have completed a quest, but it was completed in a way unusual enough to trigger the Bandit Achievement! Unlike the real Bandit, who is usually instrumental in helping Jonny Quest complete his tasks, you didn't actually do anything to deserve this prize. But that's okay because you're still getting it. This is one of the rare achievements that can be rewarded more than once.
''Reward:'' Your Platinum [[Quest Box]] has been upgraded two times to a Celestial Quest Box! [[Category:Achievements]]

Bang Bro is an enchantment spell that adds fire and electrical damage to an equipped item. == AI Description == '''Cost''': 5 Mana
'''Target''': Temporarily Enchant Equipped Item
'''Duration''': 5 minutes + 1 minute per level of spell. Requires 5 minute cooldown.
Adds both fire and electrical damage to any currently-equipped item. May not be cast on flesh. Well, actually it can be cast on (your own) flesh, but I really wouldn’t recommend it. May inflict Burn and Shock on targets.
Can also be used to cook hotdogs and other items. [[Category:Spells]]
{{delete}} A [[cat]] and [[Donut|Donut's]] cousin, she got run over by a tractor after running into a field. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

Admin Notice. This page may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Posting spoilers for Book 7 will result in “acceleration” per this wiki’s rules. ==Description== Author of the 12th Edition of The [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]. ==Cookbook Entries== Be careful with the marketplace interface. It uses a different system to value items than whatever you might have installed in your UI. It tags this tome as a unique, heirloom item, giving it a ridiculous value, something like 50 million gold. Nothing has happened yet, but I am afraid of giving a third party access to my inventory like that. (Chapter 3, Book 4) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

== AI Description == You built a structure and deployed it in battle. And your mother thought you were wasting your life away while you spent all those hours eating Doritos and playing Minecraft. If she could only see you now. Too bad she's probably dead.
'''Reward:''' You've received a Silver [[Mechanic's Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

Beatrices's mother. She was highly religous and had had plastic surgery.
She was used as one of the head of the [[The Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance|Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance]], her head had a fireball ability. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

{{Character info |species=[[Human]] |origin=Seattle |first_appearance=Chapter 1 }}Beatrice, mostly known as Bea, is [[Carl|Carl's]] ex-girlfriend and the former owner of [[Donut|Princess Donut]]. ==Description== She has thin long straight hair and freckles.
After surviving the collapse her appearance had changed, she had lost weight and looks like she’s aged ten years.
== History == Prior to the start of the book she cheated on [[Carl]] with two different men and [[Angel|Angel's]] owner.
Bea was on vacation to the Bahamas at the time of the Collapse. She was on vacation and cheating on [[Carl]] with [[Brad]], after posting a picture of herself and Brad on instergram Carl rung her up and ended their relationship.
After Carl's work mate [[Sally]] sent him a facebook message asking him out for drinks Bea contacted Carl's boss [[Dick]] and asked him to sack her, accusing her of stalking him. Dick agreed in return for a picture of her breasts. Bea and her friends labelled this operation slut stop. She also knew about Carl's half brother [[Asher]] but kept his existence from Carl.
In the epilogue of book 4, ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'', it is revealed that Bea is now living in the ruins of Seattle. She had broken down after posting the photo of herself and [[Brad]], resulting in Carl ending their relationship, and they flew back early. Two bounty hunters, searching for [[Ferdinand]] (Gravy Boat) stumble upon her, Gravy Boat is ultimately taken by [[Odette]] for her own unexplained plans.
It's implied that an unknown [[residual]] saved her by starting a fire outside her hotel just before the collapse.
As of book 5 she now has full citizenship and is no longer on the planet. She appeared on [[Odette|Odette’s]] show but was heavily drugged.
== Trivia == She used to watch the teletubbies and cry. [[Category:Characters]]

{{Item|title=Beguiler Box|image=00709.jpg|imagecaption=Legendary Beguiler Box|type=Loot Box|source=Achievement}} The '''Beguiler Box''' is a [[:Category:Loot Boxes | Loot Box]] awarded for charming mobs and NPCs.
==Silver Beguiler Box== Donut receives this after charming the goblins on the second floor.<ref>{{ref|1|19}}</ref>
===Sample Contents=== *[[Glossary:Tomes|Tome]] of [[Minion Army]]
==References== <references />
[[Category:Loot Boxes]] {{Navbox Items}}

{{Item|title=Belt of Buoyancy|type=Equipped Item, Accessory, Quadruped|source=Silver [[I'm Wet Box]]}} {{Quote |quote = “That was pretty awesome,” I said.
“Go fuck yourself, Carl,” Donut said. -- (Book 4, Chapter 23) }} The '''Belt of Buoyancy''' is a simple belt that, when equipped, prevents the wearer from sinking. It only works in water.{{ref|4|23}} It can be equipped on quadrupeds by wrapping it around their stomach. ==References== [[Category:Items]][[Category:Accessories]] {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Equipped Items]]

{{Character_info|species=Boer goat {{!}} Hellspawn Familiar|origin=Italy|status=Alive|allies=* [[Miriam Dom]] * [[Prepotente]]|level=32|title1=Bianca Del Ciao}}A horse sized hellspawn with six breasts that used to be a goat. Has a pair of wings. [[Category:Characters]]

[[File:00553.jpg|thumb|Big boy blue]]
== AI Description == The good ol’ Big Boy Blue is the largest of the jellyfish one might find floating around. They’re a little like that guy you used to know in high school who was always wearing either overalls or a jersey of some sort. The dude is like six foot five and pushing 300 pounds when he was a freshman. He always had a crewcut. Dad’s a trucker. Never talks. Never does his homework. He’s just always, you know, kinda there. He doesn’t mean any harm. But he’s so goddamned dumb he does harm anyway if you get in his way. Plus he always has a super-hot girlfriend for some reason, but that has nothing to do with the damn jellyfish. Anyway, you get the point. Harmless as long as you don’t touch them. [[Category:Mobs]]

{{Item|title=Big Daddy Box|type=Loot Box|source=Achievement}}
The '''Big Daddy Box''' is a rare [[:Category:Loot Boxes|Loot Box]] awarded for the sort of crazy feats that cause the [[System AI]] to say, "Holy shit. Good job."<ref name=":0">{{ref|3|14}}</ref>
==Platinum Big Daddy Box== ===Sample Loot=== *A regular, unenchanted toothbrush *[[Seize the Day Toothpaste]]<ref>{{ref|3|15}}</ref>
===Related Achievements=== *[[Three Cheers for Slaughter]]<ref name=":0" />
==References== <references />
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Loot Boxes]]

{{Character_info|species=[[Allosaurus]]|level=80|image1=00714.jpg}} Big Tina is a level 80 allosaurus city boss. She used to be a ursine but after [[Scolopendra]] nine tier attack her and several other female [[Ursine|ursines]] where turned into dinosaurs. She managed to contract Vampirism off of [[Miriam Dom]] but was cured after she died.
== Discription == A giant dinosaur wearing a pink feathered boa, a tiara and carrying a wand.
Her mother [[Kiwi]] taught her to dance.
== Gear == She has a wand that casts The Recital, a minor charm that makes people happy and want to take part in her performance.
== History == She came from a culture where dance was forbidden, despite this she planned to dance at a secret recital but when her father, the towns head cleric, found out he got angry and hit her mother. He whipped her mother almost to death and pushed her daughter causing her sparkling wand to break. Scolopendra nine tier attack hit just as she fell. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:City Boss]] [[Category:Boss]]

[[Carl]] was ported back after his panel appearance into a door.
==Description== You teleported into a solid object. Congratulations. You've lost your...
Oh, wait! You were teleported due to an administrative action. That means your privileged ass was saved. Again. No missing arm or leg. No dungeon-style circumcision. Nothing. Boy, you must really bring in the cheddar for them to keep coddling you like this.
Teleport mishaps are funny as shit. You ever see ''The Fly''? Anyway, you don't have to worry about it. This time.
'''''Reward''''': You've received a Silver [[Lucky Bastard Box|Lucky Bastard box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

== AI Description == Type: Berserking Spell + partial invulnerability.
Target: Self only
Cost: Item based.
Duration: twenty seconds.
Cooldown: Once every 30 hours.
Effect: You ever seen an angry, on-fire weasel tossed into a room full of chickens?
You catch on fire. You are invulnerable to blunt damage. Then you get really angry and kill every goddamn thing in the room. This is a berserking spell. Don’t cast this inside of a Denny’s. Or anywhere near people you like. [[Category:Spells]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Bitchmeat!}}
== AI Description == You’ve been attacked by a fellow crawler in a safe zone, and the system has been forced to save your ass. That usually suggests you’re either really annoying, or you snore.
If this were a prison, you would now be my bitch. Wait…
'''Reward''': Bitches don’t get rewards. [[Category:Achievements]]

== Description == A class that combines a cleric, magic user and warrior.
== Crawlers with This Class ==
* [[Lucia Mar]] [[Category:Class]]

== AI Description == Type: Involuntary Abjuration
Cost: Item Based
Duration: Instantaneous casting. Affected target will suffer the effects of this spell for (30 + [Caster’s Intelligence+Constitution] – [Target’s Intelligence/2]) Seconds.
Cooldown: Once Every Hour
Target: Single target.
Effect: Has the same effect as wearing a shirt for the band Cattle Decapitation to church. Instantly removes target from the blessing of their deity and all associated buffs and effects. Will make it so target is unable to physically enter church or temple while the spell is in effect. Higher levels of this spell increase the possibility of forcing a smite upon the target.
Warning! You probably don’t want to cast this on members of the same religion more than two or three times in a row. [[Category:Spells]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A skill that makes guards forget who you are after a while once your out of sight. [[Category:Skills]]"
revision.text: A skill that makes guards forget who you are after a while once your out of sight. [[Category:Skills]]

'''Bliss Surfing''' is a status condition caused by ingesting a combination of [[:Category:Pharmaceuticals | drugs]]. The target is unconscious for hours, reliving memories (similar to [[Blitz Sticks]] but more intense).<ref>{{ref|6|28}}</ref>
== Effects == * 50% Chance of + STR * Chance of -INT
== References == <references /> [[Category:Status Conditions]]

{{Item|title=Blitz Sticks|type=Pharmaceutical|keywords=Magical|effects='''If Eaten:''' +5 INT (temporary) '''If Smoked:''' 15% chance of +1 INT * Addiction * Unspecified Side Effects|source=Dungeon Pharmacists Loot}}{{Quote |quote = “And stay away from blitz sticks. They’re hallucinogens, and they’re highly addictive. Magically addictive. You don’t want that.”
--[[Mordecai]] (Book 2, Chapter 15) }} '''Blitz Sticks''' are a common but highly addictive magical hallucinogen. ==AI Description== '''Blitz Stick.''' '''It’s like candy, but for your mind. If you eat this, your Intelligence temporarily rises by five points. If you smoke it, there’s a 15% chance your Intelligence will permanently rise by 1.''' '''There might be a side effect or two. Or three.{{ref|2|15}}''' ==Description== Blitz sticks look a bit like licorice sticks and, when lit, have a distinct tangy smell like patchouli.{{ref|3|19}}{{ref|5|32}} While smoking a blitz stick, saying ''"show me..."'' can produce a vivid non-existent memory or create a false escapist dream. The hallucinations are shorter each time the drug is used.{{ref|5|epi}} They are one of the few substances that cannot be counteracted with a [[Rapid Detox Potion]].{{ref|4|5}} The addictive properties of blitz sticks can be treated with an unidentified skin patch, which must be worn for a while.{{ref|6|30}} ==References== {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Pharmaceuticals]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Items]]

revision.comment: Created page with "== Description == A mage class == Crawlers with This Class == [[Elle McGib]] [[Category:Class]]"
revision.text:
== Description == A mage class
== Crawlers with This Class == [[Elle McGib]] [[Category:Class]]

revision.text:
[[File:00281.jpg|thumb|The Bloom]] The Bloom is the ultra-nationalist ruling party of the [[Borant system|Borant System]]. They appear to be a totalitarian regime guilty of state sanctioned murder/torture. [[Zev]], who is not a member of the party when [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] first meet her, is later "Re-educated" to bring her into the party. [[Loita]], who is a member of the party, tells [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] that this involved doing unspeakable things to [[Zev|Zev's]] mother and aunt. Later a civil war breaks out in the [[Borant system|Borant System]] with the aim of overthrowing the Bloom.
== Members ==
* [[Loita]] [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Governments]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Spy]]|species=[[Human]]|first_appearance=Chapter 6, Book 4|allies=* [[Low Thi]] * [[Tyler Storm]] * [[Mike Barnes]] * [[Morris]]|level=24|title1=Bobby D.J.|status=Deceased, probably crushed}}
One of the crawlers in the Subterranean Quadrant of Bubble #543. He speaks with a stutter.
At some point he became possessed.
== Appearance == He has dark hair and tanned skin giving him a mediterranean look. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

'''Race: Human'''
'''Class: Legatus'''
Bogdon Ro is a crawler in the dungeon. He spends time on/off the top 10 list. He has a lot of player killer skulls. He is killed by a hunter on [[Sixth Floor|the 6th floor]] and [[Vrah]] sports his head attached to her back while fighting. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

[[File:00839.jpg|thumb|Bomb Squad Tech ]]
== AI Description == This exclusive class is only available to crawlers who have obtained the Boom! Achievement.
People who actually choose to work with explosives are the craziest bastards around. You excel at making things blow up. And while you’re good at keeping the bombs from going off in your own hands, Bomb Squad Techs still tend to lose both friends and limbs at alarming rates. Luckily this class comes with a benefit that can fix 50% of that problem.
* All explosive-based traps will mark themselves as you approach. * All armor is 10% more effective. * The handling of explosives no longer degrades them. * Automatic +2 to all explosive-based skills. * +5 [[Bomb Surgeon]] skill * +2 to Dexterity. * +2 to Constitution. * -2 to Intelligence (After all, only dumbasses would choose to do this for a living.) * Plus the [[Limb Regeneration Benefit]].
This is an Earth Class. As an incentive to choose an Earth Class, you will receive a Silver Earth Box upon choosing this class. [[Category:Class]]

[[File:00081.jpg|thumb|Bomb Surgeon]]
===Description=== Allows the person possessing this skill to split up or deconstruct bombs. Applications include splitting a bomb into smaller, lower yielding pieces, or taking apart a bomb and using the component parts for other applications. [[Category:Skills]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Cave Mudge Bonker}} [[File:00092.jpg|thumb|Cave Mudge Bonker]] Squat grey-skinned, pig-like monster with toothpick legs and a wooden club studded with nails.
== AI Description == '''Cave Mudge Bonker. Level 19.'''
In the hierarchy of Cave Mudge society, the Bonker is about as high on the list as a commoner can get. These odd, war-like creatures are said to have once been a star-faring nation, but something happened to cause them to regress back to the stone age. Probably too much reality TV. Don't let those skinny legs fool you. When these guys get to bonkin', they can be pretty darn quick. [[Category:Mobs]]

She is setting up a lemonade stand in memory of her pig, Sausage. She is guarded by the feral goose [[Denise]].
== AI Description == {{Character_info|species=Dirigible [[Gnome]]|first_appearance=Chapter 16, Book 4|level=5|image1=00581.jpg}} '''Bonnie - Dirigible Gnome. Juvenile. Level 5.'''
Little Bonnie only loves two things in this world. Her pet pig Sausage and getting what she wants.
The only daughter of [[Commandant Kane]], a case can be made that she's the true leader of the ''Wasteland''. It is said that when Sausage was captured and held as ransom by the Bactrian camels, the young woman threw such an epic temper tantrum that the only thing that calmed her was watching her father order the bombing of the neutral changeling settlement.
That's the rumor, at least. The truth is, nobody knows much about the shy child. As such, do not judge her too harshly. She is but a spoiled, rich kid. If she's evil, she doesn't know any better, If she's not, it's a tragedy that you're probably going to have to kill her.
Life's a bitch. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

[[Category:Spells]]"

[[File:00064.jpg|thumb|Boom!]] [[Carl]] earned this achievement on the [[First Floor|first floor]] by causing the [[Goblins|goblin]] Murder Dozer to explode outside [[Mordecai|Mordecai's]] [[Tutorial Guild Hall|Training Guild]]. It is safe to assume that the [[Loot Boxes|loot box]] is themed to the first mob or situation a crawler explodes.
==AI Description== You've caused a wall-shaking explosion within the dungeon! The last time the walls shook like this was when your mom came over for a visit.
''Reward:'' You’ve received a Silver [[Goblin Box]]!<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 51; chapter 5). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]
#REDIRECT [[Borant Corporation]]

[[File:00013.jpg|thumb|Borant present dungeon crawler world: Earth]]The Borant Corporation is the company that runs the current version of [[Dungeon Crawler World]]. They have recently gotten into financial difficulties causing them to start the show early to stave off bankruptcy.
By the end of the [[Fifth Floor|fifth floor]] the board of directors was replaced by the politburo as principle controllers of the borant corporation.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Corporations]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

The Borant Emancipation Front is a rebel group fighting for controll of the [[Borant system|Borant System]]. [[Donut]] and [[Zev]] helped smuggle [[Valtay]] secret agents to them.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

revision.text:
The Borant system is a system run by the [[Borant Corporation|Borant Corperation]]. The ruling political party is called [[The Bloom]] and most of it's citizens are [[Kua-Tin]].
After the running of Dungeon Crawler World was taken over by the [[Valtay|Valtay Corperation]] the entire system went dark.
Currently undergoing a civil war.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

{{Item|title=Boss Box|type=Loot Box|source=Boss Battles}}{{Quote | “I got a magic boomerang. Chris got some book of the club thing. Imani doesn’t tell us what she gets, and Yolanda received a new type of quiver.” -- <small>[[Brandon An]] Re: Silver Box (Book 1, Chapter 31)</small> }} ''Boss Boxes'' are a common Loot Box awarded for defeating Bosses. The Loot Box's tier is determined by the Boss's tier.<ref name=":0">{{ref|1|12}}</ref>
==Bronze Boss Box== Awarded for defeating Neighborhood Bosses.
===Sample Loot=== *[[Enchanted Fae Scale Quadruped Crupper of the Fleet]]<ref>{{ref|1|19}}</ref> *[[Enchanted Shuriken of Bloodlust]]<ref name=":1" /> *[[Hobgoblin Dynamite]] *[[Hobgoblin Pus]]<ref>{{ref|2|13}}</ref> *Ring of Constitution +2 *[[Bang Bro|Tome of Bang Bro]]<ref>{{ref|3|2}}</ref> *[[Puddle Jumper | Tome of Puddle Jumper]]<ref name=":1">{{ref|1|25}}</ref> *[[Torch | Tome of Torch]]<ref name=":0" /> *[[Wisp Armor Spell | Tome of Wisp Armor]]<ref name=":0" /> ==Silver Boss Box== Awarded for defeating Borough Bosses.
===Sample Loot=== *100 - 1,000 Gold Coins *[[Cheat Code Potion]]<ref>{{ref|1|30}}</ref> *[[Determine Value Potion]] *[[Dungeon Book of the Floor Club]] *[[Enchanted BigBoi Boxers]] *[[Enchanted Fur Brush of the Ecclesiastic]] *[[Heal Critter | Tome of Heal Critter]]
==Gold Boss Box== Awarded for defeating City Bosses.
==Platinum Boss Box== Awarded for defeating Province Bosses.
==Legendary Boss Box== Awarded for defeating Country Bosses.
==Celestial Boss Box== Awarded for defeating Level/Floor Bosses.
==References==

Brad is [[Beatrice|Beatrice's]] lover, he persuaded her to post a picture of the two of them on instagram that resulted in her breaking up with [[Carl]].
Prior to the creation of the dungeon he worked construction part time and modelled part time. His instergram handle is Bradthechad69.
Was killed during a fight between [[Sadir]], [[Gennrik]] and [[Gennrik|Lexus]]. After Gennrik was killed he tried reaching his gun and was shot by Lexus and slowly bleed out, [[Odette]] order Lexus not to save him. [[Category:Characters]]

{{Citation}}
{{Character info |image1 = 00849.jpg |crawler_#=12,330,671 |species=[[Human]] |origin=Wenatchee, Washington |occupation=Maintenance Guy |first_appearance=Chapter 22 |status=Deceased, killed by [[Shade Gremlin]] in [[Third Floor|The Over City]] |party=[[Meadow Lark]] |allies= *[[Chris Andrews]] *[[Yolanda Martinez]] *[[Imani C]] |level=6 |gear= }}
Brandon Andrews is described as a "young chubby black guy" and is a caretaker at the [[Meadow Lark]] elderly care center. He, his brother [[Chris Andrews|Chris]], and the other caretakers all evacuate their elderly wards into the dungeon and do everything they can to protect them, getting most as far as the third floor.
==Description== Brandon is a cheerful talkative person, is good enough at math to help Carl figure several things out on the first couple floors. He also is a big help building the Moab device to escape the Rage Elemental on the second floor. Brandon dies on the third floor defending the remaining members of the Meadow Lark group from a swarm of Mobs.
Brandon sends Carl a message that Chris wants to join back up with Carl and Donut because they are “aggressive”. Brandon asks Carl to tell Chris he is sorry for fighting and that Brandon loves his brother. These are Brandon’s final words.
==Personality==
==Gear== [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

revision.text:
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]] {{Character_info|class=[[Pit Fighter]] -> [[Pit Champion]]|species=[[Human]]|origin=Ukraine|level=55|title1=Britney Proskurina|allies=* [[Firas]] * [[Louis]]}}Ukrainian plastic surgery patient. She survived the [[The Transformation|Transformation]] by being outside having her pictures taken before her cosmetic surgery. Appears to be on the edge of hysterics all the time.
Wears a fur bikini and carries a spiked covered stick.
She has an extinction sigil tattoo under her eye.
During the [[Butcher's Masquerade]] she acts as [[Donut|Donut's]] guitarist, her playing is spectacular, whilst there she managed to disable a warning light using one of [[Daniel Bautista|Bautista's]] Beanie Babies. She got badly injuried during the final fight with her face getting heavily scarred.
== Skills == She knowns the [[shield]] spell.
She's really good at the Guitar.

The Butcher's Masquerade is a spell that only the most divine can cast and they can cast it only once in their life. It creates a party and guest list, no one on the guest list can be harmed unless in self defence, the guest list is designed to be as disharmonious as possible. If the party finishes without violence everyone attending gains a boon from [[Apito]]. If someone breaks the peace they are feed into the [[Nothing]]. Different factions are put in different room, guests aren’t allowed to leave their room until the party is over or the peace deal is broken.
The spell has never been successfully completed
There is also a pet show and talent competition.
== History == The first masquerade was put on by [[Taranis]] and [[Apito]] for their extended family in the [[Halls of Ascendancy]]. It was called a Masquerade even though they didn't wear masks because they could pretend they were not enemies. [[Yarilo]] was the first to break the peace when he attempted to rape a familiar of one of the other gods, as punishment he was banished to the [[Nothing]]. All the remaining gods thought and murdered each other. Afterwards the party became a ritual. [[Category:Spells]]

{{Character info |image1=[[File:Dungeon Crawler Carl.jpeg|220px|center|thumb|alt=Carl|From cover of Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 1]] |crawler_#=4,122 |age=27 |height=6'3" |weight=230 lbs. |titles=Royal Bodyguard Warlord |class=[[Agent Provocateur]] ([[Compensated Anarchist]]) |species=[[Human]] {{!}} [[Primal]] |origin=Seattle, WA |occupation=Marine Technician / Former US Coast Guard service member |first_appearance=Chapter 1 |status=Alive |party=Royal Court of Princess Donut |allies= *[[Donut]] *[[Katia Grim]] *[[Mongo]] *[[Mordecai]] *[[Samantha]] *[[Quasar]] |level=73 |highest_stat=Strength |views=13 Septillion |followers=331 Quadrillion |favourites=41 Quadrillion |gear= *[[Carl's Xistera]] *[[Drakea’s Enchanted Kerchief of Chaos.]] *[[Enchanted Anarchist’s Battle Rattle]] *[[Enchanted Auto Buckler of the Peach Pit]] *[[Enchanted BigBoi Boxers]] *[[Enchanted Necklace of Haute Bourgeoisie]] *[[Enchanted Nightgaunt Cloak of Stoutness]] *[[Enchanted Night Wyrm’s Ring of Divine Suffering]] *[[Enchanted Nipple Ring of the Defiler]] *[[Enchanted Spiked Kneepads of the Shade Gnoll Riot Forces]] *[[Enchanted Right Back Atcha Personal Shield]] *[[Enchanted Toe Ring of the Leprous Bandit]] *[[Rockard's Ring of Sniping]] *[[Enchanted Toe Ring of the Splatter Skunk]] *[[Enchanted Trollskin Shirt of Pummeling]] *[[Enchanted War Gauntlet of the Exhalted Grull (Right-handed)]] *[[Shrink Wand]] *[[Enchanters Paupers Ring of the Steadfast Emberus]]|skills=*[[Talon Strike]] *[[Tripper]] *[[Bang Bro]] *[[Fear]] *[[Heal]] *[[Ping]] *[[Protective Shell]] *[[Wisp Armor Spell]] *[[Black Nimbus]] |patrons= *[[The Valtay Corporation]] (lost sponsorship) *[[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)]] *[[The Apothecary]] *[[The Plenty]] |organizations=* [[Desperado Club]] * [[Naughty Boys Employment Agency]] * [[Guild of Suffering]] * [[Club Vanquisher]] (Via Emberus)|gods=[[Emberus]]}}
{{Quote | quote = You will not break me. You will not fucking break me. }} Carl is the titular protagonist of Dungeon Crawler Carl. == Description == Before entering the [[Dungeon]], Carl was a 27-year-old U.S. Coast Guard Veteran who worked as a Marine Technician "fixing electrical systems for rich assholes and their party boats."<ref name=":6">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (p. 2). Kindle Edition</ref> He shared a two-bedroom second floor apartment in Seattle, WA, ~0.5 miles from the coast of the Puget Sound, with his girlfriend [[Beatrice|Bea]] and her award-winning cat [[Donut|Princess Donut the Queen Anne Chonk]]. He hit the gym three times a week<ref name=":0">{{ref|1|3}}</ref> and enjoyed playing Call of Duty on Playstation<ref name=":6" /> with his friend [[Monobrow Sam]] while Donut sat in his lap. He survived [[The Transformation|the collapse]] because [[Donut|Princess Donut]] escaped the apartment when he cracked open the window to smoke, and he went outside in only his leather coat, boxers, and Bea's ill-fitting pink croc sandals to search for her.
In the Dungeon, Carl focuses primarily on hand-to-hand combat and explosives. After reaching the [[Third Floor]], he selects the [[Primal]] race and the unique monk/rogue hybrid class of [[Compensated Anarchist]], which the AI aptly describes as "a trapmaking, bomb-making, social-media dynamo" that "will happily throw a Molotov through a window one moment and step in front of a camera to plead for the violence to stop the next."<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 2).</ref> He takes the bomb-focused [[Agent Provocateur]] specialization on the [[Sixth Floor]]<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Butcher's Masquerade'' (chapter 1).</ref>.
Carl is the twenty-fifth holder of the [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]].
{{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler = After the events of the [[Fifth Floor]], Carl is a devotee of [[Emberus]]. This is the highest possible rank a crawler can attain unless they are a Cleric or Paladin class.}}
==Appearance == Carl is described as a clean shaven, tall human man with brown hair he keeps trimmed short and "one of those bodies that naturally held muscle well."<ref name=":0" /> Due to the effects of the [[Enchanted Pedicure Kit of the Sylph]], his bare feet are "shiny" and "glittery."<ref>{{ref|1|32}}</ref>
Donut describes him as the worst dressed crawler in the dungeon.
==Personality== Carl is a gruff man who has a strong sense of right and wrong. He also has "grit", refusing to let the system break him. While not charismatic, he is the sort who will assume leadership if nobody else steps up. He is a loyal and trustworthy crawler, willing to take risks if he can help others, which engenders a great deal of loyalty from other crawlers. Many describe him as "crazy" due to the risks he takes and the creative, albeit half-baked, plans he hatches. In book five it is revealed that the “river” Carl feels within his mind was a trait his mother also had, alluding that she too had a streak of mental illness.
Carl is extremely resourceful, and has a knack for finding and exploiting loopholes. Although he doesn't view himself as particularly skilled in math, he is able to "fix most anything electrical after studying it for a bit."<ref name=":3" />
==History== Carl's mother was 5'10". His maternal grandfather played center for Oregon State before becoming a prison guard.<ref name=":0" /> Carl's father was a linebacker<ref name=":0" />. It is revealed throughout the books that Carl was physically and emotionally abused by his father.
His mother, in an attempt to free Carl from their shared misery attempted to kill both herself and his father and only succeeded in committing suicide, all on Carl’s birthday. He thought he was getting a bike.
During his time as a coast guardsman for the US Coast Guard, Carl received firearm and hand-to-hand combat training.<ref name=":7">{{ref|1|2}}</ref> He spent most of his time aboard a cutter as a Machinery Technician (MK), but was never involved in any real law enforcement.<ref name=":7" /> He spent free hours reading and playing ''Pathfinder'' and ''Dungeons and Dragons''.<ref name=":6" /> The last time he played D&D was aboard the USCGC ''Stratton''.<ref>{{ref|1|41}}</ref>
==Skills==
===Combat Skills=== *Aiming, Level 4. *Bare Knuckles Skill, Level 8. *[[Foot Soldier Skill]], Level ?. Increases damage dealt by kicking. Carl gains this skill after reaching level 3.<ref name=":1">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 8).</ref> *[[Iron Punch]], Level 10. Increases fist damage bonus when wearing gauntlets/lumpers by 10% per skill level.<ref name=":2">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 12).</ref> *[[Powerful Strike]], Level 10 (Level 15 after taking items into account). *[[Pugilism Skill]], Level 10.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 30).</ref> Carl starts at level 4.<ref name=":8">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 5).</ref> *Slingshot Skill, Level 5. * [[Smush|Smush Skill]], Level 12. Increases force of smushing by 10% per level. Carl unlocks this skill with 3 skill levels after reaching level 3.<ref name=":1" /> * [[Talon Strike]], Level -. *[[Unarmed Combat]], Level 9. Carl enters the Dungeon with 3 levels in this skill.<ref name=":3">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 4).</ref> *[[Wand Casting]], Level 5.
===Dungeon Crawling Skills===
*[[Find Crawler|Find Crawler Skill]], Level 5. *Find Traps Skill, Level 13. *Regeneration Skill, Level 7+, from [[Enchanted Trollskin Shirt of Pummeling]] (which also negates melee-based debuffs including Stun, Knockback, Disarm, and Out-of-Breath).<ref name=":5" />
===Explosives Skills===
*Alchemy, Level 3. *[[Dangerous Explosives Handling Skill]], Level 10 (Level 12 after taking items into account).<ref name=":4">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 19).</ref> * [[Explosives Handling Skill]], Level 11.<ref name=":4" /> *[[Goblin Explosives Skill]], Level 5.<ref name=":4" /> *[[IED|IED Skill]] (Improvised Explosive Device), Level 3.<ref name=":4" /> *[[Incendiary Device Handling Skill]], Level 5. *[[Infusion Skill]], Level 3.
===Spells===
*[[Fear|Fear Spell]], Level 10. *[[Protective Shell]] *[[Wisp Armor Spell]]<ref name=":2" /> *[[Ping|Ping Spell]] *[[Tripper]]
===Other Skills===
* Basic Electrical Repair Skill, Level 6.<ref name=":3" /> At level 6, this is Carl's second highest skill when he enters the dungeon. *Breathing, Level 3.<ref name=":3" /> *[[Cesta Punta Skill]], received from [[Earth Hobby Potion]] on the third floor. *Dumpster Diving, Level ?.<ref name=":2" /> *[[Frogger]] - 1981 Video Game Cabinet Version (result hidden due to filters), Level 8.<ref name=":5">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 6).</ref> * Lacing Boots, Level 3.<ref name=":5" /> *Operating a Sony Brand RMVLZ620 Universal Remote Control, Level 1.<ref name=":5" /> *Swimming, Level 4.<ref name=":3" /> *Walking, Level 4.<ref name=":3" /> *Various Firearms, Level ? but "proficient."<ref name=":3" />
===Vehicle Skills===
*Biplane Pilot Skill, Level 3. *Chopper Pilot Skill, Level 5.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 21).</ref> *Motorbike Driving Skill, Level 9.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Carl's Doomsday Scenario}} {{Book | title =Carl's Doomsday Scenario | author =Matt Dinniman | datePublished =January 2, 2021 | previous =[[Dungeon Crawler Carl (Book) | Dungeon Crawler Carl]] | next =[[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Book) | The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]] |image=DCCBook02.jpg|illustrator=''Cover:'' [https://www.artstation.com/lucianofleitas Luciano Fleitas] ''Interior:'' [http://www.erikwilsonartgallery.com/ Erik Wilson]|publisher=Matt Dinniman|pages=362 (Paperback Edition)|isbn=979-8588333764}}'''''Carl's Doomsday Scenario''''' is a fictional LitRPG fantasy adventure novel by Matt Dinniman, and the second installment in the ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' [[:Category:DCC Books|book series]]. It is available in paperback, digital, and audiobook formats.
== Abbreviated Summary == [[Carl]], [[Donut|Princess Donut]], and [[Mongo]] arrive at the Dungeon's [[Third Floor|third floor]], where Mordecai helps the crawlers choose new races and classes. The floor is a lore-themed level called the Over City, and includes NPCs called "Elites" who are starring in their own Syndicate television shows.
== Official Summary == '''"The training levels have concluded. Now the games may truly begin."'''
The ratings and views are off the chart. The fans just can't get enough. The dungeon gets more dangerous each day. But in a grinder designed to chew up and spit out crawlers by the millions, Carl and Princess Donut must work harder than ever just to survive.
They call it the Over City. A sprawling, once-thriving metropolis devastated by a mysterious calamity. But these streets are far from abandoned. An undead circus trawls the ruins. Murdered prostitutes rain from the sky. An ancient spell is finally ready to reveal its dark purpose.
Carl still has no pants.
They call it Dungeon Crawler World. For Carl and Donut, it's anything but a game. [[Category:DCC Books]] {{DEFAULTSORT:02 Carl's_Doomsday_Scenario_(Book)}}
