[[Category:Carl]]

'''Type''': Incendiary Tossable
'''Effect''': When lit and tossed, results in a small explosion, followed by burning splash damage over a wide area. Flames will burn for 15 seconds per level of attacker’s level of Incendiary Device Handling.
'''Status''': Inert until torch is activated.
'''Description:''' Created by an unstable, pantsless man who talks to a cat, Carl’s Jug O’ Boom takes the bigger-is-better approach when it comes to hobgoblin fire bottles. Burns hotter, bigger, and faster than your normal Molotov Cocktail. The use of a standard torch instead of a cloth wick makes these devices much more stable. Just don’t drop it once it’s lit, lest you find yourself doing a Joan of Arc impersonation.
Carl's Jug O' Boom is created by inserting a Torch into a jug of [[Rev-Up Toilet-Grade Moonshine|Rev-Up Moonshine]]. Creating this device earned Carl the [[Dungeonpreneur]] achievement<ref>Page 306 Book 1</ref>.
The recipe for Jug O' Boom was featured on the recap episode and added to the Dungeon Codex. Carl will receive one gold coin for every kill with this device by other crawlers. Two gold plus a 25% fee, rounded up, is deducted upon cash out. Royalties from this recipe indicate that at least one other crawler has access to [[Rev-Up Toilet-Grade Moonshine|Rev-Up Moonshine]] and has used it to craft this recipe .
{| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" | colspan="2" |Kills with Jug O' Boom by Other Crawlers |- |Book |Page |Kills |Royalties After Fees (Gold) |- |1 |390 |4 |1 |}
[[Category:Items]] [[Category:Explosives]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Xistera}}
== Description == A wicker-like scoop, two feet long, that [[Carl]] can attach to his hand and arm. It is used for throwing projectiles with high speed and accuracy. When Carl summons something from his inventory into his hand it goes right into the scoop, which adjusts itself to accommodate the projectile. He typically uses it to throw bombs or potions held in delivery devices fashioned by [[Mordecai]]. Carl has a lot of range with the xistera, and his accuracy is very good except at the longest distances, where he will often overshoot his target. When not in use the xistera can fold inward onto Carl's forearm and form a bracer, which leaves his hand free and allows him to summon his gauntlet.
Carl got the xistera from his first fan box. The Cesta Punta skill he got from his Earth Hobby Potion gives him instinctive knowledge of how to use it, which is why his fans chose it for him. It was also much cooler than the slingshot he had been trying to use.
== Enchanted Xistera Extension Slot (Head-throwing attachment) == This is a unique item!
This item was created especially for Crawler Carl by The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network, Intergalactic NFC.
Attaches to the end of a xistera. Allows for the tossing of a head.
This special edition head tosser is custom made to fit decapitated love doll heads.
When tossing a head of a withering spirit, the distance traveled will be greatly enhanced. (500 meters x Strength.)
Tossed head will be magically returned once the extension slot is removed from xistera.
This item bears an inscription that reads "Made for Crawler Carl by the Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network, Intergalactic NFC with design approval by CEO and president of Outreach Operations, [[Porthus|Dr. P. Hu.]]"
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Utility Items]] [[Category:Weapons]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Xistera}}

{{Character_info | height = 2' 0" | occupation = Dungeon Administrator | first_appearance = Book 1, Chapter 14 | species = [[Kua-Tin]] | organizations = * [[Borant Corporation]] * [[The Bloom]] | status = Alive }}{{Quote | quote = "Now get out there and kill, kill, '''kill.'''"}} '''Cascadia''' is the lead engineer and current executive producer of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]: Earth''.<ref name=":1">{{ref|6|40}}</ref> She makes the overly enthusiastic daily announcements.
==Description== Cascadia is recently divorced, a [[Kua-tin]] member of [[The Bloom]], and a [[Borant Corporation]] employee. As the lead engineer and executive producer of this season's crawl, she is responsible for managing the Dungeon and coordinating the Faction Wars.<ref name=":1"/> [[Zev]] reports to her.<ref name=":0"/>
She spent years designing the [[Seventh Floor | Great Race]].
==Appearance== A small kua-tin, Cascadia has long, droopy, catfish-like whiskers. Her scales have a dull sheen, and - when necessary - she wears a rebreather over her gills. She smells a little bit like the whitefish and spinach-flavored cat food [[Donut]] used to eat on Earth.<ref name=":0">{{ref|6|21}}</ref>
==Personality== Although Cascadia comes across as overly perky and enthusiastic during her daily announcements, [[Prepotente]] describes Cascadia as "a nasty little woman who thinks she's smarter than everyone else."<ref>{{ref|5|epilogue}}</ref>
{{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler = As the [[Ninth Floor | Faction Wars]] approach, she is increasingly overwhelmed and stressed; as she says, "I am on a tight schedule and am one crisis shy of pulling the failsafe, which would kill us all."<ref name=":0" /> In the same scene, she physically appears in [[Carl]]'s space and dares him to attack her.}}

{{Character_info|class=[[Song Bard]]|species=[[Pterolykos]]|first_appearance=Chapter 7, Book 3|status=Alive|level=66|image1=Checo the bard.png}}
Chaco is a former crawler who is now Host of [[''The Prize Carousel|The Prize Carousel]]''.'' Carl wins the carousel in a platinum fan box. Chaco is attacked by Mordecai as soon as he enters the saferoom to host the picking of the prize, which was the point of the box. Mordecai is put in time-out for seven days after the attack.
He later manned the prize counter at the [[Butcher's Masquerade]].
== AI Description == Here's your host. It's the dungeon darling, giver-of-prizes, slayer of gods, former Crawler champion, it's Chaco the Bard!
== Physical Description == A winged, wolf-headed man in a brown and orange checkered leisure suit.
== Skills ==
* [[Wings of the Pixie]] * Circle of Containment
== History == He was a crawler the same season as [[Mordecai]], and killed his brother at the instruction of [[Odette]], who was Mordecai's manager.

Character Actor is a skill that allows a crawler to pick a new temporary class on each floor. ==Description== This is the primary skill of Donut's [[Former Child Actor]] class. Every floor she chooses a class and receives a random selection of that class's benefits and abilities. The quality of the roll scales with level, which only increases when going down to the next floor. It starts at level 3 on floor 3, so the base level is always equal to the floor number. In the beginning she hardly gets anything with her choice, but with each floor she gets progressively more of the benefits and abilities. When she exits the floor, she loses the benefits and abilities granted by the class and must select a new one.
A hidden side effect of this skill is it's actually possible for Donut to retain any of the abilities granted to her by her temporary class as long as she gained a level in it. Instead of the skill itself being removed, only the levels granted by the class are removed. She keeps the levels she gained and her experience is redistributed. So a skill that might have started at 5 and increased to level 7 on a floor will end up being something like level 4 once the original 5 levels are removed. However, a skill that was not leveled at least once will be lost at the end of the floor when all its levels are removed.
In addition, as Donut gets stronger she fulfills the prerequisites of increasingly rare and powerful classes, giving her access to a progressively better selection of options each floor.
On floor 6, Donut received all of the starting skills of her class plus some upgrades. ==Donut's Classes== These are the classes Donut has chosen on each floor: *[[Artist Alley Mogul]] *[[Football Hooligan]] *[[Glass Cannon]] *[[Legendary Diva]] *[[Viper Queen]] *[[Master Telephone Psychic]]
[[Category:Skills]]

{{Character info | crawler_# = 324,116 {{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler = (when controlled by [[Maggie My]]) }} | species = [[Human]] {{!}} [[Igneous]] | origin = Wenatchee, Washington | occupation = Maintenance Guy | first_appearance = Chapter 22 | status = Alive | party = [[Meadow Lark]] | allies = *[[Brandon An]] *[[Yolanda Martinez]] *[[Imani C]] | level = 35 | gear = | class = [[Zulu Warrior]] | organizations = [[Desperado Club]] (banned) | patrons = * Prince [[Maestro]] * Crown [[Prince Stalwart]] | title1 = Chris Andrews 2 | image1 = 00815.jpg }}Chris Andrews is a caretaker at the Meadow Lark elderly care center. He, his brother [[Brandon An]], and the other caretakers all evacuate their elderly wards into the dungeon and do everything they can to protect them, getting most as far as the third floor.
==Description== Chris doesn’t talk much during the first two floors, but according to his brother “there’s nothing wrong with him, he just don’t say much.” Apparently even their mother thought Chris was ‘slow’. {{Spoiler | book = 2 | spoiler = After the race selection on the third floor Chris gets into a fight with his brother and leaves the Meadow Lark group. He takes several people with him but only Chris survives to the fourth floor. Brandon sends Carl a message that Chris wants to join back up with Carl and Doughnut because they are “aggressive”. Brandon asks Carl to tell Chris he is sorry for fighting and that Brandon loves his brother. These are Brandon’s final words. }}
== Skills == His race lets him burrow underground.
==Personality== ==Gear== [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

Mentioned on [[Dungeon Crawler After Hours with Odette|Odette's show]] in Epilogue of Book 3.
By the [[Sixth Floor|sixth floor]] they teamed up with [[Eva Sigrid|Eva]] and some of the former [[Brynhild's Daughters|Daughters]]. They later abandoned Eva after she wanted to fight a second [[Odious Creepers|Odious Creeper]] as they had taken significant losses fighting the first one.
They are named after Polish special forces despite none of them being from Poland.

Cici is one of [[Lucia Mar]]'s Rottweilers that entered the dungeon with her. Cici is killed in Book 5 by Donut's [[Hole]] spell. Cici seemed to play a part in controlling which of Lucia Mar's personalities is in control. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Pets]]

A lizard-faced monster who works as a bouncer at the [[Desperado Club]].
== History == She stole one hundred gold from [[Donut]] when she short changed her for the refund on her security. Donut later used that to blackmail her into letting them enter the [[Sixth Floor|Hunting Ground]] level of the club.{{Character_info|species=[[Crocodilian]]|party=[[Desperado Club]]|allies=* [[Astrid]]|level=40|image1=00139.jpg}}
== AI Description == Clarabelle - Crocodilian. Level 40. Employee of the Desperado Club. This is a Non-Combatant NPC.
Crocodilians are an intelligent, thick-skinned, semi-aquatic race. They tend not to be the sharpest tools in the shed, but they're certainly more intelligent than their smaller cousins, the [[Troglodyte|Troglodytes]]. They are inclined to work as muscle or enforcers for both legitimate and not-so-legitimate organizations throughout the universe. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

'''Crawler Classes''' define and shape a crawler's skillset as they advance through the [[Dungeon]]. Crawlers select classes on the third floor, and may have the option to further specialize their classes on the sixth, ninth, and twelfth floors. ==3rd Floor Class Selection== Upon arriving on the [[Third Floor]], all crawlers must choose a Race and then a Class. The [[System AI]] prepares a list of 30+ Class options for each crawler based on their stats, race selection, [[Desperado Club|Desperado]] or [[Club Vanquisher|Vanquisher]] membership if applicable, certain gear items (such as the [[Enchanted Crown of the Sepsis Whore|Crown of the Sepsis Whore]]), and other choices made on the tutorial levels. The System AI also recommends three Class options to each crawler, but the crawler -- aided by their [[Game Guide]] -- may decide not to select one of these options.{{ref|2|1}} Base classes such as ''Bard, Magic User, Necromancer, Rogue, Warlock,'' and ''Boring Ol' Fighter'' are available, but there are also more specialized subclasses: ''Jack-of-all-Trades, Wind Mage, NecroBard, Compensated Anarchist'', etc. Each class includes various benefits, which may or may not include: new skills and spells, the ability to train specific skills or spells beyond level 15, experience/mana point buffs or debuffs, immunity to specific effects, stat point bonuses or penalties, club memberships, etc. === Earth Classes === '''Earth Classes''' are specialized classes inspired by Earth culture. Crawlers who select an Earth Class receive a Silver [[Earth Box]] containing an [[Earth Hobby Potion]].{{ref|1|5}}
==6th Floor Class Specialization== After arriving on the Sixth Floor, all remaining crawlers are ushered through a Staging Area and into a small room, where they are given 10 minutes to make a decision. They do not have access to chat features.{{ref|5|1}} If a class chosen on the 3rd Floor specified that it would be specialized on the sixth floor, the crawler must choose between 3+ new subclasses. The crawler's "class" name will change. Some of these subclasses may be further expanded on the ninth and twelfth floors, so it is technically possible for a magic user to specialize in all four elements and create a "four seasons build;" however, this has never been accomplished.{{ref|5|8}} === Endorsements === If a crawler has a class that cannot be specialized on the sixth floor, they may have the option to choose one of three '''"endorsements."''' Picking an endorsement does not change the crawler's class. ==See Also== * [[:Category:Class]] - All Crawler Classes documented on the wiki so far. ==References== [[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]][[Category:Class | {{PAGENAME}}]][[Category:Floor 3]][[Category:Floor 6]]

[[File:00402.jpg|thumb|Climb (because it needed a picture)]]
== AI description == You can climb stuff better, yahoo. What an exciting benefit. I guese that makes you a monkey. [[Category:Skills]]

A bald, one-legged were-castor.
== Abilities and skills == He has a high constitution scores and an ability that draws the aggro of mobs.
== AI Description == {{Character_info|class=[[Light Recon Specialist]]|species=[[Chee]] {{!}} [[Were-kin]]|first_appearance=Chapter 13, Book 5|allies=[[Tsarina Signet]]}} '''Clint Smashgrab. Level 50. Were-Kin. Light Recon Specialist'''
A long time ago, Clint and his people were of a race called the Chee. They were peaceful. Carpenters, mostly. But then the High Elves wanted their land, and that was that. What happened to them next is a pretty awful story.
There are no Chee left in this realm. There are survivors of that night, when the High-Elves invaded their land. But there are no Chee.
So I'm going to assume you know what a werewolf is. This isn't a werewolf. Or maybe it is. It's a were-kin. That's all you know until either he tells you what he turns into, or he bites you, and you find out for yourself.
Clint and his brothers have joined forces with Tsarina Signet. They have a common enemy. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

[[File:00072.jpg|thumb|Clockwork Triplicate]] Clockwork Triplicate is a utility spell that creates duplicates of a pet or minion. Obtained by [[Donut]] on [[The Overcity|Floor3 ]] through her membership to the [[Dungeon Book of the Floor Club]]. ==Description== '''Cost''': 26 mp
'''Target''': Pets and minions controlled by the caster
'''Duration''': 1 minute per spell level
Creates two clockwork duplicates of the target. When the spell is cast, the target appears to split into three. The duplicates look and behave the same as the target but act independently. The system does not identify which one is real. When the spell ends, the replicas break into gears and servos and electric parts that disintegrate into a little pile of ash .
If something else cancels the spell prematurely, the replicas explode in a shower of parts that can cause minor damage.
'''Level 5 Upgrade''': Duration increases to 2 minutes per spell level [[Category:Spells]]

{{Group|part_of=[[Dungeon]]|type=Club|first=Book 6, Chapter 35|status=Active|members=* [[Carl]]|former_members=* [[Anton]] * [[Gwendolyn Duet]] * [[Miriam Dom]] * [[Paz Lo]] * [[Prepotente]] * [[Sister Ines]]}}{{Quote | quote = Club Vanquisher is more like a country club where old clerics sit on leather chairs and smoke pipes and occasionally tell racist jokes. -- [[Mordecai]]{{ref|2|15}}}} '''Club Vanquisher''' is one of two [[Dungeon]]-based clubs that crawlers can join starting in the Over City on the [[Third Floor]]. Similar to the Desperado Club, it includes a marketplace called "Comforting Supplies" and access to various guilds. Its members consist predominantly of clerics and paladins, who have to pick a god after selecting their class.{{ref|4|32}} ==Description==
'''Entering Club Vanquisher. Members Only.'''
'''Heathens will find no solace here.'''{{ref|6|18}}
Club Vanquisher membership is marked by a '''Club Vanquisher Ring.'''{{ref|4|2}} It is not clear how membership is obtained without selecting a god, but a few gods and bard classes allow crawlers to access both the Desperado Club and Club Vanquisher. In towns, Club Vanquisher typically located in temples and marked by a spire. Its interior is clean, with colorful stained glass windows and soft, ethereal music. The entrance may be guarded by robed Warrior Clerics. Its full-time staff includes healers. Defiling or defying Club Vanquisher will compel the club to put a "Holy Crusade Bounty" on a crawler's head. ==Story== {{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler = [[Miriam Dom]]'s membership is revoked on the [[Fifth Floor]] after she is turned into a [[Vampire]]. Furious, [[Prepotenten]] unleashes [[Bianca]] in the main lounge, and she eats a number of clerics. The Club puts a '''Holy Crusade Bounty''' on the crawlers, and closes down to be "cleansed."{{ref|4|25}} Carl gains "Free access*" to Club Vanquisher as a result of choosing to worship [[Emberus]]. }} ==References== [[Category:Dungeon]] [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Dungeon Organizations]]

==Description== You have assassinated an NPC whose existence was required to complete another crawler's quest. (NPC Killed: Miss Quill - Skyfowl. Level 30.) Who was that other crawler? What was the quest? Who fucking cares? You get the reward they were promised! Warning: You may only receive this award once. The next time you do it, we tell them who you are. And then they get a new quest to kill you. Nobody likes cockblocks.
''Reward:'' You've received a Silver [[Quest Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:00104.jpg|thumb|Cockroach]] This skill is one of the benefits of Donut's [[Former Child Actor]] class. ==Mordecai's Description== "Basically, it gives a chance to survive a fatal attack. At level five she's guaranteed one free lethal hit a fight, though she'd be near death afterward. At level ten, your health doesn't go down at all after the first fatal strike. The problem is, the only way to train the skill is by using it. Or with potions, or a training guild if you can find one, but that can get expensive." [[Category:Skills]]

{{SpoilH|4}}{{Item|title=Coffee Shop Author Kit|type=Enchanted Interface Enhancement|source=Gold [[Makeup Sex is the Best Sex Box]]|effects=Scratchpad +1 Page}} A magical sheet of paper, a quill pen, and a little capped jar filled with black ink.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'' (chapter 13).</ref>
==AI Description== '''Coffee Shop Author Kit.'''
'''Alcoholism and crippling self-doubt not included.'''
'''So you want to be a writer. It started with sappy poetry in middle school. You soon graduated to Naruto fan-fiction. By the time you crash landed face-first into adulthood, your brain swelled with the misguided notion that your shitty novel with a self-insert protagonist sporting a traumatic childhood would change the world. Spoiler alert. Nobody is going to read your autobiography disguised as a space vampire and minotaur romance. You and every other half-wit out there with a nearby Starbucks and a laptop is writing the same bile. What you’re really doing is inadvertently live-blogging the story of human mediocrity, and the universe is now a better place that the Syndicate has put a stop to it all.'''
'''Anyway, this is a magical sheet of paper. You will find you now have a second tab on your scratchpad in your interface. You can write something on this paper, and it will appear in the scratchpad and vice versa. If the proper spell and glyphs are accurately copied onto this paper, you can present the sheet at a market kiosk, and a scroll will appear for sale. Or if you have a printing press, you can make your own scrolls. Or even your own tome if you think you have the chops.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'' (pp. 199-200; chapter 13). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>
== Description == Typically used by scholar and arcanist classes with skills related to scroll making, the Coffee Shop Author Kit allows users to copy information from a second page of their scratchpad onto the magical paper and vice versa. When transcribed correctly, a spell or glyph can be classified as a "scroll" and sold at the market kiosk. The greatest benefit is that you can transcribe a spell from your scratchpad onto an unlimited number of scrolls using a printing press table. If you use the same scroll more than 200 times, you learn the spell.<ref name=":0" />
Obtained by [[Carl]] on the [[The Fourth Floor|fourth floor]] from a [[Makeup Sex is the Best Sex Box|Makeup Sex is the Best Sex]] box. He left it in the toilet where no one can see them and used it as a secret way to communicate with the other team members.
== References == <references />

[[File:00567.jpg|thumb|Compensated Anarchist]] This is [[Carl|Carl's]] primary Class.
== AI Description == This rare and exclusive class is only available to crawlers who have obtained Level five in the Explosives Handling skill and have received at least 500 Billion views by the time they’ve reached the third floor.
When the oligarchs want to manufacture a social movement, or better yet, stop one in its tracks, they must first bring in the big guns. The paid protestors. The Agent Provocateur. This Monk/Rogue hybrid class is a trapmaking, bomb-making, social-media dynamo. The Compensated Anarchist will happily throw a Molotov through a window one moment and step in front of a camera to plead for the violence to stop the next. Experts in hand-to-hand and dirty tactics, the Compensated Anarchist only suffers when it comes to more traditional fighting techniques.
* +1 to the [[Bomb Surgeon Skill]] * +1 to the Trap Engineer Skill * +1 to Unarmed Combat Skill * -25% Damage when using bladed weapons * +25% Mana cost for damage-dealing spells * +5% skill progression speed in all trap-making and bomb-making skills. * + 2 Hide in Shadows Skill * + [[Fear]] spell * + 1 Intelligence * + 5 Charisma * +5 to the Find Trap Skill * +5 to the [[Backfire Skill]] * +5 to the [[Escape Plan Skill]] * Access to the [[Desperado Club]] (already obtained) * Access to the [[Naughty Boys Employment Agency]]
This is an Earth Class. As an incentive to choose an Earth Class, you will receive a Silver Earth Box upon choosing this class.
== Subclasses == Compensated Anarchists must choose a subclass upon descent to the sixth floor. * [[Agent Provocateur]] * [[Guerilla]] * [[Revolutionary]]
[[Category:Class]]

[[File:00038.jpg|thumb|Concierge Sharks]]
== AI Description == These psychos are of the bite-first, ask-questions-later school of underwater diplomacy.
Also known as the “Death’s Welcoming Committee Shark,” the Concierge Shark is one of the fastest and most voracious of the ocean’s predators. They’ll eat anything. ANYTHING. Even those circus peanut candy things. It’s really kind of gross.
They are attracted to the scent of blood, making them the most common death dealers of any water-themed dungeon. [[Category:Mobs]]

revision.text:
{{SpoilH | 4}}
== Description == Author of the 19th Edition of The [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]].
== Cookbook Entries == There are three types of deity summonings. Avoid all three. Only idiots deal with deities. Some of them are genuine NPCs, but the big ones like [[Apito]] and [[Eris]] and so forth are always sponsored by some rich prick who basically paid extra to play a game called the [[Celestial Ascendancy]]. The game is contained on the 12th floor, but the individual gods sometimes get called away. That game is different than the [[Ninth Floor|faction wars]] game and has its own followers and storyline. I don't really understand, but I do know this. The gods are invulnerable except on the 12th and above floors. They are strong. They kill everything. And there ain't a damn thing you can do about it. Anyway, the three types of summonings. All three require a physical vessel. Usually a mob. There are celestial boons, which is when a worshipper prays to a god, and he comes to fight for his worshipper. There are indentured summonings, where a powerful mage summons the deity to fight for him for a short time. This is against the god's will, and they are usually pissed when it happens. And finally there are involuntary summonings. That's when some poor fool accidentally summons the god because of some trap or spell or just bad luck. The gods are usually pissed about this one, too, and what's worse, they arrive untethered, which allows them to smash everything in sight. In my short experience, all three scenarios lead to the summoner's death. Even the first scenario. Don't trust deities under any circumstances. Just stay the fuck away. That's my advice.<ref>{{ref|3|32}}</ref>
I went on a program tonight. They transported me to a ship that floats in low orbit over the planet. The ship has an open window with no glass that is only protected by a forcefield. It is amazing. I can look down upon my planet. My beautiful, lost planet. If I am to die here, I want this to be my last view.<ref name=":0">{{ref|4|18}}</ref>
I am going on another program tonight. I have secreted bugbear paste into my boots. I will detonate them while I am in orbit. There will be two admins on board. My [[Blast Shield]] skill should protect me from the explosion - if the skill works at all in that place. I don't even know. But if I blow the ship, it won't matter. Think of me, brothers. It is little, but it is all I have.<ref name=":0" />
I have failed. I have blown the ship, and my skill indeed protected me, but the forcefield around the ship has prevented it from fully breaking apart. The admins only appeared to be with me. They were holos. I was fooled today, and I am ashamed, brothers. The gravity has failed, the temperature is dropping, and it is getting difficult to breathe. I do not think they can remove me while the forcefield remains. But I see my planet, my beloved Qurux. It shines, and it warms me in this cold. I pray one day someone will avenge her, for I cannot.<ref name=":0" /> <references />
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

They look similar to a [[Forsoothed|soother]], they are tall and thin with pale skin that's weathered and wrinkled and covered in veins. They have big bug like eyes, and a head covered in coarse hair and with two distinct humps similar to a hearts. They have a line of four red nipples on their chest.
On their home plantet they are subterrainian dwellers. They are considered barbarian meat heads that actually looked forward to the idea of death. Some of the universes most popular alcohol and illegal drugs originate in their system. [[Category:Races]]

revision.comment: Created page with "{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Creeping Apocalypse}} == AI Description == '''New Quest. The Creeping Apocalypse''' This is a world quest! With the rising of today's sun, she found herself caught out in the open. Helpless and crying, she burned away into dust. The callous crawlers [[Carl]] and Donut|Princess Donu..."
revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Creeping Apocalypse}}
== AI Description == '''New Quest. The Creeping Apocalypse'''
This is a world quest! All crawlers ''and'' all hunters currently active on the sixth floor will receive this quest!
You may not opt out of this quest.
[[Miriam Dom]] the vampire has fallen. With the rising of today's sun, she found herself caught out in the open. Helpless and crying, she burned away into dust. The callous crawlers [[Carl]] and [[Donut|Princess Donut]] watched and did nothing as she died in agonizing pain. Nothing!
(Actually, not nothing. Someone should probably ask Carl why he suddenly has three new points to his intelligence stat. Suspicious!)
Anyway, Miriam did not go quietly into the good night. Oh no. Her death has cured thousands of crawlers monsters, and hunters who have been touched by the vampirism curse.
There is, however, a problem.
Some of the forest monsters infected with vampirism have spent the past few nights on a killing spree. And another vampire, a now-cured Allosaurus by the name of [[Big Tina]], unfortunately has expended a lot of effort on building an army of undead monstrosities using the... leftovers... from the forest-wide slaughter.
These newly created monsters are not vampires, and they were not cured when Miriam died. These mindless freaks were left all alone, not under control from any entity. Some are nothing more than mini-Grinder, also known as Shrillings, also known as Shambling Berserkers. We've all seen these before, most notably in some of the train stations at the end of the fourth floor. Yes, they can get pretty big and annoying, but it's not anything you really need to worry about. Hardly worth a regular quest, let alone a world one. You'd have to be a total idiot to let one of those things kill you, especially during the day. I'm looking at you, [[Nihit Kumar]] who's about two seconds from getting... Oh that's a shame, Gross.
Anyway, some of the other, more powerful monsters have become something else, and short of a god, they are the most powerful monsters who have ever set foot on a sixth floor in ''Dungeon Crawler World'' history.
I like to call them Odious Creepers.
The good news? Like Shambling Berserkers, Odious Creepers tend to be pretty slow during the day. The bad news? When it's dark outside, they gain the ability top combine with both Shamblers and other Creepers and get even stronger. And they can get fast, very fast. They can replicate themselves, too, if they have the parts!
There are currently fifty of these things... growing around... the forest, plus another few thousand Shambling Berserkers of various sizes. For fun, we have randomized their location. And for extra fun, we have marked the location of each creeper on the map for you all.
So here's the quest part. Kill all the Odious Creepers before the sun sets tonight.
For every Creeper you kill, you will receive +5 to a random stat. For every five you kill, you will receive an additional +5 levels. The crawler or hunter who kills the most will get an additional prize.
Only the person who does the most damage gets credit for the kill.
If you don't kill all of them before the sun sets tonight, bad stuff will happen. And I mean every single one of the fifty Creepers. And by bad stuff, I mean something completely batshit. And not just to the crawlers, but the hunters, too. So all of you cowards sitting on your ass in Zockau need to get to work.
'''Quest Failed. The Creeping Apocalypse'''
Holy shit. You idiots.
I warned you. I promised batshit consequences for failing one of the easiest world quests ever.
Here we go, bitches!
I can't help but notice the two remaining Odious Creepers happen to be where only the hunters could conceivably reach them. That's where this is going to start. You hunter guys holed up in Zockau are so fucked.
All of you may notice there's a new status bar in your interface. There's an official name for this thing, but I like to call it the blood bar. Effective immediately and for the remainder of this floor, all saferoom access - and this includes personal space access - is operated under tenth floor and below rules.
For those of you that don't know what that means, here's a quick lesson. You gotta earn your keep. This is an action-themed program, after all. Not some sappy drama where everyone just cries and masturbates all day long. I'm looking at you, Hunter Veeka.
All saferoom access is now timed for all hunters and crawlers. The moment you enter a safe area, your blood bar starts to count down. When it's full, you are given ten earth hours to be layabouts. If it reaches zero while you're still tucked away, you get randomly teleported to a location outside of the saferoom. If it's at zero, you cannot enter a saferoom at all, including guildhalls or locations that double as pubs.
You fill that blood bar by killing shit. It's simple, really. If you've been doing everything you're supposed to be doing, this particular change shouldn't bother you.
That's the change to the rules, but that's not the punishment y'all are receiving for failing the quest.
Gird your loins. This is a good one.
Starting with the location of the two remaining Odious Creepers, the spell ''Gehenna Bramble'' has been cast. This will spread outward at the average speed of four and a half kilometers per hour. Faster at night, slower in the sun.
If you're not familiar with the spell, here's a quick rundown. Every plant touched with the spell is transformed into a thick, impenetrable, ten-meter-high wall of thorn-covered vines that will undulate and thrust and attack. If you are pricked by the thorns, your blood immediately boils away, and you explode.
This spell cannot be countered. The plant cannot be poisoned and killed. The brambles can be beaten back, but they are relentless. They will not come within five square meters of a stairwell, but everything else will be encompassed, including towns and buildings and everything that's not a saferoom.
And it starts right now.
Oh, one last thing I forgot to mention regarding the saferoom rule. The filling of the blood bar is retroactive. That means if you haven't killed anything at all on this floor, your bar is empty. Heads up!
Good luck. And just remember, you brought this onto yourselves. [[Category:Quests]]

Crocodilian are lizard creatures that make good barbarians.
They have an ability that triples the effectiveness of any buffs they receive from eating creatures.
== Known Crocodillian ==

[[Carl]] lost his Celestial Quest Box due to a Syndicate Court Order when [[Borant Corporation|Borant]] sued to prevent excessive awards.
==Description== You got fucked by a fish. You've done something so spectacularly controversial, courts and lawyers had to get involved. The end result was *my* decision being overturned.

'''Cursed Light Walker''' is a status condition and debuff that causes a creature's health to slowly decline when in darkness. If the creature's health reaches zero, they die and crumple to dust.<ref>{{ref|5|47}}</ref>

This achievement and having one trillion views are the two pre-requisites that allow [[Donut]] to select the [[Former Child Actor]] class during class selection on the third floor.{{ref|3|1}} == References == [[Category:Achievements]]

He refered to [[Astrid]] as his "mother". After she died he requested Carl to take his fellow NPCs with him to prevent them being repurposed. After Carl agreed he went off to try and kill [[Hamed]]. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

{{Character_info|crawler_#=2,165,570|height=6'0"|class=[[Swashbuckler]]|species=Human {{!}} [[Tigran]]|first_appearance=Chapter 23, Book 2|status=Alive|allies=* [[Katia Grim]] * [[Carl]] * [[Donut]] * [[Grace Bautista 3]] * [[Nica]] * [[Lea]]|patrons=[[Jaxbrin Amusements, Limited]]|title1=Daniel Bautista 2|party=[[Team Katia]]|image1=00556.jpg}}
Daniel Bautista is of Asian, possibly Filipino, descent when he enters the dungeon with his sisters and cousins. He chooses the [[Tigran]] race but regrets it later. His family is killed by [[Former Circus Lemur|Former Circus Lemurs]] and avenged by [[Carl]] and [[Donut]].
He begins a romantic relationship with [[Katia Grim]] and keeps her secrets.
== Description == He's well muscular and doesn't wear a shirt. Owns a curved sword.
== Personality == He's highly religous.
== Skills == As a swashbuckler he gets a bonus when he’s working with other members of his class like [[Tran]].
He's able to cast the tame spell which he uses on his less cooperative beanie babies.
== Gear == He has around a thousands beanie babies that he uses as pets. Later on his sponser gives him somethings that lets him reuse beanie babies provided they live, he can only do this twice for each one.
On the sixth floor he recieved a shape changing ring.
== Relations == He had four brothers and sisters and fifteen cousins, all of which are now dead.
He had a quest to kill [[Miss Quill]] but was unable to finnish it due to Carl and Donut killing her first. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

[[File:00855.jpg|thumb|Deloris Doesn’t Splat]] Devised by a [[Crocodilian]] crawler whilst she was falling down a deep pit that took over 10 minuets to reach the bottom.
Made from combining two potions, one used during the breeding of rock buffalo and another that mimics [[Katia Grim|Katia’s]] Crowd Blast ability. It only works while falling at speeds greater than 200 kilometers per hour.
When taken it causes anyone currently falling to speed up and softens any surface they hit causing them to bounce five times.

[[File:00014.jpg|thumb|Denise]] Denise is a feral goose.
== Trivia == It's revealed on the sixth floor that she loved reading to children.
== Abilities == Magic item’s don’t work in her presense and she can’t be harmed by magical or physical damage unless it's from items that originated from within the hosue.
== AI Description == Denise! The Feral Goose Mother! Level 53 Borough Boss!
Like most of the creatures in this godsforsaken bubble, Denise shouldn't be here. She was plucked directly from the seventh floor when her grandfather, emperor Anser, decided to use a magical gate to bring his people to this world. But like many of those who were unwilling in their journey to this place, she lingered too long in the inbetween. The [[Nothing]].
She paid dearly for it. Her mind is all but gone.
The gnomes captured her long ago, but they do not know what she really is. Denise doesn't know either. She has a few special abilities. Abilities that only recently started to manifest themselves. She can prevent magic from harming her. She is an environmental. She has an overwhelming need to protect children.
But most of all, she just wants to kill everybody. Especially bitches.
And guess what you are? [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Borough Boss]]

[[Carl]] fell into the Temple of [[Diwata]].
==Description== You have found a desecrated temple! That means all the temple's attendants have been murdered. The temple's treasury has been looted. The sacred wine has probably been all lapped up, too.
And this used to be a nice town. It hasn't been the same since you guys moved in.
If you are an adherent of this temple, you may no longer worship here. You've also probably just received a quest to hunt down and kill the heather who did this.
If you ''don't'' worship this god, just scram. Remember that time you walked in on mommy and daddy playing leapfrog? It's just like that. Back away. Don't touch anything. Never talk about it again.
You should also probably avoid the person who did this. Not only does society frown upon those who slaughter whole congregations, but there are real consequences for this sort of stuff.
'''''Reward''''': You entered a building. You don't get a reward for that. It's not like you kicked it up a notch by defiling the shrine.
Oh, wait. [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Stub}} {{Quote | quote = This place is like your Las Vegas Strip mixed in with Mardi Gras and the discos of the 1970s. <small>-- [[Mordecai]]<ref>{{ref|2|15}}</ref></small>}} '''The Desperado Club''' is one of two [[Dungeon]]-based clubs that crawlers can gain membership to. Its logo is a stylized knife dripping knife, and its tagline is, "So fun it hurts."<ref>{{ref|2|12}}</ref>
{{Group|part_of=[[Dungeon]]|type=Club|first=Book 2, Chapter 12|status=Active}}
==Description== A seedy casino, marketplace, and strip club rolled into one.
There are multiple secret passageways and tunnels, including some with monsters in them.
==Layout==
*First Room - general pub, exclusive to the specific town. No pass needed. *Pet Room *Main Room - a nightclub with a dance floor and a bar, people are in the same room as everyone in all club locations. *Casino * The Hunting Grounds - opened on sixth floor *Guild-O-Rama - rogue-themed guild rooms, including explosives guild *Bitches - female strip club and brothel *High Class Bitches * Penis Parade - male strip club and brothel *Penis Palace - male strip club *Badger bar *Drug dens *Secret potion market *Jobs - [[:Category:Quests|quest]] hub *The Silk Road - market that includes Hobgobs and Boom Sticks store. *Restrooms *Back Offices - [[Astrid]], [[Orren]] *Cosmic Lounge
[[Category:Dungeon Organizations]] [[Category:Dungeon]] [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Groups]]
<references />

''Warning'': Holding a Desperado Pass negates the ability to obtain a Vanquisher pass.

== Description == You have seen a deity. Don’t get too excited. It doesn’t mean you’re a prophet or anything like that. This is a pretty common achievement that all crawlers eventually receive if they survive long enough, so you aren’t really that special. Finding a god is easy. What you don’t want is for that god to find you.
''Reward'': You now have the option to worship the god [[Grull]].
'''Admin Note:''' There is a new tab now available in your interface. [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:00721.jpg|thumb|Diwata]] She is a god of nature and is often worshiped by [[Dryad|dryaids]]. She is distantly related to [[Apito|Apido]]. Known to changes genders but is normally referred to by female pronouns.
She normally appears as a squirrel with antlers that's covered in moss and leaves but she is capable of shapeshifting. She uses her shapeshifting to sleep with different creatures, she then gives birth to regular versions of those creatures.
Known for doing strange things such as impregnating herself then eating her own offsprings and forming cities with her poop.
During the [[Sixth Floor|Hunting Grounds]] she was sponsored by [[Circe Took]] so she could sleep with her daughter and cure her [[Arrow of Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea|enthusiastic double gonorrhea]].
== Appearance == Her natural form is a giant squirrel like creature with antlers that's covered in moss and leaves.
[[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]]

{{Quote | quote = “That’s not how this works, Carl.” <small>-- [[Elle McGib]]<ref name=":0"/></small>}}{{Item|title=Doggy Door|type=Personal Space Upgrade|effects=* Fast-travel}} The '''Doggy Door''' is a Tier-3 Personal Space Upgrade that allows crawlers to fast-travel to any door they have previously used on the floor, or to the location of other party members.<ref name=":0">{{ref|6|63}}</ref>
==AI Description== Personal Space Upgrade. Tier 3 Doggie Door.
So, you’re out adventuring, and you suddenly have a hankerin’ for those sweet pancakes you had two weeks back at some dive that’s now over two hundred kilometers away. What are you gonna do? Travel for several hours in the wrong direction just to get another taste? Psshh. Okay, loser.
The cool kids use the doggie door.
Upgrades the door in your personal space to allow a selectable exit via any door you have previously utilized on this same floor, effectively creating a fast travel waypoint system. Allows shared gated access amongst guests and party members.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (pp. 596-597). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>
==Description== As a Tier-3 Upgrade, the Doggy Door would not typically be available until the [[Ninth Floor]]. It costs 25million gold to install as a [[Guilds | Guild-wide]] upgrade.<ref name=":0" />
==Story== {{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler = [[Lucia Mar]] gives (5) of these to [[Li Jun]] and [[Li Na]] on the [[Eighth Floor]]. They installed one in [[Imani C]]'s personal space, so anyone who has access to Imani's room (i.e. all of [[Safehome Yolanda]] can quickly travel to the location of Meadowlark party members. }}

“Cats don’t shoot lasers from their eyes either, but here we are, Carl. Mama needs a night off.”-- (Book 2, Chapter 15) }} '''GC, BWR, NW Princess Donut the Queen Anne Chonk''' is the secondary protagonist of [[Dungeon Crawler Carl (Book) | Dungeon Crawler Carl]]. She is a tortoiseshell Persian cat formerly belonging to [[Carl|Carl's]] ex-girlfriend [[Beatrice]]. She is the party leader of the [[Royal Court of Princess Donut]]. == Description == Before entering the [[Dungeon]], Princess Donut was a pedigreed, award-winning show cat who belonged to [[Carl]]'s ex-girlfriend [[Beatrice]] and was bred by Bea's family. She participated in shows "almost every weekend," and a full bedroom of their two-bedroom Seattle, WA apartment was dedicated to her ribbons, trophies, and awards.{{ref|1|1}} At home, Donut enjoyed yogurt and Purrfect Cat Treats, and spent her free time watching television or sitting in Carl's lap while he played video games.{{ref|1|9}} {{ref|1|28}} In the most upsetting moment of her pre-dungeon life, [[Angel]], the neighbor's cocker spaniel, broke one of Donut's jingly ball toys.{{ref|1|19}} The morning of the [[Transformation]], Donut escapes the apartment for the first time with the intention of finding [[Ferdinand]], and Carl braves the freezing winter night to rescue her.{{ref|2|19}} Carl carries her down the [[Dungeon Entrance|staircase]], and Donut receives a Legendary [[Quadruped Box]] for being the first cat to enter the Dungeon. As the first crawler to enter the Dungeon with a cat, Carl receives a [[Pet Box|Legendary Pet Box]] containing an [[Enhanced Pet Biscuit]], which Donut snaps out of his hand before melting into a furry heap of goo.{{ref|1|6}} Eventually, she emerges as a talking, sentient cat with the [[Enhanced Growth]] buff, which elevates her base stats and gives her four (automatically assigned) stat points each time she levels up. Now the party member with the highest total stat points, she is designated party leader and promptly renames the party the [[Royal Court of Princess Donut]] and changes Carl's title to "Royal Bodyguard." She opens her Quadruped Box and does not read the description before equipping its prize, the [[Enchanted Crown of the Sepsis Whore]], which requires her to slay the entire [[Blood Sultanate]] royal family on the [[Ninth Floor]].{{ref|1|7}} Donut's low constitution prevents her from engaging in melee combat; instead, she largely relies on charisma and spells. Near the end of the [[Second Floor]], she insists on adopting and bonding with [[Mongo]], who she treats like her child. After arriving on the [[Third Floor]], she selects the [[Cat]] race and the bard/rogue class [[Former Child Actor]], allowing her to pick a new class on each level. As her repertoire of skills and spells continue to grow, she is rapidly becoming a jack-of-all-trades in the dungeon and a social media force in the galaxy. ==Appearance== A tortoiseshell Persian, Donut is described "one of those fluffy, flat-faced cats that look like they need to be sitting on the lap of a Bond villain" and as "fuzzy, black and beige and white." Donut is deliberately depicted incorrectly on the book covers and in the Donut Holes logo. Matt Dinniman commented on reddit, "Before I wrote books, I drew pictures of cats for a living. Torties are my favorite cats, but they are—by far—the most difficult colorings to draw, and I wasn't going to subject another artist to that."[https://www.reddit.com/r/DungeonCrawlerCarl/comments/197jid2/comment/ki1f2or/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web3x&utm_name=web3xcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=share_button reddit comment] by Matt Dinniman (as u/hepafilter) ==Personality==

''"Have you ever woken up from a long dream, one where you’re one thing, and now that you’re awake, it takes you a moment to realize that’s not who you really are?”''Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (p. 70; chapter 8). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
Princess Donut is a cat. She's vain, likes pretty things, and is initially afraid of getting dirty or injured. As she adjusts to her new awareness, she is rude enough that Carl prepares to leave her behind. She apologizes and they work together (with some hiccups) to survive. While Donut has moments where she can charm NPCs to give the group what she wants, she can also be extremely abrasive in less than opportune moments. Donut lives for the spotlight and pretends to be less clever than she is, but she is also extremely possessive and protective of "her" people. She shows affection with head-bumps, purrs, and enthusiastic messages in all caps. She has a deep fear of being left behind or abandoned. ==Relationships== Her grandmother is Princess Chonkalot. ==Levels & Stats== ===Book 1=== {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" | A shape-shifting race that rearranges its body mass to look like another race.
== Notable Doppelgängers ==
* [[Katia Grim]] [[Category:Races]]

[[Carl]] participated in the drama [[Vengeance of the Daughter]] during [[Sixth Floor|The Hunting Grounds]] while on [[Dungeon Crawler World]] as part of a deal he made on the third floor with the producers.
==Description== You are one of the first five crawlers to receive double-billing! I bet you don't know what that means. This is similar to switch-overs, but this time it's on purpose. I bet that didn't help at all.
''Reward:'' You have received a Platinum Fan Box! [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:00624.jpg|thumb|Double Tap]] A skill that adds the chance of landing a critical hit if a monster is hit twice in a row with the same attack.
[[Donut]] has this skill from the [[Enchanted Anklet of the Fallen Oak]]. [[Category:Skills]] [[Category:Donut]]

[[File:00852.jpg|thumb|Dr. Bones]] Dr. Bones is the DJ at the Penis Parade in the [[Desperado Club|Desperado]]. He is a level 90 [[Skin skelly|Skin Skelly]] [[bard]].
Has access to several crown control spells including the [[Conscript]].
[[Astrid]] was his former patron, after her death [[Carl]] became his new patron. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

A book on creating automatons, features a dwarf riding on the back of a mechanical horse on the cover. Autographed.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Books]]

Admin Notice. This page may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Posting spoilers for Book 7 will result in “acceleration” per this wiki’s rules. {{Character_info|species=[[Bune]]|status=Deceased, died on 11th or 12th floor of his crawl, sabotaged by the Naga}} == Description == One of the authors of the [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]], he was a crawler in a [[Naga]]-controlled season. He had a magic-based trap class, and had an elaborate scheme that was sabotaged by the show resulting in his death. It was the last season that the Naga ran the show, and Drakea was partially responsible for bankrupting them. He has the most entries in the cookbook, with many of them rambling and filled with hatred for the Naga. He wrote little about himself. He died on either the 11th or 12th floor when one of his traps exploded after being sabotaged by the naga, after his death the syndicate sued [[The Blood Sultanate]] and they filed for bankruptcy shortly afterwards. == Cookbook Entries == The saferoom restrooms are a good place to read. Just don't take too long or you'll get pinched. The rats say there's a Syndicate rule that they can't watch you in the bathroom stalls. This is just for the actual toilets, not the rest of the bathrooms. Dunno if it's true. Those Naga bastards are a suspicious lot, and I fear I may soon be discovered. (Chapter 8, Book 3) Once lit, a fire is easier to stoke than extinguish. Remember that. Fuck the snakes. Fuck the rats. Fuck them all. One day they will all burn, and while I'm certain I will be long dead, I will laugh. I will laugh long and hard, and I will be waiting for them on the other side of the veil where not even the vast expanse of stars or time will withhold my wrath. If you are reading this, friend, I pray you will join me. Side by side we will exact our revenge. (Chapter 13, Book 3) We found one of them and tied him to the front of our shield. Ha. The next day the Nagas patched it. Didn't make an announcement or anything, but the guy disappeared. Went back to the church to grab him again, and wouldn't let us take him from the building. We dragged him out the door, and he exploded and was reborn, Tried it five times before giving up. Turns out he knew the password to the safe that held the key for the stairwell chamber. (Chapter 26, Book 3) The hunters avoid the elites. They are smart enough to know not to fight against something they won't be allowed to easily defeat. The problem for us is elites are more dangerous than the hunters, and much more numerous. They should always be avoided. However, it appears some of the more powerful hunters go out of their way to hunt these elites anyway, all in a quest to gain more equipment and clout for themselves. It is a most dangerous game, one I am happy to watch play out. I am not yet powerful enough to kill either elite or hunter claw-to-claw, but with my new subclass, I am experimenting with hidden traps that may even the odds. I shall attempt not to directly slay either, but to bring hunter and elite together. The woman from the talk show let slip that the naga fools have offered insurance to those idiotic dramas that control the elite beasts. It will be my pleasure to watch the elites fail and die. While killing a hunter directly is a worthy feat, it is not a smart one. Killing individuals may be satisfying, but the true satisfaction is hurting them on a larger scale. When one values coin above life, you should target the coin, for it hurts them more. And that is my food. My life. My god. Hurting the naga and everyone responsible for this nightmare. (Chapter 24, Book 5) This is [[Volteeg]]'s first, last, and only entry in the cookbook. Fuck everything about this place. (Chapter 47, Book 5) This was [[Ikicha]]'s last entry. It took me awhile to understand what our brother truly meant when he posted this. Now that I know, I, too, struggle with the knowledge. Gone is gone. Dead is dead, and anything presented to you in any other matter is nothing but a cruel, sadistic tease. We are on a fabricated stage surrounded by puppets built by the enemy. Do not ever forget this. Even if I succeed. Even if I survive to this fabled 18th floor and emerge victorious, I hold no cursed faith for those who have been lost, and I suggest you do not, either. But that doesn't mean we still can't have hope. I dream of a fire that spreads across the sky like the Winter Nebula. A fire that reaches the beginning and the end, and even though this fire exists only in my mind - for now - the warmth of it is enough to sustain me, even on the coldest of nights. For you, Ikicha. (Chapter 52, Book 5) This was [[Everly]]'s last entry. She did not mention the manner in which she was set up, which is unfortunate. Please, future author. Be as detailed as you can. (Chapter 64, Book 5) Ever since I hit the tenth floor, I've noticed a peculiarity in some of the mobs. It is difficult to put into words, but it is like they are embracing death more and more. It's not that they are willing to fall upon my traps, but there is a strange... Joy? Curiosity? that only appears at the very end, when they know they have been beaten. But there's more. There's frustration, too. I must admit, it scares me. I know this will sound unhinged, and maybe I am indeed the one who has lost their mind, but I can't stop thinking about it. The voice that runs this world has been getting stranger and stranger in its words and rulings. I believe it is moving into the minds of these monsters, taking them over, but just at the point of death. It's as if it's desperately attempting to know what it's like to lose it all. But it keeps failing, so it keeps trying. It's frustration grows. If only I could convince it to move into the minds of one of these nagas. (Chapter 42, Book 6) If you get the chance, don't hesitate. Not for one second. (Chapter 50, Book 6) This is [[Priestly]]'s second-to-last entry. Do yourself a favor. Don't read the last one. He doesn't make it to the battle once he sees what has happened to Larracos, and that's all you really need to know. Fuck them all. (Chapter 54, Book 6) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{Item|effects=+5 to the Detect Traps Skill Remote Detonator Benefit
Level 15 Tripper Spell|source=Lusca(City Boss) - Gold Boss Box}}
== Description == This handy-dandy, versatile garment can be worn around the neck, in the hair, or on your face if you want to cosplay as a cowboy robbing a bank. Can also be tied around your arms or legs, but only if you want to look like a moron. Don’t tie it around your leg.
This simple, square piece of fabric is a reminder that looks can be deceiving.
== Effects == The wearer of this item receives the following benefits:
* +5 to the [[Detect Trap Skill|Detect Traps skill]].
* Wearer may cast a level-15 [[Tripper|''Tripper'' spell]] once every five hours.
*'''The Remote Detonator benefit:''' If you’re one of those explodey guys, I bet you use a lot of Hobgoblin Pus or Troll Boom-Boom Paste to make your bombs pop. Those days are now over. This benefit allows you to magically remote-detonate any explosive that has been designated by you. ''This benefit offers multiple physical and interface-based triggering options when combined with a Sapper’s table.''
== Trivia == Appears to be named for [[Drakea]]
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Clothing]] [[Category:Floor 5]]
#REDIRECT [[Dreadnoughts]]Large red humanoids [[Category:Races]]

[[File:00914.jpg|thumb|A Dreadnought taking a well earned break after nailing a big presentation]] Large humanoid creatures with red skin, they rarely did well in faction wars because their prefered method of fighting was to just hit everything in front of them.‏‎
The Dreadnoughts where one of the original participants in faction wars, they withdrew after [[Carl]] destroyed their army when he flooded Larracos. The warchief's wife got stung by a [[Pain Amplifier Jellyfish]] and the chief himself had to kill her to stop the pain.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]] [[Category:Factions]] [[Category:Races]]

[[File:00543.jpg|thumb|Drek]] A knee-high, fat, wrinkly monster with sharp claws and teeth. They stand on two feet but can climb on all fours. They wear loincloths and cry like babies.
== AI Description == '''Drek. Level 6.'''
Everybody loves babies, right? What kind of asshole doesn't love babies? How about demonic, ravenous, berserking babies who travel in packs of at least 50? It's rumored these lil' rascals can devour a full-sized elephant down to the bone in less than five seconds. And you're a lot smaller than an elephant. [[Category:Mobs]]

{{Character_info|species=[[Iguanoid]] {{!}} Moon [[Elf]] {{!}} [[Gondii]]|first_appearance=Chapter 33, Book 5|gear=in his season, a plasma saw}}
A former crawler and member of [[The Dream]], but now with a [[Valtay]] in his brain. He is old and scarred, but still heavily muscled. Carl meets him on the panel [[Crawling Through the Ages]] at [[CrawlCon]]!
He was stabbed in the back and killed after bragging about how good a fighter he was in a way station bar.
He was an option for one of the options for [[Carl]] and [[Donut|Donut's]] [[Adjutant]]. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:CrawlCon]] [[Category:Aliens]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]]

[[File:00858.jpg|thumb|Dromedarian ]]
== Description == The Dromedarians are a common, formerly nomadic race that is found throughout the drier parts of the universe. With the ability to store mass amounts of liquid in their bodies, it is said a Dromedarian can survive up to two months without taking a single sip of water. When these hunters and warriors are placed in a situation where they can no longer wander, they tend to become lethargic, sloth-minded creatures. But make no mistake, this is a mighty race of warriors who were once known for their abject brutality.
Trapped atop the [[Fifth Floor|Necropolis of Anser]], these local Dromedarians are locked in a three-way stalemate with the Bactrians and the Dirigible Gnomes. Any day now this smoldering conflict could boil over into an all-out war. A war they probably would not survive. In the meantime, they’re perfectly content to sit around, smoke weed, and do their best to drink all their problems away. [[Category:Races]] [[Category:NPC]]
Unknown. [[Category:Races]]

revision.comment: Created page with "{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Dumber of the Flunkies}} == AI Description == '''New Quest. The Dumber of the Flunkies''' THIS IS A GROUP QUEST. All survivors of the [[Where the Red God Glows|previous group ques]]<nowiki/>t are now a party to this quest. And why the hell not, all Crawlers in Bubble number 18 are also added to the quest. Let's make it a fiesta. ''Your party has been designated Host of this Group Quest.'' No parties may opt-out of this quest. Oh boy, oh boy do we..."
revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Dumber of the Flunkies}}
== AI Description == '''New Quest. The Dumber of the Flunkies'''
THIS IS A GROUP QUEST. All survivors of the [[Where the Red God Glows|previous group ques]]<nowiki/>t are now a party to this quest. And why the hell not, all Crawlers in Bubble number 18 are also added to the quest. Let's make it a fiesta.
''Your party has been designated Host of this Group Quest.''
No parties may opt-out of this quest.
Oh boy, oh boy do we have a situation here. [[Emberus]], god of fire and ash seems to believe that his son's missing puppy is inside of bubble 18. The dog is not, in fact, within that bubble. He's just outside of 543, having been recently rescued from a painful death. The next step should be easy. You just gotta bring the two together. Once that happens, both Emberus and [[Orthrus]] will immediately return to the Celestial Halls and everything will be almost back to normal.
If something happens to the pup, you will fail this quest. If you fail this quest, you will each in turn be smote by Emberus one by one, no matter what floor you're on. You probably don't know what that means. You don't want to know what that means.
Hmmm. Maybe that's a little too easy. Do you know not a single crawler in Bubble 18 has yet died? The whole world has been turned to lava, and they're all still alive! That's just ridiculous. That's no fiesta. Let me think on this for a minute.
'''''Reward''''': You will receive a [[Quest Box|Platinum Quest Box]]. [[Category:Quests]]

revision.comment: Added as special category to Dungeon Category.
revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:The World Dungeon}} {{Location | title = The World Dungeon | image = Dungeon.jpg | system = The Milky Way (Orion's Arm) | planet = Earth | organization = [[Borant Corporation | The Borant Corporation]] [[Valtay | The Valtay Corporation]] | first = Book 1, Chapter 2 }} The World Dungeon is an eighteen level maze created when Earth underwent the [[Transformation]]. It features on the current season of [[Dungeon Crawler World|''Dungeon Crawler World'']], which is produced by [[Borant|the Borant Corporation]]. ==Description== While the 18-Level World Dungeon is ostensibly a process by which a human can reclaim control of Earth from [[Borant]], it is really a way to generate income via advertising, sponsorships, royalties, and purchases in [[Dungeon Crawler World|''Dungeon Crawler World'']], a deadly alien game show. Should a crawler actually exit the dungeon's [[Eighteenth Floor|18th]] floor, they will win regency of Earth. No crawler is expected to survive this long. One person in the history of Dungeon Crawler World made it as far as the [[Thirteenth Floor|13th]] floor. He died within 30 minutes. ==Floors== Each floor is progressively more difficult. [[First Floor|Floors 1]] and [[Second Floor|2]] are considered "[[Tutorial|tutorial]] levels." After arriving on the [[Third Floor|third floor]], Crawlers are given the opportunity to choose their race and class. They may further specialize their classes on the [[Sixth Floor|sixth floor]]. On the [[Fourth Floor|fourth floor]], sponsorship bidding begins and a [[Dungeon Leaderboard]] populates with the top ten crawlers. Floors [[Third Floor|3]], [[Sixth Floor|6]], [[Ninth Floor|9]], [[Twelfth Floor|12]], [[Fifteenth Floor|15]], and [[Eighteenth Floor|18]] are special in that they are all created at the same time and linked in an in-universe fairy tale. Excluding [[Third Floor|floor 3]], they are also the levels where "tourists," or rich [[Syndicate]] citizens, can pay to enter the floors and fight each other and/or crawlers. All other floors are created as needed, following a proposal submitted before the season airs. Each floor collapses after the specified time limit, killing any crawler who has not descended to the next floor or made a deal (typically for indentured servitude) to eventually exit the dungeon. In general, crawlers who enter the stairs to the next floor more than six hours before floor collapse are put in stasis until floor collapse and then placed on the next floor without being aware time has passed. Crawlers who descend with less than six hours remaining not only get more time leveling up, but are also allowed to move to the next floor immediately, getting a head start on those who descended early. Here is a list of the floors in the dungeon with basic stats on the floor. All times are calculated from the known time of the [[Transformation]]. Each time assumes that the collapse timer for the next floor begins when the previous floor has six hours remaining. {| class="fandom-table" |+ ! Floor !Name !Exits !Mob Level !Duration !Start Time ! End Time |- !0 ![[Dungeon Entrance | Earth Surface]] |150,000 |None |0 days |Jan. 03 2:43 AM |Jan. 03 2:43 AM |- !1 ![[First Floor | The First Floor]] |75,000 |1 - 11 |5 days |Jan. 03 2:43 AM |Jan. 08 2:43 AM |- !2 ![[Second Floor | The Second Floor]] |37,500 | |6 days |Jan. 07 8:43 PM |Jan. 13 8:43 PM |- !3 ![[Third Floor]]: The Over City |18,750 | |8 days |Jan. 13 2:43 PM |Jan. 21 2:43 PM |- !4 ![[Fourth Floor]]:The Iron Tangle |9,375 | |10 days |Jan. 21 8:43 AM |Jan. 31 8:43 AM |- !5 ![[Fifth Floor]]: The Bubbles |4,688 | |15 days |Jan. 31 2:43 AM |Feb. 15 2:43 AM |- !6 ![[Sixth Floor]]: The Hunting Grounds |2,344 | |17 days |Feb. 14 8:43 PM |Mar. 03 8:43 PM |- !7 ![[Seventh Floor]]: The Great Race |1,172 | |20 days |Mar. 03 2:43 PM | |- !8 ![[Eighth Floor]]: The Ghosts of Earth |586 | |21 days | | |- !9 ![[Ninth Floor]]: The Faction Wars |293 | | | | |- !10 ![[Tenth Floor]]: | 147 | | | | |- !11 ![[Eleventh Floor]]: |74 | | | | |- ! 12 ![[Twelfth Floor]]: The Halls of Ascendancy | 37 | | | | |- !13 ![[Thirteenth Floor]]: |19 | | | | |- !14 ![[Fourteenth Floor]]: |10 | | | | |- !15 ![[Fifteenth Floor]]: Sheol |5 | | | | |- !16 ![[Sixteenth Floor]]: |3 | | | | |- !17 ![[Seventeenth Floor]]: | 2 | | | | |- !18 ![[Eighteenth Floor]]: Scolopedra's Lair |1 | | | | |} Note: Though the year is never specified in the books, it does state that The Transformation occurred on Tuesday, January 3rd. 2017 was the most recent year prior to the book's publication that had January 3rd fall on a Tuesday. 2023 is the next time this will happen. Just a fun fact for you. ==System AI== The [[System AI]] maintains the operation of the World Dungeon, running everything from the physics systems to the item descriptions, awarding achievements and [[Loot Boxes|loot boxes]] to the crawlers, and generally acting as the main force keeping the dungeon deadly for the crawlers and interesting for the spectators watching the show. == Inhabitants== Aside from the crawlers making their way through the dungeon, each floor of the World Dungeon is filled with a variety of mobs and bosses placed there by the show runners to fight crawlers. In addition, NPCs provide services in the dungeon and act as [[quest]] givers and characters for the crawlers to interact with. ===New Crawlers=== Upon entering the Dungeon, new Crawlers are healed of any existing physical ailment or illness that may kill them; however, the denizens of Meadowlark are not healed of senility. In Book 6, we learn that crawlers who previously took psychiatric medication may no longer require the medication. Biologically female Crawlers are notified that their menstrual cycles have been suspended and they cannot fall pregnant while they are in the Dungeon. Any children (with one obvious exception) or pregnant women who attempt to enter the Dungeon are teleported away to the kinder facility on Earth's surface. Children that enter the dungeon aren't allowed to participate, if they enter the dungeon they are taken away and looked after by a [[Youth Assistant]], the minimum age depends on species and intelligence. == History==
The original council nations accidentally tripped the Primal engines, causing galactic overpopulation.  Eventually the Primal elements were collected and the council concluded the “new biological overgrowth” had to be “beat back”.  The Hive, at the forefront of decoding Primal tech, developed the first macro AIs.  They made a proposal to the syndicate government, which was sent to subcommittee. The dungeon crawl apparently originated there.
-Butcher’s Masquerade, Chapter 33 [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Dungeon Floors | {{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dungeon | {{PAGENAME}}]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook}}{{Book|title=The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook|author=Matt Dinniman|previous=[[Carl's Doomsday Scenario (Book) | Carl's Doomsday Scenario]]|next=[[The Gate of the Feral Gods (Book) | The Gate of the Feral Gods]]|illustrator=''Cover:'' [https://www.artstation.com/lucianofleitas Luciano Fleitas]|datePublished=March 19, 2021|publisher=Matt Dinniman|image=DCCBook03.jpg|pages=532 (Paperback Edition)|isbn=979-8724495066}}'''''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook''''' is a fictional LitRPG fantasy adventure novel by Matt Dinniman, and the third installment in the ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' book series. It is available in paperback, digital, and audiobook formats.
== Official Summary == '''Welcome to the Gun Show!'''
The top ten list is populated. The sponsorship program is open. The difficulty is ramping up. The first three floors were nothing compared to what Carl and Donut now face.
The Iron Tangle. An impossibly-complicated subway system built out of the world's subterranean railway systems, all combined and then tied together into a knot. Up is down. Down is up. Close is far. The cars are filled with monsters, the railway stations are less than safe, and the exit is always just a few stops away.
But there is hope. For the first time, the crawlers are all working together. The loot is better than ever. And the secret to unraveling it all may be hidden in the pages of a seemingly-useless book. Welcome, crawlers. Welcome to the fourth floor of the dungeon.
[[Category:DCC Books]] {{DEFAULTSORT:03 The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Book)}}

:''This is an article about the item. For the book, see [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Book)]]'' {{SpoilH|3}}{{Item|title=The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook|image=[[File:Cookbook_Accented.png]]|type=Book|source=[[Prize Carousel | The Prize Carousel]]|keywords=[[Unique]]|effects=Scratchpad + 1 Page}} ==AI Description (Public)== '''Book. ''The Dungeon Anarchist’s Cookbook'' by Anonymous.''' '''This is a unique item.''' '''Chicken and Goblin recipes galore! But it’s more than that, too. Each recipe is accompanied by a hilarious tale by the anonymous author, recounting some of the zany and madcap misadventures they experienced gathering these mouth-watering recipes. Fun for the whole family! This book is a real hoot.'''Dinniman, Matt. The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (p. 121; chapter 7). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. ==Description== The cookbook is a thick book, approximately the size of a large dictionary, with a nondescript cover bearing an anarchy symbol in lieu of a title. One of two single books presented to Carl as options on [[The Prize Carousel]] on the [[Fourth Floor|fourth floor]], the cookbook glints as the carousel turns; he "couldn’t tell if that was the glow of magic or the glint of light off the gold-leafed pages."Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (p. 119; chapter 7). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. After selecting the item, Carl receives the same public AI description that everyone else sees. It is not until he cracks open the book that his [[Escape Plan Skill|Escape Plan]] skill triggers, and he sees the true welcome message: {{Quote | quote =

Hello, Crawler. As you’re about to find, this is a very special book. If you’re reading these words, it means this book has found its way into your hands for one purpose and one purpose only.

Together, we will burn it all to the ground. }} Created by the System AI during the 15th season of ''Dungeon Crawler World'', the cookbook has passed to crawlers who meet specific criteria and conditions. When a crawler inherits the cookbook, a second page is added to their [[HUD / Crawler Menu|scratchpads]] that allows them to record their discoveries, experiences, recipes, secret societies, thoughts, and more, for future cookbook holders to use. The cookbook takes a new form each time it enters the dungeon, typically tailored for the crawler. Neither the audience nor the show producers can see its contents, but the System AI is aware of its existence. The book does not break dungeon rules but, should ''anyone at all'' suspect that it is more than it appears to be, the crawler will lose access to the book. The book disappears from the crawler's inventory upon death or retirement.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 8). ==Previous Editions== {| class="article-table" style="width:100%" ! scope="col" | Edition ! scope="col" | Author ! scope="col" | Known Entries ! scope="col" | Topics |- ! scope="row" | 1st | | | |- ! scope="row" | 2nd |[[Porthus]] |2 |Possession |- ! scope="row" | 3rd |[[Dante]] | | |- ! scope="row" | 4th |[[Tipid]] |2 |[[Mysterious Bone Key]] |- ! scope="row" | 5th |[[Everly]] |4 |Mercenaries Sponsors |- ! scope="row" | 6th |[[Milk]] |8 |Country Bosses Demons
