page.title: Enchanted Toe Ring of the Leprous Bandit

revision.text:
A toe ring belonging to [[Carl]].
== AI Description == This is a unique item.
Most children in the universe know the exciting tale of the Leprous Bandit, the infamous human thief whose people were starving to death because of a planet-wide quarantine. While all the planet’s residents were carriers of the disease, it did not affect them. But because the disease was deadly to the Forsoothed, the planet’s regents, the aliens placed themselves in floating protection platforms, guarding the gardens and food stores in hopes to starve the humans all out.
The bandit climbed a mountain, jumped onto a platform, and broke into the floating garden. He was quickly killed, of course, but not before he infected the Forsoothed and caused them to flee the planet. Thanks to the bandit’s intervention, the human planet survived another 100 years before it was obliterated in an unrelated conflict. To this day, the Leprous Bandit remains an inspiration.
== Effects == This toe ring imbues the following:
* '''The Sticky Feet Benefit:''' Once every six hours, for (Dexterity x 2) seconds, you may walk upon a non-horizontal surface, such as a wall or ceiling. Gravity will not change, so leave your beer on the ground and make sure you tuck in your shirt first. Your bare feet must be in contact with the surface. No socks, no shoes. * '''The Super Spreader Benefit:''' You have been given the power of every plague rat and kindergartner since the dawn of time. You may pass any active debuffs onto a target of your choice once per hour. This does not remove the debuff from yourself.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Jewelry]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Toe_Ring_of_the_Leprous_Bandit}}

page.title: Enchanted Toe Ring of the Splatter Skunk
Enchanted War Gauntlet of the Exhalted Grull (Right-handed)

revision.text:
== AI Description == Item is a wrist bracer that transforms into a spiked war gauntlet made of orcish steel when the hand is shaped into a fist or wields a hilted weapon for more than two seconds at a time. This item on its own does not negate the [[Pugilism Skill|bare knuckle]] skill bonus.
* +3 Strength (In Fist Mode Only) * +1 Dexterity * + 2 Skill Levels to [[Iron Punch]]. * + 1 Skill Level to [[Powerful Strike]]. * 2% chance to Stun enemy upon a successful hit.
'''Warning''': if you use this weapon to strike adherents of the war god Grull, you have a 1.5% chance to transfigure your target into the deity himself. Trust me on this. You don’t want to do that.
A bigger, redder, WARNING. Remove this item before you jerk off.
== Upgraded Stats == After Carl received a [[Platinum Sharpening Stone]], he used it to upgrade the gauntlet to the following:
* +4 Strength (In Fist Mode Only) * +2 Dexterity * + 2 Skill Levels to Iron Punch. * + 1 Skill Level to Powerful Strike. * 2% chance to Stun enemy upon a successful hit. *Plus (2 x current level)% damage to all attacks.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Clothing]] [[Category:Weapons]] {{DEFAULTSORT:War_Gauntlet_of_the_Exhalted_Grull_(Right-handed)}}

page.title: Enchanted Wrestling Belt of the Great Gorgo

revision.text:
[[File:00440.jpg|thumb|[[Enchanted Wrestling Belt of the Great Gorgo]]]] A wrestling belt belonging to [[Katia Grim]]
== AI Description == While you’ll never be as amazing as the greatest, most beautiful wrestler of all time—Christopher Alan Pallies—you will look pretty snazzy when you wrap this bad boy around your waist.
This enchanted belt offers the following benefits:
* +5% Strength * +5% Constitution * +The Avalanche benefit.
'''Avalanche Benefit:''' This benefit is straightforward. If you hit a living creature with your body while you are moving, the force exerted upon that body will be as if they were hit by twice the mass.
*Your entire body must be moving for this benefit to activate. This benefit’s power will not translate to weapons. *You might want to take this off if you plan on getting busy with someone. Especially if you’re the top
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Clothing]] [[Category:Accessories]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Wrestling_Belt_of_the_Great_Gorgo}}

page.title: Enchanters Paupers Ring of the Steadfast Emberus

revision.text:
[[File:00160.jpg|thumb|Enchanted Pauper's Ring of the Steadfast Emberus]] Removes most health seeping and diseased based debuff effects, also numbs other debuff effects. Too many debuffs of any kind will temporary mute or overheat this ring. Can only be worn by a worshipper of [[Emberus]] and will turn into a cursed item if worn by a non worshipper. This ring can only be seen by a worshipper of Emberus, otherwise it will appear as an enchanted strength ring.
This ring has a debt attached to it, it can not be sold whilst the debt is unpaid, if you loss this ring the loan repayment will accelerate, if you're expelled from the church you will be effected by it’s curse.
This ring is cursed, if a non-worshipper attempts to wear the ring they will find themselves infected with every debuff suffered by anyone within 50 meters of this ring.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Jewelry]]

A tattoo that looks like a flaming ball of snakes.
== Effects ==
* You can nolonger worship [[Diwata]] and all adherence outside of [[Club Vanquisher]] will attack you on sight, including Diwata herself. * You gain a twenty five percent damage bonus against worshipers of Diwata. * This tattoo can’t be hidden and can only be removed by killing [[Diwata]] or chopping of your arm.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Tattoo]]

[[File:00872.jpg|thumb|Engaged Lockbox of the Nightworm]] A lockbox containing [[The Orchid of Eileithyia’s Grace]].
Obtained by [[Katia Grim]] from a celestial loot box after she flooded Larracos‏‎, to open it she must complete three tasks, kill someone you are currently or formerly partied with, kill a country or level boss and find a [[Guild of Suffering|guild of suffering]] and complete an assassination quest. [[Category:Loot Boxes]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

'''Enhanced Growth''' is a status condition and Buff that boosts four random stats, and then gives crawlers four automatically assigned stat points upon leveling up (instead of the standard three). It is one of the 100 possible outcomes of consuming an [[Enhanced Pet Biscuit]].
==AI Description == :'''After an initial boost to four random stats, all additional levels will automatically grant +1 to Strength and Intelligence. Charisma will gain +2 per level. No additional stat points will be received upon level-up.'''<ref>{{ref|1|7}}</ref>
==References== <references /> [[Category:Status Conditions]] [[Category:Donut]]

The Enhanced Pet Biscuit is a small, hard but crumbly brown pellet that looks like a cat treat. There are over 100 possible effects; half of the effects are good, while the others lean toward neutral or disastrous.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 5).</ref> {{Item|title=Enhanced Pet Biscuit|type=consumable|effects=random (any of 100 possible effects)|source=[[Pet Box | Legendary Pet Box]]|image=[[File:00086.jpg|thumb|Enhanced Pet Biscuit]]}}Mordecai recommends only using these in safe rooms (so that - in the event of a bad outcome - the pet will teleport to a random place within one square mile of the crawler), or selling them for a few thousand gold.
==AI Description== '''Enhanced Pet Biscuit.'''
'''So, it looks like a regular pet biscuit. It’s not.'''
'''Feed to your pet at your own risk. What’s the worst that can happen?'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (p. 55). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. </ref>
== Possible Effects == The pet-class creature that consumes this item may experience one of these effects. The transformation takes approximately five minutes.<ref name=":0" />
* Receive the [[Enhanced Growth]] [[:Category:Buff|buff]].<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 6).</ref> * Transform into a [[hellspawn familiar]].<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 14).</ref> * Transform into a [[toothed fleshbutcher]].<ref name=":0" />
== References == <references />
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Food]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Pet Items]] [[Category:Floor 1]] [[Category:Floor 2]]

{{Character_info|party=[[The Dream]]}} Leader of [[The Dream]]. Son of [[Epitome Noflex]].
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

==Description== This skill allows for a crawler to more readily find hidden doors. It also has a hidden benefit that Mordecai was only allowed to explain to Carl due to Donut's [[Manager Benefit]]. It allows access to the Dungeon Locator, a concealed map at major intersections of the dungeon that gives a general overview of what's in every direction. It could point to exits and bosses. On Level 4, it offered a more detailed map of the train line the party was on. [[Category:Skills]]

The Eulogist is believed to be a stable primal AI engine. It is located in the inner system and spreads an enhancement zone over several solar systems.
It is worshipped as a god by the [[Nebular]].
[[Category:Syndicate History]] [[Category:Review Requested]] [[Category:Technology]]

'''Race: Half Nagini-Half Orc'''
{{Character_info|class=[[Nimblefoot Enforcer]]|species=Human {{!}} Half Nagini, Half-Orc|origin=Iceland|occupation=Economics Professor|party=[[Brynhild's Daughters]]|allies=[[Hekla]]|gear=Fangs of the Green Sultan|crawler_#=9,077,240|status=Deceased, killed by [[Katia Grim]] after Butcher's Masquerade|level=55|image1=00136.jpg}}
'''Class: Nimblefoot Enforcer'''
Eva Sigrid is of Icelandic descent. She worked with [[Katia Grim]] before the collapse. She was a member of Brynhild's Daughters and [[Hekla]]'s "right hand woman." After Hekla's death, Eva starts killing off other players including her fellow Brynhild's Daughters. During the sixth floor she managed to kill an [[Odious Creeper]] but lost most of her team mates.
Katia is able to kill Eva at the end of the Butcher's Masquerade, but not before Eva places the [[Enchanted Crown of the Sepsis Whore|Crown of the Sepsis Whore]] on Katia's head.
She's killed at least thirteen people by the time she was introduced in the [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Book)|third book]]. By the start of the [[Butcher's Masquerade]] she had killed over fifty player and had four hunter killer marks.
== Skills == She has some kind of charm ability, using it to persuad a bunch of NPC to attack Katia and her group.
== Gear == She had a piosoned rapier blade that attaches to her decapitated hand and a magical breastplate.
She had two enchanted swords, one of which was stolen by Katia.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}{{Character_info | species = Unknown (presumed to be an arthropod race) | organizations = [[Desperado Club]] | patrons = [[Dictum Waystation Controls, Limited]] | status = Deceased }} '''Everly''' is a former crawler and author of the ''[[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]'' (5th Edition). ==Description== Everly was a crawler thousands of cycles ago and a member of the [[Desperado Club]]. Her team included at least three other crawlers, including a healer, plus additional mercenaries. Her sponsor, [[Dictum Waystation Controls, Limited]], won her trust by sending her an item that ultimately saved her team. The next [[Sponsorship Box]] they sent her arrived on the Eighth Floor, and lead to her death. ==Cookbook Entries == ===On Mercenaries===
''We ended up hiring five [[ mercenaries]]. I got four from the Merc guild on the sixth floor of the Desperado Club, and another party member got a healer from [[Club Vanquisher]]. It was and continues to be a disaster. My guys cost us 1,500 gold a day each, and I’m not sure if it was worth it.'' ''First off, you have to be very careful with them. If they die, you can’t loot their bodies, and our contract stipulates you have to pay their daily rate for the rest of the damn floor. It’s outrageous. The healer charges per spell cast.'' ''Second, getting them from one place to the next is difficult if you use a [[Personal Space | personal space]]. It’s easy to lose them. If they leave with me, it’s fine. The door opens, and we walk out together. Otherwise, it automatically defaults to the last place they entered, as if they were a regular crawler. So if they’re not right there with you when you exit, they could end up three or four saferooms away. One of our guys left and never came back. He’s still alive, as I can see him in the chat, but the prick is just wandering around some town having a good ‘ol time and I can’t even fire him because you have to bring them back with you to let them go.'' ''Plus their levels mean next to nothing. My level-40 orc is a significantly better fighter than my level-50 dwarf, who is now dead, by the way. Got hit by a chair, of all things, and he died. Twenty-two more days at 1,500 gold a day. The whole thing is a scam.''Dinniman, Matt. The Butcher's Masquerade: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 5 (pp. 61-62). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|5|6}}
=== On Her Death ===
''My sponsor sent me a box today meant for someone else in my party. And not a crawler, but one of my mercenaries. A spellbook of Hasten Poison. I was quite upset about it. But not five hours later, he used that spell to kill the boss holding the lockbox key, and it saved the lives of us all. I don’t trust my sponsors, but I do trust that they want to keep me alive. As long as I breathe, their insipid advertisements remain on full display, and their investment is intact.''
''The moment I hit floor eight, they gave me a great box, as if to make up for the previous one. A tool that allows me to take shortcuts through this maze. I really want to hope. To think that there’s good out there. It’s in times like this that there’s a spark in my chitin, a longing for a future that contains warmth and stars.''
''I take it back. I take it all back. My sponsor was deliberately steering me not toward life, but a death that would be watched and remembered and ultimately heartrending and painful. I was a fool. Fuck you, Dictum Waystation Controls, Limited, whatever that means. I hope your company and all your children die in pain.''
''This is Everly’s last entry. She did not mention the manner in which she was set up, which is unfortunate. Please, future author. Be as detailed as you can.''Dinniman, Matt. The Butcher's Masquerade: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 5 (pp. 565-566). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|6|64}}
==Speculation== *She mentions feeling a "spark in her chitin," suggesting that she is or chose an arthropod class.{{ref|6|64}} ==References== [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

== Description == You have, with a single attack, killed every last member of a non-unique species on a dungeon’s floor. That’s not an easy thing to do, and it takes a special brand of asshole to pull something like this off.
Species killed: Wall Monitors.
''Reward'': You have received a [[Extinction Sigil Tattoo (Wall Monitor Race)|Platinum Asshole’s Box!]] [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Citation}} Removes automatic hostility for any natural enemies of lizard-class creatures.
'''Warning''': holding this Extinction Sigil will cause lizard-class enemies to deal 20% more damage against you. Any Wall Monitors will deal 150% more damage against you.
You may only hide this tattoo with a cover-up sleeve.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Tattoos]]

[[File:00255.jpg|thumb|Eye in the sky scroll]]These scrolls come in level 5, 10 and 15 varients. At level 5 they give infomation on the caster, at level 10 they just tell the target they've been spotted, at level 15 they receive no information at all. {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Scrolls]] [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]]
{{Stub}} A modification for traps that sends its user a notification if a trap is ever disabled or set off. [[Category:Traps]] [[Category:Items]]

{{SpoilH | 6}} {{Item|title=Failsafe|type=Syndicate Technology|effects=Star Destroyer}}{{Quote | quote = I am on a tight schedule and am one crisis shy of pulling the failsafe, which would kill us all. So don’t test me, especially not today. -- <small>[[Cascadia]] <ref>{{ref|6|21}}</ref></small>}} The '''failsafe''' is a standard safety measure in ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]].'' Once triggered by the [[Syndicate Council]], it destroys the solar system's sun, effectively killing everything and everyone in the solar system.<ref>{{ref|6|51}}</ref>
==Description== An unknown mechanism using unknown technology, activated by an unknown protocol. The "failsafe" typically enters discussion around or after the [[Twelfth Floor]] Halls of Ascendency, when the [[System AI]] begins to "go primal."<ref>{{ref|6|48}}</ref> Its purpose is appears to be to prevent a rogue AI from infecting the Center System.<ref>{{ref|6|epilogue}}</ref>
==References== <references />
[[Category:Dungeon Backstage]] [[Category:Technology]] [[Category:Syndicate History]]

== Description == Their magic is stored in their wings.
Orcish metal ball bearings are apparently deadly to them.

* Sprite

* [[Astrid]] (Bloodlust Sprite) [[Category:Races]]

[[Carl]] receives this achievement shortly after entering the [[First Floor|first floor]].
== AI Description == '''New achievement! Fall into an obvious trap.'''
'''''Reward:'' Well, if there's a heaven, and if you haven't been too much of an asshole, maybe they'll let you in. Because you about to meet your maker.'''<ref>''Dungeon Crawler Carl,'' Chapter 2</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

{{Character_info|species=Human|origin=Iceland|occupation=Professor}}
Based on comments from [[Katia Grim|Katia]] and [[Eva Sigrid|Eva]], he seems to be an ex-boyfriend of Katia's who called her useless and left her for one of his students. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

{{SpoilH | 5}} The Fantasy Hunter Camp is a camp run by [[Vrah|Vrah's]] family and simulates the [[Sixth Floor|sixth floor Hunting Grounds]], allowing participants to experience being a hunter without any risk of harm.{{ref|5|22}} [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] learn about the Fantasy Hunter Camp from [[The Dream]] [[Elf]], [[Akland]]. {{Quote | quote = I wasn't ever supposed to be in real danger. But they offered me money.
-- [[Akland]] (Book 5, Chapter 22) }} He tells them that once a cycle, [[The Dream]] rent the whole moon, allowing their family members and employees to compete for a few days in the simulated hunt. Those who perform best win spots on [[The Dream|The Dream's]] [[Ninth Floor|Faction Wars]] army. Having done well during [[The Dream|The Dream's]] last camp, [[Akland]] was offered a significant sum to instead enter the [[Sixth Floor|Hunting Grounds]]. [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

[[File:00612.jpg|thumb|Fear]]
== Description == '''Cost''': 3 Mana
If successfully cast, the effected mob either runs away, or stands its ground, but its Dexterity is lowered by an increasing amount per spell level. At level 5 it works on groups of enemies and a level 10 it has a 2% chance to paralyse an opponent and can be cast on a wide area. [[Category:Spells]]

{{Glossary Entry |Title = Feral |Definition = '''Feral''' is a keyword and status condition that indicates something has been touched by the [[Nothing]].<ref>{{ref|4|20}}</ref>}}<noinclude>[[Category:Keywords]]</noinclude>

The Feral Goose is a level 45 neighbourhood boss.
== History == A dirigible gnome fired one at [[Carl]], [[Donut]] and [[Katia Grim|Katia]] but it died from the landing.
[[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Neighborhood Boss]]

{{SpoilH | 5}} {{Character_info | species = [[Cat]] | aliases = Gravy Boat | origin = Earth: Seattle, WA | occupation = | first_appearance = Book 4, Epilogue | gear_head = Turban | party = | status = Alive | allies = [[Queen Imogen]] | hair = Yellow / Orange | level = 100 }}{{Quote | quote = “I imagine it’s time you learned of my secret affair. A princess and a ruffian. It wasn’t meant to be, but our love was pure.”<small>-- [[Donut]] (Book 2, Chapter 19)</small> }} Ferdinand (actually named "Gravy Boat") is a yellow and orange cat who lived with Marjory on the first floor of Carl's Seattle, WA apartment.<ref name=":0" />
==Description== An unneutered indoor/outdoor cat, Gravy Boat had impregnated every female cat within three square blocks and would sit outside Carl's second-floor window when Donut was in heat.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 19).</ref> Bea called him "Ferdinand" before she learned his real name.<ref name=":1">Dinniman, Matt. ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'' (epilogue).</ref> She called animal control on him twice and screamed at his owner Marjory about his presence.<ref name=":0" />
He was outside during the transformation, and was later found -- starving, half-feral -- by Brad and Bea. Ferdinand returned to New Queen Anne with them, and slept with Bea at night while she sang to him: ''“Good boy, good boy, you’re a good boy, Ferdinand. You’re no Gravy Boat. Oh no, oh no. I’d take it all back and let you in. I’d do it all over again. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry, Ferdinand. I should have let you in.”''<ref name=":1" />
Mercenaries kidnap him from the settlement and turn him over to [[Borant Corporation|Borant]]. Ferdinand is added to the dungeon as a Province Boss and familiar of [[Imogen|Queen Imogen]].
He was sent down to the 9th floor by the [[Zerzura]] spell along with everyone else inside the high elf castle. He managed to escape to the city but lost his hat.
==Abilities== His turban that gives him a lightning spell and be can turn invisible. He's also able to phase jump and has a powerful claw attack.
He rides a rhino as a mount.
===Stats===
*Str - 100 *Dex - 125 *Cons - 100 *Int - 100 *Cha - 75
== References == [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Boss]]
<references />

The fifth floor consists of thousands of individual giant domes called "bubbles". Before the start of the floor the [[The Royal Court of Princess Donut|Royal Court of Princess Donut]] where randomly assigned to one of four possible locations, the Razorfox Kite City, the Dirigible Gnome Wasteland Fortress, the Nightgaunt Precipice or the Great Dirt Island of the Wind Sirens.{{Dungeon Floor|floor_number=5|theme=Bubble Domes|duration=15 Days|exits=4,688|crawlers=178,887|start_date=January 31|preceded_by=[[Fourth Floor]]|followed_by=[[Sixth Floor]]}} ==Introductory Announcement==
''Hello, Crawlers. Welcome to the fifth floor! We are so very excited for you to enjoy this new and exciting level! We have just over 178,000 of you joining us. The last floor was somewhat of a mystery, and finding out how it worked was part of the fun. This floor is a little different. The layout is not so much a secret, and the rules are pretty simple. We want you guys to have a great time with this one.'' ''There are over 4,000 castles on this floor. Every castle contains a single stairwell. No two castles are the same. Think of a sheet of bubble wrap. Every bubble is its own self-contained world. Each individual world has four zones or “quadrants.”'' ''There are a total of 1,172 bubbles. All of you are inside of a bubble, equally and randomly distributed the best we could. That comes to a little more than 150 crawlers per bubble. Like with the castles, every bubble is different.'' ''Each bubble is split into four quadrants. Land, Sea, Air, and Subterranean. Each quadrant has a single castle within. Your mission is to find the castle, raid it, and take the throne room. Once the throne room is occupied or the quadrant’s boss is killed, the castle is considered conquered. The stairwell is also located in the throne room, so no need to be scrambling around, worried about not being able to find it. Easy, right? Take the castle, take the stairwell.'' ''But, there is a small hitch. In order for your stairwell to actually open up and be passable, all four castles in your bubble must first be taken. That’s right, the Land, Sea, Air, and Subterranean castles must all fall in order for you to proceed to the sixth floor.'' ''Luckily for you, once you have taken your own castle, you may traverse outside of your quadrant to lend a hand to your fellow bubble buddies. Once all four castles are taken, the bubble is popped, and you may proceed outside of the bubble area if you wish. You may not enter other bubbles until they are also popped.'' ''Good luck, folks. Some of these castles are much easier to crack than others. Also, the second round of sponsorship bidding is underway. We’ll have another message in a few hours after the regular recap episode. Now get out there and kill, kill, kill!''
== Bubble 543 and Its Occupants == === Air Quadrant - Castle of the Dirigible Gnomes === ==== Crawlers ==== * [[Carl]] * [[Donut]] * [[Firas]] * [[Katia Grim]] * [[Langley]] and five other salesmen-turned-archers * [[Louis]] ==== Mobs ==== * [[Male Thorny Devil]] * [[Feral goose|Feral Goose]] * [[Night Fright]] ==== Races and Notable NPC's ==== * [[Bactrian]] * [[Changeling]] ([[Henrik]], [[Juice Box]], [[Ruby]], [[Skarn]], [[Svern]], [[Spurn]]) * [[Dirigible Gnome]] ([[Bonnie]], [[Commandant Kane]], [[Leon]], [[Wynne]]) * [[Dromedarian]] ([[Clay]]) ==== Bosses ==== * [[Denise]] === Land Quadrant - Sandcastle of the Mad Dune Mage === ==== Crawlers ==== * [[Gwendolyn Duet]] ==== Mobs ==== * giant snakes * giant spiders * half-human half-scorpion punk rockers * Buzz-ard ==== Bosses ==== * [[Ruckus]] * [[Mrs. Ghazi]] === Water Quadrant - Bridge of the ''Akula'' === ==== Crawlers ==== * [[Britney]] * [[Chris Andrews]] * [[Vadim]] ==== Mobs ==== * [[Big Boy Blue]] * [[Bubble Beluga]] * [[Concierge Shark]] * [[Juvenile Octo-Shark]] * [[Pain Amplifier Jelly]] ==== Races ==== * [[Bugbear|Bugbears]] * Robots ==== Bosses ==== * [[The bugbears delight]] * [[Sentinel gun]] * [[Lusca|Lusca! Octo-Shark Brood Mother Queen!]] === Subterranean Quadrant - The Necropolis of Anser === * [[Bobby]] * [[Low Thi]] * [[Mike Barnes]] * [[Morris]] * [[Tyler Storm]] ==== Mobs ==== * ==== Bosses ==== * [[Quetzalcoatlus]] [[Category:Dungeon Floors]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Dungeon Floor 05}}

I’m not repeating this shit over and over, but you got seven of these bad boys all at the same time.
You and I have been named co-defendants in an action brought to the Syndicate Court by a third party, and we have been deemed—drum roll please—victorious! Why did they sue us? If you don’t already know why, you probably will never know. This is a rare event, but when it happens, crawlers usually lose these fights since they can’t afford a lawyer, being slaves and all. Plus I’ll throw you under the bus quicker than you can say “Arch Support.” But that doesn’t matter because today, victory is ours! Chalk one up for the little guy!
This is one of the rare achievements that may be awarded more than once.
''Reward'': You’ve received a Silver [[Summary Judgement Box]]! (x7) [[Category:Achievements]]
Puts the name of all nearby crawlers on the map and allows users to sort and find them via a list. [[Category:Skills]]

page.title: Find Out Who Killed My Son

revision.text:
== Description == '''New Quest. Find Out Who Killed My Son.'''
[[Geyrun]] was murdered. Find out who did it and why. My only clue is that the most obvious suspect, my brother [[Hellik]], was in council with the rest of us when it happened. Visit the high cleric at the Emberus Shrine at [[Club Vanquisher]] for additional details.
'''''Time Limit:''''' There is no time limit for this quest. However, you swill receive a smite if you attempt to exit the 18th floor of the world dungeon before this task is complete.
'''''Reward''''': That depends on who did it.
'''Quest Update. Find Out Who Killed My Son.'''
Obtain the item: Memorial Crystal: [[Apito]]. See if this has any bearing on Geyrun's murder. You still need to speak with the high cleric at the Emberus Shrine at Club Vanquisher. [[Category:Quests]]

{{Character_info|age=25|class=[[Hammersmith]]|species=Human|first_appearance=Chapter 1, Book 4|allies=* [[Louis]] * [[Britney]]|skills=[[Puddle Jumper]]|occupation=Car detailer and audio installer|title1=Firas M|level=35|origin=Miami|status=Deceased, killed by [[Queen Imogen]] Lightning Spell at the end of [[Sixth Floor|The Hunting Grounds]]}}
== Skills == He has access to the [[Puddle Jumper]] spell, currently at level 10.
== Appearance == Has a tattoo of bart simpson on his ankle.
== Gear == Owns an intelligence enhanced mace made for a clerics.
Carl gave him a cloak that has some hammer based attack skills.
== History == After arriving on the fifth floor he and [[Louis]] spent the time getting very drunk until [[Mordecai]] gave him his rapid detox potion.
He'd asked [[Katia Grim]] to sew tuxedos for him and [[Louis]] for when Louis and [[Juice Box]] got married. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

== AI Description == {{Character_info|species=Lesser Demon MILF|level=75|image1=00237y.jpg}} Fire(wo)man of the Nightmare Express. This is a non-combatant NPC. A single mother's gotta eat!
Where one finds big ovens that need stoking, one will regularly find a Lesser Demon in control. But if it's a fire that needs to be ''extra'' hot, the much rarer Sheol MILFs are often employed to keep those fires sizzling.
Once a pregnant Lesser Demon falls into labor, her delivery usually lasts about sixty days. During these two months, she has a litter of 15-18,000 babies, delivering one approximately every five minutes, non-stop.
Only one in 10,000 Lesser Demon babies are viable. The rest rarely live more than a few seconds. Their corpses shrivel and harden, becoming a valuable resource called Sheol Bricks. The 15th floor will be lousy with them. If exposed to fire, Sheol Bricks burn long and hot. Lesser Demon MILFs who also learn water magic can find lucrative work as steam boiler fire stokers. Once they seal themselves within the boiler, they create an almost self-sufficient system that keeps most larger boilers humming. Plus it's a convenient way of disposing of their failed young.
== Back Story == [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Demon]]

== Description == A support class.
== Abilities ==
* Juiced - provides temporary strength * Shrouded - provides temporary damage reduction * Trolled - provides temporary accelerated healing
== Crawlers with This Class == [[Imani C]] [[Category:Class]]

A lottery ticket Carl gets from a Platinum [[Lucky Bastard Box]]. It has five spots to scratch.
== AI Description == Scratch off a spot in the midst of battle, and this zany ticket casts a spell at the closest red-tagged mob! Each spot has a 50/50 chance. Will it cast a level-15 [[Fireball]]? Will it cast a glob of delicious, healing Strawberry Custard? Who knows! Either way, the results will be a hoot! Thirty minute cooldown between scratches.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Utility Items]]

revision.text: The Firecracker is a class Donut was offered for her [[Character Actor]] skill. [[Category:Class]]

{{Quote | quote = '''Welcome, Crawler. Welcome to the First Floor.'''}} {{Dungeon Floor |floor_number=1 |theme=[[Tutorial]] / Generic Fantasy |duration=5 Days |crawlers= < 13,000,000 |crawler_levels = 1 + |mob_levels = 1 - 5 |locations = [[Tutorial Guild Hall]] |start_date=January 03 |npcs=* [[Mordecai]] * Tally * B.A. * Face * Murdock * Rory * Lorelai * Mistress Tiatha * Sebastian |preceded_by=[[Dungeon Entrance]] | followed_by=[[Second Floor]] |exits=75,000 |mobs= * Axebeak * [[Bad Llama]] * Chilly Goat * [[Gnolls]] * [[Goblins]] * Scatterer * Slimes * Troglodyte | bosses = * [[The Hoarder]] * [[The Juicer]] * [[The Ball of Swine]]}} '''The First Floor''' is accessed from the [[Dungeon Entrance | surface-level staircases]] that populate the Earth after the [[Transformation]], and is considered a [[Tutorial | tutorial floor]]. Located beneath the Earth's surface, it is a sprawling, grid-like network of passages and tunnels that look like they were hewn out of rock. The vast level is split into sections that are not connected, so crawlers originating in China cannot interact with crawlers from the USA.{{ref|1|4}} __TOC__ == Introductory Announcement == [[Cascadia]] makes the introductory announcement after the stairwells from the surface close, one hour after the Dungeon opens.{{ref|1|1}}
''"Hello, Crawlers! The dungeon is now sealed. We have a diverse group joining us this season, and we are very happy to have you here. We had just under 13 million human crawlers make it through the gates and into the dungeon. We are already down to under 10 million. A quick note, the entrances to the second floor will not open up until the introductory episode of Dungeon Crawler World tunnels, which will be in approximately 30 of your hours. Once that happens, the entrances to the second level will populate. There will be no lag time for the appearance of additional levels. On behalf of the [[Borant Corporation]] I wanted to thank you for volunteering, and I wish you all good luck and a happy crawl."''Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (p. 44). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
== Special Mechanics == '''1.''' [[Tutorial Guild Hall | Tutorial Guild Halls]] liberally populate the first floor. Crawlers '''must''' complete the [[Tutorial]] to receive full access to their [[HUD / Crawler Menu | HUD and Crawler Menus]], and to be assigned to a [[Game Guide]]. '''2.''' The First Floor cannot be viewed by live viewers of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]'' (unless they have a press pass); instead, it is summarized by [[Dungeon Crawler World: Earth | Borant's highlight reels]]. == Layout == The First Floor is a network of halls and tunnels organized in a giant square grid. Each equally-sized square is bordered by wide passageways and intersected by twisty, maze-like halls and tunnels laid out like a condensed version of the city above. The first main artery that Carl finds is dimly illuminated by torches and approximately 30' W x 30' H (9.14m x 9.14m), stretching as far as he can see. Alleyways of various widths and heights branch from its walls; some alleys are hewn from smooth stone, others are shrouded in absolute darkness, and others have "green, lichen-like growths" glowing on dark red brick walls.{{ref|1|2}}{{ref|1|3}} The various halls are humid and stuffy.{{ref|1|10}} === Bosses === Each square contains four neighborhoods, each with its own area-specific mob and neighborhood boss. The mobs range in level from 1 to 5, and neighborhood bosses (which are typically caricatures of an earth stereotype mashed together with the local mob) range from level 7 to 9. Mobs stop spawning in a neighborhood after the boss is killed.{{ref|1|15}} All Borough Bosses and City Bosses on the level have a stairwell in their arena, but many of the 75,000 stairwells randomly distributed across the level can be accessed without a boss battle.{{ref|1|22}} Borough Bosses appear to encompass a full square grid. No City Bosses are defeated on the first floor. === Restrooms === Restrooms (with one complimentary roll of toilet paper) appear roughly every 0.25 mile (0.4 km). The doorways seem to have been stolen from commercial building restrooms around the world and still bear men/women symbols or handwritten signs; however, the mismatched doors always open to the exact same cramped bathroom stall. [[Carl | Carl's]] restroom contains a silver toilet and a roll of toilet paper; [[Donut | Princess Donut's]] contains a litterbox.{{ref|1|8}} === Safe Rooms=== Safe Rooms appear every few miles. On the first floor, these take the form of fast food restaurants and rest areas teleported from Earth's surface: a Peruvian Taco Bell, a Waffle House from Alabama, etc. Some safe rooms are full-service dining areas staffed by [[Bopca Protector]] non-combatant NPCs, but smaller safe rooms may have once-per-day servings of [[Experience Cookies]] or +1 DEX candies.{{ref|1|9}} Safe Room bathrooms may include showers and amenities, or only toilet stalls. Some Safe Rooms have rooms to rent (for free), while others have a few cots to sleep on and maybe a curtain for privacy. All Safe Rooms have three main screens: the first shows the current crawler count, the second airs ''Dungeon Crawler World'', and the third contains information specific to the room. == Floor Timeline & Patch Notes == {| class="fandom-table" |+First Floor Timeline & Patch Notes !Time to Level Collapse !Event |- |5 Days 00 Hrs |Stairwells open on Earth's surface. |- | 4 Days 23 Hrs 48 Min |Carl and Donut are the 4,119th and 4,122nd crawlers to enter the Dungeon. |- |4 Days 23 Hrs |Cascadia's introductory announcement. The stairwells are now closed; 13,000,000 crawlers entered the dungeon.
'''Remaining Crawlers: < 10,000,000''' |- |4 Days 17 Hrs |'''Remaining Crawlers: 4,322,395.''' |- |4 Days 03 Hrs |'''Remaining Crawlers: 4,148,111.''' |- |3 Days 17 Hrs |'''Remaining Crawlers: 4,006,002.''' ''Dungeon Crawler World: Earth'' premiers. |- |3 Days 16 Hrs |Cascadia's first update and patch notes. Stairwells to level 2 are now populating, but anyone who descends before six hours to level collapse will be held in stasis until collapse; anyone who descends with six hours or less to level collapse will have a head start on the next floor. *Bosses Killed: 15 Borough Bosses, 1,500+ Neighborhood Bosses. *''Fire Finger'' spell is now safe to cast. *If you open a hallway bathroom door and someone else enters, they should no longer explode. * Toilet paper now limited to one roll per floor. *Mobs cannot be added to inventory in order to kill them. * Items no longer preserve momentum when added to inventory. |- |2 Days 18 Hrs |'''Remaining Crawlers: 3,594,517'''{{ref|1|18}} |- |2 Days 11 Hrs |''Dungeon Crawler World: Earth'' episode 2. Highlights include: *A six-legged, tentacled rhinoceros Borough Boss wiping out a team of 40 men - and turning half of them into stone - before dying of its injuries, ending the battle in a "Match Draw." *[[Hekla]], sporting her Valkyrie helmet and crossbow, fighting [[gnolls]]. *[[Lucia Mar]] swinging her mace at red monsters, aided by her two rottweilers.{{ref|1|20}} |- |2 Days 10 Hrs |Cascadia's second update and patch notes. *The hallways toilet suction issues and exploding issues have been resolved. Stop relieving yourselves in the hallways. *Support for all languages has been added. *Cross-support for all languages has been added; crawlers can now communicate with each other. *The [[Feral Rabies]] debuff is now curable and no longer airborne. ''"Sorry about that, New Zealand."'' *[[Blender Fiend]] mobs have been moved to a lower floor after killing 15,000 crawlers in one day. *The ''Street Preacher'' neighborhood boss has been upgraded to a Borough Boss. *Strength levels have been tweaked for many mobs. |- |1 Day 06 Hrs |'''Remaining Crawlers: 2,552,085'''{{ref|1|26}} ''Dungeon Crawler World: Earth'' episode 3. Highlights include: * [[Lucia Mar]] and her rottweilers. * [[Hekla]]. * [[Le Mouvement]], 150 African soldiers armed with AK-47s. * Two other unnamed large groups that appear to be performing extremely well. |- | 1 Day 05 Hrs |Cascadia's third update and patch notes, mostly a long list of changes to spells and mob power levels. |- |0 Days 00 Hrs |'''Remaining Crawlers: 1,292,526'''Crawlers killed on Level 1 when the floor collapsed: >700,000. ''Dungeon Crawler World: Earth'', episode 4. Highlights include: * New first floor mobs, including a three-headed baboon and an eggplant with teeth. * [[Le Mouvement]]'s party has shrunk from 150 to 80 due to internal conflict; they have 500 rounds of ammo remaining. * [[Lucia Mar]] and her dogs destroying shaggy brown monsters. * [[Hekla]] and her new team of three more women fighting a yeti-themed Borough Boss. * A 15 second clip of the [[ Royal Court of Princess Donut|Royal Court]] and [[Meadow Lark]] versus [[The Ball of Swine]], ending with [[Imani C|Imani]] dropping the strap-on dildo. * Quick clips of various crawler groups fighting monsters or racing for the stairs.{{ref|1|31}} |} == Loot == The first two floors are designed to load crawlers up with a variety of loot so that they can experiment with possible builds. By the time a crawler arrives on the [[Third Floor]], they should have a good idea of what class and race will work for them. On the first floor, low-tier [[Loot Boxes]] commonly contain torches and bandages. Mobs drop skins, organs, and other items that can be used in [[:Category:Crafting|crafting]] later. == See Also == * [[Floor 1 Achievements | All First Floor Achievements]] * [[Tutorial]] == References == [[Category:Dungeon Floors]][[Category:Floor 1 | {{PAGENAME}}]] {{DEFAULTSORT: Dungeon Floor 01}}

A team mentioned on [[Dungeon Crawler After Hours with Odette|Odette's show]] in Epilogue of Book 3.

You killed a city boss with the participation of five or less crawlers. That is some serious badassery right there. Color me impressed. Now go do it again with a Province Boss.

{{DISPLAYTITLE: First Floor Achievements}} This '''List of All First Floor Achievements''' includes all named and unnamed achievements distributed on the [[First Floor|first floor]], as well as those awarded to other crawlers. It is intended as a resource for superfans, DMs, and fanfic writers. ==Description== The first two floors are designed to load crawlers up with a variety of loot so that they can experiment with possible builds. By the time a crawler arrives on the third floor, they should have a good idea of what class and race will work for them. On the [[First Floor|first floor]], low-tier loot boxes commonly contain torches and bandages. ==Achievements for Entering the Dungeon== {| class="mw-collapsible fandom-table" style="width:100%" !Achievement !For !Reward |- |[[Crazy Cat Lady]] |entering the dungeon with a cat. |Bronze [[Pet Box]]{{ref|1|2}} |- |[[Early Adopter]] |being one of the first 5,000 crawlers. |Silver [[Adventurer Box]] |- | [[Empty Pockets]] |entering the dungeon without any supplies. |Bronze [[Adventurer Box]] |- |[[Loner]] |entering the dungeon without a human companion. |none |- |[[Trailblazing Crazy Cat Lady|''Trailblazing'' Crazy Cat Lady]] |being the ''first'' to enter the dungeon with a cat. |Legendary [[Pet Box]] |- |[[Unarmed Combat]] |entering the dungeon without a weapon. |Bronze [[Weapon Box]] |- |[[Why aren't you wearing pants?]] |entering the dungeon without pants. |Gold [[Apparel Box]] |- |N/A |being the first cat to enter the dungeon. |Legendary [[Quadruped Box]]{{ref|1|7}} |- |N/A |being the first to drive a van into the dungeon. |N/A{{ref|4|5}} |- |N/A |entering the dungeon while fighting a family member. |Legendary [[That's the Spirit! Box]]{{ref|3|19}} |} == Achievements for Combat == {| class="mw-collapsible fandom-table" style="width:100%" !Achievement !For !Reward |- |[[Battlefield Construction!]] |building a structure and deploying it in battle. |Silver [[Mechanic's Box]]{{ref|1|30}} |- |[[Bitchmeat]] |being attacked in a safe room. |none.{{ref|1|21}} |- |[[Boom]]! |causing an explosion for the first time. |Silver [[Goblin Box]] |- |[[Borough Boss (achievement)|Borough Boss!]] |finding a borough boss. |none |- |[[Boss Babe]] |inflicting damage on a dungeon boss for the first time. |none |- |It burns, dunnit? |attempting to punch a slime. |N/A, but probably none.{{ref|1|15}} |- |[[Podophillia!]] |crushing an opponent with your bare feet for the first time. |Gold [[Shoe Box]] |- |[[This Little Piggy Went to Market!]] |making daddy very, very happy. |Platinum [[Shoe Box]] |- |[[Two Chicks at the Same Time]] |killing two mobs using only their bodies as weapons. |Gold [[Brawler Box]] |- |[[You Monster!]] |killing a child. |Bronze [[Asshole's Box]]{{ref|1|19}} |- |[[You've inflicted damage on a mob|You’ve inflicted damage on a mob]] |inflicting damage for the first time. |none.{{ref|1|5}} |- |[[You've killed a mob!]] |killing a mob for the first time. |'''can now earn experience''' |- |[[You've killed a mob with your bare fucking hands!|You’ve killed an armed mob with your bare fucking hands!]] |killing an armed mob bare-handed for the first time. |Bronze [[Weapon Box]] |- |[[War Criminal]] |killing more than 20 NON-combatants in one attack. |Gold [[Asshole's Box]] |- |N/A |being one of the crawlers who defeated the first Borough Boss. |Platinum [[Weapon Box]]{{ref|1|14}} |- |N/A |dealing melee damage for the first time (conditions apply). |Silver [[Adventurer Box]]{{ref|1|25}} |- |N/A |ending a boss battle with less than 5% health. |Silver [[Survivor's Box]] |- |N/A |ending a boss battle with less than 10% of health. |Bronze [[Survivor's Box]] |- |N/A |killing more than 10 mobs with an explosive. |Silver [[Goblin Box]]{{ref|1|11}} |- |N/A |killing more than 15 mobs with one attack. |Gold [[Crowd Control Box]] |- |N/A |killing more than 100 mobs wandering the maze. |N/A |- |N/A |miscellaneous explosive-based actions. |unspecified [[Goblin Box]] |}
== Achievements for Dungeon Crawling == {| class="mw-collapsible fandom-table" style="width:100%" |+'''Achievements for Dungeon Crawling''' !Achievement !For !Reward |- |[[Bully and a Thief]] |stealing property from a crawler who is a lower level than you. |Bronze [[Asshole's Box]] |- |[[Fall Into an Obvious Trap]] |falling into an obvious trap for the first time. |none |- |[[Level-Up, Baby]]! |reaching level 2. |none |- |[[Loot!]] |wearing something found in the dungeon for the first time. |none{{ref|1|6}} |- |[[Oooh, Magic]]! |wearing magical gear for the first time. |Bronze [[Adventurer Box]] |- |[[You found stairs!]] |finding a stairwell to level two. |none |- |[[You've discovered and read an official dungeon sign]] |locating a tutorial guildhall sign for the first time. |[[HUD / Crawler Menu|HUD]] upgrade |- |[[You've entered a guildhall!]] |entering a tutorial guildhall for the first time. |none |- |N/A |being one of the first 100 crawlers to reach Magic Missile Level 3. |Gold [[Magic Item Box]] |- |N/A |casting a spell for the first time. |N/A |- |N/A |charming multiple dungeon mobs. |Gold [[Beguiler Box]] |- |N/A |finding a saferoom for the first time. |Silver [[Adventurer Box]]{{ref|1|9}} |- |N/A |looting a corpse for the first time. |Bronze [[Adventurer Box]]{{ref|1|8}} |- |N/A |putting on jewelry for the first time. |none |- |N/A |riding the chopper for more than 5 hours. |N/A |- |N/A |sharing experience for the first time. |Bronze [[Adventurer Box]] |- |N/A |storing more than 1 ton of weight in inventory. |Gold [[Looter Box]] |- |N/A |storing more than 10 tons of weight in inventory. |Gold [[Looter Box]] |} == References == [[Category:Achievements | {{PAGENAME}}]][[Category:Floor 1 | {{PAGENAME}}]]

[[File:8-ib5OMD95NCfqfeP.png|thumb]] {{Character info|crawler_#=|age=|height=|weight=|titles=|class=[[Shotgun Messenger]]|species=Human {{!}} [[Crocodilian]]|origin=France (Supposedly)|occupation=Private Security/Mercenary|first_appearance=Chapter 14, Book 2: Carl's Doomsday Scenario|status=Alive|party=|allies=* [[Ifechi]] * [[Carl]] * [[Donut]]|gear=Magical Unlimited Ammo Shotgun}} [[File:00339.jpg|thumb|Florin]]
== Description == Upon the Earth's seizure by the Borant Corporation, Florin was one of the nearly 13 million individuals that chose to descend into the newly created World Dungeon, and in doing so, become a Crawler. As a Crawler, Florin became a participant in the Universal Reality Series "Dungeon Crawler World". If Florin, or any other Crawler, is successful in completing all 18 levels of the World Dungeon, a feat that has never been done, he will be free to exercise his right of resource reclamation by reclaiming regency of the planet.
Florin is described as having a mysterious background, stating that he was originally from France yet had an Australian accent. At the time of the World Dungeon's opening, Florin had been in Africa working "private security". He entered the dungeon "armed to the teeth", but came to mostly rely on a heavily modified automatic shotgun that he brought with him. This shotgun would become his primary form of offense after it became magically modified to create and hold unlimited ammunition.
During the "Recap Episode" upon the opening of level 3, it was discovered that Florin had begun traveling with fellow Crawler, Ifechi. Florin and Ifechi became a party at some point after Ifechi lost her entire party to a City Boss slime monster. Florin and Ifechi begin dating.
At the conclusion of the 4th Floor, Florin and [[Ifechi]] are confronted by [[Lucia Mar]]. When Florin tries to shoot her, she uses a redirection spell to make the blast hit Ifechi instead, killing her. Florin spends most of the 5th Floor despondent, until [[Elle McGib|Elle]] and [[Imani C|Imani]] convince him to keep going, when he finally entered the quadrent he found that everyone in the bubble was already dead.
== Leaderboard Placement & Levels == {| class="mw-collapsible fandom-table" |+Book 2: Carl's Doomsday Scenario !Level !Placement !Page |- |24 |Fourth |347 |} {| class="mw-collapsible fandom-table" |+Book 3: The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook !Level !Placement !Page |- |24 |Fourth |52 |- |32 |Sixth |369 |} {| class="mw-collapsible fandom-table" |+Book 4: The Gate of the Feral Gods !Level !Placement !Page |- |33 |Tenth |85 |- |Unknown |Not Placed |290 |} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Fools Who Broke the Glass}}
== AI Description == '''New Quest. The Fools Who Broke the Glass.'''
THIS IS A GROUP QUEST. All Crawlers currently within the 45 square kilometer blast radius will receive this quest.
''Your party has been designated Host of this Group Quest. As hosts, you will not be allowed to opt-out from this quest.''
What the hell is going on? Am I glad you asked!
A while back a certain NPC started casting a very powerful spell, a spell so potent, that it had to be completed by a future generation.
Here's the thing with old spells. They're like trees. They grow. They get big. Sometimes huge. Bad shit happens when they get screwed up. The bigger the spell, the badder the shit. And boy was this spell big. Not gonna lie. Your favorite AI was looking forward to it going off.
Oh well. This will be almost as good.
Shit is about to go down. For example, you may have noticed every Skyfowl and Chickadee NPC in the area has fallen ill. Most of them have already plunged into a coma, or death. It's not their fault, but they were tied to the spell, and that's just the way it is.
Just like it's not your fault that you happen to be within 45 kilometers of the fallout from this failed spell. Again, not your fault. (Well, unless you're Crawlers [[Carl]], [[Donut|Princess Donut]], or [[Katia Grim]]. Then it is your fault.) That's just the way it is. Sucks to be you.
There's going to be an explosion. The epicenter of the blast is marked on your map. Every crawler within the designated blast area is fucked.
The object of the quest is simple. Unfuck yourself. Don't die.
Warning: This is an event quest. If you do not want to participate in this quest, you will have sixty seconds from the end of this message to get yourselves into a saferoom. After that, all access to saferooms within the quest zone will be shut off until the event quest is concluded. All NPCs who remain indoors, saferoom or not, will remain safe. All mobs and neighborhood-level boss monsters within the blast radius subject to both physical and magical explosions will be killed.
'''''Reward''':'' All participants who survive will receive a [[Quest Box|Platinum Quest Box]].
Oh, by the way. The explosion is coming in seven minutes.
'''''Run'''''.
'''Quest Update'''
You've probably noticed you're not dead. Everybody say, "Thank you Crawler Carl." I'll give you a second to luxuriate in your victory.
That's the good news, You might want to sit down for this next part.
The bad news is there's still an explosion coming. A bigger bang, actually, but the area of effect will be similar. I won't bore you guys with the technical details, but what you just felt is called a precursor burst. It's a foreshock. The first of four before the big show. The one you just felt temporarily removed the magical properties of all your equipped gear. The next one will do something different.
All of this will culminate with a burst of pure, wild magic much more potent than the magically-infused chemical explosion from which you guys were just spared. Less physical damage to the environment. More face melting. I prefer this, if we're being honest. Have you ever put a marshmallow in a microwave? Imagine your head as the marshmallow. It'll be kinds like that. Prepare your defenses accordingly.
You now have twenty minutes to save yourselves. [[Category:Quests]]

[[File:00467.jpg|thumb|Football Hooligan]] The Football Hooligan was the class [[Donut]] took as part of her [[Character Actor|character actor]] skill. Donut only got the Mascot, Guinness and constitution bonus.
== Benefits ==
* The [[Mascot Skill]] - if a pet deals damage to an enemy everyone in the party gains a bonus to dexterity and constitution, if they kill a mob it lasts a couple of hours. * Guinness – doubles your strength if your drunk * Moving Riot – increase your damage whilst moving. * Group Chant – some kind of team buff * +10 constitution
[[Category:Class]]

A [[T’Ghee totem|T'Ghee]] card that forces an opponent to play a card.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:T'Ghee Card]]

Admin Notice. This page may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Posting spoilers for Book 7 will result in “acceleration” per this wiki’s rules. {{Character_info|class=[[Sapper]]|species=[[Urgyle]]}} == Description == Author of the 20th Edition of The [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]. == Cookbook Entries == Confirmed. Works with bombs but smoke works better. Doesn't kill high-level undead, but the get mad. I use these to clear rooms of those invisible Swamp Wights. (Chapter 8, Book 3. Comment added to Crawler Sinjin's note about soaking hobgoblin smoke bombs in healing potions to use against undead.) Backpacks now only slow destabilization now, not negate it. Found that out the hard way. Rest well, little sister. I pray those who read this kill an enemy in her honor today. That is all we can do, no? Her name was Barkith, and she was all I had left. I feel lost, but I will persevere. (Chapter 13, Book 3) They [the gods] may be invulnerable, but they still feel pain. They still bleed. The drivers of these bodies suffer. In honor of my sister, I pray I make it to the 12th floor just so I may slay one. I know this is but a dream, but I will look in the god's eyes and say to him, "This is for Barkith. This is for my sister." (Chapter 32, Book 3) Based on some of these previous passages and my own observations, I think I've put together a good idea about the layout of [[Sixth Floor|The Hunting Grounds]]. They say it's the same every time, but that is not true. [[Herot]] spoke of those tall creatures who bellow into sky each night, rumbling the world. [[Azin]] described the kite birds always flying overhead. [[Ikicha]] wrote of the ice and cold weather. None of those are here, not in this iteration. Most of the world is jungle. That is a constant. But the monsters within change, so be careful taking advice from previous editions of this book regarding this floor. However, the map appears to be the same each time. The "political" landscape" is the same, too. It is a round world with a single named metropolis and dozens of other unnamed cities of varying sizes like on [[Third Floor|the third floor]]. This world, according to the story, was half metropolis and half jungle before Scolopendra's nine-tier attack, whatever the hell that even means. After the attack, most everyone died, and the jungle ran rampant, swallowing the ruins. However, after a few hundred years, the survivors have started to rebuild. The named city is always in the same place. In the north, near the edge of the map and overlooking a clear valley filled with lower-level monsters, placed there so the hunters can train while the crawlers make their way through the lower floors. All the way to the southeast is the high elf city, which is in the thickest part of the jungle. Stay away from the elves. They are powerful magic users, and they attack everyone. Even the hunters stay away. Before the cataclysm, this world was rich. The city was under control of a multi-race council. The jungle was under control of the high elves. They hated each other, but there was mostly peace. A river separated the two districts. That river still winds through the map. There are bridges at regular intervals. Stay out of the water. The Naiads live within and are just as bad as the elves. The named city - whose name appears to be different each time - will always be under control of a single race, It doesn't matter which one. The moment the hunters arrive, one of them always hunts down and kills the NPC leader, which gives them control. I think it's the only city they're allowed to do this in, otherwise they'd have control of them all by the time we arrive. Either way, once the floor opens, the low-level valley will be hunted to extinction, the existing government of the named city will have been wiped out, and one of the hunters will have set themselves up as Grand, the title given to mayors of the biggest settlements. Stay out of the big city. The guards will attack you on sight. (Chapter 5, Book 5) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{Class | title1 = {{PAGENAME}} | image1 = 00883.jpg | type = Bard/Rogue Jack-Of-All-Trades, Earth Class | prerequisites = [[Cut!]] achievement and one trillion views | stats = +10 to Charisma | skills = +3 [[Character Actor]] +5 [[Cockroach]] | effects = Immunity to all poisons and diseases +15% faster growth in all Charisma-based skills | benefits = [[Manager Benefit|The Manager Benefit]] | caption-image1 = Former child actor "MacFoley Flobkin" }} Former Child Actor is [[Donut|Donut's]] main class which she selects during class selection on the third floor. It grants her the [[Character Actor]] skill which allows her to select another class for each floor. Critically it also grants the [[Manager Benefit]] and this is the real reason she chose it. [[Odette]] had recommended Donut chose a class with the manager benefit so that [[Mordecai]] would become their managar.{{ref|3|1}} {{Quote | quote = CARL ARE YOU SURE ABOUT THIS? HE IS GOING TO BE REALLY MAD.
-- [[Donut | Princess Donut]] (Book 3, Chapter 1) }} [[Zev]] later comments that most viewers are happy with [[Carl]] and [[Donut|Donut's]] class/race choices. She says some people are complaining that Former Child Actor doesn't allow for growth but that most think it off-sets the training required for Carl's [[Primal]] race.{{ref|3|4}} == AI Description == This rare subclass is an offshoot of the Character Actor class. It can only be obtained by Crawlers who have both received the “[[Cut!]]” achievement and have obtained at least one trillion views. Once a spoiled brat superstar, then addicted to drugs, you have crawled back from the brink stronger than ever. You are ready for your comeback. This Charisma and Chance-based class could go either way. You’ll either rise to the top, or you’ll be dead in a ditch in a week. This unique Earth class is based on the Bard/Rogue Jack-Of-All-Trades subclass, but with a few distinctive differences. In addition to the following benefits, the most distinct aspect of this multi-faceted class is the Level-3 [[Character Actor]] skill. This skill increases in level only upon descent to the next floor. Additional benefits: * Immunity to all poisons and diseases. * Level-5 [[Cockroach]] skill. * +10 to Charisma. * +15% faster growth in all Charisma-based skills. * The [[Manager Benefit]] This is an Earth Class. As an incentive to choose an Earth Class, you will receive a Silver [[Earth Box]] upon choosing this class.{{ref|3|1}} ==References== [[Category:Class]]

{{Race_Infobox | image1 = 00159.jpg | type = Mob | floors = [[Third Floor | Floor 3]] | bonuses = stealth trait (invisible on map) | organizations = Grimaldi's Traveling Circus }}{{Quote | quote = “They were my sisters and cousin. All five of them died in seconds. It happened so fast. I was with my other cousin, and we barely got away.” <small>-- [[Daniel Bautista]] re: lemur attack (Book 2, Chapter 23)</small> }} Once an attraction at Grimaldi's Traveling Circus on the [[Third Floor|third floor]], Former Circus Lemurs were transformed into knife-throwing mobs by [[Scolopendra]]'s curse.
==AI Description== '''Former Circus Lemur – Level 8'''
'''Grimaldi’s Traveling Circus was one of the Over City’s favorite attractions before that fateful day so long ago. Hundreds of years later, the feral and transformed descendants of that circus still stalk the ruins, seeking out adults and children alike to dazzle and entertain.'''
'''And by dazzle and entertain, we mean devour the flesh from their bones and use their remains as armor.'''
'''Grimaldi’s Amazing Juggling Lemurs were one of the circus’s key attractions. Children from all over the realm would laugh and clap as they watched these funny little creatures juggle all manner of items, from balls to pins to knives.'''
'''You can probably guess where this is going.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (p. 40; chapter 4). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. </ref>
==Description== The red-furred lemurs wear black and red-painted human skulls to cover their own furless, skinless faces and bulbous blood-shot eyes. Their bandoliers contain six or more throwing knives.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 5).</ref>
An unnamed stealth ability makes them invisible on a crawler's minimap until the crawler actually lays eyes on them.<ref name=":0" /> They appear to travel in groups and either stake out high vantage points, waiting for unsuspecting targets, or ride along on artillery giraffes that then fling the lemurs like bombs.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 9).</ref>
==Dropped Loot==
*Poor lemur skin *Small bandolier with throwing knives<ref name=":0" />
==References== <references /> [[Category:Mobs]]

== Description == Unspecified, but an affliction specialist class
== Crawlers with This Class == [[Prepotente]] [[Category:Class]]

aka Soothers
Humanoid alien. White, thin, hairless with a ridged mohawk crest. Very large eyes. Three fingers.
Shown often in Earth fiction and movies. [[Category:Races]]
Fort Freedom is the castle that serves as [[Imogen|Princess Imogen's]] primary base of operations. [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Floor 6]]

{{Dungeon Floor|floor_number=4|theme=Trains|duration=10 Days|exits=9,375|crawlers=389,441|start_date=January 21|preceded_by=[[Third Floor]]|followed_by=[[Fifth Floor]]|npcs=* Limp Richard (Mole Man, Level 36) - general store proprietor * Wendita ([[Bopca Protector]]) - saferoom attendant * Vernon (Dwarf, Level 32) - Yellow Line Train Conductor * Pierre (Grapple, Level 25) - Yellow Line Porter * [[Widget]] (Grease Gremlin, Level 19) * [[Madison]] (Human, level 10)|mobs=* [[Drek]] * [[Jikininki]] * [[Psycho Sticker]] * [[Bonker]] * [[Shock Chomper]] * [[Pollyslog]] * [[Literal Fire Ant]] * [[Cornet]] * [[Spider ghoul]] *[[Festering ghoul]] * [[Zlurpie]] * [[Kravyad]] *[[Wall monitor lizards]] * [[Station Mimic]]}} [[File:The Iron Tangle.jpg|thumb|The Iron Tangle, created by a listener (WIP) (unofficial)]] The Fourth Floor is called the Iron Tangle because it consists entirely of thousands of interconnected subway tunnels. Each tunnel has a color designation or unique name an has one or more trains running in a loop. Train stations are located up and down the lines. At some stops mobs board or exit the train; some contain safe rooms. There are also transfer stations where crawlers can transfer to different lines. When trains get to the end of the line they are portaled to either a train yard where they are readied for another loop or to the abyss - a giant pit where wreckage is discarded. == Introductory Announcement ==
''Hello Crawlers. Welcome to the fourth floor!'' ''We are so very excited to introduce you to what is being hailed a genius feat of engineering. We call it the Iron Tangle. The trick is to find the stairwells. There are a lot of them out there, but where? Let's see how many of you figure it out.'' ''This is important. This is not a permanent change, but it is a new rule for this level only.'' ''You may not go down early this level. The stairwells will open six hours prior to collapse, and that's it. Again, you may not go down early this floor. Now have fun out there. These train things are so nifty. We never had anything like it on our world.'' ''Patron bidding is active, and we are very happy with the results so far. You will get a notification when your bidding has concluded. We'll have more info on that later.'' ''You will notice that the leaderboard has finally populated. Congratulations to everybody on the list. As you can see, each member of the top 10 has a bounty after their names. That means hunting season is'' open''! Isn't that exciting? If you kill one, you will receive a loot box containing the reward. If you are on the leaderboard, don't worry, you get to join in on the fun too. If you survive the floor, you will receive 10% of your own bounty upon floor collapse. That percentage goes up each floor.'' ''Finally, we'd like to address the especially high mortality rate of the third floor. This occurred due to a high instance of group quests gone bad. While the number of crawlers are still in the acceptable range, we are all concerned about early extinction. That does not mean we will be letting up. So quit sucking. It's as simple as that.'' ''Now get out there, ride the rails, and kill, kill, kill!''
== Named Trains == * ''Nightmare Express'' - A black steam engine with a large cowcatcher wedge in front. Comes every 90 minutes. Runs a figure-eight track in a loop with five stops: Transit to Yellow/Red #83, Transit to Mauve/Purple #283, Abyss #436, Transit to Green/Yellow #283, Transit to Tangerine/Plum #83) * ''Misery'' * ''Dismemberment Limited'' - A white monorail train with only two cars. Comes every 48 minutes. Has a war mage named Dismember aboard. * ''Eviscerator'' * ''Raven Blade Unlimited'' * ''Escape Velocity'' * ''Homeward Bound'' - Employee-only train that runs on employee line straight to stop #60 == Notable Colored Lines == * Red * Yellow * Orange * Indigo * Azure * Brown * Purple * Mauve * Green * Tangerine * Plum * Winter Sky * Ochre * [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fulvous Fulvous] * Camel * Cobalt * Puce * Vermillion * Mango * [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinopia Sinopia] * [https://encycolorpedia.com/e3f988 Mindaro] * [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grullo Grullo] * [https://encycolorpedia.com/39a78e Zomp] == Navigating the Tangle == [[File:The iron tangle map.png|alt=The Iron Tangle line map|frameless|The Iron Tangle|right]] * '''Stairwells''' at 12, 24, 36, 48, and 72 on any colored line * '''Saferooms''' at prime numbered transfer stations (11, 13, 17, etc.) * '''Exit-only Caverns''' every five stations (15, 20, etc.) where monsters get [[Rev-Up Vitamin Shots]] * '''Desperado Club''' at transfer stations ending with 1 * '''Club''' '''Vanquisher''' at transfer stations ending with 9 * '''Trainyard''' at 10 * '''End of the Line''' 435 (employees depart and portal to trainyard) == Named Stations == * '''Jikininki Peak''' '''Station''' #12 * '''Barren Station''' #18 * '''Employee Station''' - All colored lines and ''Homeward Bound'' #60 * '''Sirin''' '''Station -''' Red Line #81 with [[Drek]] * '''Mora''' '''Station -''' Red Line#82 with [[Psycho Sticker]] * '''Rusalka''' '''Station''' - Red Line #84 * '''Phantom Kangaroo''' '''Station''' - Yellow Line #84 with [[Pollyslog]] * '''Mothman''' '''Station''' - Yellow Line #88 with Skinned Mollie * '''Banshee''' '''Station''' - Yellow Line #116 with Red Cornet * '''Terminus''' '''Station''' #433 with [[Station Mimic]] * '''Abyss''' '''Station''' #436 * [[Category:Dungeon Floors]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Dungeon Floor 04}}

{{Character info |crawler_#=324,119 |age=40 |height=5'11" |class=[[Blood Assassin]] |species=Human {{!}} Night [[Elf]] |origin=Seattle |occupation=ICE Agent |first_appearance=Chapter 20 |status=Deceased |party= |allies= *[[Maggie My]] *[[Yvette]] |level=17 |gear= }} Frank Q. is another crawler. He kills his fellow crawlers for experience. He entered the [[Dungeon]] with his ex-wife, [[Maggie My]]. After the death of his daughter, [[Yvette]], he is a shell of his former self and dies at the hands of [[Maggie My|Maggie]]. Frank is the one who gives [[Carl]] the [[Enchanted Night Wyrm’s Ring of Divine Suffering]], which he does thinking it will ruin [[Carl]]'s life. == Description == == Personality == == Gear ==
[[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]] [[Category:Characters]]

AI Description
== AI Description == '''New Quest. Free Wynne from his bondage.'''
[[Wynne]] the Dirigible Gnome is in chains. Free him, and he will provide easy access to the ''Wasteland''.
'''''Reward''''': You will receive a [[Quest Box|Silver Quest Box]]. [[Category:Quests]]

== AI Description == And I’m freeeeee! Freeee Ballling!
Usually reserved for monk classes and those too soused to reliably dress themselves, recipients of this benefit receive an additional 100% damage bonus to all attacks that originate below the waist. In addition, all skills that originate from below the waist train 20% faster. But as the name implies, this benefit allows only a single layer of armor or clothing to cover your crotch area. And since you’re already wearing these, it looks like you won’t be getting trousers anytime soon. [[Category:Benefit]]

[[File:00140.jpg|thumb|Freelance Psychiatrist]]
== Description == A psionic class.
== Crawlers with this Class ==
* [[Morris]] [[Category:Class]]

'''Frogger''' is an arcade action game developed by Konami and manufactured by Sega. It was released in America in September 1981.<ref>Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frogger</ref> In 1982, ''[[Softline (magazine)|Softline]]'' stated that "''Frogger'' has earned the ominous distinction of being 'the arcade game with the most ways to die'."<ref>Rose, Gary and Marcia (November 1982). "Frogger". ''Softline''. p. 19. </ref>
The goal of the game is to guide each of three, five, or seven frogs (depending on game settings) from the bottom of the screen to their empty homes at the top of the screen. The frogs must cross a horizontal road full of speeding vehicles, and then jump from log to log across an alligator-infested pond to reach their homes. When all frogs are in their home, the game progresses to the next level; each level is progressively more difficult, although the difficulty briefly eases every five levels.

'''Game Guides''' are noncombatant NPCs who serve as guildmasters of [[Tutorial Guild Hall|Tutorial Guild Halls]] on the [[First Floor|first]], [[Second Floor|second]], and [[Third Floor|third]] floors of the [[Dungeon]]. They are typically former crawlers who took indentured servitude "deals" to exit previous Dungeons sponsored by the host company, and the current season only counts against their indentureship if one of their crawlers reaches the Fourth Floor.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 29). When a crawler meets a guildmaster, the infobox pop-up provides the guildmaster's name, race, class, level, and the description, formatted as:
'''Mordecai – Rat Hooligan. Level 50.'''
'''Guildmaster of this guildhall.'''
'''This is a Non-Combatant NPC.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (p. 25). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. '''
Game Guides can be permanently killed in the DungeonDinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 15). and tend to stay in safe rooms. ==Responsibilities== As guildmasters, they are responsible for teaching new crawlers how to use their [[HUD / Crawler Menu|HUD and Crawler Menus]] during the [[Tutorial|tutorial]]. Once a guildmaster successfully trains a new crawler, the guildmaster is registered as that crawler's game guide. Any time the crawler enters a training guild on the first three floors, the crawler will be transported to their game guide's guild.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 8). Game Guides have access to the [[codex]], but do not have access to the chat feature.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 1). They cannot be watched by live viewers. They are able to share limited information about the Dungeon, but are restricted by a specific set of rules to prevent cheating. After their crawler engages in a battle, they can review the fight notes and give tips to help the crawler improve and better understand the Dungeon.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 25). Beginning halfway through the Second Floor, Game Guides may begin instructing Crawlers about the Third Floor and race and class selection.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 44). On the Third Floor, Game Guides must help crawlers through class and race selection without overtly telling them what to do. After the selection process is complete, the Game Guide exits the guild hall -- dressed in formalwear -- with the crawler and formally presents the crawlers to the live viewers:
“I’d like to present Dungeon Crawler Carl, the Level 13 Compensated Anarchist Primal. Welcome, Carl, to the third floor.”Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (p. 30). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
Crawlers lose access to their Game Guides as soon as they reach the Fourth Floor. ==Preparations== Guildmasters spend years preparing for each new season of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]].'' In [[Carl]]'s season, which takes place in either 2017 or 2023 (see notes on [[Dungeon]] and [[The Transformation|Transformation]] pages), the advance teams arrived on Earth in 1937 and [[Mordecai]] began the prep phase in 1964.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 4). Preparations include consuming popular media and learning the planet's customs. In previous years, Guildmasters received a newsletter every few cycles; however, Borant Corporation discontinued the newsletter to cut costs and did not notify Guildmasters that the season was opening two years early.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 2).
“Guildmasters prepare for years for each new dungeon world. Kid, I have been preparing for this longer than you have been alive. The advance team arrived in your 1930s, I believe. Whenever that book came out, ''The Hobbit''. I left the last system and entered the prep phase in your year 1964. I know this world and your customs just as well as you do. I even once got to shapeshift into a human and go out into the world. I went to a Blockbuster Video and stole a bunch of James Bond tapes. I was so happy once you guys started digitizing everything.”Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (pp. 34-35). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
==Notable Game Guides== *[[Mordecai]] *[[Mistress Tiatha]] *[[Odette]] (former) ==References== [[Category:Floor 1]] [[Category:Floor 2]] [[Category:Floor 3]] [[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]] [[Category:NPC]]

Garrett is a [[Tummy Acher]] that once belonged to [[Tserendolgor]], she received it as a gift for going to crawl con, before she died she gave him to [[Carl]].
He is extreamly tough and able to regenerate if killed, each time he is killed gains an additional weakness. Every five time he regenerates he goes back to level one and you have to bond with him again.
== Current weaknesses ==
* Sylvan crystal * Consuming hobgoblin sweat * The bite of a ribbon wing * Consuming undead flesh * Reaper gaze
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Pets]]

<small>
: ''This page is about the item.  For the Book, see [[The Gate of the Feral Gods (Book)]].''</small>
{{Citation}}
{{SpoilH | 4}}

== Description ==
A celestial item that opens a gate from one place to another, this includes other floors but doesn't allow crawlers to travel down without using a staircase. The cost is ripping a hole in the [[Nothing]] and summon an ancient, feral god. Usually when one of those is summoned, another god comes looking for it. The gate comes in three pieces: two watches and a winding box. 

When it was created by the AI, it set off a chain reaction of checks and balances that crashed the entire system, effectively allow it to circumvent it’s own rules. 

Multiple factions sue to keep this item out of Carl's hands, but they were [[Fight the Power!|unsuccessful]].
