revision.text:
== AI Description == '''New Quest! Get Orthrus.'''
This is a world quest! All living crawlers on the fifth floor will receive this message!
''Now'' it's a party.
[[Orthrus]], the two-headed puppy is bounding his way happily through the Lacuna, the world that houses the bubbles. This very adorable pup is running back to his former master's father. Don't worry. You can't miss him. He just drenched the folks in bubble 331, and then he knocked down the Sounder Tower in bubble 298.
What a menace!
Let's kill it.
'''''Reward''''': Any crawler who kills this cute puppy before he reunites with grandpa will receive the following:
* One million gold pieces. * Five level-up potions. * A pet monkey named Jimbo.
Current participants in the "[[Dumber of the Flunkies]]" group quest are free to kill the puppy if they are sadistic assholes, but they will not receive the rewards. You know what, never mind. They get the prize, too! [[Category:Quests]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A spell that can cure the stunned condition. [[Category:Spells]]"
revision.text: A spell that can cure the stunned condition. [[Category:Spells]]

Geyrun is the deceased son of [[Emberus]]. He is the original owner of the giant puppy [[Orthrus]]. Emberus suspects his brother [[Hellik]] killed Geyrun and gives Carl a [[Find Out Who Killed My Son|quest]] to find out who killed him. [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]]

== AI Description == {{Character_info|species=Human|occupation=Glass Mage|first_appearance=Chapter 21, Book 4|level=43|status=Deceased, turned to sand after being killed by Katia}} Ghazi - Human. Level 43 Glass Mage
Known by most everyone in the area as the Mad Dune Mage, Ghazi came to the area for the same reason as the bugbear captain, [[Shamus Chaindrive]]: to seek out the hidden treasure that is said to be buried within the Necropolis of Anser.
As a glass mage who specializes in the study of both transmutation and the teleportation of energized particles, Ghazi told his colleagues at the [[Larracos]] College of Magecraft that he was seeking out the [[Gate of the Feral Gods]] to study its potential use in stable, long-distance transportation.
This was, in fact, a lie.
His real purpose in seeking out the fabled artifact was for reliable, controlled access to the [[Nothing]] in order to converse with [[Yarilo]], the banished god of Lust. He sought but a simple boon in exchange for freeing the god.
Ghazi wished for [[Yarilo]] to make the famed [[Lika]] fall in love with him.
Lika is a half-naiad trobairitz. A trobairitz is a bard cleric who has taken a vow of celibacy. She is also the fictional main character of a popular series of stage plays that are often performed in the Larracos stage district. She was never real, and is very loosely based on a minor deity. She has been portrayed by dozens of half-naiad thespians over the years.
In other words, Ghazi was trying to summon a god to turn his waifu into the real deal.
Funny thing about summoning creatures from within the Nothing. They're all crazy. They all want out. Some of them are very good at pretending they're somebody they are not.
Yadda, yadda, yadda. The entity Ghazi summoned is not Yarilo. And now the glass mage is trapped in his now-transformed castle, cursed with the knowledge what he's done and what he's unleashed onto the world.
He has an escape. He is too much of a coward to do it. But there is one thing that will throw him over the edge. You probably don't want that to happen. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

{{Item|title=Glory Bound|type=Drug|effects=* Coma * Relive memories|source=[[Dungeon]] Marketplaces|image=00464.jpg}} '''Glory Bound''' is a highly dangerous and addictive drug available in the [[Dungeon]].
==Description== Like [[Blitz Sticks]] but stronger, Glory Bound puts you in a coma and allows you to relive a memory.
Unfortunately, if taken once, you will slowly lose your mind and become unable to differentiate between "then" and "now" if you can't get more. The only cure is a bad trip of Glory Bound that makes you relive your worst memories.<ref>{{ref|6|30}}</ref>

revision.comment: Eekz moved page [[Gnomish Drop Bear (Contraption)]] to [[Gnomish Drop Bear]]: housekeeping
revision.text:
{{SpoilH | 4}}{{Item|title=Gnomish Drop Bear|type=Vehicle, Plane|keywords=Contraption|source=Dirigible Gnomes}}
'''Gnomish Drop Bears''' are open-air biplanes created by [[Gnomes]]. They are used by the Dirigible Gnomes in [[Fifth Floor]] Bubble #543.
== AI Description== Gnomish Drop Bear. Contraption.
This is one of the Dirigible Gnome’s earliest fast-attack planes. There are only a handful of these still in service. While able to quickly reach most targets when drop-launched from home base, the twin engines of these early models were famously underpowered. Damaged Drop Bears oftentimes had difficulty obtaining enough altitude to reach home, even after ditching their payload. This is why most of these planes carry rapid-deploying, quick-escape balloons, making them sitting targets for enemy aircraft and flak.
That information is not going to do you any good when you’re sitting there on the ground watching this thing barrel at you like a robin descending upon a glistening, fat worm.
Don’t worry, these guys don’t drop bombs. Their standard payload is something much more entertaining.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. The Gate of the Feral Gods: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 4 (pp. 51-52). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>
==Appearance== Gnomish Drop Bears look like open-air, twin-engine biplanes, with each engine nestled between the wings, and look like they were built out of scrap metal. The planes may be decorated with paint.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" />
Their payload is egg-shaped and only slightly smaller than a refrigerator.<ref name=":0">{{ref|4|3}}</ref>
==Operation== Gnomish Drop Bears are fueled by gasoline.<ref name=":1">{{ref|4|15}}</ref>
==References== <references />
[[Category:Vehicles]] {{Navbox Items}}

revision.comment: Eekz moved page [[Gnomish Drop Bear (Contraption)]] to [[Gnomish Drop Bear]]: housekeeping

{{Item|title=Gnomish Knock-Knock|type=Explosive|source=[[Fifth Floor]] Bubble #543}}{{Quote | quote = "Flint says the gnomes are bomb-dropping cowards. He says anybody who uses a bomb is a pussy.”<ref name=":0">{{ref|4|2}}</ref>}} '''Gnomish Knock-Knocks''' are refrigerator-sized bombs created by [[Gnomes]] and capable of leveling cities. In the Air Quadrant of [[Fifth Floor]] Bubble #543, a number of these dangle from the underbelly of Gnomish airships.<ref name=":0" />
==AI Description== '''Gnomish Knock-Knock'''
'''Type: Fuel-air bomb.'''
'''Effect: Thermobaric Explosion.'''
'''Status: 40. Barely stable. I wouldn’t be tapping on the thing.'''
'''Ever seen a hundred Dromedarians die because their lungs imploded, followed by their skin getting melted off their body just before they all shatter into mist? Well now’s your chance! Fun for the whole family, this was the main weapon of the Gnomish Bombardier Squads. There are only a few of these things left, and they’re usually strapped to the failing air force’s most reliable patrol ships.'''
'''The fuel-air Knock-Knocks were once used to devastating effect in the early days of the last conflict. The remaining munitions are instead used as a mutual-standoff weapon. These are simple, crude, but highly-effective bombs. They are detonated using an adjustable, pressure-based fuse that can allow the bombardier to fine-tune the height at which they explode. Requires the bomber to know the altitude of their target to obtain maximum efficacy.'''
'''Famously unstable. But god-damn do they put on a show.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. The Gate of the Feral Gods: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 4 (pp. 36-37). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>
==References== <references />
[[Category:Explosives]] [[Category:Floor 5]] {{Navbox Items}}
[[File:00184.jpg|thumb|Gobble Box]] A box that appears to be related to turkeys. [[Category:Loot Boxes]]

[[Category:Loot Boxes]] The Goblin Box is a [[:Category:Loot Boxes|Loot Box]] awarded for using [[Goblins|goblin]] explosives on the [[First Floor|first]] and [[Second Floor|second]] Floors, and generally contain more explosives. Carl receives similar loot items in unspecified boxes on the Third Floor.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 13).</ref> After the second Silver Goblin Box, Carl does not identify the tier of the goblin boxes he receives.
The boxes appear to be haphazardly assembled with bits of metal, colored by tier, and have a goblin skull etched onto the lid.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 5).</ref>
== Silver Goblin Box == Carl receives several Silver Goblin Boxes on the first two floors. The very first box contained the [[Goblin Pass]].<ref name=":0" /> The boxes typically include three line items of loot.
=== Sample Loot ===
* Goblin Dynamite x 5 * [[Goblin Pass]] * [[Goblin Smoke Bombs]]<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 19).</ref> * Lighter * Satchel of Gunpowder
=== Related Achievements ===
* [[Boom|Boom!]] * an unnamed achievement for killing more than 10 mobs with an explosive.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 11).</ref>
== References == <references />

{{Item|title=Goblin Copper Chopper|type=Vehicle, Contraption|source=[[First Floor]] [[Goblins]]}}{{Quote | quote = He smiled, revealing a row of sharp teeth. “Don’t you worry about that, human. You will know. Just listen to the chopper. It will tell you.”<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 132). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>}} The '''Goblin Chopper Copper''' is a [[Goblins|Goblin]]-made motorcycle running on a steam engine. It has a sidecar fit for a princess.
==AI Description== '''Goblin Copper Chopper with attached sidecar. Human-sized. Contraption.'''
'''Take a junkyard bicycle, add an unreliable steam engine, remove all the bolts holding it together, replace them with chewing gum, and you get the idea. The preferred assault transport of Goblin Bomb Bards, what this contraption lacks in reliability and safety it makes up for in absolutely nothing.'''<ref name=":0">{{ref|1|16}}</ref>
==Appearance== The framework is seemingly welded from mismatched copper scrap, and a thumping steam engine sits in the middle of the chassis. The seat appears to be an alligator skull with white fur on top. The sturdy black wheels are made of some unknown material, more disc than tire.
The detachable sidecar is little more than a bar, a single wheel on a massive spring, and a smaller flat-headed, fur-lined orc skull as a seat. The backrest is painted purple and has an extra layer of fur.<ref name=":0" />
==Operation== The steam engine runs on a permacube, rather than on a lesser demon, so it will operate as long as it has fuel to heat it. A hopper extends from the engine to the handlebars, allowing the rider to toss coal in as needed to heat the permacube.<ref name=":0" /> At a rough speed of 20mph, the hopper will need 3-4 lumps of coal per mile (60 - 80 per hour).<ref name=":1" />
To start the engine, the rider needs to pedal the chopper like a bicycle to reach their desired speed (max of 25 mph<ref>{{ref|1|40}}</ref>), then turn the throttle to stay locked at the speed.<ref>{{ref|1|20}}</ref> Due to the engine's heat, the rider will need to hold their legs out to prevent burning. As the operator's '''Chopper Pilot Skill''' level increases, they can use the throttle to adjust the bike's speed, rather than the pedals.<ref name=":1">{{ref|1|21}}</ref>
Pressure and heat can be further controlled by twisting spigots on the side of the bike; one reduces heat to prevent the engine from blowing, and the other reduces pressure.<ref name=":0" />
==Story== [[Carl]] commissions the Goblins to make the chopper on the [[First Floor]], as a way to navigate the winding tunnels more easily and cover ground quickly. For a while, it is the second most valuable item in his inventory, just behind the [[Wisp Armor Spell | Tome of Wisp Armor]].<ref>{{ref|1|19}}</ref> The chopper is instrumental in Carl's plan to save [[Meadow Lark]] from the [[Rage Elemental]], but is destroyed in the process.
==References== <references />
[[Category:Vehicles]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

{{Item|title=Goblin Murder Dozer|type=Vehicle|source=[[Goblins]]}} The '''Murder Dozer''' is a [[Goblins | Goblin]]-made coal-powered contraption found on [[First Floor | the First Floor]]. ==AI Description==
"'''A goblin-built, steam-powered machine designed to mow down and slaughter unsuspecting dungeon crawlers. I hope you're up to date with your tetanus shot.'''''"''{{ref|1|2}}
==Description== The tractor-sized Murder Dozer is haphazardly constructed of rusting hunks of metal, runs on tank-like treads, and has several pipes billowing out black smoke. A spinning wheel covered in spikes whirrs on the front of the machine, and there's a small ladder on the back.{{ref|1|3}} It sounds like a steam engine and has a wide turn radius. The top of the machine is a fur-lined recessed hole with benches enough to seat fifteen goblins. Goblin Shamans may enchant Murder Dozers so that, in the event of a boiler breach, the focused energy of the blast targets the nearest non-goblin. ==References== [[Category:Vehicles]] {{Navbox Items}}

{{Item|appearance=|location=|effects=*Removes automatic goblin hostility. *Free passage through goblin territory. *Goblin enemies deal 20% more damage.|source=[[Goblin Box | Silver Goblin Box]]|title=Goblin Pass|type=Tattoo}}'''The Goblin Pass''' marks the bearer as a friend of the [[goblins]]. It takes the form of a goblin skull tattoo on [[Carl]]'s inner left forearm, branded on both his skin and any clothing covering it (unless covered by a coverup sleeve).{{ref|1|5}} Carl receives the Goblin Pass in a Silver [[Goblin Box]] for the [[Boom|Boom! achievement]] within one hour of entering the [[First Floor|first floor]], for blowing up the [[Goblins|Goblin]] Murder Dozer and surviving. ==AI Description==
'''It’s a tattoo! On your forearm! Now you’ll never get a good job!''' '''Note: Pass tattoos cannot be hidden unless you purchase a coverup sleeve. Will show through any armor you may wear.''' '''Removes automatic goblin hostility. Allows for free passage through goblin-controlled territory in the dungeon.''' '''Warning: holding a Goblin Pass will cause natural goblin enemies, such as fairy-class creatures, to deal 20% more damage against you. Still, it looks kinda badass.'''Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (pp. 57-58; chapter 6). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
== Notes == When encountering creatures considered "natural goblin enemies," the [[System AI|AI]] is kind enough to include a warning in the initial summary. The text changes to specify whether the hostile entity is a mob or an NPC.
'''WARNING: This is a fairy-class mob. Mobs of this class inflict 20% more damage against you due to your goblin pass.'''Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (p. 270; chapter 32). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
=== Natural Goblin Enemies include: === * [[Clurichaun]] * [[Fairy|Fairies]] * [[Naiad]] == References == {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Tattoos]]

{{Race_Infobox | title1 = Goblins | image1 = [[File:DCC Goblin.png]] | caption1 = Illustration by Erik Wilson | type = Mob | floors = [[First Floor|First]] | height = 4' (120cm) | weight = lightweight | bonuses = Goblin Explosives | natural_enemies = fairy-class races, including: * [[Clurichaun]] * [[Fairy | Fairies]] * [[Naiads]] | npcs = Rory Lorelei }}{{Quote | quote = To offer goblins funpowder is like offering water to a piranha.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 15). }} Goblins are a race of small green humanoids that are common antagonists in fantasy and tabletop games. They are present on the [[First Floor|first floor]], and were the first enemies [[Carl]] encountered in the [[Dungeon|World Dungeon]]. == Description== Small and reckless, the Dungeon's goblins are associated with explosions and unstable contraptions. Crawlers who receive explosion-related achievements earn [[Goblin Box|Goblin Loot Boxes]] containing ever-unstable [[goblin dynamite]] and goblin smoke bombs, and may earn skill points in the "Goblin Explosives" skill. Goblins live in clans lead by a War Chieftain or - occasionally - Goblin Warlord. Goblin Shamans (or Shamankas) specialize in Anguish Magic, and serve as the leader's second-in-commands. If a crawler kills only one goblin in a group, the others will return shortly after with the rest of the clan. Their guttural language sounds like grunts and squeaks, and their laughter is high-pitched and squealing.''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 2 == Appearance == Green-hued humanoid creatures that stand approximately 4 ft (1.2 meters) tall, goblins are mostly bald and have "pointed ears, angular faces, and sharp teeth." On the [[First Floor|first floor]], the goblins are unarmored and clothed in leathery rags. ==Classes== There are several variations of Goblins that appear in the World Dungeon with various attributes. === Goblin (No Class)=== AI Description:
"'''Small, green and smart. What Goblins lack in physical strength they make up in pure spunk'''.''"''Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure by Matt Dinniman. pg.19
Lower level goblins are the most common class of goblin on the [[First Floor|first floor]]. They are armed with wooden sticks with pineapples at the end. ===Goblin Engineer=== AI Description:
"'''Engineers. The incels of the goblin world. They have a hard time finding a date, which makes them extra angry. If there are any females in you party, they will attack them first.'''''"''
Goblin engineers seem to be responsible for creating and maintaining the goblins various constructs. The first Goblin Engineer that Carl meets is driving the Goblin Murder Dozer and carries a small, curved blade.''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 3 All goblin engineers wear something odd on their heads, whether a pot, a hockey helmet, or boxers' headgear. === Goblin Bomb Bard === [[File:01031.png|thumb|Goblin Bomb Bard by Sandboy OC]] AI Description:
'''"These bastards are more unhinged and sadistic than those guys who couldn’t pass the psych exam to join the military. Bomb Bards are experts with explosives, and they strike with a variety of ranged attacks that’ll blow your socks off. If the one you’re looking at right now has more than half of his fingers, then he’s probably very, very dangerous."'''
When preparing for battle, the bomb bards wear metal helmets with a spike at the top; the spike shoots sparks, allowing the bomb bards to light dynamite sticks and bombs by raising them over their heads.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 16). === Goblin Shamanka & Goblin Shaman === AI Description:
'''"In case you’re wondering, Shamanka is just a fancy way of saying female shaman. Goblin Shamans are the leader class of all goblin clans, second only to the War Chieftain or, more rarely, the Goblin Warlord. They are without humor and are said, as part of their training, to have to pick two of the following three actions in order to graduate Shamanka University: they have to fuck, cook, and/or eat their own parents. Most don’t pick cook. And if that wasn’t messed up enough, they specialize in [[Anguish Magic]], a dark magic school designed to focus and enhance damage from other attacks."'''
Shamankas are marked by heavy facial piercings and black robes. Their wooden staffs are topped with carved pineapples. ==Goblin Engineering== Goblin steam engines run on coal, but use a [[permacube]] rather than a lesser demon. ===See Also:=== * [[Goblin Copper Chopper]] * [[Goblin Murder Dozer]] ==References== [[Category:Races]][[Category:Mobs]][[Category:Floor 1]]

A parasitic worm who take over their host's body. Also known as a citizen of the [[Valtay]].

'''Good Rest''' is a daily buff/bonus imparted by certain bed upgrades (such as the [[Ultra-Stabilized Size-Adjustable Race-Adjustable Alleviating Sleep Apparatus]], which gives 30 hours of the Good Rest bonus). <ref name=":0">{{ref|3|2}}</ref>
After receiving this buff, the crawler feels as though they have had a full night's sleep.<ref>{{ref|3|3}}</ref>
== Effects == * 10% increase to all base stats * 10% bonus to experience * 10% bonus to skill training<ref name=":0" />
== Associated Achievements == * [[Well-Rested!]]

== AI Description == '''War God Grull. Level 250.'''
'''Sponsored by [[Maestro|Prince Maestro]] of [[the Skull Empire]]'''
'''Warning: This is a deity. He is invulnerable on this floor.'''
''This god has been involuntarily summoned to this location. Summoning rules apply.''
The child of [[Taranis]] and [[Apito]], Grull, the god of war, is one of the few trueborn heirs to the [[Celestial Ascendancy]]. But with an angry streak as long as a horse's cock, Tanaris worries his son may not be the best choice to rule the heavens. Plus his worshippers tend to be donkeys and other equine-themed creatures. It's a bit unsettling, even to a god.
Grull cannot die. But even if he could, would it really matter? At level 250, he could raze this entire floor in a day.
I hope you said your prayers and brought the lube, because you about to get fucked from here to eternity. [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]]

[[File:00190.jpg|thumb|Guerilla]] Option for [[Carl]]'s 6th floor specialization class. He did not take it.
== AI Description ==
Unlike a revolutionary who stands front and center, you take your fight to the jungles. You cease to be the face of the revolution and instead become the tip of the sword. Using your superior trap-making and ranged-weapon skills, you kill the enemy before they even know you’re there.
Guerillas receive the following benefits:
* An additional +1 to dexterity upon level-up * Access to the Advanced Trap Maker’s Workshop. * Plus [[Camouflage]] * +5 to the Crossbow skill. * Faster trap-making training.
[[Category:Class]]

An organisation associated with a demigod named the [[Night Wyrm]]. Several seasons ago the entire 7<sup>th</sup> floor was centred on them trying to raise their god.
It's members are marked with a [[The Nightworms Nasty Little Web of Suffering|spider web tattoo]] that allows them access to the guild.
The entrance is in the strip club in the [[Desperado Club]], the Guild is run by Hamad the wife of [[Astrid]]. They offer members assassination contracts printed on dried skin.
They have a memorial crystal, presumably of a deceased god.
== Members ==
* [[Prepotente]] * [[Carl]] * [[Katia Grim|Katia]] * [[Damascus Steel]]
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Dungeon Organizations]]

'''Guilds''' are a [[Dungeon]] mechanic introduced on the [[Sixth Floor]] that allow separate parties or individuals to team up and share upgrades.<ref>{{ref|5|8}}</ref>
==Basic Guilds== To start a Guild, a crawler needs to purchase a '''Guild Charter''' for 500,000+ gold from a [[Bopca Protector]].
The basic level one guild can include up to five separate parties or individuals, as long as at least one member in each [[Party]] already owns a [[Personal Space]]. After the guild is formed, a new room labelled '''Guild Common Area''' is added to all associated personal spaces. The crawler's existing personal and party spaces are still restricted to party members only.<ref>{{ref|5|21}}</ref>
==Guild Leaders / Guildmaster== Each Guild has a '''Guild Leader''' who controls guild membership and can assign administration rights to members, such as the power to edit the common area or purchase common upgrades. Guild Leaders may choose to charge membership fees and create a guild treasury.
==Guild Upgrades== Guild upgrades can be purchased.
*Most personal space environmental upgrades can be shared with other guild members for a small licensing fee. *Guild-wide experience sharing can be purchased.
== References == <references />
[[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]][[Category:Guilds | {{PAGENAME}}]]

GumGum is a level 5 [[Orc]] living in the [[Third Floor|Overcity]].
She asked [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] for help with the [[Sex Workers Who Fell from the Heavens|mysterious pile of dead hookers]]. She was murdered shortly after,
Her mother was a prostitute who died after being stabbed. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

{{Character_info | title1 = Gustavo | aliases = | origin = Earth: Ecuador | first_appearance = Book 1, Chapter 14 | crawler_id = Gustavo 3 | species = Dog (Rottweiler) | spells = Lightning Bark | allies = * [[Lucia Mar]] | status = Alive }} '''Gustavo''' is a rottweiler, and one of [[Lucia Mar]]'s [[Pets & Dungeon Familiars | dungeon familiars]].
==Description== Gustavo entered the [[Dungeon]] in Ecuador with Lucia Mar and another rottweiler, [[Cici]]. The three feature heavily on the second episode of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]'' sixty hours later, which shows the young teenager already kitted out with a full set of enchanted armor, Cici equipped with a chainmail sweater, and Gustavo 3 shooting lightning when he barks.<ref name=":0">{{ref|1|14}}</ref> <ref name=":2">{{ref|4|4}}</ref>
{{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler = While both dogs generate a great deal of carnage, Gustavo is particularly violent. He blocks a crawler from accessing the stairwell on the [[Fourth Floor]], and "accidentally" slaughters Lucia's new friends on the [[Fifth Floor]].<ref name=":2"/><ref>{{ref|4|19}}</ref>}}{{Spoiler |book = 5 | spoiler = When Lucia seizes a village on the [[Sixth Floor]] Hunting Grounds, Gustavo attacks a [[dryad]], which ends with Lucia and the dogs slaying all dryads in [[Diwata]]'s temple before challenging [[Donut]] to a fight.<ref>{{ref|5|35}}</ref> Donut ultimately kills Cici (with style) before escaping, and Lucia responds by wailing, "She killed the wrong one."<ref>{{ref|5|37}}</ref> Later, [[Florin]] insists that Gustavo 3 is remotely controlling Lucia.}}
==See Also== * [[Lucia Mar#Story: A Deep Dive| Lucia Mar: Story]]
==References== <references />

{{DISPLAYTITLE:HUD & Crawler Menus}} Immediately upon descending the stairwell to the [[First Floor|first floor]], all crawlers are equipped with a simple heads-up display (HUD) visual interface.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 2). The HUD's functions are limited until the crawler visits a [[Tutorial Guild Hall]] on one of the first three floors and completes the [[Tutorial|tutorial training]], which gives the crawler access to the expanded HUD and Crawler Menus.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 4). The HUD is always active when the crawler is in the Dungeon unless the Crawler is in the presence of a Dungeon administrator.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 36). In this particular season of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]'', due to a shoestring budget, crawlers have access to their HUD and menus as long as they are located between the Earth's core and sea level.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 20). Various elements of the HUD can be upgraded by items, awards, potions, etc. == Before the Tutorial==
'''Error. You may not access this until you have completed the tutorial.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 3).'''
After entering the surface stairwells and before entering the Dungeon, crawlers have access to a basic HUD. A '''countdown timer''' to level collapse appears in the upper right corner of the crawler's vision. Additional functions include: *The crawler can view and mentally "x" out of tool tips, including descriptions of other crawlers, mobs, and points of interest. *After a mob takes damage, a health bar appears above its head. *The crawler can view achievements and notifications when they happen. When in combat, new achievement and other notifications appear as little messages in the upper left of a crawler's vision. Otherwise, the messages auto-play. *Languages are translated to Syndicate Standard. *The AI's announcements are accompanied by text which cannot be dismissed, like subtitles. ==HUD== The HUD is always active in the crawler's vision, and can be customized by focusing on an item. The basic HUD unlocked during the tutorial consists of (in clockwise order from the upper left): # Notifications - upper left. #Health Bar - top right. #Mana Bar - top right, below health bar. # Countdown Timer (changes location during tutorial) - top right, below mana bar. #Minimap - bottom right. #Hotlist - bottom center. ===Notifications=== Notifications are sorted into a folder at the top left of the crawler's vision. The folder blinks when there are unopened notifications. These include: *''Crawler Notifications'', seen only by the crawler. These include: "You've gained a skill level!" and "Level up! You are now level -." *''System Messages'', seen by everyone regardless of which floor they are on, and may be in different voices (such as [[Cascadia]]'s introductory announcements). *''Floor-Specific Notifications'' ===Health Bar=== The Health Bar appears as a long green bar in the top right, just above the Countdown Timer. It represents the crawler's overall HP, and turns red when a crawler's health is low. The Health Menu (see below) breaks down the crawler's status in more detail. ===Mana Bar=== The Mana Bar shows the crawler's remaining mana points (see "Magic Menu" section below), represented as a status bar of an unspecified color. It appears in the top right, below the Health Bar. ===Countdown Timer=== The Countdown Timer to level collapse is still in the upper right, but now below the Health and Mana Bars. === The Minimap=== The minimap appears in the bottom right of the crawler's vision. Focusing on the map enlarges it; it can be expanded to fill the crawler's entire vision. The basic minimap is a simple blue and gray map which represents nearby creatures as dots, and shows the cardinal directions. The map only shows areas the crawler has seen; the rest of the minimap is grayed out by the "'''fog of war'''," which obscures mobs, stairwells, and most locations. Safe rooms are always visible, even when located inside the fog of war. Slain bosses drop [[Neighborhood Map|area maps]] that remove the fog of war from the boss's location; e.g. a neighbor boss drops a neighborhood map, which allows the crawler to view the boss's entire neighborhood on their minimap, regardless of whether they have visited every location or not.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 12). ====Minimap Symbols ==== {| class="fandom-table" !Symbol !Description |- |Green Dot |self |- |Blue Dot |other crawlers |- |Orange Dot |pets Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 47). |- |Purple Dot |Hunters on the [[Sixth Floor|sixth floor]]Dinniman, Matt. ''The Butcher's Masquerade'' (chapter 5). (presumably will apply to other "tourists" on the 9th floor as well) |- |Red Dot |mobs, bosses, and hostile NPCs |- |Red Dot with Black Cross |hostile [[Elite|Elites]] (note: if crawler has not earned the [[Meet an Elite|Meet an Elite achievement]], the Elite appears as a normal red dot)Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 6). |- |White Dot |friendly or nonhostile NPCs |- |White Dot with Black Cross | nonhostile Elites (note: if crawler has not earned the [[Meet an Elite|Meet an Elite achievement]], the Elite appears as a normal white dot) |- |X |corpses. The X disappears if the body is significantly destroyed. Crawler corpses appear twice the size of mob corpses and pulse; hovering over the "X" shows "Corpse of Crawler _ - Level _". |} === Hotlist === Centered in the bottom of the Crawler's vision, the Hotlist has ten spots that can hold potions, spells, or special items. Items such as potions can stack up to (999) per slot. Taking a potion directly from the Hotlist uses the item and applies the effect automatically without requiring the crawler to physically drink it.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 5). ==The Crawler Menu == '''You have been granted access to the Crawler Menu.''' After the Crawler Menu is unlocked in the [[Tutorial|tutorial]], it functions similarly to Inventory and Character tabs in video games. It includes the following (in alphabetical order): #Crafting Menu #Health Menu #Inventory # Magic Menu #Messaging Menu # Party Menu #Pet Menu #Player Stats #Ratings Menu #Skills Menu ==='''Crafting Menu'''=== The Crafting Menu contains recipes for potions, items, and more.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 12). It was not introduced during the tutorial. ==='''Health Menu'''=== While the HUD Health Bar is a single green bar, the Health Menu is a more extensive pie chart and indicates any active conditions or debuffs. The Crawler is able to drill down and see which areas are affected, as well as detailed explanations of injuries and the healing process.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 8). In the Dungeon, healing is accelerated. Health slowly refills based on constitution level, and instantly refills when the crawler enters a stairwell. The Dungeon automatically triages injuries and heals the most serious injuries first, but the Crawler can manually adjust the priority list. Spells such as [[Heal]], [[Heal Critter]], and [[Heal Party]], and items such as the [[Healing Potion|standard healing potion]] can be used to recover health more quickly. ==='''Inventory'''=== In this season of ''Dungeon Crawler World'', crawlers have "a dimensional inventory and AI cataloging system" -- essentially, unlimited inventory capacity and Achievements can unlock new filters/sorting options. Items are added to Inventory using an '''Add to Inventory''' button. Inventory restrictions include: *Any item the crawler can physically lift off the ground for ~4 seconds can be added to their inventory. *If a living creature is added to inventory, it will immediately die. *Potions and similar items can be stacked up to 999 per slot. * Inventory is time-locked, so food items will not expire and explosives will freeze. *Gear and clothing can be transferred directly into the crawler's inventory, but the crawler has to physically put the gear on to equip it.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 25). (Quadrupeds have a different interface, which allows them to equip items and perform actions like opening doors directly from the menu.) The basic inventory is sorted into tabs and can be organized by value (although no actual gold value is shown to the crawler).Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 24). Unopened [[:Category:Loot Boxes|Loot Boxes]] appear in the "Awards and Boxes" tab marked as '''Ready to Open'''. New tabs/submenus appear as items are added, including such tabs as: Healing, Food Items, Gross Shit,Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 22). History,Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 47). Pharmaceuticals, Potions, and Quest Clues.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 18). ==='''Magic Menu''' === The only real description of the Magic Menu is Carl's description: "complicated as shit." Learned spells can be added to the hotlist. At Level 1, '''mana points''' appear to be equal to the crawler's Intelligence stat and refill at a rate of approximately one point per hour. ==='''Messaging Menu''' === The Messaging Menu is not introduced during the tutorial (which presents "group chat" as exclusive to the Party Menu), but allows crawlers to start chats with crawlers and NPCs outside of their party. Except in special circumstances, crawlers who do not share a Party must physically shake hands or fist-bump to communicate by chat.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 21). When the Dungeon opens, viewers cannot see private chats between crawlers but [[Borant Corporation]] and the system AI can.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 40). ==== Chats with Admins ==== After crawlers are entered into the [[Crawler Assisted Outreach Program]] and assigned a PR agent, the PR agent can create a special chat in the Messaging Menu.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 36). The admin has the ability to close the chat at any time; the chat disappears from the crawler's log, and the crawler cannot respond or open a new chat with the admin.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 41). ==== Chats with NPCs ==== [[Manager Benefit|Managers]] have private, protected chats with their crawlers, which are not accessible to viewers. Sentient NPCs, including those currently employed in clubs such as the Desperado Club, can also communicate by chat. ==== Quest Chats ==== All crawlers engaged in a group quest are lumped into a Quest Chat, which - similar to Discord - lists all participants on one side of the screen. The party designated to host the group chat has the ability to remove or silence users from the chat.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (epilogue). ==== Scratchpad ==== The Messaging Menu contains a '''scratchpad''', which a crawler can copy and paste items onto or simply record thoughts in.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 8). ==='''Party Menu'''=== New Crawlers are automatically grouped into a "party" with anyone who entered the Dungeon at the same time and place as them. The Party Menu allows crawlers in groups to manage their party and use a group chat, as well as view each other's Stat, Health, Skills, and equipped items.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 7). The party member with the highest combined stat total is designated as party leader and given more control over the party menu. Crawlers in the same party share experience (EXP). Crawlers in a party receive 9.8 EXP from consuming a 10-EXP crawler cookie, regardless of whether their party includes two or more members, so it appears that 2% of a crawler's earned experience is distributed equally across other party members.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 19). Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 20). When a crawler first begins to use the group chat, a virtual keyboard materializes in front of them; however, most crawlers soon learn that they can simply focus on the chat window and think the words they want to send.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 15). If two party members are split up, and one is locked into a boss battle, they cannot use the Party Chat to communicate with each other until after the battle is over.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 22). ==='''Pet Menu'''=== The Pet Menu is unlocked after the crawler tames a pet, and its dot turns orange. The crawler can change the pet's name and title, and view the pet's stats and abilities.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 7). ==='''Player Stats'''=== The Player Stats menu allows Crawlers to view their current stats: *Strength: *Intelligence: *Constitution: *Dexterity: *Charisma: The typical adult human averages between 3 and 5 in each of these stats when they enter the Dungeon, but may score outside of this range. Crawlers will receive (3) stat points every time they level up, but cannot distribute these stat points until they choose a race and class on the [[Third Floor|third floor]]. Items, gear, potions, and buffs may temporarily or permanently adjust these stats. Wisdom is hidden and allegedly cannot be adjusted, as doing so impacts a person's personality. ==='''Ratings'''=== The [[First Floor|first floor]] of the Dungeon is not accessible by live viewers, but crawlers who appear on the highlight reels will typically gain billions of views and millions of followers as soon as they reach the [[Second Floor|second floor]]. The Ratings Menu shows: {| class="fandom-table" |+The Ratings Menu !Stat !Description |- |'''Views:''' |Any time someone watches a crawler's feed for approximately 8 seconds counts as 1 view. |- |'''Followers:''' |Number of viewers who bookmarked the crawler's ID and can tune in when they want (unless the crawler is in the bathroom). |- |'''Favorites:''' |Favoriting a crawler gives the viewer live updates on the crawler's stats and conditions, and if the crawler is in combat. Viewers receive a limited number of favorites. |- |'''Patrons:''' |Usually organizations, patrons sponsor popular crawlers for advertising purposes. Patrons typically only send [[Loot Boxes|Silver or Gold Boxes]] due to the cost, but are exclusively able to send [[Sponsorship Box|Benefactor/Sponsor Boxes]], which contain the rarest items. |} === '''Skills Menu''' === The Skills Menu includes an infinite list of skills, both useful and useless, organized in pages. If a crawler doesn't have a given skill, it appears "blurred out" and illegible on the list. The list can be filtered by whether or not the crawler has the skill, the skill level, and more, by checking and unchecking boxes. The menu includes a search box.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 6). Skills can be taught or trained in guildhalls scattered throughout the dungeon, or by equipment, potions (such as [[Legendary Skill Potion|Legendary Skill Potions]]), or spells. It is relatively easy to train most skills to level 10 or 11, but the more advanced levels are a slog to train.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 2). Most skills cap out at level 15. The crawler's race or class can unlock the ability to train certain skills up to level 20. Guildhalls throughout the Dungeon can teach crawlers how to use and train their skills. Check the [[:Category:Skills|Skills Category]] page for some useful skills, or [[Carl]]'s profile for some examples of useless or joke skills (such as Dumpster Diving). == Additional Interface Tabs == Crawlers unlock new tabs in their interface over the course of the Dungeon. === '''Quests''' === The Quest tab is unlocked when the crawler stumbles into a quest.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 4). === '''Sponsorship Tab''' === Unlocked after sponsorship bidding concludes on the fourth floor.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 11). === '''Third-Party Upgrades''' === Unlocked by installing upgrades created outside the dungeon, such as a [[Valtay|Valtay Corporation]] Neural Enhancer. Upgrades recorded in this tab do not include much information aside from the status, such as "This upgrade is working properly."Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 13).
'''Warning: All communication-based upgrades will be disabled while you are within the dungeon. Any attempts to circumvent dungeon security will result in immediate disqualification.'''Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook.'' (p. 203). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
==References== [[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]]

[[Carl]] completed the quest [[Show Must Go On|The Show Must Go On]] in an unusual way.
==Description== You have completed a quest, but you completed it in a way unusual enough to trigger the Hadji Achievement! And like the oft exploited street children of Kolkata, where there's one, there's usually more. This is one of the rare achievements that can be rewarded more than once.
''Reward:'' Your Gold Quest box has been upgraded to a Platinum [[Quest Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

== Description == You have initiated an attack that has caused more than 100 casualties more than 100 kilometers from your current position. You’re either the universe’s greatest sniper, or you’ve been a sneaky, little, portal-using bitch. Either way, that’s rather impressive. You’d have a great career in politics ahead of you if, you know, we hadn’t destroyed your world and all the governments and stuff.
''Reward'': You’ve received a [[Surefire (Crafting Item)|Gold Sniper’s box!]] [[Category:Achievements]]

{{SpoilH | 6}} Husband of [[Astrid]]. Father to [[Damascus Steel]] and [[Anaconda]]. He is also known as [[The Night Wyrm]] he head of the [[Guild of Suffering]].
He hired [[Katia Grim|Katia]] and [[Carl]] to kill Astrid so that he could inherit her money when they get out of the Dungeon. After learning what happened Damascus swore to kill him. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

== Description == Unspecified, but melee class with a focus on hammers.

Heal is the basic restoration spell every crawler is taught during the [[Tutorial Guild Hall|tutorial]] on the [[First Floor|first]] or [[Second Floor|second floor]].<ref name=":0">''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 4</ref> It does not level up. ==Description== '''Cost''': 2mp<ref name=":0" />
'''Target''': Self
'''Duration''': Instantaneous
The user glows red while casting the spell. When [[Carl]] was level 1, this spell could heal him by about 20% of his max health. [[Mordecai]] suggested it could be used to treat injuries or sickness.<ref name=":0" />
== References == <references /> [[Category:Spells]] [[Category:Donut]] [[Category:Carl]]

Heal Critter is a restoration spell obtained by [[Donut]] on [[Dungeon Floor 2|Floor 2]] after obtaining [[Mongo]]. ==Description== '''Cost''': Unknown
'''Target''': Mob
'''Range''': Limited
'''Duration''': Instant
Restores HP to a monster. The amount healed scales with spell level.
[[Category:Spells]] [[Category:Donut]]
A heal spell. [[Category:Spells]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Standard Healing Potion}} {{Item|title=Standard Healing Potion|type=Potion|effects=Heal 50%+|source=* [[Tutorial]] * [[Adventurer Box]]}}
The Standard Healing Potion is a single-use item given to crawlers when they learn how to use their [[HUD / Crawler Menu|Inventory]] during the tutorial, and is commonly received in [[:Category:Loot Boxes|Loot Boxes]].<ref name=":0">''Dungeon Crawler Carl,'' Chapter 5</ref>
== AI Description == '''Standard Healing Potion.'''
'''Increases your health by at least 50%. Doesn’t cure poison or other health-seeping conditions such as succubus-inflicted gonorrhea. So remember to wrap it up, bucko.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 49). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref> <ref name=":0" />
== Description == The Standard Heal Potion is red and contained in a corked glass bottle approximately 1/3 the size of a coke bottle.<ref name=":0" /> When consumed (rather than administered directly from inventory), it tastes like kiwi juice.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 24).</ref>
'''Effect:''' Heal 50% + of Health.<ref name=":0" />
'''In Inventory:''' Located in Potions and Healing submenus; it can stack up to 999 per slot.<ref name=":0" />
== References == <references /> {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Floor 1]] [[Category:Potion]]

{{Character_info | origin = The Dungeon | occupation = Neighborhood Boss | species = black bear | height = 8' (243.8 cm) | level = 19 | organizations = [[Grimaldi's Traveling Circus]] [[The Vengeance of the Daughter]] | status = Deceased (Killed by Carl) }}{{Quote | quote = Now, if you’ve never had a flaming, skull-faced bear on roller skates barreling at you full speed, you don’t know what you’re missing. <small> -- (Book 2, Chapter 9)</small> }} Once an attraction at [[Grimaldi's Traveling Circus]] on the third floor, Heather the Bear was transformed into a monstrous [[Boss|Neighborhood Boss]] by [[Scolopendra]]'s curse. [[Tsarina Signet]] of ''[[Vengeance of the Daughter|The Vengeance of the Daughter]]'' sacrificed countless victims to Heather over the years before asking [[Carl]] to kill Heather, claiming Heather's blood will be some of the most potent blood she's used for her summons.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 8).</ref>
==Admin Notice== '''Admin Note: Boss Battles that arise concurrently with secondary productions or as parts of a Quest may present themselves differently. You will still receive awards commensurate with the boss’s proper rank. If you survive, of course.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (p. 103; chapter 8). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. </ref>
==AI Description== '''Level 19 Neighborhood Boss!'''
'''Performing since she was a cub, Heather the Roller-Skating Bear was one of the longest-running attractions at Grimaldi’s Traveling Circus. Her retirement had been only weeks away when the cataclysm hit. Now the tired, old bear has been transformed into a monstrosity, barely recognizable from her former self. She lives out her days as a hunter for the circus, seeking out juicy mobs and unsuspecting crawlers. She finds and incapacitates her prey using her overwhelming speed and strength. Then she drags her quarry back to the circus so the clowns may feed.'''
'''Somewhere in there, deep, deep down, there is a spark of the old Heather. The beloved bear has moments of lucidity as she runs down her terrified prey. In those brief moments, she thinks: ''Good. I’ve always hated all you assholes, anyway.'''''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (pp. 104-105; chapter 9). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. </ref>
==Description== An exceptionally large former-black bear, Heather's skinless face is nothing but exposed skull and round red eyes, fused to a tattered pink clown hat that sits cockeyed on her skull and a pleated clown ruff around her neck. Her two front paws have been replaced by dozens undulating white worms, which glow and extend. She wears a pink tutu on her waist and well-oiled roller skates on her two back feet.<ref name=":0" />
When the worms come in contact with prey, they begin to burrow into flesh and immediately begin talking in their prey's mind.<ref name=":1">Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 9).</ref>
Carl ultimately defeats Heather by healing her with [[Fireball or Custard?|a Fireball or Custard? scratch-off ticket]]. The custard kills the worms and restores her to a mostly-normal female black bear (which, according to Mordecai's not-so-helpful advice, is smarter than a male black bear).<ref name=":1" />
==References== <references /> [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Neighborhood Boss]] [[Category:Floor 3]]

[[File:8-9hwsEoQtTDO0a2C.png|thumb|Hekla- AI rendering]] {{Character_info|class=[[Shieldmaiden]]|species=Human {{!}} [[Amazonian]]|origin=Iceland|occupation=Psychiatrist|status=Deceased, accidentally killed on [[Fourth Floor|The Iron Tangle]] by [[Katia Grim]]|party=Brynhild's Daughters|allies=* [[Eva Sigrid]] * [[Silfa]] * [[Katia Grim]]|gear=[[Enchanted Repeating Crossbow of the Scavenger Mother of Mothers]]|height=Nine inches taller than Carl, so 7'0"|first_appearance=Chapter 39|level=33}}
'''Race: Amazonian Class: Shieldmaiden'''
Hekla is from Iceland. She is the party leader of Brynhild's Daughters. She is described as a pretty blonde. After taking the Amazonian race, she became taller and wider, with a bodybuilders physique. She wears an enchanted breastplate and wields a magical crossbow called the [[Enchanted Repeating Crossbow of the Scavenger Mother of Mothers]].
Hekla was fighting with her husband when the dungeon was formed. Shortly afterwards, he was poisoned by a Walking Cactus and she fled. When she returned, he was being eaten by rats. She gained an achievement for killing one of them with a bone from her husband and was awarded a loot box containing an enchanted crossbow.
During book 2, [[Carl]] appeared with Hekla on a show and she requested that he take in [[Katia Grim|Katia]], a party member she'd been separated from.
{{Spoiler | book = | spoiler = In the Iron Tangle on floor four, Hekla met up with Donut, Carl, and Katia. She asked them to go to station 101 to aid a large group of stuck crawlers. With Hekla and the Daughters, they battled ghouls while riding to the station. Katia formed into a cowcatcher so they could roll through the ghouls. Taking advantage of the chaos and a distracted Katia, Hekla covertly attacked and wounded her with invisible arrows. However, Donut’s glasses allowed her to detect and call out Hekla's treachery, prompting her to confess that she ordered their healer [[Silfa]] not to aid Katia. She was planning to lure Carl into attacking Silfa, giving her an excuse to kill him and recruit Princess Donut and her manager [[Mordecai]] to [[Brynhild's Daughters]]. Katia awoke confused as accusations were flying. She fought with her friend Eva and used the [[Rush]] ability, intending to kill her. Thrown off kilter, she instead lethally hit Hekla and took the [[Enchanted Repeating Crossbow of the Scavenger Mother of Mothers|magical crossbow]] from her corpse. }}
== Equipment ==
* [[Dirty Little Phase Bolt]] * [[Enchanted Repeating Crossbow of the Scavenger Mother of Mothers]]

Hellik is a god of sun and life. He is the twin brother of [[Emberus]] and younger brother of [[Taranis]]. He is obsessed with killing his brothers. Emberus blamed Hellik for the death of his son, and wishes for [[Carl]] to kill him before reaching the 12th floor of the dungeon. [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]]

Henrik is the leader of the [[Dromedarian|Dromedarians]] in [[Hump Town]]. He has been replaced by a [[Changeling]]. Brother of [[Juice Box]].
Attempted to force [[Wynne]] to teach him a spell to turn [[Quetzalcoatlus]] into a corporeal form.

{{Character_info|species=Human|origin=Seattle|first_appearance=Chapter 1, Book 3|status=Deceased, killed by [[Shade Gremlin]]|party=Meadow Lark|allies=[[Brandon An]]}}
One of the residents of the [[Meadow Lark]] nursing home. He made it to the [[Third Floor|The Third Floor]] with the help of [[Brandon An]], [[Chris Andrews]], [[Imani C]], and [[Carl]].
On the Third Floor, he is pulled into an alleyway and fathered thousands of [[Shade Goblin]] monsters with a succubus. He and Brandon An held the line against the goblins so the rest of Team Meadow Lark could escape to the [[Fourth Floor]].

page.title: Here’s Some Good Shit Because Your Going to Need It Box

revision.text: Carl and Donut received this box for going down a staircase within one hour after the start of a level. [[Category:Loot Boxes]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}
==Description== She was the author of the 16th Edition of The [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]. ==Cookbook Entries== During my studies, I have run across multiple castle variations. So far I have identified three distinct types. The size of the castle doesn't seem to have a bearing on what type it is. It is more a function of the game's insistence to forward the narrative, not unlike how the musical key of a Virilean opera movement is a function of the performer's ability to progress and not necessarily in service to aural aesthetics. The first iteration is just a regular building like anything else you might encounter in the dungeon. It is a fortified building with monsters, sometimes with a boss within. Sometimes a quest is involved, but the castle is usually an obstacle or part of the environment, not the target of the quest. I have found this type to be the most common. The second type is a governmental entity. Usually, this is a quest target. One must either claim the throne room or kill a boss. Once this occurs, the castle is "conquered" and whatever this castle has dominion over is obtained. It can be a region or a whole country or just the castle itself or simply a quest trigger. Once this goal is met, the castle itself is no longer relevant. (Incidentally, this second iteration is the type in [[Ninth Floor|the faction wars]] games of the ninth floor. There, each team is gifted with a throne seed the moment we crawlers arrive. They are given a day to place the seed, and the game begins. The seed must be placed within a self-contained structure on their property. Oftentimes they have prepared for this by pre-building a castle or using a pre-existing structure. The location of this building cannot be hidden, so placing the seed within a fortified structure is the best choice. Once the castle is conquered, then the associated armies are defeated and dominion is transferred to the conqueror.) (See my essay on the nature of NPCs for more insight on how conquering areas may be utilized to forward my Worn Path Method of enlightenment.) The third castle type is similar to the second with a small difference. The castle itself is a self-contained village with an NPC and guard ecology. It is almost identical to the villages and cities of the third and sixth floor. If conquered, the castle will appear in the crawler's interface as an owned village and taxes will be collected. Guards can be controlled just as if in a regular village. I have not personally administered a castle, but a fellow crawler has. They state there are a few differences to the interface regarding town defense and available upgrades, but they have not told me what they are and threatened to punch me in the mouth if I kept asking, so I have refrained. If I learn more, I will update this entry. (Chapter 54, Book 5)
Show them the lie. Show them the seams. Shows them the path they're on is a false one. Think of a trolley on a track. A worn path is easily traveled. The more worn the path, the more difficult it is to get them to look away. Just like the deeper the track, the sturdier the trolley.. But even the strongest of minds, even those controlled and relentlessly corrected can be derailed just as a trolley can be derailed by a tiny, properly placed pebble. Find the pebble and place it on the path, and their own momentum will do the work for you. (Chapter 56, Book 5)
I do wonder, sometimes, how my worn path method will work on the deeper floors with the longer timelines. Tea that steeps too long tends to take on an unexpected flavor. (Chapter 21, Book 6)
[[Milk]] is correct here about the stairwells. It states in the rules manual that while stairwells may be gated until certain conditions are met, the stairwells themselves are not allowed to be removed from the playing field. (Chapter 61, Book 6)
I'm starting to believe I have the ability to manifest my own destiny, after a certain fashion. The more unstable the AI running this system becomes, the less predictable it is. Yet at the same time, it's even more predictable in certain ways. I made a quip about being hungry, and I suddenly received a random achievement notification about my hunger level. I discussed with my friend how I wished we could kill more ghasts, because they often drop knowledge scrolls, and not one hour later, I received a quest to hunt down a certain number of the very same monsters. Beware, however. That same quest killed my friend. The AI is always listening, thinking, plotting, changing the game to suit its desires. At the higher levels, it is not as rigid as it once was. That pliability can be an asset or an extreme danger. (Chapter 62, Book 6)
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]
Hills Cyclops are one eyed creatures, they are the weakest and bumbest of the cyclops. Like all Cyclops they are unable to see themselves in the mirror. [[Category:Races]]

The Hobble card is a [[T’Ghee totem|T'Ghee]] card that reduces a totems summoning time by 90%.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:T'Ghee Card]]

== AI Description == This limited race is only available to Crawlers who have obtained a level five Explosives Handling skill by the time race selection becomes available. A Hobgoblin is what happens when a lady troll manages to get a goblin drunk enough to talk herself into his pants. Large, muscular, and smart, Hobgoblins excel at trapmaking, explosives management, and all-out mayhem. Unfortunately, these guys are so ugly even Gorgons lose their lunch looking upon them. This race is best suited for rogue and fighter-based classes. * Automatic +3 to all trap-based and explosive-based skills. * +5% Faster skill progression in all trap-based and explosive-based skills. * Unlocks higher-tier explosives and trap-making abilities, allowing one to raise these skills to 20. * Free access to all Hobgoblin Sapper Workshops. * -5 to Charisma. Charisma is capped at 10. * +1 to Dexterity. * +2 to Intelligence. * Adds the Regeneration skill
[[Category:Races]]

Hold Steady was one of [[Mordecai|Mordecia's]] former team mates along with [[Uzzi]] and [[Chaco]].
He appeared to have significant magical abilities.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Aliens]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]]

[[File:00076.jpg|thumb|Hole (about to close)]] Hole is a utility spell that makes a hole in a surface. Obtained by [[Donut]] on [[Fourth Floor|Floor 4]] through her membership to the [[Dungeon Book of the Floor Club]]. ==Description== '''Cost''': Unknown amount of mp per second (Donut can use it continuously for about 5 minutes near the beginning of floor 4)
'''Target''': Any surface within spell radius
'''Duration''': Variable, can be canceled at will
Allows the caster to instantly carve a cylindrical volume, a hole, out of a surface of their choosing. The diameter of the hole by default is about the size of a manhole cover, but it can be changed with practice. The depth of the hole scales at 3cm per spell level. At level 1 it creates more of a dimple in most surfaces rather than a hole. When the spell ends the hole disappears, leaving the affected area undamaged.
Anything that can fit in the hole created by the spell can pass through it, but the spell can also be used offensively to create portal cuts. When the spell ends it destroys any matter that's occupying the space created by the spell.
[[Category:Spells]] [[Category:Donut]]

A were-castor with a mullet.
He got into a fight with [[Clint Smashgrab|Clint]].
He has a high constitution scores and an ability that draws the aggro of mobs. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

{{Character_info|species=[[Grixist]]|first_appearance=Book 6|gear=|gods=[[Eileithyia]]}} Huanxin Jinx is the current sponsor of the goddess [[Eileithyia]]. She's been playing the Ascension game since she was a kid.

If they participated in extracurricular activities, it was always either drama, yearbook committee, or the dreaded anime club. They planned on changing the world with s..."
revision.text:
== AI Description == {{Character_info|species=Human {{!}} [[Bush Elf]]|first_appearance=Chapter 1, Book 5|level=30}} Ian - Bush Elf. Level 30. Registration Area Attendant. This is a Non-Combatant NPC.
You know those perpetually-depressed emo kids from high school who always sat on the floor during lunch? If they participated in extracurricular activities, it was always either drama, yearbook committee, or the dreaded anime club. They planned on changing the world with some bullshit cause. They all had jobs at the smoothie place. Then after high school, they just kinda got absorbed by the world, like pouring a dark drink into a rushing stream. You blinked, and they were just gone, along with all of their black hair dye and all of their dreams.
That is a Bush Elf. A once-proud people, almost physically indistinguishable from the ruling class High Elves, Bush Elves are the regular joes of the forest. If you look really close, you can see the wrinkles around their eyes, or the very slight hunch to their backs. A sign of their defeat. They tend to favor druid magic and jobs at places where they're in cubicles.
Sometimes they remember how strong of a people they once were.
== Description == Ian is a former human crawler who is usually an attendant at Club Vanquisher. His brother was killed by [[Vrah]] in the previous season. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Physicker]]|species=Human|origin=Nigeria|status=Deceased|level=29|party=Le Mouvement|allies=[[Florin]]|occupation=A member of the Red Cross|image1=00610.jpg}}
'''Race:''' Human '''Class:''' Physicker (Healer)
Ifechi entered [[Dungeon|The Dungeon]] with a large group of men, unarmed and carrying a medical bag, it's later revealed that she used to be a member of the red cross. In Chapter 31, the group goes from 150 to about 80 due to infighting. The entire group, minus Ifechi, is killed fighting a City Boss slime monster. Ifechi survived by being outside the boss room when it sealed.
It is revealed in Book 4 that Ifechi is a woman and Florin's girlfriend. She is killed when [[Lucia Mar]] casts ''Rubber'' on herself and [[Florin|Florin's]] shotgun blasts are reflected to his partner's head.
Her twin sister is resurrected as [[Imogen|Queen Imogen]] for [[The Butcher's Masquerade]].
== Gear == She had a staff that summons hundreds of leaches, once they cover a mob they can kill it in seconds. Afterwards the leaches are filled with blood and other fluids from their victims and if eaten they make whoever eat them stronger.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

[[File:00815.jpg|thumb|Chris Andrews - Igneous]] A race made from rock. Changing into this race alters the users personality.
Capable of firing lava from their bodies and comes with a camouflage ability. They can also breath underwater.
[[Maggie My|Maggie]] claimed that in return for their high constitution they are unable to use chat or inventory functions but this was a lie, based on Chris’s later ability to chat.
== Known Igneous ==
* [[Chris Andrews]]
[[Category:Races]]

Admin Notice. This page may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Posting spoilers for Book 7 will result in “acceleration” per this wiki’s rules. ==Description== Author of the 11th Edition of The [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]. ==Cookbook Entries== We are meant to live solitary lives, even the eunuchs amongst us. Still, the sight of him, twisted and changed, speaking with that same voice that once said such sweet words... It broke me, friends. It broke me in such a way I did not think possible after all that has happened. They're not the same. Even if cured of the rot injected into their aura. Don't even try. Hope is crucial, but it can also be poison if it is blind. (Chapter 52, Book 5) My people have a saying. "The burning [[Yenk]] needs only to embrace their enemies." It likely translates poorly, but what it means is that some problems aren't problems at all if you think on it long enough. (Chapter 52, Book 6) Gods, I am so lonely. (Chapter 63, Book 6) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

[[File:Hotpot.png|thumb]] {{Character info |crawler_#=12,329,440 |age=19 |height=5'2" |weight=90 lbs. |class=[[Fire Spiritualist]] |species=Human {{!}} [[Obsidian Butterfly]] |origin=Wenatchee, Washington |occupation=Caretaker |first_appearance=Chapter 22 |status=Alive |party=[[Meadow Lark]] |allies= *[[Elle McGib]] *[[Chris Andrews]] *[[Carl]] *[[Donut]] |gear= }} [[File:00332.jpg|thumb|Imani]] Imani is another caretaker from [[Meadow Lark]]. She is one of [[Carl]] and [[Donut]]'s oldest allies, having received their help rescuing the elderly under her care. == Description == Before she chooses her class/race, Imani is described as a 19 year old woman, about 90 pounds, and with hollowed out eyes. After her transformation on the 3rd floor, she becomes a species called the Obsidian Butterfly. She is described to be a "gaunt, skull-faced vision." She weighs half of her original weight and has a white skull painted on her face. reminiscent of the Danger Dingoes. She has four translucent butterfly wings. The wings are similar to the colors of a monarch butterfly, but more saturated. Her wingspan is about 12 feet and the wings pass through physical objects. == Abilities == Her class is primarily a support class with decent healing abilities. * Juiced - 10% temporary strength * Shrouded - 10% temporary damage reduction * Trolled - 25% temporary accelerated healing * Smart Juice - an aura that raises the level of a spell but also adds an additional cool down She is also able to fly. == History == When she is first introduced, she has a relatively high level and has already killed 12 crawlers, all her own residents, but they were mercy killings. She is a healer at heart, but will do whatever is necessary. On the eight floor all four of her squad mates died when her totem killed them giving her four more player skulls. == Personality == She's highly religious. == Gear == * Magical chain
[[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]] [[Category:Characters]]

'''Immortalized''' is a timed status condition that affects creatures newly cured of [[Vampire | vampirism]].<ref name=":0">{{ref|5|49}}</ref>
== Effects == While the creature is in direct sunlight, Immortalized is a debuff. The creature has half strength, half its mana supply, and is unable to heal.<ref name=":0"/>
When the creature is in shadow, Immortalized has no effect.<ref name=":0"/>
When the creature is in direct moonlight, Immortalized is a buff. The creature has +50% strength, +50% mana, and double healing speed.<ref name=":0"/>
== References == <references />
[[Category:Status Conditions]]

{{Character_info|titles=*Princess * Queen|class=[[Cleric Sorceress]]|species=High [[Elf]]|status=Deceased, killed in Cage Match|gods=[[Apito]]|level=145|image1=00611.jpg}} Queen Imogen is a level 145 high elf Fallen Cleric Sorceror Country Boss.
They got [[Ifechi|Ifechi's]] twin sister to play Imogen, they were originally played to use [[Beatrice]] but couldn't due to [[Odette|Odette's]] interference.
Imogen attempted to eradicate all of [[King Finian|King Finian's]] half blood children, including [[Tsarina Signet]].
During the war against the [[Chee]] she turned them all into [[Were-kin]].
==Skills== She is immune to poison and curse, she can return magical fire and is susceptible for blunt force attacks. During the [[Butcher's Masquerade]] her mana was temporary unlimited.
===Stats===
*Str - 201 *Dex - 201 * Cons - 201 *Int - 300 *Cha - 201
==AI Description == '''Queen Imogen - High Elf Cleric Sorceress. Level 145 Country Boss'''
This isn't just any high elf. This is Imogen, the queen of the elves. The big baddie of the floor. Don't let her good looks and polite manner fool you. She is as ugly as they come.
Sometimes, when we meet bad guys, there's a lingering possibility that we might see some sort of redemption arc. There's a good quality buried in there somewhere. Did you know, for example, that Juicer guy you murdered on the first floor used to spend all his free time volunteering at a hedgehog rescue? Remember Denise the goose? The one you shoved headfirst into the garbage disposal? She loved reading to children. In fact, you've now killed two bosses who loved reading to kids.
Anyway, Imogen doesn't have any qualities like that. Not a one. She has never left a tip in her life. If they had shopping carts in this world, she'd never return it to the receptacle. Sure, she pretends to be a kind and just leader. She throws a killer party, that's for certain.
But in the end, it's all a show. Everything she does is in service of her main motivation, which is power. She's nothing more than a terrified little girl, afraid of weakness, afraid of dying like her father, King Finian. Impotent and alone and overshadowed by someone more powerful.
She has a plan to make certain that never happens to her. A plan that all hinges on the success of tonight's masquerade.
I sure hope you don't do anything to piss her off. That might be bad. [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Country Boss]] [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

[[File:AI generated incubus .png|thumb|270x270px]] A type of demon, with dusky gray skin. They also have devil horns, a forked tail, and bat-like wings. Incubi have a low alcohol tolerance.
This was the race [[Mordecai]] became on the [[Third Floor|3rd Floor]].
== AI Description == Also known as the Gigachad of the Over City, Incubi are the male counterparts of the infamous Succubus. The smooth, seductive, and ultimately deadly Incubus can be identified by his stunning good looks, exquisite charm, and sensuous feet. They can only be found on urban levels of the dungeon. They give new meaning to the phrase, "hit it and quit it." [[Category:Races]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Indigenous Planetary Species Protection Act}}
The '''Indigenous Planetary Species Protection Act''' is a [[Syndicate]] law.
Subsection 35, in conjunction with the [[Mined Material Reclamation Act]], requires that survivors of the [[The Transformation|Transformation]] must be given the opportunity to reclaim the matter lost in the event. The "assigned planetary regent" may "choose the manner of this reclamation." Option 3 is the [[Dungeon|18-Level World Dungeon]].<ref name=":0">''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 1</ref> Another option is presumably the battle royale aired in other seasons.
The law also requires that all remaining matter must be repurposed to create the subterranean World Dungeon.<ref name=":0" />
== References == <references /> [[Category:Syndicate History]] [[Category:Dungeon Backstage]]

== Description == You have been physically attacked by a deity, and you survived. This is a feat that has only been accomplished by a handful of crawlers in the history of ''Dungeon Crawler World''. Good job! Unfortunately for you and anybody around you, whenever this happens, the other deities tend to notice.
''Reward'': You have received a [[Pawna's Tears|Legendary Deity’s Box]]. [[Category:Achievements]]

revision.comment: Moved info about Maggie taking over Chris into a spoiler
revision.text:
== Description == An aquatic brain parasite that takes full control of a living body over a few days. The person affected usually doesn't know they have the parasite, and then they are locked out of their own bodies. An anti-parasitic can kill the infiltrator. Also known as Scree.
{{Spoiler | book =4 | spoiler =Maggie My chooses this race and infiltrates [[Chris Andrews]] at the beginning of the third floor to get close to [[Carl]] and enact her revenge for her daughter's death. }}
== Notable Infiltrators ==
* [[Maggie My]] [[Category:Races]]

A god who is part of the [[Orisha]] pantheon. He is deaf and mute and spent time in the nothing.
== Appearance == Well muscled but with androgynous facial features, he has a translucent sea serpent twisted around his body.
== Shrine == Gain immunity from most health seeping conditions, gain 50% bonus to constitution.
He will not ascend, instead he will return to the [[Nothing]].
[[Category:Deities]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

[[File:00838.jpg|thumb|Insurgent]] [[Carl]] set an explosive trap killing the hunter [[JayGee]] during [[Sixth Floor|The Hunting Grounds]].
==Description== You left an explosive device along a well-traveled path, and it detonated and killed an intended target. It was really cool. Too bad you didn't get to see it because you're a trap-leaving bitch!
''Reward:'' You've received a Gold [[Trapmaster Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]
A type of parasite, the dead bodies they posses continue rot. [[Category:Races]]

{{SpoilR}}{{Character_info|class=[[Coin Tinker]]|species=[[Crafter]]|occupation=Hunter|status=Deceased, killed by Carl|party=[[The Crafter Alliance]]|highest_stat=Intelligence|level=50}}Iota was a hunter acting as an account for the [[Crafters Alliance]].
He stayed in the safe room refusing to fight until the [[System AI]] teleported him out the room. Landed in front of [[Carl]] and a bunch of dinosaurs, he explained to Carl about the system [[System AI|AI]] going primal and ignoring court order before Carl killed him.
== Gear == He had four magical nipple rings, one that gave +5 to the drink mixing skill one that showed the average selling value of a non unique value, a gold ring that provided quarter fall, a nipple ring that gave a constitution buff. He also had 498 regular healing potions, 20 blitz sticks, 400 gold and over 40 different types of alcohol.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Hunters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

[[Carl]] gained the first levels in this skill after he punched out the first boss with a metal leash wrapped around his his fist.
At level 10 it gains an upgrade called the Breadbasket Effect which provides a 10% chance to stun a mob for several seconds.
== AI Description == When simple brutality isn’t enough. Newsboy cap not included.
With a skill like this, you can always find work as a 1920’s street tough or a collection agent for a bookie.
[[Enchanted War Gauntlet of the Exhalted Grull (Right-handed)|War gauntlets]] and lumpers will protect your hands and enhance your punching damage without losing your [[Pugilism Skill|bare-knuckle]] bonus. Each level of this skill increases the enhanced fist damage bonus by an additional 10%. [[Category:Skills]] [[Category:Carl]]
