revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Fourth Floor]]

[[File:00061.jpg|thumb|You've received a quest!]] Carl received the quest [[Show Must Go On|The Show Must Go On]].
==Description== And you thought all you had to do was bonk monsters on the head.
You've received a quest! Puzzles and intrigue and mysteries, oh my! If you want to survive in this world, you're going to need to be more than just a pretty, sword-swinging barbarian. Some quests require brute strength, yes, but sometimes you also gotta use your noggin.
''Reward:'' We don't want you getting bored. That's your prize. [[Category:Achievements]]

page.title: It's Not My Fault You Fish-Headed Assholes Don't Properly Program Your Quests Box

revision.text: [[Category:Loot Boxes]] A loot box [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] received after he had his celestial lootbox overruled by [[Borant Corporation|Borant]].

[[Carl]] infected [[Vrah]] with double gonorrhea when he stabbed her with the [[Arrow of Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea]].
==Description== New Achievement! It itches when I pee! You infected another combatant with a venereal disease. Good job there, Derek Jeter. I hope you bought them dinner first.
''Reward:'' You've received a [[Bronze Condom|Bronze condom]]. Use it next time. [[Category:Achievements]]

You have been featured during a live special event. Sure you got your loyal followers and viewers, but this is on a whole new level. This is like getting to play the halftime show during the Super Bowl. We brought you to the stage, now dance for us, monkey. Dance!
Reward: You have received a Platinum [[Fan Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

Jaxbrin Amusements makes stuffed beanie babies that summon the creatures they represent. They currently sponsor [[Daniel Bautista]].
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Corporations]] [[Category:Crawler Sponsors]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

{{Stub}} A hunter killed by [[Carl]] after he set off one of his traps.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Hunters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{Character_info|age=~25|class=[[Knife Sharpener]]|species=Human|first_appearance=Chapter 9, Book 3|status=Deceased, killed by Donut in self-defense|level=21}}
An Asian man who tries to kill Donut in the [[Desperado Club]] for her bounty. A woman who is with him casts a spell to knock down Donut's bodyguards, and he knifes Donut. Her [[Cockroach]] skill activates and she slashes his neck, earning a player skull that greatly upsets her. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

[[File:01032.png|thumb|Jikininkis (AI Rendition)]]
== AI Description == '''Jikininki. Level 17.'''
Of all the types of ghouls one may find in the [[Fourth Floor|Iron Tangle Rail System]], the Jikininki is the most common, the most well-behaved, and the most insatiable. Their voracious appetite for flesh makes them the perfect janitors. They'll generally leave you alone as long as you're not bleeding, as long as you don't litter, and as long as you don't trespass into their personal space. It's rude. [[Category:Mobs]]

[[Carl]] completed the quest [[Show Must Go On|The Show Must Go On]].
==Description== Not only have you been given a quest, but you actually completed it without dying. We like it when you do what you're told. It means you're a good dungeon citizen and not a traitor to your people at all.
''Reward:'' In addition to the Gold [[Quest Box]] you've received for completing the quest, new quest locations will ''sometimes'' appear on your map. Notice how I italicized "sometimes"? The next one was even more interesting. [[Category:Achievements]]

Lucian is a judge for one of [[Donut|Donut's]] cat shows.
He's in his seventies and has blue hair. He is sexually attracted to cats and he gave Donut a "pelvic exam". He also sniffed her.
He was used for [[The Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance]], in that battle he had an anti-magic ability. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]] [[File:01033.png|thumb|Junkie's Box (AI Rendition)]]

{{SpoilH | 4}} {{Quote | quote = I needed what he had, but he insulted me, so I killed him.}}{{Character_info | first_appearance = Book 4, Chapter 32 | species = [[Skyfowl]] of the White Cliffs | status = Unknown }} '''Justice Light''' is a [[Skyfowl | Skyfowl of the White Cliffs]], former crawler, and author of the ''[[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]'' (8th Edition). They contributed to the cookbook's discussion of NPCs and warned future crawlers of "trap shops." Further biographical details and status are unknown. ==Cookbook Entries==
''I made a mistake today. I killed an NPC I shouldn’t have. We are a strong people, the skyfowl of the white cliffs. We do not take insults without retribution. He was a proprietor of a store selling trap supplies in a large settlement here on the sixth floor. I needed what he had, but he insulted me, so I killed him. It let me take the item that was on the shelf. But he had so much more. He always said the items were in the back, but there was nothing there. I think everything was in his inventory, but it appears shopkeepers don’t drop their full inventory if you kill them. Now the town guards are after me, and the shop, which was a good source of supplies for me and many others, is just gone, and I fear the whole operation is going to fail thanks to my actions. It was the only trap shop on the whole floor.''

''This is something we should note and remain aware of. Do not make the same mistake as me. Killing of these innocents should be kept to a minimum, unless absolutely necessary.''Dinniman, Matt. ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'' (p. 490). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. {{ref|4|32}}

==References== [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{Stub}}{{Citation}} == Description == This is a minion of Lusca.
Ah, the babies. Here’s the thing about Octo-Shark babies. The odds are stacked against them from the get-go. There’s just too many of them. Their mom is really strict and won’t let them leave her mouth. They don’t know who their daddies are, which makes them kinda sad, especially around Christmas. They need constant nourishment. So when food does arrive, they have to fight for their morsels. Only the strongest survive.
Eventually, even Lusca won’t be able to keep up with the demand. That’s right around the time the juveniles start to realize their brothers and sisters are also delicious. In each birthing of 2-3,000 pups, only one or two survive.
In other words, their odds of survival are better than yours!
[[Category:Mobs]]

{{Character_info |image1= 00799.jpg|Currently 00795.jpg|Natural | first_appearance = Book 2, Ch. 21 | highest_stat = Constitution | class = [[Monster Truck Driver]] | crawler_id = Katia Grim | crawler_# = 9,077,265 | age = mid-30s | hair = naturally black; varies, but purple | occupation = Art Professor | gear_hands = Ring of CON+15 | party = The [[Royal Court of Princess Donut]] | eyes = light | level = 53 | species = Human {{!}} [[Doppelgänger]] | patrons = [[Formidable | Princess Formidable]] [[The Squim Conglomerate]]
[[The Apothecary]] | allies = [[Carl]] [[Donut | Princess Donut]] [[Daniel Bautista]] [[Louis]] [[Florin]] | enemies = [[Eva Sigrid]] | status = Alive | injuries = Four fingers removed from right hand. | skills = [[Find Crawler]] Gear Head (Earth Hobby)
[[Pathfinder]]
[[Rooted in Place]]
[[Rush]] (Crowd Blast)
[[Second Fuel Tank]]
[[Steelie Skin]] | origin = Earth: Reykjavik, Iceland | spells = [[Hanzo]] | gear = | weapon = [[Enchanted Repeating Crossbow of the Scavenger Mother of Mothers | Crossbow of the Scavenger Mother]], [[Enchanted Shade Gnoll Riot Forces Telescoping Crowd Control Baton | Crowd Control Baton]]
[[Enchanted Shade Gnoll Riot Forces Crowd Control Shield | Crowd Control Shield]] | gear_head = [[Enchanted Crown of the Sepsis Whore | Crown of the Sepsis Whore]], | gear_torso = [[Enchanted Wrestling Belt of the Great Gorgo | Wrestling Belt of the Great Gorgo]] | guild = [[Safehome Yolanda]] | organizations = [[Desperado Club]] | gods = [[Eileithyia]] }}{{Quote | quote = Katia came strolling up in her regular, human form. She had what looked like an iced tea in her hand with a little umbrella. She sipped on it.

“What was the plan again?” she asked. “Oh yes, I remember. You were going to sneak in, figure out what they had hidden in there, and sneak out again undetected. Good job.” (Book 4, Chapter 7) }} Katia Grim joins [[Carl]] and [[Donut]]'s party on the [[Third Floor]]. ==Description== Katia was a university art professor in Reykjavik, Iceland, before the transformation.{{ref|3|21}} A single thirty-something, Katia is well-traveled and fluent in Icelandic, German, Russian, and English.{{ref|2|epi}} {{ref|3|12}} She enters the [[Dungeon]] with her friend and fellow professor, [[Eva Sigrid|Eva]]. The two join [[Hekla]] and [[Brynhild's Daughters]] and participate in a neighborhood boss and a borough boss battle before descending to the [[Third Floor]], where they are separated from the party for [[class]] selection. After her game guide, Bannon, persuades her to take the [[Monster Truck Driver]] class and [[Doppelgänger]] race, Katia transforms into a tank with a momentum-based constitution buff who can shape her mass (i.e. body and equipped gear) like clay into any form of equal mass... if she can just figure out how. By the time Hekla asks the Royal Court to add Katia to their party, Katia is ten levels behind and the [[System AI]] has only recently graduated her visible race from "What the f-word?" to "Human."{{ref|2|21}} With Carl and Donut's influence, Katia soon learns to use her skills to kill with style. {{Spoiler | book = 4, 5, 6 | spoiler =

When Carl and Donut are removed from the fifth floor, Katia assumes leadership of the ongoing bubble quest and succeeds. Enraged to learn that members of Brynhild's Daughters are returning to Eva and dying, she informally splits from the Royal Court on the [[Sixth Floor]] to team up with [[Louis]], [[Firas]], [[Daniel Bautista]], [[Florin]], and [[Gwendolyn Duet|Gwen's]] team. They follow a trail of Eva's victims across The Hunting Grounds and Katia finds the "gift" Eva left for her on one of the former daughter's corpses: [[Blitz Sticks | blitz sticks]].

Katia and Bautista had been in contact since meeting on the second floor and develop a romantic/sexual relationship on the sixth floor, even as Katia becomes addicted to drugs and the false memories they create. Katia's self-destructive habits worsen after she kills Eva, and Eva's last act is placing the [[Enchanted Crown of the Sepsis Whore]] upon Katia's head, ensuring that only Katia '''or''' Donut can leave the [[Ninth Floor]] by traditional means.

}} ==Appearance== [[File:00798x.jpg|thumb|Katia on floor 3 unable to pass for human (AI Gen)]] '''On Earth, While Sleeping, and On Shows.''' In her natural human form, Katia has short black hair, pale skin, and "light wide-set eyes that sat at an odd angle on her face." Although Carl describes her as "stunning," she hadn't liked her hair or her nose; they were the first traits she changed. '''The Third Floor.''' Katia struggled to master her race, sculpting her appearance using the reflection off of a [[Healing Potion|health potion]] bottle, and it shows. Her face generously looks "like a Juan Gris painting" (a twentieth century artist known for cubism), her hair follicles are too large, and even her blue track suit and snow boots look poorly sewn. '''The [[Fourth Floor]].''' With Donut's encouragement, Katia slowly transforms to become more "vibrant" and "interesting." Her new look is marked by a purple mohawk, a leather outfit, and black shoes.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 15). {{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler = '''The [[Eighth Floor]].''' Katia stops reshaping the four fingers that were severed from her right hand during the Iron Tangle. }} ==Personality== [[File:00799.jpg|thumb|Katia looking less grim on the 8th floor (AI Gen)]] Insecure, shy, and a little awkward, Katia is initially afraid of almost everything in the Dungeon and struggles to understand her class and race. Still, she is a fundamentally good person: when [[Fools Who Broke the Glass|The Fools Who Broke the Glass]] triggers shortly after she joins the Royal Court, spelling her near-certain death, she focuses on saving NPCs and encourages Donut and Carl to save themselves.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario,'' chapter 24. She has a quiet sense of humor and is clearly not a person who is used to or comfortable with being noticed. With Donut's "advice" and Carl's very special brand of support, Katia starts to come into her own. ==History== [[File:00795.jpg|thumb|Katia as a human (AI Gen)]] On Earth, Katia has previously visited at least Moscow and Tokyo. Although Katia claims that she and Eva were "friends but not great friends" who ate lunch together occasionally at the university, Eva knows a great deal about her including: Katia's ex, Fannar, left Katia for one of his students; that Katia was unable to adopt; and Katia's enough of Katia's secrets to taunt her.{{ref|3|23}}{{ref|5|epi}} {{Spoiler | book = 5 and 6 | spoiler = Katia had wanted to start a family but was unable to conceive and prevented from adopting. Before the Butchering, when she smokes [[Blitz Sticks]], she thinks of Annie: the nine month old girl she had wanted to adopt. She remembers Annie standing in her crib, and she remembers picking the baby up in her arms. For an unspecified but probably terrible reason, this memory is paired with two quotes: * ''I do that sometimes. I hurt those around me.'' Dinniman, Matt. ''The Butcher's Masquerade'' (p. 717; epilogue). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. * ''Why do you do this,'' Fannar used to say. ''You’re dumb. Dumber than you look. Do you really think I’d start a family with you? You’re a joke. Do you really think you could be a mother? Do you really think I’d let you do more damage to this world?'' }} == Progression: Stats, Skills, & Gear== === Book 2=== {| class="fandom-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed plainrowheaders" |+Book 2 Levels & Stats ! scope="col" |Chapter ! scope="col" |Note ! scope="col" |Level ! scope="col" |STR ! scope="col" |INT ! scope="col" |CON ! scope="col" | DEX ! scope="col" |CHR |- ! scope="row" | 21 |Starting Stats (includes Ring of CON+15) |'''9''' |'''11''' |'''8''' |'''51''' |'''30''' |'''8''' |- | colspan="8" |'''Bold''' numbers are explicitly stated in the text. Mana points may be used as a reference for intelligence. |} ====Book 2 Skills==== *[[Gear Head]] (engine proficiency), from [[Earth Hobby Potion]]. *[[Pathfinder]], Level 3.{{ref|3|1}} *[[Rush]] *[[Second Fuel Tank]] === Book 3=== {| class="fandom-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed plainrowheaders" |+Book 3 Levels & Stats ! scope="col" |Chapter ! scope="col" |Note ! scope="col" |Level ! scope="col" |STR ! scope="col" |INT ! scope="col" | CON ! scope="col" |DEX ! scope="col" |CHR |- ! scope="row" | 1 | Starting Stats with Momentum Bonus (CON x 2) a | |11 |8 |51 / '''102a''' |30 |8 |- ! scope="row" |2 (p.39) |[[Good Rest]] Bonus: All Stats +10% b | |11 / 12b |8 / 9b |51 / 56b / 112a |30 / 33b |8 / 9b |- ! scope="row" |2 (p.39) |Good Rest Bonus + Automatic Shower (All Stats +10%) Totalc | |11 / 13c |8 / 9c |51 / 61c / 122a |30 / 36c |8 / 9c |- ! scope="row" |6 (p.95) |stated |''22'' | | | | | |- ! scope="row" |6 (p.100) |stated |''23'' | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | (p.149) |Armor: +8 STR, +4 DEX** | |19 / 22** |8 / 9** |51 / 61 / 122** |34 / 40** |8 / 9** |- ! scope="row" | (p.172) |stated |''24'' | | | | | |- ! sope="row" | (p.193) | Stat allocation, unknown points into CHR* | |'''49/58*''' |8/9* |51/61/122* |34/40* |8/9* +? |- ! scope="row" | (p.196) |STR bonus due to mass increase, DEX down (not specified) | |49/58* +? |8/9* |51/61/122* |34/40* -? |8/9* +? |- ! scope="row" | (p.342) |stated |''37'' | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | (p.354) |Enchanted Repeating Crossbow of the Scavenger Mother of Mothers (+15 DEX, +10 STR when wielded) | |49/59/70** +? |8/9** |51/61/122** |49/58** -? |8/9** +? |- ! scope="row" | (p.366) |Enchanted Wrestling Belt of the Great Gorgo (+5% STR, +5% CON) | |51/61** +? |8/9** |53/64/128** | 34/40** -? |8/9** +? |- ! scope="row" | (p.430) |Enchanted Shade Gnoll Riot Forces Crowd Control Shield: +5% CON | |51/61** +? |8/9** |56/67/134** |34/40** -? |8/9** +? |- | colspan="8" |'''Bold''' numbers are explicitly stated in the text. Mana points may be used as a reference for intelligence. |} ===Book 5=== {| class="fandom-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed plainrowheaders" |+Book 4 Levels & Stats ! scope="col" |Chapter ! scope="col" |Note ! scope="col" |Level ! scope="col" |STR ! scope="col" |INT ! scope="col" |CON ! scope="col" | DEX ! scope="col" |CHR |- ! scope="row" | | |'''52''' | | | | | |- | colspan="8" |'''Bold''' numbers are explicitly stated in the text. Mana points may be used as a reference for intelligence. |} ===Other Gear=== '''THIS SECTION MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS.''' * As a reward for completing the [[Squeeze out the Juice Box]] quest she got a sed on her level. *10 bolts of petrify rock creature. * An adjustable backpack similar to the one Carl made but with a higher capacity. It’s indestructible and enhances the wearers stability whilst worn. It also has retractable stilts that makes loading it easier. *After the sixth floor she received an item that lets her move really fast. ==References & Notes== [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

A small knitted beanie that increases all stats by 3%. It also includes a spell named “[[I need my Personal Space]]” that violently knocks everyone back, works on everyone including fellow party members.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Clothing]]

[[Carl]] took control of the Nightmare Express with instruction from [[Fire Brandy]].
==Description== You're driving a train! Holy shit!
''Reward:'' I'm pretty sure the act of driving a train is a badass-enough award. [[Category:Achievements]]
An orange, lizard newscaster outside the Dungeon. He was the announcer for Carl and Katia's fight against the [[Lusca|Octo-Shark]]. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

== Description == '''New Quest. Kill Hellik.'''
My twin brother [[Hellik]], god of Sun and Life seeks to kill both me and my older brother [[Taranis]] God of Thunder and regent to the Celestial Throne. He is a fool. He is a danger. He has no right to exist. As an adherent, it is your task to kill him. You will receive a bonus if his death is painful.
'''''Time Limit:''''' Hellik must die ''before'' you reach the 18th floor. If he still lives, you will receive a smite.
'''''Reward''''': Slaying Hellik will result in a [[God Box|Celestial God Box]].
'''Warning: Killing a god may have some unintended consequences for all crawlers.''' [[Category:Quests]]

{{Quote | quote = Rickard, the guy who’d written the most recent version of the book, didn’t add too much content, but he did mention that he’d entered the dungeon with his pregnant wife, but the moment he went through the gate, she’d disappeared, and he never saw her again. -- <small>(Book 4, Chapter 25)</small> }}
A relatively new addition to ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]'', the kinder facility is a structure on the planet's surface that is staffed by [[Youth Assistant|youth assistants]]. Pregnant women and crawlers below a certain age (determined each season based on the species and intelligence level) who descend the stairs after the transformation and attempt to enter the dungeon are instead transported to the kinder facility, where they will remain until the crawl ends. <ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Butcher's Masquerade'' (chapter 37).</ref>
This season, the facility is managed by [[Borant Corporation|Borant]] and located in the former city of Mumbai, India.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (chapter 19).</ref> The facility is guarded by security forces and mercenary guilds.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (epilogue).</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Dungeon Backstage]]

King Croissant is a fuzzy black kitten with a teeny tiny headset microphone. He was meant as a replacement for [[Donut]]. He is level 60.
He was used as a [[T’Ghee totem|T'Ghee]] card by [[The Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance]].
He appears to have bard abilites including an escape song.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:T'Ghee Card]]

{{SpoilR}} {{Character_info|species=[[Mongoliensis]]|first_appearance=Chapter 11, Book 5|level=60}} Kiwi is a female Velociraptor first lives in the [[Sixth Floor|Hunting Grounds]].
She and [[Mongo]] slept together it's later implied she became pregnant.
She is the mother of [[Big Tina]].
She was actually an [[Ursine]] but was transformed into a dinosaur after [[Scolopendra|Scolopendra's]] attack, she managed to returned to her original form during the [[Sixth Floor | Butcher's Masquerade]] thanks to the [[I Take It All Back Potion|I Take It All Back]] potion.
==Abilities== [[Deer in the Headlights]] skill.
==AI Description== '''Kiwi. Mongoliensis Pack Leader- Level 60.'''
They say an asteroid is what wiped out the dinosaurs on this planet.
I don't think that's true. If Kiwi and her pack of voracious, slightly-insane velociraptors are even remotely like what you had roaming around way back in the late Cretaceous period, I'm pretty sure what happened is that these ladies simply killed everyone and everything.
This is Kiwi. The head bitch in charge of the jungle's fastest, most vicious, most clever predators: the Mongoliensis. Take a gang of women convicts from a 1970's prison movie. Combine them with a coalition of cheetahs and a shoal of hungry piranhas, and you have a vague notion of just how screwed you are.
This particular pack if comprised of only females. In fact, it appears all the dinosaurs in the area are female. That's pretty odd. Almost interesting.
And here's an even more interesting, seemingly random, but probably important fact. Dinosaur-class monsters didn't exist in the area before [[Scolopendra|Scolopendra's]] nine-tier attack. Yet here they are. Where did they come from? If you weren't about to die screaming, it would be something you might want to look into.
Warning: This is a lizard-class mob. It will inflict 20% more damage against you thanks to your [[Extinction Sigil Tattoo (Wall Monitor Race)|Extinction Sigil]].
And yes, I know dinosaurs aren't really lizards if we're being super technical. Get over it.
[[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Floor 6]]

== Description == An assassination class.

revision.comment: Created page with "Kobold are a movs that are similar to a chihuahua but walk on their rear hind legs. They wear chainmail armour made from beer can tabs and are armed with spears with feathers on the end. They use danger dingos as mounts. [[Category:Mobs]]"
revision.text: Kobold are a movs that are similar to a chihuahua but walk on their rear hind legs. They wear chainmail armour made from beer can tabs and are armed with spears with feathers on the end. They use danger dingos as mounts. [[Category:Mobs]]

The Krakaren are a hive mind that runs the [[The Apothecary|Apothecary]] and is financing [[The Plenty]].
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]] [[Category:Races]]

[[File:DCC-AIT-S01E06-Cover.jpg|thumb|Official art of Krakaren Clone from the cover of the Soundbooth Theatre Immersion Tunnel: Season 1, Episode 6: Not a Pyramid!]] == AI Description == '''Krakaren Clone. Level 10 Neighborhood Boss!'''
First off, this isn’t the Krakaren. This is a Krakaren. For every one that is killed, [[Krakaren Prime]] births two more.
Part of a collective mind intent upon destroying any semblance of scientific progress in the universe, the Krakaren is the only communal brain entity in the galaxy who actually gets stupider as time moves on. Consisting of multiple, shrieking tentacles, members of the Krakaren cooperative spend their days birthing their disease-laden minions, creating and selling harmful products, attempting to debate scientific experts, and proselytizing to the weak-minded, all in an attempt to… Well, nobody knows what the hell their end goal is.
Even [[Eris]], Goddess of Chaos, doesn’t want anything to do with these crazy assholes. [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Neighborhood Boss]] [[Category:Mobs]]

[[File:00135.jpg|thumb|Mudskipper... I mean Kua-Tin]] The Kua-Tin are the dominant species of the [[Borant system|Borant System]] and principal owners of the [[Borant Corporation]]. They are an aquatic species and must be in a rebreather when interacting outside their home planet. The Kua-Tin system government is controlled by an ultra-nationalist political party called [[the Bloom]] (also called the Party). Disparagingly called "mudskippers".
== Description == The Kua-Tin are 2 feet tall aquatic creatures. Kua-Tin have a humanoid fish body. The first Kua-Tin that Carl and Donut meet is [[Zev]].
== Notable Kua-Tin ==
* [[Zev]] * [[Loita]] * [[Cascadia]]
[[Category:Races]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A spotted, gecko-like creature. [[Category:Races]]"
revision.text: A spotted, gecko-like creature. [[Category:Races]]

{{Stub}} {{SpoilH | 5}}
{{Character_info|age=45|class=[[Archer]]|origin=originally Ukraine, but immigrated to Helsinki, Finland|occupation=Automobile salesman|first_appearance=Chapter 3, Book 4|status=Deceased|party=[[Archers]]|level=24}}Langley is a member of the Archers, a team of crawlers that all have the [[archer]] class.
Died on the [[Sixth Floor|Hunting Grounds]] after being killed by [[Vrah]] along with the rest of his team.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

Laundry Day is a utility spell that strips armor off the target. Obtained by [[Donut]] on [[Sixth Floor|Floor 6]] through her membership to the [[Dungeon Book of the Floor Club]].
==Description== '''Cost''': unknown
'''Target''': Someone wearing armor, line of sight
'''Duration''': unknown
Removes a random piece of armor from the target and causes it to fall on the floor. The effectiveness of the spell scales with level. Initially it can only target minor pieces of armor, but at level 5 it can target breastplates or the equivalent. At level 10, it can strip an opponent bare. At level 15, it can target multiple opponents.
Crawler Tin, of the 21st edition of the Cookbook, also theorizes that since the gods and goddesses are technically Soul Armor, any spell that targets biological armor, like Laundry Day, should in theory be able to remove a sponsor from the deity they are piloting as long as their invulnerability is first neutralized.
[[Category:Spells]] [[Category:Donut]]

Carl is hit by [[Tsarina Signet]]'s unknown spell.
==Description== You have been hit with - and survived - an offensive spell that was higher that level 15. The fact you are not a quivering stain of meat on the dungeon floor right now is a testament to your sheet luck. It's either that or you're banging the producer.
''Reward:'' You've received a Platinum [[Lucky Bastard Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

{{stub}} Notable members: [[Ifechi]]
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Dungeon Organizations]] [[Category:Parties]]

[[File:00115.jpg|thumb|Legatus]]
== Description == Not specified, but traditionally, an officer in the Roman army.
== Crawlers with This Class == [[Bogdon Ro]] [[Category:Class]]

A god who is part of the Orisha pantheon, along with [[Ogun]], [[Oshun]], [[Shango]], [[Asojano]], [[Inle]], and [[Yemaya]].
== Discription == A man wearing a fedora with a rooster on his shoulders.
== Shrine == If his shrine is repaired it will give everyone a 50% chance to avoid all future smites. All will learn the spell [[Confusing Fog]]. [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]]

[[File:00271.jpg|thumb|Legendary Diva]] A bard Class. Requires the users to cast spells via singing, when cast this way spells require no mana.
== Features == Comes with a decent constitution buff and several enchantment spells.
== Spells ==
* Standing Ovation - increases the parties dexterity and make their regular spells more powerful * Entourage - creates multiple illusionary versions of each party member * Encore - a heal party spell that removes multiple debuffs * A psionic attack * A ice attack
[[Category:Class]]

== AI Description == '''Type''': Summoning Spell.
'''Cost''': 25 mana
'''Duration''': (spell level*2 + intelligence level) seconds.
'''Cooldown''': One minute. May only have one active instance of this spell at a time.
'''Target''': May only be cast on unattended armor or weapons. Total targets allowed varies based on multiple factors.
'''Effect''': There are a lot of angry souls out there. Like, a lot. It’s said if one has the ability to actually see all the wailing souls that filter through the edges of our world, one would go quite insane.
Quite, quite insane, actually. All that death, spiraling down, down, down into the drain. Where do they go? Why are they always screaming?
Uh, anyway. This spell reanimates physical weapons or armor pieces for a period of time with an undead, wailing spirit plucked straight from the river of falling souls. These will be temporary minions of the caster. Strength of the summoned symbiotes varies, depending on multiple factors.
'''Warning''': In most cases, armor and weapons utilized with this spell will disintegrate upon the completion of this spell. Certain cursed and enchanted items may react in an unpredictable manner upon the completion of the spell. [[Category:Spells]]

A democratic government consisting of multiple races. They vote on everything but to stop something they've voted on requires an 80% majority. Their leader is a fuzzy catapiler.
Their forces were badly damaged when the high elf castle landed in their battlefield, their commander is currently trapped in the [[Desperado Club|desperado club]]. They filed litigation claiming it was an attack but [[Quasar]] successfully argued that the castle placement was an [[System AI|AI]] decision.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]] [[Category:Governments]] [[Category:Factions]]

revision.comment: Created page with "{{Character_info|class=Negotiator|species=[[Dirigible Gnome]]|occupation=Commissar of the Wasteland|first_appearance=Chapter 11, Book 4|level=44}} == AI Description == Leon. Level 44 Dirigible Gnome Negotiator. Commissar of the ''Wasteland''. A master politician and stickler for rules, Leon might have been a tax attorney in another life. Now he lives as the chief political officer aboard the dreadnaught ''Wasteland''. I'd say he has a stick up his ass, but he's always..."
revision.text:
{{Character_info|class=Negotiator|species=[[Dirigible Gnome]]|occupation=Commissar of the Wasteland|first_appearance=Chapter 11, Book 4|level=44}}
== AI Description == Leon. Level 44 Dirigible Gnome Negotiator. Commissar of the ''Wasteland''.
A master politician and stickler for rules, Leon might have been a tax attorney in another life. Now he lives as the chief political officer aboard the dreadnaught ''Wasteland''.
I'd say he has a stick up his ass, but he's always clenched so tight, there's no way a stick would fit up there. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

[[Carl]] summoned the god [[Grull]] into the dungeon.
== Description == You have successfully summoned a god into the dungeon. That's a great way to get more friends. Everybody loves it when someone brings immortal death machines to the party.
''Reward'': It might've been a bad idea, but it's sure going to be entertaining. [[Category:Achievements]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Level-Up, Baby!}}
Achievement received for leveling up for the first time. [[Carl]], like most crawlers, received this achievement on the [[First Floor|first floor]]; however, [[Elle McGib]] and most other residents of [[Meadow Lark]] would not have received this achievement until the [[Third Floor|third floor]].<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (p. 51; chapter 5). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. </ref> <ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 22).</ref>
Crawlers gain three (3) stat points each time they level up, but they cannot distribute these stat points until they choose a race and class on the [[Third Floor|third floor]].<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 4).</ref> Abilities, items, and buffs (such as [[Enhanced Growth]]) may affect the number and distribution of stat points a crawler receives each level.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 7).</ref> See the [[HUD / Crawler Menu]] page for more information about stats.
==AI Description== '''New achievement! Level-Up, Baby!'''
'''You’ve received enough experience to gain a level.'''
'''''Reward:'' Leveling up is your job. You don’t get rewards for doing your job.'''<ref name=":0" />
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

[[File:00058.jpg|thumb|Leveled up Frank]] Leveled up Frank is a a [[T’Ghee totem|T'ghee]] card that was owned by [[The Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance]] but never played.
It is a copy of [[Frank Q|Frank]] but at level 90.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:T'Ghee Card]]

== AI Description == '''New Quest. Levi is On the Menu!'''
This is a pass or fail quest. Failure has consequences.
Do not allow [[Levi the 7th]] to be devoured by the Fleshers. This quest is active as long as you remain on the train.
'''''Reward''''': You will receive a [[Quest Box|Silver Quest Box]].
'''''Failure''''': Every crawler on the train will be turned into a Flesher. [[Category:Quests]]

== AI Description == '''Levi the Seventh - Troll Flesher and Hobgoblin Skellie Symbiote. Level 7.'''
This is actually two creatures. Only when combined do they have intelligence and the ability to speak. The Skellie is your typical, run-of-the-mill reanimated skeleton. In this case, it's the skeleton of a hobgoblin, one of the few monsters who are much more palatable in skeleton form.
Of all the War Mage spells soldiers encounter during the brutal, mass combat that will occur on the ninth floor, the ''You're Not Done Yet'' spell is one of the most terrifying. Fallen soldiers - in this example a Basher Troll - are cast with the spell, and their flesh is ripped from the body. This loose skin becomes a sentient minion called a Flesher. Fleshers are oftentimes tossed across the battlefield, landing in and around the trenches of the enemy. Fleshers have one goal. To find a new set of bones.
Once they have found a victim, the skin unfurls and pounces, covering the body, smothering and melting it. Once dead, the rest of the victim burns away, and the Flesher casts the only spell it knows. ''Boned'', which animates the remaining skeleton.
The creature that eventually forms is no longer a minion to the original mage. Not is it undead. It is new to the world, oftentimes confused and afraid. And weak. The Symbiote is very easy to kill. After a few hours have passed and the new Symbiote is complete, the combined creature becomes a target for other Fleshers, who are said to be drawn to their former companion's new bones. If a Flesher kills a Symbiote, this second iteration is more intelligent and powerful than the last.
There are rumors about oft-resleeved Symbiotes. After enough repetitions, it's whispered they can become quite powerful.
Here's a neat bit of trivia. This is Levi the 7th. This [[Levi is On the Menu!|quest]] has triggered six times now since the floor has opened.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

{{Character_info | name = Lexis | race = Syndicate Human | image1 = 00900.jpg | occupation = Associate Producer | first_appearance = Book 1, Chapter 27 | species = Human | height = ~ 5'5" (165.1cm) | hair = blonde | organizations = [[Titan Conglomerate]] | allies = [[Odette]] | status = Alive }}{{Quote | quote = I'd call him brave, but he's crying like a little girl. <small>-- Lexis<ref name=":1">{{ref|4|epilogue}}</ref></small>}} '''Lexis''' is [[Odette]]'s assistant and an associate producer of ''[[Dungeon Crawler After Hours with Odette]].''<ref name=":0">{{ref|1|27}}</ref>
==Description== Lexis is extremely matter-of-fact and efficient in the studio and in combat. She is the first Syndicate Human that [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] meet, and she explains the tunnelling and recording process clearly and concisely.
She smokes the same vape pens as Quasar; the smoke refracts light and smells like burnt candy.<ref name=":2">{{ref|5|20}}</ref>
==Appearance == Lexis is approximately 5' 5" (165.1cm) and willowy; as a Syndicate Human, she is only about 3/4 as wide as an Earth Human. Appearing to be in her late 20s, she has Asian features and long blonde hair held back in a tight bun. When her clothing is described, she's wearing a simple black dress.<ref name=":0" />
Her voice is "light and musical. Almost cartoonish."<ref name=":0" />
==Story== {{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler = Armed with a flechette gun and a skintight black bodysuit with a translation module, Lexis locates [[Beatrice]] on Earth when Bea's bounty is the highest on the [[Walk-On List]]. In the process, Lexis kills [[Gennrik]], captures [[Sadir]], and -- efficient as ever -- suggests wiping out the entire settlement of [[New Queen Anne]] before Odette proposes a more humane option.<ref name=":1"/> }}
{{Spoiler | book = 5 | spoiler = During the hand-off between [[Valtay]] and [[Borant Corporation]] on the [[Sixth Floor]], Lexis - at Odette's behest - warns Carl and Donut about the upcoming Butcher's Masquerade and country boss [[Imogen | Queen Imogen]]. She encourages them to go down the stairs early. Donut reveals to both Carl and Lexis that she had helped smuggle Valtay agents to [[Zev]] shortly before Donut and Carl are teleported back to the [[Dungeon]].<ref name=":2"/> }}
{{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler = The first time Carl sees Lexis after Donut's big reveal, Lexis and Zev are whispering to each other.<ref>{{ref|6|35}}</ref> Lexis sits beside Carl while Odette explains her motivations for participating in the [[Twelfth Floor]] Ascendency Games, and her only reaction is a sharp breath when Odette states that she expects to die.<ref>{{ref|6|37}}</ref> }}
==Speculation== *Odette calls Lexis "Plexis" exactly one time during the series.<ref>{{ref|1|29}}</ref> Is it a typo, or is it Lexis's full name?
==References== <references />
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Syndicate Citizens]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Street Monk]]|species=Human|origin=China|occupation=Warehouse worker|first_appearance=Chapter 42|status=Alive|allies=* [[Li Na]] * [[Zhang]]}}
Li Jun is a crawler of Asian descent. He is the brother of Crawler [[Li Na]]. He is also partied with Crawler [[Zhang]]. His first appearance is in Book 1 on the Death Watch Show with the [[Maestro]]. Li Jun and his party are in a fight with multiple mobs when they become frozen and Li Jun and [[Zhang]] are transported to the Death Watch show. They end up escaping along with Li Na once they are teleported back.
In Book 2 he is seen on the top 10 board by Carl. In Book 3, Li Jun and his party are trapped at Station 101 and [[Hekla]] recruits Carl and Donut to go save them. In Book 4, Li Jun and his party clear their bubble on their own. In Book 5 Li Jun was afflicted bt Vampirism but cured when [[Miriam Dom|Mariam Dom]] was killed, later he and his party attend the [[Butcher's Masquerade]] and participate in the fight against [[Imogen|Queen Imogen]] and advanced to the seventh floor.
His eye was stabbed out and eaten by [[The Bedlam Bride|Shi Maria]] at the end of the eigth floor.
== Abilities == His class gives him immunity from acid attacks.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

{{Character_info | image1 = 00823.jpg |class=[[Slave Driver]] |species=Human {{!}} [[Changbi Demon]] |origin=China |first_appearance=Chapter 42 |status=Alive |allies=* [[Li Jun]] * [[Zhang]]}} Crawler Li Na is of Asian descent and is the sister of [[Li Jun]] and also partied with [[Zhang]], she is one of the most dangerous crawlers in the dungeon. She is a demon race whose mere touch can curse someone and inflict excruciating pain, even on other party members. She fights with chains. She has a trait that allows her to see if anyone is affiliated with a god. Li Na is a practical, no-nonsense woman and is a lethal fighter. She also attended the [[Butcher's Masquerade]] and participated in the fight against [[Imogen|Queen Imogen]], proceeding to the 7th/8th floor with her brother Li Jun.
==Gear== She has at least four chains she uses whilst fighting, one uses fire, one creates wind blades and another keeps mobes immobilized.
On the sixth floor she received an item that improved her chain throwing ability.
==Skills== Her class gives her immunity to acid attacks.
She's able to turn into smoke.
She has a skill that lets her prevent injuries from healing.
She has a racial trait that lets her see if someone worships a god. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

[[File:00821.jpg|thumb|Light on your feet]]
==Description== This skill influences the ability to pounce higher and farther.
==Donut's Light on Your Feet Skill== [[Donut]] entered the dungeon with levels in this skill. It is what she uses to jump around. Her [[Talisman of the Slate Butterfly]] increases this skill by 4 when she wears it.
[[Category:Skills]] [[Category:Donut]]

revision.comment: DrSubterfuge moved page [[Lika Love Doll Head]] to [[Samantha]]: We don't have a page for Samantha, but we have one for the description of the vessel. I figure we can make an article just for the love doll head if the Samantha one ever gets too big.
revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Samantha]]

page.title: Like a Moth to the Flame

revision.text:
[[File:00147.jpg|thumb|Like a Moth to the Flame]]
== AI Description == You attacked and caused damage to a mob that is more than 75 levels above your own. The fact that you're reading this suggests you're the luckiest fucker in the dungeon. Just remember, luck goes both ways, like your mom.
'''Reward:''' You've received a Platinum [[Lucky Bastard Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

A potion that protects against insanity, blindness and a host of other debuffs. It lasts until you sleep.
[[Mordecai]] brewed this for [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] to protect them from [[The Bedlam Bride|Shi Maria]].
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Potion]]

[[Carl]] caused a train derailment on the fourth floor.
==Description== While it's not exactly a feat of engineering worth of a Queen Elizabeth Prize, you finally managed to manufacture a train derailment. Let's hope this doesn't set off some sort of unforeseen domino effect that will ripple through out the rest of the floor, leading to mass confusion and death amongst you and your fellow crawlers.
''Reward:'' You've received a Gold [[Engineering Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

{{SpoilR}}{{Character_info|species=[[Kua-Tin]]|occupation=Borant Corporation Administrator|first_appearance=Chapter 34, Book 3|party=Bloom|status=Deceased, killed in explosion when [[Robot Donut]]'s battery compartment cover falls off in Book 4}}
Manager for [[Brynhild's Daughters]]. After the team disbands, she is put in charge of [[The Royal Court of Princess Donut]] while [[Zev]] is taking time off to deal with a personal tragedy.
She is a member of [[the Bloom]], the ruling Borant ultra nationalist party, she appears to share their racist views.
She was killed by Carl after robot donut exploded. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Syndicate Citizens]] [[Category:Dungeon Admins]] [[Category:Aliens]]

The seventh and final achievement [[Carl]] receives upon entering the [[Dungeon]]. Presumably, all Crawlers who entered the [[First Floor|first floor]] alone received this achievement, including [[Miriam Dom]] and [[Lucia Mar]].
== AI Description == '''You entered the dungeon without any human companions. Didn't anyone teach you there is safety in numbers?'''
'''''Reward:''''' '''None! Haha. You are so dead.<ref>''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 2</ref>'''
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

page.title: Long Haul Biological Waste Management Solutions

revision.text:
{{SpoilH | 6}} {{Quote | quote = MY NEW SPONSOR IS NAMED LONG HAUL BIOLOGICAL WASTE MANAGEMENT SOLUTIONS, AND I JUST CAN'T WITH THAT.
-- [[Donut | Princess Donut]] (Book 6, Chapter 29) }} == Book 6 == Long Haul Biological Waste Management Solutions is a front company for the [[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)|Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network]]. In [[The Eye of the Bedlam Bride (Book)|book 6]] they sponsor [[Donut]] and send her a Celestial [[Benefactor Box]].{{ref|6|72}} The sponsorship starts shortly before all members of [[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)|The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network]] disapear.{{ref|6|49}} During the Epilogue it is revealed that former [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|cookbook]] authors, [[Tipid]] and [[Rosetta]], are aboard a converted garbage freighter belonging to the company. This freighter, "Homecoming Queen", is used to smuggle 50,000 former crawlers into [[Ninth Floor|factions wars]] to aid [[Carl]] and [[Donut|Donut's]] [[Princess Posse (faction)|Princess Posse faction]].{{ref|6|Epilogue}}
"I always knew I would die in the dungeon. Even after I got out, I always knew." -- [[Tipid]] (Book 6, Epilogue)
[[Porthus|Porthus aka Doctor Hu]], 2nd author of the [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|cookbook]], is known to have recruited [[Tipid]] and [[Rosetta]] to [[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)|The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network]] and therefore Long Haul Biological Waste Management Solutions. [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Corporations]] [[Category:Crawler Sponsors]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

[[File:00041.jpg|thumb|Loot!]] [[Carl]] donned on his [[Enchanted Trollskin Shirt of Pummeling]] and [[Enchanted Nightgaunt Cloak of Stoutness]].
==Description== You're wearing something you found in the dungeon.
''Reward:'' You're now a handsome son of a bitch. That's reward enough. [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Item|title=Loot Boxes|type=Dungeon Mechanic|effects=+ semi-random [[:Category:Loot | loot]]|source=Achievements Fans
Sponsors|buy=Not Eligible|sell=Not Eligible}} '''Loot Boxes''' are generally distributed to crawlers by the [[System AI]] as rewards for earning [[Achievements]]. The [[:Category:Loot Boxes|type of loot box]] a crawler receives is tailored to the achievement, and the semi-randomly generated loot is influenced by the box's type. Special boxes may be ordered by the crawler's [[Fan Box|fans]] or [[Sponsorship Box|patrons]]. ==Tiers== There are six tiers of Loot Boxes. A lower tier loot box will contain common or unenchanted items, whereas higher tier boxes contain more powerful and rare loot. The tiers are (in order of lowest to highest):{{ref|1|4}} #Bronze #Silver #Gold #Platinum #Legendary #Celestial The host company pays taxes to the Syndicate on the tier of every non-sponsored box distributed in game. As a result, only 2,145 Celestial Boxes of any kind have been awarded in the history of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]].'' No crawler has ever received more than four Celestial Boxes, and no more than (18) have been distributed during a single season.{{ref|2|epi}} [[Sponsorship Box|Benefactor/Sponsorship Boxes]] are purchased at great expense by a crawler's patrons/sponsors, with the cost increasing with the box's tier. They often contain stronger equipment and items, and may include items from the sponsor's homeworld or other items or equipment that do not match the dungeon's match. In general, a Bronze Benefactor box is better than a Gold Adventurer Box. ==Loot== Loot is "semi-random" in that it may be random or it may be specifically chosen to help or hurt the crawler for the sake of ratings.{{ref|1|29}} The crawler may also receive loot can be used by their race but not by their class; so a barbarian may end up with a necromancer's staff.{{ref|1|7}} All loot gained from Loot Boxes (with the exception of [[Sponsorship Box|Benefactor Boxes]]) will fit the [[Dungeon]]'s setting, so no one in [[Borant Corporation|Borant]]'s fantasy-themed dungeon will find "a pulse rifle or automated power armor" when opening one. Loot Boxes may contain unstable or damaged loot, but will never contain outright cursed loot; still, some items may be dangerous or harmful for the crawler.{{ref|1|5}} As [[Mordecai]] emphasizes, "Always read the descriptions before you activate or wear something. Always, always. No exceptions."Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (p. 52). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. ==Opening Loot Boxes== After completing the [[Tutorial]] in a [[Tutorial Guild Hall|Tutorial Guild]], crawlers can access unopened Loot Boxes through the "Awards and Boxes" tab of their Inventory [[HUD / Crawler Menu|Crawler Menu]].{{ref|1|2}} Unopened boxes cannot be sold or transferred. Loot Boxes can only be opened in Safe Rooms and most be opened all at once; the crawler cannot pick and choose boxes, or stop before all boxes are opened. The boxes float out of the crawler's inventory and line up in front of the crawler by tier, from Bronze to Celestial, before opening one by one: the top pops open, the box disappears in a puff of smoke, and the items appear on the ground and then are automatically deposited into the Crawler's inventory. ==References== [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Loot Boxes| {{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]] {{Navbox Items}}
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

{{Character_info|age=27|class=[[Pest Exterminator]] -> [[Extermination Professional]]|species=Human|first_appearance=Chapter 1, Book 4|allies=[[Firas]]|skills=* [[Cloud of Exhaust]] * [[Tent the House]]|title1=Louis Santiago 2|origin=Miami|level=35}}
== Appearance == He is overweight and going bald.
== History == He got an achievement for driving a convertible van into the dungeon, as a reward he got access to the [[Cloud of Exhaust]] spell which is now level 11, it has a 10 minuet cool down and disables any enemies in it’s radius.
After arriving on the fifth floor he and [[Firas]] spent the time getting very drunk until [[Mordecai]] gave him his rapid detox potion.
He repeatedly joked about how hot he thought [[Epitome Noflex]] was and asked [[Juice Box]] to turn into her so he could pretend to be have sex with her as a result the Dream faction in the [[Sixth Floor|Hunting Grounds]] planned to shoot him with an [[Arrow of Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea]] as revenge.
Got engaged to [[Juice Box]] near the end of the [[The Gate of the Feral Gods (Book)|fifth book]].
He broke down after having to fight a copy of his mother on the eigth floor. Near the end of the level he got five player killer skull.
== Skills == As an Exterminator Professional he has a 0.5% chance to insta kill any mobs his level or lower. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

Love Vampire is a damage transfer ability that [[Donut]] earned for getting her unmodified Charisma to level 100.
After upgrading it to level 6 it started casting automatically.
==Description== '''Cost''': Free
'''Target''': Enemy of lower level
'''Duration''': Until the enemy dies
'''Cooldown''': "a couple of hours"
Causes an affected enemy to take damage instead of the person using the ability. [[Category:Skills]] [[Category:Donut]]

{{Character_info|crawler_#=4,778,551|class=[[D-Bag Geek]]|species=Human|first_appearance=Chapter 6, Book 4|allies=* [[Tyler Storm]] * [[Mike Barnes]] * [[Morris]] * [[Bobby]]|level=25|status=Deceased, killed by [[Quetzalcoatlus]]}}
One of the crawlers in the Subterranean Quadrant of Bubble #543.
== History == Killed [[Wynne]] believing doing so would give him access to a map and allow him to complete his quest.
At some point he became possessed. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

{{Character_info | image1 = [[File:00888.jpg]] | allies = [[Cici]] [[Gustavo III | Gustavo 3]] | status = Alive | age = 13 | highest_stat = Intelligence / Strength | skills = ability to hide presence on map. | spells = [[Rubber]] [[Loop-de-Loop]] | crawler_id = Lucia Mar | class = [[Black Inquisitor General]] | species = [[Human]] {{!}} [[Lajabless]] | origin = Earth: Ecuador | first_appearance = Book 1, Chapter 14 | weapon = unspecified mace | patrons = The [[Apothecary]] }}{{Quote | quote = “No,” Lucia Mar said. “This show is a waste of time. Every moment spent not gaining experience is a waste of time.” Her voice came out raspy with her thick, Spanish accent. “I will find this Donut in the dungeon, where her death will be forever. Cici and Gus will tear this puta apart. And then I will rip Carl to pieces and take all of his shiny toys.”

“She seems nice,” I said. (Book 2, Chapter 21) }} '''Lucia Mar''' is a young teenage girl from South America, and one of the Top Ten Crawlers on this season of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]''. == Description == Lucia Mar enters the dungeon in Ecuador with her two rottweilers, [[Cici]] and [[Gustavo 3]]. The youngest crawler is a fan favorite, but dangerous and volatile both inside and outside of the [[Dungeon]]; her personality always rapidly switching from friendly to murderous. She specializes in traps, strong magic, and melee damage. On the [[Third Floor]], Lucia takes the [[Lajabless]] race and the cleric/magic-user/warrior combo [[Black Inquisitor General]] class. She now splits her day between two forms: a beautiful adult woman with half of her base strength, twice her magical ability, and the ability to cast spells for half the mana cost; and a skull-faced monster that must pay twice base cost to cast spells, but also has twice her base strength.{{ref|2|7}} As a result, all magic cast in her skeleton form comes from items.{{ref|5|37}} ==Appearance== When Lucia enters the dungeon, she looks like an approximately 13 year-old street kid wearing an oversized yellow soccer jersey with a thick blue stripe. A mere sixty hours later, she has a full set of glowing silver armor; she wears her jersey over the armor like a tabard. Beginning on the [[Third Floor|third floor]], she spends half the day as a beautiful adult woman and the other half as "a skull-faced monstrosity." In both forms, she now walks with a pronounced limp (which lessens over time), as her right leg has transformed into a hairy goat leg with a cloven hoof. The transformation between the forms is instantaneous. Beginning on the fourth floor, she may or may not be wearing a necklace fashioned from monster tongues. * As a beautiful woman, she has sparkling raven hair. * In her "lady Skeletor" form, her skull eye sockets teem with bugs.{{ref|2|21}} === Gallery === File:00888.jpg|Early Lucia Mar |link=File:00468.jpg File:8-cHmNMA52py65c7o.png|Lucia Mar|link=File:8-cHmNMA52py65c7o.png == Story: A Deep Dive == Lucia Mar enters the dungeon in Ecuador with her two rottweilers, [[Cici]] and [[Gustavo 3]].{{ref|5|71}} She features heavily in the second episode of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]'' sixty hours later, which shows the young teenager already kitted out with a full set of enchanted armor and a mace. Cici has equipped a chainmail sweater, and Gustavo 3 can shoot lightning when it barks.{{ref|1|14}} {{ref|4|4}} She and her dogs continue to steal the spotlight in recap episodes as they tear and smash their way through the first floor, showcasing an unspecified dexterity bonus that allows her to run on walls and do flips.{{ref|1|30}} Lucia soon proves that her aggression is not limited to dungeon mobs. After her post-first floor interview on ''[[Dungeon Crawler After Hours with Odette]]'', during which one of her dogs mauled Odette's producer, [[Odette]] calls her a "psychopath" who "cannot work a crowd."{{ref|1|29}} Thirty hours later, just over a day after the second floor opens, Lucia has accumulated four player killer skulls.{{ref|1|39}} At some point during the first and second floors, she kills her first [[Game Guide|game guide]].{{ref|4|19}} Arriving on the [[Third Floor]] and at the top of the [[Leaderboard]], Lucia takes the [[Lajabless]] race and the cleric/magic-user/warrior combo [[Black Inquisitor General]] class. Her new race causes her to limp as she walks with one human and one goat leg, and she now splits her day between two forms: a beautiful adult woman with half of her base strength, twice her magical ability, and the ability to cast spells for half the mana cost; and a skull-faced monster that must pay twice base cost to cast spells, but also has twice her base strength.{{ref|2|7}} As a result, all magic cast in her skeleton form comes from items.{{ref|5|37}} She promptly displays her new abilities in the [[Desperado Club]], where she freezes everyone with a powerful spell, smashes an Elite's head with her mace, and steals a few bottles of tequila while her dogs (which had already killed two attendants and another pet in the playroom) attack the dancers.{{ref|2|15}} Later, she appears on ''[[Knuckle Cracking]]'', where she expresses that any moment not spent gaining experience is a waste of time.{{ref|2|21}} {{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler =

Still topping the leaderboard on the [[Fourth Floor]], Lucia Mar becomes more brutal in her skull-faced form; crafting necklaces from tongues and smashing a mantaur against a train repeatedly until it dies.{{ref|3|8}} At some point in the middle of the floor, Cici transforms to become twice its size.{{ref|3|29}} When Lucia and her dogs move to the stairwell for the final time, she has "a mess of boss kills and player-killer skulls over her head" and talks nonsense to phantoms (see "Speculation" below for specifics). The recap episode shows her square off against [[Florin]], [[Ifechi]], and an unnamed crawler in the stairwell as Gustavo 3 blocks the way down; she casts [[Rubber]] three times, and all three of Florin's bullets strike and kill Ifechi instead of Lucia or her dogs.

In the [[Fifth Floor]] Bubbles, Lucia is shown working with a group of crawlers (including Bini, Abraham, and Siti) against a multi-limbed ice mummy.{{ref|4|17}} [[Carl]] learns that Lucia has confessed in writing to killing two dungeon administrators in separate incidents, and the next recap episode shows Gustavo 3 "accidentally" killing the crawlers she was working with and the young girl break down sobbing. {{ref|4|20}} In the video, she slams her hand against her temple in a steady rhythm: ''slap, slap, slap.''

}}{{Spoiler | book = 5 | spoiler =

On the [[Sixth Floor]] Hunting Grounds, [[The Dark Hive]] specifically target Lucia Mar, Carl, and [[Donut]], and the [[Nebular Sin Patrol]] takes a few ill-fated jabs at Lucia.{{ref|5|15}} {{ref|5|34}} Lucia seizes control of a village she names [[Alucarda]] by ripping its mayor in half. Gustavo 3 immediately targets a [[dryad]], which leads to Lucia and co. slaying all dryads in [[Diwata]]'s temple before challenging Donut.{{ref|5|35}} The battle is intense and laden with traps (see "Progression" below). Eventually, alone with Donut in a tavern and separated from both dogs, Lucia attempts to order milk for herself and the cat; she tells Donut that her [[Youth Assistant]], [[Alexandro]], is mad that she doesn't want to kill Donut. As soon as Cici enters the pub, Lucia changes modes; ultimately, Donut must kill Cici (with style) to escape, and Lucia responds by wailing, "She killed the wrong one."

At the Masquerade, with Gustavo 3 on a different level of the castle, Lucia behaves like the child she is; back to the wall, gnawing on her fingernails, huddling and hugging herself. Although Florin had resolved to kill her, he is the first to recognize that something is ''very weird''.{{ref|5|67}} The crawlers see Florin cradling a sobbing Lucia, who asks for her mom (in the wrong accent) before flipping like a switch to her violent, abrasive, tequila-loving persona. Florin insists that he was speaking to a ten year-old Dutch girl named Jill, that there are multiple kids in Lucia's head, and that Gustavo 3 is remotely controlling her. When Carl asks [[Zev]], Zev replies, "It's complicated, Carl." Lucia escapes the final battle on the sixth floor using her teleport trap.

}}{{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler =

Florin stays in contact with Lucia and follows her to Ecuador on the [[Eighth Floor]]. Florin notes that she no longer attacks him on sight, but she and her dog are keeping a wary distance from him.{{ref|6|22}} It is not clear where Lucia goes for the second phase, but she somehow lands in Beijing, China for the finale phase of the floor; the result is one-sided slaughter at the Soho building now called the [[Battle of Beijing]].{{ref|6|55}}{{ref|6|63}} Lucia refused to play the T'Ghee Game; instead, she kept the six low-level totems automatically assigned to her during phase two, discarded one at the start of battle, then played the rest of her hand. With all of her cards in play, she had access to her spells and inventory, and she and Gustavo 3 could race into battle. She uses this technique to kill at least half of the squads that do not have keys before killing [[Fang]] and his wife to seize their key.{{ref|6|57}}

[[Li Jun]] and his team find her waiting for them in the stairwell. She amiably says that Florin had asked her to help them and gives them five [[Doggy Door | Doggy Doors]]; then, unfriendly again, states that she is "saving something special for herself" to use against [[Donut]] and [[Mongo]] on the [[Ninth Floor]].

}} ==Progression, Gear, and Skills== ===First Floor=== Lucia's levels and stats are not specified on the First Floor. She is known to receive: * A significant Dexterity bonus; * A full set of enchanted armor; * A mace. ===Second Floor=== Lucia's levels and stats are not specified. She has four player killer skulls and an enchanted personal shield.{{ref|1|44}} ===Third Floor=== Lucia is the #1 Crawler on the Leaderboard. She is the first crawler to reach Level 25, and ends the floor at Level 29.{{ref|2|epilogue}} Lucia still uses her mace, and now has an unidentified spell that can freeze every occupant inside the [[Desperado Club]] freeze the entire Desperado Club. ===Fourth Floor=== {{Spoiler | book = 3 | spoiler = Lucia enters the floor at Level 29 and reaches Level 30 by the end of the first recap episode, which shows her laughing maniacally as she rips the heads off ghouls in her increasingly strong skull-faced form.{{ref|3|3}} She is level 35 when [[Hekla]] is killed.{{ref|3|25}} By the time Lucia and her dogs reach the stairwell, she has "a mess of boss kills and player-killer skulls over her head." She also gains: * A self-crafted necklace of monster tongues that her dogs try to steal; it's ''probably'' not magical, but it's definitely a fashion statement.
* The spell [[Rubber]], which [[Mordecai]] believes comes from an item she has equipped. She has also overcome the spell's extended cooldown. }} ===Fifth Floor === {{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler = Lucia is Level 38 at still at the top of the pack when the Leaderboard populates on the fifth floor. After the final recap episode of the fifth floor, Lucia Mar is Level 48 and number two on the leaderboard.{{ref|4|34}}}} ===Sixth Floor === {{Spoiler | book = 5 | spoiler = Lucia is level 48 when the leaderboard first populates.{{ref|5|8}} Lucia shows that despite her mismatched legs, she continues to have incredible dexterity. Her spells and tactics include: * Lucia diligently sets an escape trap spell in multiple locations when she enters an area. In safe rooms and at safe room doors, she sets this trap so that it teleports everyone away, allowing her to attack them; however, she can only cast the spell while in her "Pretty Lady" form.{{ref|5|35}}
* Lucia always finds stairwells early and sets teleport traps there.{{ref|5|77}}
* Lucia has more than a dozen ways to teleport her and her dogs out of dangerous situations.
* She is able to cast a protection spell over villages (or - specifically - villages that she controls) that prevents all dots from appearing on crawlers' minimaps.
* [[Loop-de-Loop spell]]. A practiced move includes swapping places with her target. Her target trips an escape trap or spell, and Lucia lands in classic superhero-pose in the target's previous position (typically the entrance to a safe area) while her target lands between Lucia's two snarling dogs.
* Mordecai believes she has a once-per-floor spell that teleports her to the opposite side of the map.{{ref|5|39}}}} ===Seventh & Eighth Floors=== {{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler = The first time the Leaderboard populates, Lucia is ranked number four (below Prepotente, Donut, and Carl).{{ref|6|8}} By the time Lucia Mar leaves the Eighth Floor, she has the ability to conceal her presence.{{ref|6|63}}}} ==Trivia== * Teleport traps and alcohol are the only purchases she makes.{{ref|6|57}} ==Speculation== *Lucia's soccer jersey '''''may''''' be the away uniform for the legendary Argentine football (soccer) team, [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boca_Juniors Boca Juniors]. The away uniform is currently yellow with two blue stripes.
*Lucia names a town "Alucarda," which may be a reference to [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alucarda#:~:text=Alucarda%20(Spanish%3A%20Alucarda%2C%20la,Susana%20Kamini%2C%20and%20David%20Silva. the horror movie] inspired by [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carmilla ''Carmilla'']. {{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler = * At the fourth floor stairwell, Lucia clicks her teeth. She is agitated and angry, so it may be a tick; however, given the sequence of events, it may be a command for her dogs to attack. This said, she is shown shouting commands to the dogs at other points in the series.
* After the recap episode featuring the fourth floor stairwell incident, Mordecai notes that [[Rubber]] exposes a significant vulnerability; because the showrunners revealed it, he suspects that Borant must want her dead. Not too many chapters later, the liaison reveals that Lucia has killed two dungeon admins in one-off attacks. Zev notes later that Lucia no longer does interviews or events because she is too "unpredictable."{{ref|5|32}} Lucia is clearly tipping the scales toward being more trouble than the income she generates warrants.}} ===Interesting Quotes to Fuel Interesting Theories:=== {{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler = From the encounter with Florin and Ifechi: *''He gave a terrified glance at Lucia and scrambled toward the stairwell. Gustavo—the regular-sized rottweiler—moved to block his access. Lightning sparkled in the dog’s mouth as he growled. “What did you say?” Lucia snarled at the fleeing boy. “What did you say about my papa?” Gustavo took a menacing step toward him.''
*''“Don’t take shit from anyone. It’s just a game. It’s not real,” Lucia said. She was talking to someone over her shoulder. Someone who wasn’t there.''}} {{Spoiler | book = 5 | spoiler = From the Hunting Grounds: * ''Donut: LUCIA AND HER DOG ARE IN THE SAFE ROOM. SHE’S SCREAMING AND SCREECHING, AND THE LAST TIME WE LOOKED, SHE WAS PUNCHING HERSELF IN THE FACE. SHE’S TRASHED THE PLACE WORSE THAN THE TIME MISS BEATRICE WRECKED THE KITCHEN WHEN YOU TOLD HER SHE SHOULD STOP TRYING TO SELL THOSE AWFUL LEGGINGS. CARL, LUCIA IS CRAZY. I KNOW WE SAID THAT BEFORE, BUT SHE’S CRAZIER THAN YOU THINK. SHE’S WAITING FOR ME TO COME OUT. SHE’S FIGURED OUT A WAY TO CHEAT THE SAFETY MEASURES. SHE HAS TRAPS THAT KICK PEOPLE OUT OF THE ROOM. I WENT OUT THERE WHEN I THOUGHT SHE WAS GONE, AND I HIT A TRAP. IT TELEPORTED ME INTO THE MIDDLE OF TOWN. AND THEN WHEN I TRIED TO GET BACK TO THE SAFEROOM, I HIT ANOTHER. THEN SHE CAME OUT OF THE WOODS AND CHASED ME INSIDE..."''
* '''THIS ENTIRE SCENE:''' ''She slammed her fist on the counter, and the wood cracked. “Milk. Hurry.” She turned toward Donut. “Cats like milk, right?”''
* ''“Soon, you will be tossed through the veil, and you will feast with the other losers. And I will have enough points to get across the bridge and back home with my papa.”''
* ''“Yes. Yes. They all must die. You’re right. No more mercy. No more friends. They all must die.”''
* ''It was almost like Lucia was experiencing a completely different reality than the rest of us.''
* ''Florin: I don’t understand it all. There are multiple people in there. Real people, mostly kids. The girl I was talking to is named Jill. She’s ten years old, and she’s Dutch. I thought she was trying to pull something, but she’s telling the truth. She knew the prime minister of the Netherlands. That is no street kid from Ecuador running an op.''
* ''Florin: I don’t know, mate. Something to do with the dog and a guy named Alexandro. But there are kids in there. In her head. Multiple kids. We have to get that dog. Not her. The dog. It can still control her from afar, but only in short bursts. Once we get it, it’s gone.''}} ==References== [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]] [[Category:Characters]]
