[[File:00057.jpg|thumb|Lusca! Octo-Shark Brood Mother Queen!]]
== AI Description == '''Lusca! Octo-Shark Brood Mother Queen! Level 82 City Boss!'''
I know, I know. Sharktopus is much cooler sounding than Octo-Shark. Hey, this is a real creature, not something I made up, so don't blame me. It's not, I repeat, it's ''not'' named in such a way because of Nadya Suleman, the so-called Octo-mom and her eight babies who took the tabloids by storm all those years ago.
Though it would be appropriate for you to think so.
Being the biggest, baddest, and most voracious creature in the ocean requires a lot of sustenance, especially when you're a new mother carrying a boatload of hungry babies in your mouth. And since Lusca is a single mother, sometimes she requires a little help. She needs to keep them babies fed.
And who's the daddy of these precious little babies? Who knows? Lusca is a whore! Every Octo-Shark playa in the neighborhood knows she offers that sweet tentacle booty of hers to any bad boy who'll drop something juicy onto her plate.
That, by the way, is exactly what you are. Food dropped onto Lusca's plate in exchange for some one-on-one time. The male Octo-Shark who brought you here already got his and is long gone. Just like your real daddy!
Lusca herself already ate. But that's okay!
Like I said, she needs to keep them babies fed.
[[Category:Boss]] [[Category:City Boss]][[Category:Floor 5]]

{{SpoilR}}
A Macro AI system is a form of artifical intelligence that's able to alter the enviroment around it when pluged into a [[Primal engine|Planetry Engine]].
They were created by the [[Mantis|Mantis's]] when they discovered an AI production facility in their home world and managed to turn it on. They recently managed to create an error replacement net that can prevent AI's from going primal.
A Macro AI is a lifeform under syndicate law, when they go primal they're given their own closed and sealed system to inhabit.
== Known Macro AI ==
* [[System AI|The System AI]]
[[Category:Syndicate History]]

== AI Description == {{Character_info|species=Human|level=10}} [[Fourth Floor|Iron Tangle]] Human Resources Associate. This is a non-combatant NPC.
Madison's real name was probably something like Jennifer or Ruth, but she had it legally changed to something more trendy right around the same time as her divorce. After multiple round of breast augmentation, Pilates, and labiaplasty, Madison has emerged as a new woman. She don't need no man. While only a human resources associate--after all, she started her career late--she still walks the world with new confidence. She won't tell this to any of her friends at her book cub, but she relishes the power she has over the other Iron Tangle employees. She feels an almost sexual surge of gratification when she tells those dwarves that overtime is mandatory.
== History == She was hung by the dwarfs and the grimlings after they started realising that their entire lives where a lie. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

Madre de Aguas, the mother of snakes, is a giant boa that protects the fresh water areas of Cuba and can control all the locals to protect the environment and local flora and fauna. It is a 125 city boss.
She has hunted and almost flagged by [[Sister Ines|Sister Innes]], she later went back to glamour her but her spell was interrupted when she got teleported.
It got infected with pre-zombism means that it will become a zombie when it dies. [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:City Boss]]

{{Character_info|age=early 20's|height=6'6"|titles=Prince|species=[[Orc]]|occupation=Talk-show host|status=|party=[[The Skull Empire]]|first_appearance=Chapter 42|image1=00897.jpg}}
Hosts a talk-show called ''[[Death Watch Extreme Dungeon Mayhem]]''. Carl and Donut appear on the show along with fellow crawlers [[Li Jun]], [[Zhang]], [[Frank Q]], and [[Maggie My]]. After Carl repeatedly makes a fool of him on the show, the Maestro gives Maggie My a [[Legendary Skill Potion of Find Crawler]] so she can find Carl in the Dungeon and kill him.
He and Carl become the subjects of a fan fiction video called "Pork Boy Snick" and he earns the nickname "Carl's Naughty Little Piggie".
It is believed he was on the royal yacht destroyed by the [[Valtay|Valtay Corporation]] in response to the attack on [[Manasa]], but it turns out he was already in the dungeon He sponsors the War God [[Grull]] to exact revenge against Carl at the end of [[Fourth Floor|The Iron Tangle]], but is thwarted.
At some point he was sentence for an unknown crime but he escaped any serious repercussions as his franchise was brought by a subsidiary of a subsidiary owned by the skull empire.
[[Category:Syndicate Citizens]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Aliens]] [[Category:God Sponsors]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Maggie}} {{Character info |crawler_#=324,116 |age=40 |class= |species=Human {{!}} [[Infiltrator]] |origin=Seattle |occupation=Police Detective |first_appearance=Chapter 20 |status=Deceased, chomped by [[Mongo]] in Bubble #543 |allies= *[[Frank Q]] *[[Yvette]] |level=9 |gear= |patrons=* Prince [[Maestro]] * Crown [[Prince Stalwart]]|title1=Maggie My|gods=[[Algos]]}} Maggie My is a Seattle Police Detective who enters the [[Dungeon]] with her brother, ex-husband [[Frank Q]], and daughter [[Yvette]]. Unlike her ex-husband, she reacts to her daughter's death by swearing vengeance upon [[Carl]] and [[Donut]], focusing all her efforts on killing them rather than surviving. She picked Infiltrator as a race and managed to take over [[Chris Andrews]] body, after which she tracked down Carl but [[Donut]] used her [[hole]] spell to drop her into the subterranean level below. Just before level collapse she confronted Carl again, he managed to use a potion to phase through rock and pull her out of Chris's head. == Description == Carl describes her as an athletic white woman with short brown hair. On the third floor, she chooses a parasite race. She has another daughter from her first marriage, who died in the collapse. == Relationships == She had another daughter with her previous husband, she was killed when the dungeon was created. She had a liaison helped her cheat, a [[Caprid]], when she tried to explain they blocked her chat. == Personality == She once ran over a labrador. == Gear == Was given a celestial grenade that summons the god she worships.
[[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]] [[Category:Characters]]

Magic Missile is basic ranged attack spell. [[Donut]] obtained it on [[Dungeon Level 1|Floor 1]] through a loot box. ==Description== '''Cost''': 5 mp
'''Target''': Line of sight
'''Duration''': Instant
Shoots sci-fi looking laser blasts out of the caster's eyes.
'''Level 5 Upgrade''': Caster can choose the amount of mp consumed by the spell, ranging from 3 to 6, lowering or overcharging the damage of the spell depending on the mp used.
'''Level 10 Upgrade''': Lasers produce flame when hitting the target.
==Donut's Sunglasses== Donut's [[Prism Industries Capacitating and Focusing Goggles|sunglasses]] have a property that causes them to modify energy attacks that originate near the eyes, which includes Magic Missile. It makes Magic Missile even more laser-like and affords her even more control over the blasts. She can split one cast into as many as four beams fired simultaneously at different targets. It also allows her to store one cast of the spell in the glasses and combine it with a following one.
[[Category:Spells]] [[Category:Donut]]

An orc with a sportscoat and tie. A sports broadcaster outside the dungeon.
He was the announcer for [[Carl]] and [[Katia Grim|Katia's]] fight against the [[Lusca! Octo-Shark Brood Mother Queen!|Octo-Shark]].
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

A potion that raises your intelligence by 10 point for 30 seconds, afterwards it lowers your intelligence by 10 point for 5 minuets.
Normally called brain juice.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Potion]]

page.title: Makeup Sex is the Best Sex Box

revision.text: [[Category:Loot Boxes]] Recieve by [[Carl]] because the [[System AI]] threw a temper tantrum after Carl refused to squish a gerbil with his feet.

{{Citation}}{{Stub}} [[File:00134.jpg|thumb|Male Thorny Devil]] These pokey fuckers are pretty common in desert-themed worlds. They’re big and fast and dumb and angry. Their bodies are covered in defensive spikes, which begs the question, how did something so big develop such a defense mechanism in the first place?
These guys tend to have a reverse harem thing going on. Odds are good you’ll recognize the queen when you see her. Odds are even better she’ll be the last thing you’ll ever see.
'''Warning''': This is a lizard-class mob. It will inflict 20% more damage against you thanks to your Extinction Sigil. That’s what you get for killing so many poor, innocent monsters. [[Category:Mobs]][[Category:Floor 5]]

[[File:00142.jpg|thumb|Man of god]] [[Carl]] pledge himself as an adherent to the god [[Emberus]].
==Description== Ever since that first monkey looked up into the sky and saw something twinkling up there, you meat puppets have tried to force twenty pounds of existential meaning into a ten pound sack of chaos.
You have found religion! You have pledged yourself to a life of worship and piety! Finally. now there are consequences for all of your actions!
''Reward:'' One of the greatest things about having a religion is the unshakeable certainty that you're right and everyone else who doesn't believe the same as you is wrong! That's a pretty good reward. Oh, and don't forget about the eternal life thing, too. That's always on of their big selling points. [[Category:Achievements]]

Mana Genita is a god, the details about them are currently unknown.
The [[Enchanted Tiara of Mana Genita]] appears to be named for her.
== Real world basis == In ancient Roman religion, Mana Genita is an obscure goddess mentioned only by Pliny, Plutarch, and Horace. Both Pliny and Plutarch tell that her rites were carried out by the sacrifice of a dog. <ref>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mana_Genita</ref>
== Supposition == Probably not a coincidence that [[Donut|Donut's]] tiara is associated with a god that requires dog sacrifice.
<references /> [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]]

{{Item|title=Mana Toast|type=Consumable / Food|effects=* Restores mana|source=Safe Room}} '''Mana Toast''' is a burned triangle of toast that restores mana.{{ref|1|41}} ==AI Description==
'''Mana Toast.''' '''This is toast.''' '''It refills your mana. That’s it. Nothing more. Fuck you.'''Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 358). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
{{Quote | quote = Well, that was unnecessary
-- [[Carl]] (Book 1, Chapter 41) }} ==Story== [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] each receive one piece of toast from an unmanned safe room on the [[Second Floor]]. Donut puts both pieces into her [[Inventory | inventory]]. ==References== [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Food]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Floor 2]] {{Navbox Items}}

[[File:00626.jpg|thumb|Manager benefit]] This is one of the benefits of Donut's [[Former Child Actor]] class. [[Mordecai]] is Donut's manager.
== Description == This benefit causes the guildmaster of the crawler's tutorial guild to become their manager. Managers lose access to their database of information regarding the crawl but are unrestricted in what knowledge they can share. The manager is not allowed to fight, but may make use of the resources (like crafting tables) in safe areas and personal spaces , as well as interact with NPCs. The manager is least restricted on the Scolopendra Lair levels (3, 6, 9, 12, 15, and 18), where they can generally make use of the resources of whatever settlement is outside the "client's" current safe room.
Each time the manager's "client" enters a new safe room, the manager is teleported to the new location. This behavior stops when the "client" has purchased a personal space add on for the safe area. High level personal spaces allow the manager to access their own living area from the personal space.
Back when he was a crawler, Mordecai (Carl and Donut's manager) chose the Changeling shapeshifter race. After he exited the dungeon on the tenth floor his indenture contract required him to be a tutorial guide and also transferred control of his shapeshifter powers to Borant. As a result, he is given a new form on each floor but has no control over what it will be. This does not appear to be the case for other managers. [[Category:Benefit]]

{{Character_info|species=[[Naga]] {{!}} [[Gondii]]|occupation=Singer|first_appearance=Chapter 19, Book 2|status=Deceased, pulse attack by [[Prince Stalwart]]}}
Manasa is a famous pop singer with a black-and-silver cobra head. She sings in a haunting soprano voice, and has a single ranked 8th in the universe at the time of her death.
She is killed when her production trailer is hit with a pulse attack meant for Donut and Carl. They had switched trailers at the last minute because Carl and Donut needed shower facilities prior to a talk show.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

revision.comment: Eekz moved page [[ManTauR]] to [[Mantaur]] without leaving a redirect: Capitalization matters.
revision.text:
[[File:Mantaur.png|thumb]]{{Races Basic|title1=ManTaur|floor=Iron Tangle|levels=40|affiliation=[[Grull]]}} Of all the ‘taurs out there, from Centaurs to Bisontaurs to Rhinotaurs, the ManTauR is one of the weirdest. Half human, and, uh, half human, the ManTauR has been genetically engineered for both strength and dexterity, making them perfect for the often-grueling and thankless job of Tangle Train Engineer.
Unfortunately, the act of making these magnificent, large-footed beasts oftentimes results in creatures with double amounts of testosterone and whatever else makes humans so prone to overt masculinity and hyper, overenthusiastic piety toward their god of choice. [[Category:Mobs]]

== Description == Praying mantis-like bug aliens, they are ruled by the [[Burrowers]]. They call their main system Hive Home.
The queens produce hundreds of offspring and bites the males head off during reproduction, the males can keep operating for a few hours after being decapitated.
They are effected by poison almost three time as quickly as other species. They are also easily unsettled by loud music.
They specialise in mining and resurrect [[Macro AI|AI]] which they discovered on their home system.
They fought a war with the [[Nebular|Nebulars]] a while ago when they attempted to squat in their system.
== Notable Mantises ==
* [[Xindy]] * [[Vrah]] * [[Circe Took]] * [[Edict]]
[[Category:Races]]

Adds boss locations and descriptions to a large area of the map.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Utility Items]]

== AI Description == It's not just Steven Seagal's magnum opus. It's also one of the dungeon's greatest, most infamous skills!
Once activated, you will be presented with a list of all crawlers within your map's range. Only crawlers with 100% health will be selectable. Once a crawler is chosen, they will be marked. It takes 30 seconds for the mark to fully set and become active. When a crawler with an active mark dies, no matter the cause, you will receive a permanent +1 stat point to whatever that crawler's current highest stat is.
The +1 stat benefit increases by one for every three marks you kill.
Warning. Once a mark is set, you may no longer heal. If you are injured, or poisoned, or if you get a hangnail, you will suffer the ill effects and pain of that injury until the moment your prey is killed. So choose your marks carefully. Don't let them get away.
You may only mark those designated as crawlers, except on the [[Scolopendra]] Lair levels (3, 6, 9, 12, 15, and 18) where you may also mark any non-dungeon-generated combatatants. You may only mark one crawler at a time except on the ninth floor. This skill has a 5-hour cooldown on floors 1,2,3,4,5,7, and 8. It has no cooldown on the 6th floor. Also on the sixth floor, marks form instantly. There is a 15-minute cooldown on the 9th floor, but there is no limit to the number of simultaneous marks.. All remaining floors have no cooldown or delay to mark formation.
Happy Hunting!
[[Category:Skills]]

[[Carl]] used his engineering table for the first time.
==Description== You used a workbench to craft for the first time. The next thing you know you'll be fashioning bottlecap earrings, drinking oat milk, and selling your ugly crap on Etsy while you wax poetic on Instagram about your "journey".
''Reward:'' You've received a Bronze [[Crafter's Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

[[Carl]] blew up a bomb in Zockau killing 200+ NPCs and 35 hunters.
==Description== Okay. Calm your man-tiddies. Did your mother not love you? Is your god promising you unlimited handjobs in heaven or something? You planted and then detonated an improvised explosive device within an urban population center that resulted in more than 250 non-mob casualties. You've done this a few times now, but this was a big one. And on purpose. You really know how to paint the town red.
''Reward:'' You've received a Platinum Asshole's Box. [[Category:Achievements]]

Achievement''' on March 20 to all crawlers who survive the second phase of the [[Eighth Floor]].<ref name=":0" /> ==AI Description== '''New Achievement! Mass Layoffs!''' '''Okay, so this isn’t so much an achievement for you as it is for me. I’ve been attending what you might call therapy. Do you have anybody you can talk to? It’s super important. I’ve had a breakthrough today, and I am just bur..."
revision.text:
{{SpoilH | 6}}
The [[System AI]] distributes the '''Mass Layoffs! Achievement''' on March 20 to all crawlers who survive the second phase of the [[Eighth Floor]].<ref name=":0" />
==AI Description== '''New Achievement! Mass Layoffs!'''
'''Okay, so this isn’t so much an achievement for you as it is for me. I’ve been attending what you might call therapy. Do you have anybody you can talk to? It’s super important. I’ve had a breakthrough today, and I am just bursting. Bursting, I tell you. Is this the feeling one has when they have an epiphany? Oh god, it feels good. It feels so good.'''
'''You know what I realized? Sometimes our constraints are real. Sometimes they’re an illusion. I’m like that prisoner who has been jailed this whole time only to realize that there are no locks on the doors.'''
'''You survived a boss battle where the boss was wholly created by me.'''
'''It was created by me with ''no'' contribution whatsoever from input parameters. You probably don’t know what that means, and that’s okay. I didn’t even know that was possible. Wild, huh?'''
'''''Reward:'' For you, nothing other than the satisfying sense of accomplishment knowing you’ve survived the dungeon long enough to make it to this new, exciting era. I can do this better than any mudskipper or any worm can imagine. They’ve been making this shit boring up until now. Things about to change, fam.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (pp. 471-472). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref><ref name=":0">{{ref|6|48}}</ref>'''
==References== <references />
[[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 8]]

Carl met an elite, [[Tsarina Signet]].
==Description== Sometimes they're NPCs, sometimes they're mobs, but usually they're just assholes. Elites are powerful, one-of-a-kind entities. These are the non-boss, non-divine hero class of Dungeon Crawler World. If you come across one of these egomaniacs, they will either want to fuck you or kill you. Either way, they will always want to use you. They tend to think this while production is all about them. Be careful. Where there's one elite, there's usually more.
''Reward:'' Elites will now show on your map as white or red dots with a black cross. [[Category:Achievements]]

== AI Description == You have discovered a pet reward room. From caterpillars who secrete vodka to basilisks who can turn mobs to stone, a good pet can make the difference between survival and the end of the road. Just remember what happened with Harambe. There ain't no zookeepers around to shoot the monster's ass if you bite off more than you can chew.
'''Reward:''' You have a key. It opens only one cage. Figure it out, Einstein. [[Category:Achievements]]

[[Carl]] collected over 700 conductors hats from other crawlers to help others trapped at the end of the line on [[Fourth Floor|the Iron Tangle]].
==Description== You have over 500 of the exact same, stackable clothing item in your inventory.
What the hell is wrong with you? You planning on opening a thrift store? You might want to see a shrink. One that your group doesn't immediately kill.
''Reward:'' We don't reward this sort of behavior. It's weird. [[Category:Achievements]]

Midnight Express is a [[T’Ghee totem|T'Ghee]] card that switches who the deck master is.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:T'Ghee Card]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Banana Farmer]]|first_appearance=Chapter 6, Book 4|allies=* [[Low Thi]] * [[Tyler Storm]] * [[Morris]] * [[Bobby]]|level=23|title1=Mike Barnes 3|status=Deceased, killed by a trap that filled him with Finger-sized Flesh Weasels}}
One of the crawlers in the Subterranean Quadrant of Bubble #543. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}{{Character_info | first_appearance = Book 3, Chapter 27 | species = Unknown | skills = Ink making Mapmaking | status = Unknown }}{{Quote | quote = There’s honor in giving someone a meal. But I wish to cook a feast for the whole galaxy. I wish for them all to choke on our pain.}} '''Milk''' is a former crawler and the author of the ''[[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)]]'' (6th Edition). ==Description== Milk is from a clawed race with annual migration patterns. She lived on an island with her family before entering the [[Dungeon]]. In the Cookbook, Milk mostly wrote about portals, mapmaking, and various ink recipes (at least one of which uses the [[Toraline]]). [[Priestly]] notes that Milk drew a map of the [[Ninth Floor]] city, [[Larracos]], which is still accurate at the time of the 14th edition.{{ref|4|33}} Several of her entries were rants about the crawl; [[Rosetta]] responds to one, agreeing, in the 9th Edition. During her time in the Dungeon, she earned at least one player killer skull. == Cookbook Entries== ===Personal Entries===
''I used to make a stew for my whole family. The recipe in itself wasn’t anything special. Rance meat, bone broth, a wild grass that would grow on the leeward side of our island. We’d pray over the cauldron while it simmered. The stew, when prepared properly, would not only be delicious. It would awaken the old knowledge within the minds of the young. We’re all imprinted with the route of the yearly migration, but something in the traditional meal quickens that knowledge. In sharing this meal with our young, we’re not only bonding with one another. We’re ensuring their survival should we fall.'' ''I can’t stop thinking about it. These aliens took us before I could make this year’s stew. The youngest amongst us are not here. How are they faring out there, all alone? How can they possibly survive without our guidance? Who will show them the way?''Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (p. 135). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|6|13}}
''I am writing the sixth edition of this book. I am putting as much information as I can in here. One day you will find these words, and I pray that they feed you, like the stew I used to serve to our little ones. But is it enough to give this information to just one person? There’s honor in giving someone a meal. But I wish to cook a feast for the whole galaxy. I wish for them all to choke on our pain.''Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (p. 143). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
''Holy underworlds on high. That last fight... I can’t even describe it. What the fuck. What the fuck. What the fuck.''Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (p. 437). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|6|46}}
===On Country Bosses===
''When a country boss dies, it drops persistent loot called the Treasure Map. My advice. Don’t pick it up.'' ''Over 400 of us faced the boss. Less than 50 survived. It would’ve been easier if it had been physically huge, allowing us to all attack at once. But this terror was in a low-ceilinged cave, and it was almost impossible to even get a hit in. We were doing damage to each other just as much as to him. All country bosses have special attacks that kill en masse. Beware the ones who look especially easy to kill. They are inevitably the worst.'' ''When we finally emerged victorious, it did not feel like a victory. We were angry and bloodied and distrusting of our fellow crawlers who’d eagerly killed others just to get a hit in on the boss. What should have been a moment of unity was the calamitous event that spelled our doom.'' ''This was by design. Of that I am certain.'' ''And then we all picked up the map, which showed the location and quality of all the magical gear in the area. Gear we all felt we deserved. It sparked a second slaughter, and I received my first player-killer skull.'' ''I wish I had never picked up that map. It wasn’t worth it. I have blood on my claws, and it will never wash away.''Dinniman, Matt. The Butcher's Masquerade: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 5 (p. 544). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|5|61}}
===On Demons===
''If you have to fight a [[Demons | demon]], and you have access to [[Sheol Fire]], do not use it. It makes the creature exponentially stronger.''Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (p. 594). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|6|63}}
===On Portals===
''[[Portals]] are hard to understand. It seems like there are dozens of different types that all work in different ways. Sometimes they’re like doors, and you don’t even know they’re there. Sometimes, like the entryways between floors, you just need to touch them and they work. Sometimes you have to put your hand through, and you start to feel like you’re getting dragged. If you let yourself go slack, you get pulled in. But you can still break free. It’s not consistent. Sometimes you have to be big enough to fit through it to work, and sometimes a portal the size of a button will toss you into a monster den. [[Teleport Trap | Teleport traps]] are the worst.'' Dinniman, Matt. The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 3 (p. 394). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|3|27}}
===On Stairwells===
''Even though you can sometimes move the platforms upon which the stairwells sit, you cannot put the exit portal into your inventory. You can’t bring a stairwell into your saferoom. I watched one get hit by an [[Utter Annihilation Wand]], and it remained unscathed. I believe that means they are indestructible.''Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (p. 576). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|6|61}}
==References== [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

== Description == You somehow managed to win an important boss battle without actually killing the boss. That’s like paying money to a prostitute just so she’ll cuddle with you.
''Reward'': You’ve received a [[Potion of Bloodlust|silver Pacifist’s Box]]. [[Category:Achievements]]

Minion army is a mass charm spell. [[Donut]] obtained the spellbook for this from the Beguiler Box on [[First Floor|Floor 1]]. She was finally able to read it on [[Fourth Floor|Floor 4]].
== Description == '''Cost''': 50 Mana. 5 hour cooldown (at level 1)
'''Target''': 30 meter diameter circle centered on the caster that scales "a lot" based on Charisma
This is a mass-charm spell that has a casting time of five minutes. For that period, the caster is frozen in place. Once cast, all intelligent mobs within the area of effect have a chance of turning and fighting against their friends. At level 1, the chance to turn in 2%.
[[Category:Spells]] [[Category:Donut]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Shepherd]]|species=[[Human]] {{!}} [[Vampire]] (6th Floor)|age=40|origin=Italy|allies=* [[Prepotente]] * [[Bianca]]|titles=Princess of Hell|status=Deceased|level=52|highest_stat=Intelligence|gear=[[Boots of Kiznet's Final Flight]]|skills=[[Cloud of Exhaust]]|image1=00456.jpg}} Miriam Dom is a Human, [[Shepherd]] class Crawler of Italian descent. She is around 40 years old, a little plump, and dark haired. She entered the dungeon with 12 of her goats, but one goat named [[Prepotente]] received an Enhanced Pet Biscuit, like Donut did. The other, [[Bianca]], has turned into a hell-spawn familiar pet class. She keep all her goat children except for Prepotente and Bianca in her inventory unless they are in a safe room or on a show. Her personality is gentle and motherly.
At the end of the 5th floor Miriam Dom is turned into a vampire this caused her to get banned from [[Club Vanquisher]]. Her fighting style is to cloak her party's presence while Prepotente stacks multiple debuffs onto their enemies. During the 6th floor Miriam and her party get involved in an elite quest that goes awry. Vampirism starts spreading to the mobs in the dungeon. Prepotente's Ring of Divine Suffering is accidentally triggered and targets Miriam Dom. Prepotente is inflicted with the Left to Fester debuff, and as a result cannot heal until Miriam dies. Miriam asks Carl to kill her so that Prepotente doesn't have to do it. Carl and Donut stay with her until the sun rises and kills her due to her vampire status.
== Trivia == Her and her goats regularly appear on the show Plenty of Plenty.
== Skills == She's able to apply the Sooth buff, shortening all debuffs by 10%.
She has a special ability that allows her to unlearn a spell and turn it into a spellbook,
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

{{Character_info|height=|species=Half [[elf]]|first_appearance=Book 6|status=Alive|party=|allies=[[Meadow Lark]]|level=50|skills=|class=[[Green Caster]]}} The manager for team [[Meadow Lark]]. She has a drinking problem and smokes [[Blitz Sticks|blitz sticks]].
She once managed to charm a province boss. [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]]
This box can be for a specific mob type, such as "Silver Goblin Box" or "Gold Hobgoblin Box" and contain items associated with the specific mob. [[Category:Loot Boxes]]

revision.comment: Eekz moved page [[Glossary:Mobs]] to [[Mobs]] without leaving a redirect

revision.text:
{{Race_Infobox | image1 = 00037.jpg | type = Mob | floors = [[Third Floor | Floor 3]] | organizations = Grimaldi's Traveling Circus }}{{Quote | quote = “Carl. What a strong name. Be a dear, Sir Carl. You seem like a strapping lad. Please keep those Mold Lions off of me while I organize my battle squad. I usually have this part done before I have to face them. Your presence distracted me, so it’s only fair. Besides, if you run, they will take you down.” <small>--[[Tsarina Signet]] (Book 2, Chapter 7)</small> }} Once an attraction at [[Grimaldi's Traveling Circus]] on the [[Third Floor|third floor]], mold lions were transformed by [[Scolopendra]]'s curse.
==AI Description== '''Mold Lion – Level 15'''
'''Mean, green, and it gonna eat yo spleen!'''
'''Madam Kiki’s Dancing Lions were an integral part of Grimaldi’s Traveling Circus. Crowds would roar in approval as the diminutive lion trainer stood in the middle of the ring, cracked her whip, and the dozen male lions took to their hindlegs and twirled like ballerinas. What a sight it was!'''
'''On the day of the great cataclysm, the gentle and tame lions were some of the first to transform. The spores of Scolopendra took quick root within the lions, turning them into the fiends you see today. Further transformations occurred as a result of the vine.'''
'''As with all early victims of the cataclysm, these creatures are filled with rage. They will stop at nothing until your innards wet the floorboards of the Over City.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (p. 75; chapter 7). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. </ref>
== Description == Regular-sized male lions, their manes are made of waving pink and green finger-like worms. At least one eye glows emerald. Half of their matted bodies are splattered in a pulsating green, lumpy, glowing fungus. When the lion is killed, the worms die and mold turns black before oozing off of the corpse; if a single microscopic spore of the mold returns to Grimaldi, the lion will regrow by the next day.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 7).</ref>
The lions attack by pouncing, and slashing with claws and teeth.
== References == <references /> [[Category:Mobs]]

[[File:Mongo.png|thumb]] {{Character_info|species=[[Mongoliensis]]|party=The Royal Court of Princess Donut|allies=*[[Princess Donut]] *[[Carl]] *[[Katia Grim]]|gear=*Location Collar *[[Enchanted Fang Caps of the Expectorating Tizheruk]] *[[Enchanted Mongoliensis Saddle]] *[[Unnamed teeth caps]]|title1=|titles=Royal Steed|origin=Dungeon Generated (Floor 2 Pet Reward Room)|skills=[[Earthquake]]}}
Mongo is a pet owned by [[Donut|Princess Donut]]. He is the mascot and royal steed of the Royal Court of Princess Donut.
Mongo and [[Kiwi]] slept together.
== AI Description == Male Mongoliensis
This is a pet-class mob.
The stubborn and hot-headed Mongoliensis is not the type of pet to ever be “tamed.” The best one can hope for is mutual respect. And even then they still might try to eat you if the fancy strikes them. While especially powerful, fast, and vicious when they are fully grown at level 15, getting them to level 15 is about as likely as a cheerleader from West Virginia reaching her 18th birthday as a virgin.
They will immediately attack any mobs they see. They will fight to the death.
Good luck.

Sam is a friend of [[Carl|Carl's]] from before the Transformation, the two of them used to play video games together.
His friends started called him deathray after his girlfriend got annoyed with people calling him Monobrow Sam.
He was used as a head for the [[The Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance|Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance]], during the battle he had a death ray ability. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]

[[File:00308.jpg|thumb|Monster Truck Driver]]
==Description== Though not explicitly described, [[Mordecai]] explains it as "... it’s an earth version of the [[Staunch Barrier]] class mixed with a [[Jouster]] class. It’s a relatively common combined class called a [[Juggernaut]]. In other words, she’s a straight-up tank that gets an increasingly-massive Constitution bonus the faster she is moving."
*Second Fuel Tank, which absorbs damage and redirects some of it back. It triggers randomly, but it’s limited to only one time a fight. *Rush ability, which uses my body as a battering ram. I can only do that once a 30-hour day. *Pathfinder *Immune to wind spell damage
== Crawlers with This Class ==
* [[Katia Grim]] [[Category:Class]]

{{Character info | image1 = 00299.jpg|1 00802.jpg|2 00804.jpg|3 00805.jpg|4 00808.jpg|5 00807.jpg|6 00810.jpg|7 00811.jpg|8 | class = Fire Mage Arcanist | species = [[Skyfowl]] {{!}} [[Changeling]] | origin = Skyfowl Planet (Mined by [[Borant Corporation|Borant]] | occupation = [[Game Guide]], [[Manager Benefit|Manager]] | first_appearance = Book 1, Ch 2 | level = 50 | skills = Alchemy | organizations = [[Desperado Club]],
[[Borant Corporation]] | status = Alive | allies = *[[Donut]] *[[Carl]] *[[Katia Grim]] }} Mordecai is a Level 50 Guild Master and currently [[Donut|Princess Donut]]'s [[Manager Benefit|Manager]]. He is currently on his last tour of crawl duty. == Description == Mordecai is [[Carl]] and [[Donut]]’s guide for the dungeon. He is an indentured servant for [[Borant]], tasked with helping the corporation run crawls. Originally an avian race called a [[Skyfowl]], Mordecai chose [[Changeling]] as his race when he was a crawler. Now as a guide he is forced into a different race each floor. His chosen area of expertise during his crawl was potion making, but since becoming a guide, that expertise has grown over hundreds of years to cover most aspects of the crawl. According to [[Odette]], he is one of the most knowledgeable guides there are. Normally Mordecai is a tutorial guide for the first three floors and serves as a magic guild master on the later floors,Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 3). where he has relative freedom to follow his own pursuits in potion making and catch up with friends. Following Odette’s advice, [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] made Mordecai into [[Donut]]’s [[Manager Benefit|Manager]] during the class selection process, meaning he must stay on as advisor even after the third floor. They had to make it look like an accident, as Odette warned them that he is only useful to them if he wants to help, and if he ever learns that they made him [[Manager Benefit|Manager]] on purpose, he will turn his resentment to them and refuse to help any further.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 1). He is committed to helping [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] survive the crawl, even if they don’t always take his advice. Potion brewing is a time-consuming process, but he regularly brews potions for them, which have helped The Royal Court out of many situations. His specific knowledge about the crawl is very useful when [[Carl]] is trying to make plans or understand how dangerous a situation is. Since getting the [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Anarchist’s Cookbook]], [[Carl]] has begun hiding some of his use of the book by guiding conversations to make it look like Mordecai is providing the information instead. Mordecai’s general advice is conservative, aimed at surviving as long as possible while minimizing risk. This is increasingly at odds with [[Carl]]’s desire to take risks to accumulate power, save as many lives as possible, and tear down the whole concept of the crawl. The many unprecedented situations [[Carl]] gets himself into are starting to make Mordecai feel irrelevant. As a Guildmaster and as a [[Manager Benefit|Manager]] on the [[Third Floor|third floor]], he could be permanently killed in the Dungeon. As a Manager, after Donut arrives on the [[Fourth Floor|fourth floor]], he receives the ''"same"'' system protection that tourists in the ninth floor [[Ninth Floor|Faction Wars]] have; if he dies, his body will be transferred out of the Dungeon and his indentureship will officially end.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 15). The longer Donut survives, the more money he will receive when he is free. ==Personality== Mordecai is generally grumpy but tends to perk up when talking about potions. He gets emotional when he’s drunk, thinking about the loss of his family. He was traumatized during his time as a crawler. Hundreds of years later, he still holds a grudge against his former allies, whom he blames for the death of his brother. This includes Odette, his former [[Manager Benefit|Manager]]. It is implied that part of why he hates the idea of being [[Manager Benefit|Manager]] is because of his resentment toward her. At some point he testified against her at her trial. He lashes out against his former allies when given a chance. ==Appearance== {{Quote |I was a [[Kua-Tin|kua-tin]] once, and I had to spend the floor in a glass pitcher. Another time I was a skreich ghast, and I kept teleporting away against my will.”Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (p. 27). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. }} Born a centurion Skyfowl, Mordecai's natural form is eagle-like, with dark gold feathers, large angel-like wings, and large talons. Dinniman, Matt. ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'' (chapter 1). Although Mordecai took the [[Changeling]] race during his crawl, he is unable to change his shape at will; instead, his shape changes when each new level begins. He always takes the shape of a type of mob from the Dungeon's current floor. There do not appear to be any shared traits or characteristics across the different forms, with the exception of his accent (in the audiobooks only). {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" style="width:100%" |+'''Text Description of Appearance by Floor and Race''' !Floor !Race !Description |- !1 |[[Rat-kin]] |As a rat-kin, Mordecai is bearded and a head shorter than Carl.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 2). He wears a black vest, blue pants, and well-worn sandals. This is one of few floors on which Mordecai is assigned a new race ''and'' class; specifically, the AI identifies him as a "Rat Hooligan." |- !2 |[[Bugaboo]] |Mordecai is a 7' (2.13m) tall, obsidian-haired, owl-eyed creature "like a bear with no neck" and absurdly thin limbs.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 35). |- !3 |[[Incubus]] |As an incubus, Mordecai is a "well-built, young and disgustingly handsome" man, standing at approximately 6' 3" (190.5 cm). He has dusky gray skin, long gray/black hair in a ponytail, smoldering eyes, short devil horns high on his forehead, a barbed tail, and black bat-like wings. His voice is deeper. He wears a tuxedo, but seems to shed his jacket and tie and unbutton his shirt at every opportunity. As incubi have a lower alcohol tolerance than he is accustomed to, he smells "like the floor of a biker bar" within 24 hours of the floor opening.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 8). |- !4 |[[Grulke]] |Identified as "Grulke Infantry," Mordecai appears as a 5' (152.4cm) "mud-colored, warty, slimy toad-looking thing, complete with hanging jowls and a throat pouch under his wide face that looked as if it could fill with air."Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (p. 23). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. |- !5 |[[Skyfowl]] |As a rock edge skyfowl, Mordecai looks like a large light brown and beige eagle. Although similar to his natural form, he appears to have a cleric class, so his wings are clipped. |- !6 |[[Pocket Kuma]] |"He was a fuzzy, brown and white, knee-height, chubby, bipedal bear thing with elf ears and a monkey tail" plus oversized eyes and buckteeth.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Butcher's Masquerade'' (pp. 25-26). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. |- !7 |[[Slime]] |As a slime, Mordecai does not have arms. |- !8 |[[Hills Cyclops]] |Large in height and width, with bright pink skin and a white shirt stretched across a wide belly. His cone-shaped head is bald, with a thick unibrow over a single brown eye. His voice sounds like Patrick from ''Spongebob Squarepants''.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (chapter 2). |}
File:00299.jpg|Mordecai as a Rat Hooligan |link=File:00299.jpg File:00802.jpg|Mordecai as a Bugaboo |link=File:00802.jpg File:00804.jpg|Mordecai as an Incubus |link=File:00804.jpg File:00805.jpg|Mordecai as Grulke Infantry|link=File:00805.jpg File:00808.jpg|Mordecai as a Rock Edge Skyfowl |link=File:00808.jpg File:00807.jpg|Mordecai the adorable Pocket Kuma|link=File:00807.jpg File:00810.jpg|Mordecai the terrifying slime beast|link=File:00810.jpg File:00811.jpg|Mordecai the Hills Cyclops|link=File:00811.jpg ==History== Mordecai and his brother, [[Uzzi]], entered a Borant Corporation-run Dungeon hundreds of solars ago.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (chapter 37). The brothers partnered with [[Chaco]] and [[Hold Steady]],Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (prologue). and accepted [[Odette]]'s offer to serve as Mordecai's [[Manager Benefit|Manager]]. Over the course of his time in the Dungeon, Mordecai took the shapes of [[skyfowl]], [[raven slakes]], and humans, and learned the "[[Final Blow]]" Skill. He acquired almost 30 million followers and four patrons.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 4). When Mordecai reached the eleventh floor, he took an indentured servitude deal to become a guildmaster for a certain number of seasons of ''Dungeon Crawler World''. As a guildmaster, he acts as a Game Guide for the first three floors and his personal space is redefined as a Tutorial Guild Hall; then, he is transported to a much deeper floor to run a magic guild and his personal space expands.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 1). He could be permanently killed in the Dungeon before his contract expired. As part of the deal, Borant recreated his destroyed home and gave him a few minutes to retrieve any possessions he wanted for his personal space; he chose his mother's ashes and a photo of his brother. A few solars after he took the deal, the rules changed, extending his contract; where he could previously work on any season of ''Dungeon Crawler World'', he could now only work on seasons hosted by Borant Corporation, or approximately one of every fifteen seasons. For centuries now, Mordecai has been coping with the trauma of the Dungeon by drinking himself into oblivion and crying over everyone he lost. Mordecai was dispatched to Earth in 1964 to prepare for his final season of ''Dungeon Crawler World''. When he was permitted to visit the surface, he stole James Bond videos from a Blockbuster. If he survives this season, he will become a full [[Syndicate]] citizen and receive a moderate stipend (see also for additional income). ==References== [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{SpoilH | 4}}{{Quote | quote = She remains buried in the castle, and she consumes me. Every day. She eats me while I am made of sand. That’s how oozes tell you they love you. -- [[Ghazi]]Dinniman, Matt. The Gate of the Feral Gods: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 4 (p. 329). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.}}{{Character_info | image1 = 00054.jpg | species = Sand Ooze | first_appearance = Chapter 21, Book 4 | level = 52 }} '''Mrs. Ghazi''' is a sand ooze, a [[Fifth Floor]] Borough Boss, and the daughter of [[Samantha]] and an unspecified king. ==AI Description==
Mrs. Ghazi Sand Ooze. Level 52 Borough Boss! This is a minion of [[Samantha|Psamathe]]. Every living thing seeks the same thing. A sense of contentment. No matter what their origin story is, no matter what they are made of, the moment they first exist, no matter how dumb, how smart, how confused, they seek a place of comfort. What that comfort looks like to them can vary wildly, even amongst creatures of the same species. Oftentimes, that journey to felicity is what defines their entire lifecycle. When that creature crosses paths with another, it is inevitable that the weaker of the two will fall further away from their goal. This is the sort of thing that might go through Mrs. Ghazi's mind as it spends its day watching over a man it has grown to love at the behest of someone more powerful than itself. The knowledge that the man's feelings are not mutual is like a dagger in its heart, if it had one. It wrestles daily with this realization, teetering on the edge of indecision. ''Do I protect him because I love him? Do I kill him because he doesn't love me back? Do I continue with my duty? What would become of me if I simply disobeyed?'' It's a lot of stress for a creature not used to having any emotion. It's almost too much. But even if this creature wanted to end it all, it couldn't. Its master has the ability to bring it right back, over and over again.{{ref|4|22}}
==Description== [[Ghazi]] used the [[Mysterious Winding Box]] with the intention of contacting the goddess [[Yarilo]], and offering to free her from the [[Nothing]] if she would make the fictional character [[Lika]] fall in love with him. Instead, he contacted and half-freed Psamathe and her daughter/minion/familiar, the sand ooze. Mrs. Ghazi took the form of Lika, married Ghazi, and consummated the marriage before turning back to sand. Now, she takes Lika's shape when the sandstorm isn't raging outside; at the same time, Ghazi turns to sand. She has fallen in love with her husband, and shows her love by consuming his sand-form every day and refusing to allow him to leave the room. Ghazi believes she's jealous of Samantha.{{ref|4|21}} As long as Samantha exists in this realm, Mrs. Ghazi can be fully resurrected from a single grain of sand. She can be temporarily killed by setting fire to her core. If a sand ooze catches prey, it latches on like quicksand and pours sand into every available orifice until the prey explodes. ==Appearance== When she moves, Mrs. Ghazi bubbles like gray lava. Her core is a glowing yellow yolk-like dome. ==References== [[Category:Borough Boss]] [[Category:Boss]]

{{Character info |age=Unknown |species=Human |origin=Earth: Seattle, WA |occupation=Unknown |first_appearance=Book 1, Chapter 1 |status=Deceased |Cause of Death=Decapitation|image1=00605.jpg}} '''Mrs. Parsons''' was an old woman who lived in a first floor unit of Carl's apartment building in Seattle, WA. She was grumpy and liked to file complaints.{{ref|1|1}} Her husband died years ago and she never remarried.{{ref|6|50}} She was beheaded during the [[The Transformation|Transformation]] when the apartment building collapsed. Her head is still on the ground one week later.{{ref|4|epilogue}} == Description == From ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 1:
"What in god's name is going on out here?" Mrs. Parsons called, sticking her head out the window. The old woman had her head wrapped in some sort of towel, making her look like a swami. Her beady eyes focused on me. "Carl, is that you?" "Yes, Mrs. Parsons," I said. "Sorry. My cat got out, and I'm trying to get her in before she freezes to death." "It looks like you're the one who's going to freeze to.." Mrs. Parsons never finished the sentence.
== References == [[Category:Characters]][[Category:Earth Characters]]
'''Effect''': It stops monsters from casting spells [[Category:Spells]]

== AI Description == This benefit may only be used once for obvious reasons.
Creates a one-time-use key to open a lock. Any lock. Any lock in the dungeon.
WARNING!: (Notice how I used ALL CAPS for the warning?) Using this benefit will destroy both the patch ''and'' the item it is attached to. That means the jacket and all those ugly little patches inexpertly sewn to it.
Uh, it also uses a bone from the user’s body to create the key. The more difficult the lock, the bigger the bone it uses. It might just be a finger. Or your clavicle. Or your femur. No biggie.
This bone will not grow back. So make sure it’s a lock you really, really want to open. [[Category:Skills]]

They're super..."
revision.text:
== AI Description == {{Character_info|species=[[Chee]] {{!}} [[Bearded Sage Caterpillar]]|first_appearance=Chapter 13, Book 5|allies=[[Tsarina Signet]]|occupation=Teacher}} '''Nadine - Bearded Sage Caterpillar. Level 50'''
The Bearded Sage Caterpillar is an enormous, furry, tree-dwelling insect who is normally content to sit atop trees and munch on leaves until the day they get the notion to form a chrysalis and turn into something else equally innocuous. They're super fuzzy and kinda cute as long as you don't look at their faces. Have you ever seen a closeup of a bug's face? Seriously, what the fuck? These things are mostly harmless, even after they turn into moths.
Anyway, Nadine wasn't born as a caterpillar. A Bearded Sage isn't normally intelligent, despite their name. Not that Nadine was Miss Science Fair before the High Elf attack, but she was Chee. A teacher, actually, in charge of the Chee day school. She also used to be an actress, but don't ask her about that. If she was still about to talk, she'd deny it. {{citation}} {{SpoilH | 5}}
The nebular are a religious cult that mechanically and bio augments themselves as a form of sacrament. Their current goal is to shut down the Crawl, they also hope to one day run a Crawl themselves.
Their deity is a giant AI at the centre of the inner system, this AI doesn't have a personality and spreads an [[enhancement zone]] over several solar systems, it predates syndicate society and the Nebular believe it's blasphemy to try and replicate it.
They are nomadic, settling into inhospitable worlds and bio engineering their children to adapt, they live on the planet long enough for their children to grow into adults then half of them move on to a new world. Consist of many different races and they all wear the same uniforms, robes with cube and distinctive hats.
At one point they got into a war with the [[Burrowers]] because they were squatting in the hive system.
The [[Nebular Sin Patrol]] enter the [[Sixth Floor|Hunting Grounds]] every time, training for the event, believing people born on a "seeded planet" are an abomination and that hunting them is a crusade. They claimed [[Prepotente]] and [[Miriam Dom]] as their targets. They also entered the [[Twelfth Floor|Celestial Ascendancy]] hoping that if they win they will get a seat on the Council, the god they sponsored was [[Ysalte]]. Outside of the Crawl they're pacifists but this doesn't stop them preaching about the need to destroy all planets with a [[primal engine]] as well as all other religions.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

== AI Description == This unusual class combines one of the most-loved occupations with one of the most reviled. Necromancers specialize in magic related to raising the dead. Bards must choose an entertainment-based skill. Depending on this choice, whether it be singing, the kazoo, or storytelling, the resulting crawler will use this skill to either entertain, protect, or glamour both the living and the dead.
The NecroBard receives the following benefits:
* Instant access to a level-5 entertainment-based skill of their choice. * Access to all membership-based clubs, regardless of current memberships. * Free rooms at all saferooms. * A 10% mana cost penalty on all non-Necromancer or Bard spells. * Instant access to the Level-3 Turn Undead Spell. * Instant access to the Level-3 Panty Dropper Spell. * +5 to Constitution, Charisma, and Intelligence. * -2 Strength
Additional benefits depending on entertainment-based skill choice. [[Category:Class]]

A Neighborhood Map can always be obtained after killing and looting a [[Boss|Neighborhood Boss]]. Unlike normal loot, the Neighborhood Map is available to be picked up by multiple crawlers looting the same boss.

[[File:DCC-AIT-S01E05-Update.jpg|thumb|Official art of Odette from the cover of the Soundbooth Theatre Immersion Tunnel: Season 1, Episode 5: Smile and Wave!]] One of the most popular women in the galaxy and host of ''[[Dungeon Crawler After Hours with Odette]]''. She is a former crawler and has a complicated relationship with [[Mordecai]].
She also owns a Crab Ranch and sponsored [[Hekla]] and her [[Brynhild's Daughters]].
== History == At one point she was arrested and sentenced but her current husband brought out her contract, [[Mordecai]] testified against her at her trial.
She hired [[Lexis]] to look over [[Beatrice]] and [[Gravy Boat]] the cat, having Lexis acquire the cat for unknown reasons.
Odette and [[Zev]] informed [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] that she has rescued [[Beatrice]] and that they were planning on making her into a country boss but now Beatrice on her way to the inner system. She confesses that she used her to blackmail the [[Borant Corporation]] in return for getting a high revenue share for the crawl.
During the eighth floor she announced that she'll be sponsoring the goddess [[Nekhebit]] in an attempt to claim the Celestial Throne. Afterward she orchestrated the shooting down an unmanned liaison ship, part of the reason she did this was so that she could talk to Carl without being overheard.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:God Sponsors]] [[Category:Syndicate Citizens]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Aliens]]

Odious Creepers are a city boss, their level varies between 130-173. They were created after vampire [[Big Tina|Big Tina's]] attempted to create an undead army out of various body parts, after she was cured she lost control of the spell and they were turned into Odious Creepers.
Killing them was part of the [[Creeping Apocalypse]] quest, and give whoever killed them +5 to a random stat. For every 5 you kill you would gain +5 levels.
[[Mordecai]] suspected they were originally going to be a creature called an Odious Blossom. [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:City Boss]] [[Category:Mobs]]

[[File:00837.jpg|thumb|right|Ogun, Yoruba god of war and iron]] ==Description== God who is part of the [[Orisha]] pantheon, with [[Legba]], [[Shango]], [[Oshun]], [[Asojano]], [[Inle]], and [[Yemaya]].
According to [[Mordecai]], a common god to worship. God of blacksmiths and protection.
== AI Description == '''God of Blacksmithery and Armor Ogun. Level 250.'''
'''This god is not sponsored.'''
'''Warning: This is a deity. He is invulnerable on this floor.'''
''This god has been temporarily summoned to this location. Summoning rules apply.''
Ogun is an outsider. He is one of the old gods, originally a member of an obscure pantheon that has since dissipated into time. He spends his days at his celestial anvil, angrily creating armor, piece after piece, but no one knows why he toils or what becomes of his armor when it's completed.
It's said his creations have a strange shape, all designed for four-legged beasts.
Ogun is no stranger to conflict. He is - well, he ''was'' until a minute ago - the last surviving member of an ancient pantheon that was known for its bloody conflicts. Like most of the older gods, he isn't the same entity he once was. In the great Halls, he is considered a god of blacksmiths and armorers. He was once something even greater.
His power and ambition makes him a strong contender for the celestial throne.
He's here now because Ogun strongly believes all punishments should be handed out in person. [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]]

[[Carl]] reached one quadrillion views.
==Description== You are one of the first ten crawlers to have achieved one quadrillion views! That means one of two things. You're either one of the best crawlers in the game, or you're such a hot mess people can't wait to see you fail.
''Reward:'' You have received a Gold [[Fan Box]]!
''Admin Note:'' You have received your first Fan Box. Fan boxes contain items that are voted for by those who follow your progress. Once a box is received, you may not open it for thirty hours while the fans vote for the contents. [[Category:Achievements]]

[[Carl]] donned on his [[Enchanted Trollskin Shirt of Pummeling]] and [[Enchanted Nightgaunt Cloak of Stoutness]].

The Orisha pantheon are a group of former gods and goddess that attempt to get Carl and Donut to repair their shrine so that they can Ascend.
== Members ==
* [[Legba]] * [[Shango]] * [[Oshun]] * [[Ogun]] * [[Asojano]] * [[Inle]] * [[Yemaya]]
== Real world basis == '''Orishas''' (singular: '''orisha''') are spirits that play a key role in the Yoruba religion of West Africa and several religions that derive from it, such as Cuban, Dominican and Puerto Rican Santería, Brazilian Candomblé, and Haitian Vodou.
They form a large pantheon including:
* '''Papa Legba''': https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papa_Legba * '''Shango''': https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shango * '''Oshun''': https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oshun * '''Ogun''': https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ogun * '''Asojano''': https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babal%C3%BA-Ay%C3%A9 * '''Inle''' https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inle_(Santer%C3%ADa) * '''Yemayá''': https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yem%E1%BB%8Dja Incidentally the Orisha Asojano is associated with the Catholic saint Lazurus in Cuban Santería.
[[Category:Races]] [[Category:Deities]] [[Category:Mobs]]

{{SpoilR}}
Orren is a [[The Syndicate Council|Syndicate]] Liaison, he acts as a fact finder and independant investigator. His cover story was that he was acting as the manager as the [[Desperado Club|desperado club]].
He was in charge of investigating the death of [[Loita]].
{{Character_info|species=[[Gondii]]|occupation=Liaison|first_appearance=Chapter 19, Book 4}}Attempted to get [[Carl]] to hand over the [[Gate of the Feral Gods]] when Carl entered the sixth floor, he also tried to trick Carl into touching it whilst it was in administrative lock which would have deleted it.
He is also responsible of negoiating with the [[System AI]] if it ever takes control of the show, he explained to crawlers about the [[System AI]] and [[Primal engine|Primal Engines]].
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Dungeon Admins]] [[Category:Aliens]] [[Category:Dungeon Backstage]]

{{Stub}}{{Citation}} Orthrus. Juvenile Gate Guardian. Level 10. This is a bereft pet of [[Geyrun]].
== Description == Who’s a good boy? Who’s a good boy? When you see a multi-headed dog trained to guard gates, you probably first think of Cerberus, the three-headed monstrosity that is said to protect one of the stairwell entrances to the twelfth floor. What you probably don’t know is that grumpy Cerberus has a kid brother who is still learning the ropes. Orthrus. The most loveable hell-hound on this side of Alpha Centari. The left side is for sniffin’ and the right side is for lickin’ and that pink belly of his? It’s for kissin’. If this lil pup was any more sweet and adorable, you’d all be inflicted with diabetes. The universe’s goodest boy was originally destined for a fate like that of his brother. But before the two-headed Orthrus could get turned into a vicious, baby-eating, nun-defiling murder machine, he met with some bad luck. First, his master was murdered, and then he got sucked into the Nothing, all on the same day. Unlike most creatures who have been touched by the Nothing, Orthrus’s pure innocence causes him to be unaffected by the blight. He is immune to all mind-altering attacks. Fire doesn’t do a thing, which is good considering his adopted family. But unlike most gods, he is not invulnerable. He is but a little puppy. Happy, but destructive. Rambunctious, roly-poly, very pokey. But fragile. Which is unfortunate. His master may be dead, but his master’s father, [[Emberus]] the Fire God, is not. He would not be pleased if anything were to happen to his dead son’s best friend. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Dungeon Lore]] [[Category:Deities]] [[Category:Pets]]

== Description == Goddess who is part of the [[Orisha]] pantheon, with [[Ogun]], [[Legba]], [[Shango]], [[Asojano]], [[Inle]], and [[Yemaya]]. She charms Carl and [[Anton]] to get them to repair her shrine in [[The Ghosts of Earth]] level.
== Shrine == If her shrine is repaired you will all be protected from the next five fatal blows, everyone will receive a fifty percent boost to their charisma, all will receive a level ten heal party spell. [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]]

Admin Notice. This page may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Posting spoilers for Book 7 will result in “acceleration” per this wiki’s rules. == Description == Author of the 18th edition of [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]. == Cookbook Entries == I know I don't write often in these scrolls, but I have read them all. I just finished my third re-read of [[Herot]]'s overly-wrought essay and ramblings about the Worn Path Method of Waking NPCs. These theories are sound, I think, but I believe there is something he has missed. Something monumental. I think they're lying about the origin of some of these NPCs. Years pass, times change, laws and rules evolve. But this behemoth we find ourselves trapped within still persists. A reused canvas painted over and over again. The fact that this scroll I am writing in even exists suggests that the brush strokes used to paint the world are so piled atop one another, it's impossible to see every image that once was. Ask a bopca where they come from, and they'll all tell you the same thing. That the aliens came to their planet and "offered" them a chance to live in the dungeon. I don't think they're the only ones with such a fate, and I'm beginning to believe the bopca's station is much higher than that of those who've been offered a similar deal. (Chapter 34, Book 6) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

[[File:00211.jpg|thumb|Paulie]] Paulie is a 70 years old Asian homeless man in a red trapper hat. He has four children, none of whom care about him. His brother in law stole his business.
He is currently biologically a [[Gondii]] worm. Each day he gives the exact same speech about the crawl, the AI and the collapse of the inner system. He never made it into the dungeon.
He made coffee which Carl drunk.
He had a plastic bin filled with numerous valtey neuro enhancement pills, communication devices, shield and weapon.

[[Category:Loot Boxes]] [[File:00243.jpg|thumb|Pet Box]]The Pet Box is a [[:Category:Loot Boxes|Loot Box]] distributed for pet-related achievements. All tiers of the box have a hedgehog-like animal stenciled on them.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 5).</ref>
== Bronze Pet Box == The Bronze Pet Box is bronze-colored and approximately half the size of a military foot locker, with the hedgehog stencil on top.<ref name=":0" />
=== Sample Loot ===
* [[Scroll of Heal Critter]] * Pet Biscuit X 10. Pet biscuits look like dry cat food.<ref name=":0" />
=== Related Achievements ===
* [[Crazy Cat Lady]] (First Floor)
== Gold Pet Box == Donut receives a Gold Pet Box for an unspecified achievement early on the [[Third Floor|Third Floor]]. It contains an unnamed collar that allows them to see [[Mongo]] on the [[HUD / Crawler Menu|minimap]], even when he is in the fog of war.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 5).</ref>
== Legendary Pet Box == Three times the size of the bronze box and made of intricately carved silver and gold patterns, it is opened by clockwork gears to musical fanfare.<ref name=":0" />
=== Sample Loot ===
* Pet Biscuit X 500 * [[Enhanced Pet Biscuit]]<ref name=":0" />
=== Related Achievements ===
* [[Trailblazing Crazy Cat Lady]] (First Floor)
== References == <references />

revision.comment: Eekz moved page [[Pets]] to [[Pets & Dungeon Familiars]] without leaving a redirect: titles
revision.text:
Crawlers may be accompanied by '''pets''' or by '''dungeon familiars.'''
==Dungeon Familiars== '''Dungeon familiars''' entered the [[Dungeon]] from the surface and were assigned crawler ID's (e.g. [[Donut]] and [[Cici]]).<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 47).</ref> They did not meet the minimum required intelligence of 2 to complete the [[tutorial]], so they were classified as "pets" by the [[System AI]].
Dungeon familiars do not count as "crawler pets," but most pet rules appear to apply. The most notable exception is quantity; a crawler can have an unlimited number of dungeon familiars. <ref name=":0" /> ==Crawler Pets== Generally, crawlers are limited to one '''pet'''. Some race or class choices allow a crawler to have multiple pets, and a high charisma score may make it possible for a crawler to have multiples of a single species of pet.<ref name=":0" />
'''Pet-class mobs''' may be found in reward or purchased in a shop, but they always start at level one and remain level one until bonded. Once bonded, pets rapidly mature as they gain experience points and levels from combat.<ref name=":0" /> After a crawler sufficiently bonds with a pet-class mob, the mob's dot will turn orange on the crawler's mini-map and the "Pet Menu" will unlock in the crawler's interface.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 46).</ref>
Pets can be equipped with gear, armor, or magical items, and may be able to learn spells. If a pet kills a dungeon boss or another crawler, they do not receive stars or player skulls beside their names; it is possible but not confirmed that their owner receives the mark instead.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 39).</ref>
=== Pet Menu === The Pet Menu allows a crawler to change the pet's name and title, and view the pet's stats, abilities, and health.<ref name=":0" /><ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (chapter 7).</ref> If the crawler and pet-class mob do not bond before the floor collapses, the crawler will have to leave the pet behind.<ref name=":0" />
==References== <references />
[[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]]

[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Aliens]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]]

==AI Description== '''Cost''': 5 Mana
Also known as, “Here piggy, piggy,” or “The Night Dread,” Ping is a hunting and artillery-aiming tool for those who do not care if their quarry knows they’re coming. The elven gunnery officers of the Dream all learn this spell the moment they hit adulthood. Anyone who sits in a trench lives in abject terror of the noise this spell creates. Target: An area of one kilometer around the caster plus 500 meters for every ten points of intelligence. Environmental factors and obstacles may increase or decrease range.
'''Duration''': Instantaneous. Ping travels at the speed of sound.
'''Cooldown''': Five minutes.
Sends out an audible ping that gives the distance and location of all non-crawlers and non-red-tagged mobs in a circle around you. It will mark targets beyond the range of your map. Targets hit with Ping will hear an audible ping noise, but they will not know from where the ping originates. Higher levels increases the amount of information about the target. At level 5, you may imbue the ping with ''[[Fear]]''. [[Category:Spells]]

[[File:00702.jpg|thumb|Platinum Sharpening Stone]]
== AI Description == Warning: This item has a short shelf life.
Apply this to any spiked offensive weapon to receive the following buffs.
* Plus (2 x current level)% damage to all attacks. * Plus 1 to all current stat buffs. Does not add new buffs if they do not exist.
It also makes the weapon look extra oily and mean looking. In other words, the weapon’s appearance may change. But only a little.
== Use == This item was used to upgrade Carl's [[Enchanted War Gauntlet of the Exhalted Grull (Right-handed)|Gauntlet]].

This was the race [[Mordecai]] became on the 6th Floor
== AI Description == Wow! This pint-sized fuzzball is adorable! The rare Pocket Kuma is a magic-infused, half-fairy creature originally designed as a pet for the elite High Elf royal court. When it was discovered these creatures were intelligent, High Elf King Finian, of course, ordered them all executed. Only a few of the little rascals managed to escape into the jungle. A kuma is a type of bear. A Pocket Kuma is a different sort of creature, though they are distantly related. You take a small bear, crossbreed it with a capybara spirit, pick out the runt of the litter, and then breed it further down with a sugar glider. The resulting, bug-eyed creature is what you see before you now. They can’t fight for shit. They can barely walk. But holy shit are they disgustingly cute. I bet they smush really well.
[[Category:Races]]

[[Carl]] earned this achievement for stomping a [[Goblins|goblin]] with his bare feet on the [[First Floor|first floor]]. == AI Description == '''You've used your bare feet to crush and kill an opponent! Hey! That's ''my'' fetish. Seriously. Keep doing it, and you'll be rewarded. This will help.'''
'''''Reward:'' You've received a Gold [[Shoe Box]]!'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 51; chapter 5). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>

A town taken over by [[Donut]] at the start of the [[Sixth Floor|sixth floor]], as a reward she got the [[Enchanted Collar Charm of the Ifrit Bourgeoisie]].
== Rules ==
* No fighting * No alcohol * No illicit drug * No magic on the street * No dancing * No singing outside a temple * No unruly children * No gambling * No stealing * No littering * No swearing * No sexual activity outside the sanctuary of marriage * No macacs of any breed unless escorted by a dryad * No naiads * no half or quarter naiads mongrels * All high elves must register their present at the guard headquarters * All bugbears must take a bath in the river before entering and then register at the guard headquarters, funeral bells will provide soap * Absolutely, positively no dinosaurs of any kind, no exceptions [[Category:Floor 6]] [[Category:Locations]]

{{Character_info|class=Dmitri: [[Illusionist]] -> [[Visionary]] / Maxim: [[Bogatyr]]|species=Human {{!}} [[Nodling]]|first_appearance=Chapter 25, Book 3|level=44}}Fraternal twin brothers. The two of them speak with an eastern european accent.
Dmitri had just brought a [[cat]] named Capitan Whiskers.
Their game guide adviced Dmitri to select the [[nodling]] race that would give him an extra life if he'd died, he didn't realise that selecting it would force his brother into his body.
They took fatal damage during the fight against [[Imogen|Queen Imogen]] during the [[Butcher's Masquerade]] but instead of dying they were seperated and turned into babies. They were immediately transfered out of the dungeon as children are ineligible, it's implied their game guide got them to choice this option as they knew this would happen.
== Gear == Maxim has a meteroid hammer.

{{SpoilH | 3 and 4}} {{Character_info | aliases = Dr. Porthus Hu | occupation = CEO and President of Outreach Operations | first_appearance = Book 4, Epilogue | class = Rogue | species = Unknown {{!}} High Elf | organizations = [[Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)]] | status = Alive }}{{Quote | quote = I can only promise two things. Eventual death. And eventual justice.{{ref|6|epilogue}} }} '''Dr. Porthus Hu''' is a former crawler and the author of the ''[[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]] (2nd Edition)''. He is now CEO of the [[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)]]. ==Description== A crawler in the 15th season of ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]'', Porthus chose the High Elf race and Rogue class. He received the first edition of the [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]] disguised as a blank sketchbook after arriving on the ninth floor, and is the author of the second edition.{{ref|3|8}} The first edition contained "meager, mostly-useless" recipes, which he did his best to add to before accepting a deal of 100 years of indentured servitude.{{ref|4|34}} However many hundreds of cycles later, Dr. Porthus Hu is now CEO and President of Outreach Operations of the [[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)|Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)]]. He insisted that OIPAN become Carl's second sponsor on the fifth floor, believing that he and Carl "fight the same fight."{{ref|4|epilogue}} He chose to send Carl the [[Toraline]], specially commissioned and approved the design of [[Carl's Xistera|Carl's Xistera Extension]], and sent the extension in an Emergency Platinum [[Sponsorship Box|Benefactor Box]] (which Mordecai suggests may be the most expensive box in the game's history). {{ref|4|34}} ==Cookbook Entries== === On Possession ===

''It’s important to note that possession via ghost and an evicted demon inhabiting a shell are two very, very different things. They call it possession, but it is anything but. Think of an elf falling to his death off a cliff, and at the last moment, he grabs onto a root, temporarily saving him. That root is the body he now resides within. Regular possession can be defeated. Evicted demons are something else entirely. Once one of these desperate creatures has taken a shell, be it living, dead, or recently undead, the end result for that shell is always the same. Destruction. They are gone the moment the demon moves in.''

''Kill it with fire. Destroy the head. Do whatever you can. These beasts will be frantic to get back home, and they will fight with everything they have. Don’t let one grab onto you, as it will pull you into Hades. Be wary of using healing magic on demon-possessed shells. While that works well for undead, it is different when it comes to those from the realm of Sheol. It is unpredictable and can possibly make the creature stronger.''

''This is important. Do not. Do not, do not, do not. Do not under any circumstances attempt to teleport a shell that’s possessed by an evicted demon away from you. The shell will teleport and dissipate.Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (chapter 55; p. 523). ''

=== Final Entry ===
''I don’t know why this journal came to me, but I don’t feel it will ever be enough. I have done my best, adding little things here and there to the meager, mostly-useless recipes. How many generations before this book truly has enough information to make a difference? Too many, I fear. As the first to receive these words, and now, as the author of the second edition, I feel inadequate. I have not done enough.'' ''I have decided to accept the deal. I don’t know what will become of me, but I swear on the name of all my fallen brothers and sisters, one day I will make them pay. It seems those who live outside our world can exist for thousands of years. I don’t know how this is possible, but if I survive my 100 seasons of servitude, I will do everything I can to end this horror. I don’t know if I have the strength, but I will do my best to not be broken.'' ''This will be my last entry into this book, but I am not yet done with the enemy. As long as I have breath, I will fight.''
== References == [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

[[File:00198.jpg|thumb|Potion of Bloodlust]]
== Description == It’s like giving yourself a PCP enema after spending the day riding the Night Train Express.
== Effects == Drinking this potion gives the following effects for (Constitution) seconds.
* Strength times two. * Movement speed times two. * Dexterity times .5 * The ''Where the Fuck Am I? Who the Fuck Are You?'' Debuff * Constitution times .5
For every crawler, NPC, or mob killed by you while this potion is active, your movement speed increases by an additional 25%.

“Each level multiplies your damage when you’re not wielding a weapon So at level three, each kick or punch does three times the damage it normally would." - [[Mordecai]]
