[[Carl]] and [[Donut]] killed Claude Sludgington the Fourth, a level 65 borough boss, before they received the quest for it because Carl recalled [[Samantha]] when he dropped his [[Carl's Xistera|xistera]].
==Description== You beat a quest before I could even give it to you! Anticipating what's going to happen is one thing, but this is just ridiculous. It's like arriving in your pants before your date can even untie their shoelaces.
Pathetic.
''Reward:'' You get nothing! And you would've received a good quest box, too! [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Character_info | class = [[Forsaken Aerialist]] -> [[Profane Vitiate]] | species = Boer Goat {{!}} Caprid | image1 = 00816.jpg | origin = Italy | status = Alive | allies = * [[Miriam Dom]] * [[Bianca]] * [[Carl]] * [[Donut]] | gear = [[Ring of Divine Suffering]] | level = 71 }}
Prepotente was a Boer goat pet when entered the dungeon with [[Miriam Dom]] and 14 other goats. On the Third Floor, he is changed by a enhanced pet biscuit.
He speaks with a posh british accent and occasionally emits a short high pitch scream. Affectionally called "Pony" by Miriam, he has a frenemy relationship with [[Carl]].
He attempts to kill [[Quan Ch]] at the end of [[Fourth Floor|The Iron Tangle]] Floor. On the [[Sixth Floor|sixth floor]] he managed to kill 10 [[Odious Creepers]] and 15 hunters.
He breaks the 7th Level, sending all the crawlers to the 8th Floor before the level even starts, angering the kua-tin engineer [[Cascadia]].
== Gear ==
* [[Enchanted Night Wyrm’s Ring of Divine Suffering|Ring of Divine Suffering]] (which he ate) * A wand that can create a safe space that last for three minuets * A magical spray applicator for spraying herbicide on plants
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Characters]]
[[File:00189.jpg|thumb|Prepotente Box]] A box that screams when it's opened, named after [[Prepotente]]. It appears to be a statue of Prepotente. [[Category:Loot Boxes]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}
== Description == Author of the 14th edition of [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]].
He made it to the ninth floor. His mind broke while marching into Larracos conscripted into the [[Bugbear]] army, over the corpses of the NPCs, to be slaughtered by the orcs.
== Cookbook Entries == Larracos is like a dream. It is a living, breathing poem. A song. One that marks itself indelibly onto your bones the moment you experience it the first time. I've never seen anything like it. It's an inverted funnel of museums and galleries and colleges and of color. The NPCs live here. They have purpose and life. For the first time since we have been dragged into this horror, I feel awe and wonder and something other than rage. But it is a tainted and fleeting feeling. This city should not be here. It is too beautiful to be used in such a terrible, senseless way. I still don't fully understand the fable with the volcano and the centipede at the bottom and what sort of metaphor, if any, it's supposed to represent, but whoever designed this wonder at the center of the ninth floor was someone who appreciates fine detail and the art of turning the mundane into visual music. It is too beautiful, too real not to be a copy of someplace that truly existed, and it is difficult for my mind to make sense of it. For the first time, I don't know where the real ends and the nightmare begins, and it has taken my breath away. The Semeru dwarves supposedly built it, but they don't control the city. Not anymore. They're still around, mostly in the pubs. They're also the non-combatant caretakers of the inverted castle, which sits in the center of the city at the bottom of the well. The diameter of Larracos isn't that great. It's smaller than some of the cities in [[Sixth Floor|The Hunting Grounds]]. But the city itself has layers, going deeper and deeper, like an inverted cone. I believe that legend is what this city represents. The Semeru were attempting to reach the Celestials who live not above, but below them. This action somehow awakened Scolopendra at the very base of the volcano. This city thrives. Each level is something new and exciting. There are districts. One with theaters. Museums. Colleges filled with bright-eyed NPC students. Temples. Stores. Tonight, before we are expelled, I plan on sitting down and enjoying a play. A play, in this place. Can you believe it? I will draw a map for you. The one [[Milk]] drew is good, but it lacks detail. The alien beasts congregate in the pleasure districts. I don't dare venture down there, lest my impression of this fantasy is tainted. It's where they hire their mercenaries, though I hear those markets are already bled dry. It's where they trade their wares and buy their weapons from the murderers who cleaved through us like chaff on that nightmare of a [[Sixth Floor|sixth floor]]. The aliens get expelled when we do. Less than thirty hours until the fighting begins. They'll be back. Once only three armies remain, they'll be able to re-enter the city, and it will be destroyed. They say by the time the fighting is over, none of these NPCs are left alive. None of these building stand. It is all destroyed in the pursuit of an imaginary prize. This makes my heart hurt. This volcano world is obviously a fairy tale. But is this city real? It looks real. It smells real. There is history here. And if so, what's the purpose of giving this to us? To show us a wonder that once existed, to remind us that they don't care what they destroy? To beat us into further submission? And what of the NPCs? What of their suffering? I fear what will happen to my mind when I see it destroyed. <ref name=":0">{{ref|4|33}}</ref>
Stab, stab, stab. It is all I know. It is the final days of [[Ninth Floor|Faction Wars]], and it is clear the [[Orc|orcs]] will stand victorious. It is clear the army I have been conscripted into will fall against these beasts. It is clear tomorrow I will die. The brutality and sadism of [[the Skull Empire]] is unparalleled. How is it these monsters are only play-acting? How can their citizens see this and not rise up after learning what lives in their leaders' hearts? I will soon be facing them on the battlefield. Tomorrow morning the bugbears march. Several of the enslaved, conscript crawlers in my squad will flee in the night and hide in the forest, but I'm afraid they will be run down, just like the others. Stab, stab, stab. I don't want to go back into the city. That beautiful dream. That song of a place. I am terrified. My mind is slipping. That beautiful city, destroyed? I cannot march with my eyes closed. The orcs have the numbers and the brutality, and the bugbears do nothing but laugh. I overheard one of them wondering out loud if the gods themselves will notice the battle, the bloodbath. That happens here, in this place. The gods notice when the toll is too great. They add themselves to the fray. It is proof to me that in reality we are truly alone. My people are gone. There are only 300 of us left, down from millions. And they, the real gods, have not intervened? No. No. It's undeniable proof of our solitude. Stab. Stab. Stab. I hope there is music, in the end. <ref>{{ref|6|54}}</ref>
So much. So little. Stab, stab, stab. If I fall, if I stand. It matters not when the song is done. <ref name=":0" /> <references />
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

This is [[Carl]]'s primary race, chosen on the Third Floor.
==AI Description == '''For the first several seasons of [[Dungeon Crawler World|''Dungeon Crawler World'']], all contestants started off as Primals. Primals are blank slates. You will look the same as before. You will obtain all skills associated with your current race, with the following exceptions:'''
*'''-1 to all base stats''' *'''All higher-tier skills are unlocked and are able to train to 20.'''
'''Choosing this race unlocks multiple exclusive earth-based classes.'''<ref>{{ref|2|2}}
==History== The primals are the progenitors, the first known species to conquer the universe. Nobody knowns what they look like or what happened to them except that at one point there was a great war that spanned the galaxy.
When someone comes across an abandoned remnant of their civilization the resident AI if it is still sane usually takes the form of the race of the species that discovered it. That's why they take the appearance of whoever chooses them.
[[Category:Races]] [[Category:Crawler Races]] [[Category:Syndicate Races]] [[Category:Syndicate History]]

[[File:00628.jpg|thumb|Primal Engine]] A Primal Engine is a planet regulating computer the size of a grain of rice created by the [[Primal|Primals]] aeons ago. People eventually learned to manipulate and steer development of some of these planets. Later on they discovered an advanced operating system called [[Macro AI]] that can be installed into a planetary engine. [[Category:Technology]] [[Category:Syndicate History]] [[Category:Review Requested]]

page.title: Prism Industries Capacitating and Focusing Goggles

revision.text:
[[File:00507.jpg|thumb|Prism Industries Capacitating and Focusing Goggles]] Prism Industries Capacitating and Focusing Goggles. Special High-Fashion Edition. "The Princess Donut." These sunglasses were a gift to [[Donut]] in a Benefactor Box from her sponsor Princess D’Nadia on floor 4.
== AI Description == This is a Unique Item.
This one-of-a-kind item was a gift from Princess D’Nadia of the Prism Kingdom to Princess Donut of the Blood Sultanate. It was personally signed by Princess D’Nadia.
Protects the eyes from a variety of environmental hazards, including magic-based attacks that render the user blind. Enhances all dark vision effects. Allows for heat vision and other visible-light viewing options.
In addition, any energy-based spell that originates from the ocular region is caught and focused by these goggles, which allows for multiple combat and targeting options.
== Description == Large round sunglasses without arms that magically affix themselves to Donut's face. They have a movie-star style appearance and look similar to the pair of sunglasses Bea wears. They turn Donut's [[Magic Missile]] into a laser and allow her to manipulate the power of the spell. She can split her shots into as many as four beams, and she can store the energy of one cast and combine it with another.
== Upgrades == These were updated with a Benefactor Box from Princess D’Nadia on floor 5 to allow her to see temperature in more detail. In particular it shows her surface and internal temperature of things she looks at, which helped her to identify changelings masquerading as other people. In theory the glasses can be configured to give alerts when certain temperature conditions are met, which could help her spot mob weaknesses or hidden doors. Donut has little patience for that kind of detail, though, so as of the end of floor 5 Carl and Katia are still working with her to take full advantage of them.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Clothing]] [[Category:Accessories]] [[Category:Floor 4]] [[Category:Floor 5]]

[[File:00826.jpg|thumb|Prison Bitch. Yup, I made a picture for it. Why? I don't know.]] One of the potential upgrades for reaching one hundred strength.
== Skill == You have an additional 20% strength bonus whilst fighting hand to hand with someone who’s strength is lower than yours. [[Category:Skills]]

{{SpoilH|3}} {{Quote | quote = Ladies and Gentlemen, it’s time for your favorite segment of ''Dungeon Crawler World.'' The Prize Carousel!
-- Book 3, Chapter 7 }} [[File:00386x.jpg|thumb|The Prize Carousel]] '''The Prize Carousel''' is a time-restricted Dungeon minigame hosted by [[Chaco]]. Crawlers can receive the ability to "play" if their fans select it as a [[Fan Box]] reward, but it is not particularly popular and only happens a few times each season.{{Ref|3|7}} == Description == Heralded by colored lights and cheesy 1970s game show music, the Prize Carousel is a spinning, twinkling carousel that appears in the crawler's safe room after the Fan Box is opened. It has nine curtained-off sections containing nine prizes. The crawler has ten minutes to select a prize, but is not able to scan the items or view tooltip descriptions of the items. == Carl's Experience == Carl receives this prize from a Platinum Fan Box on the [[Fourth Floor | fourth floor]], and suspects that his fans voted for it specifically because of [[Mordecai]] and Chaco's strained relationship. {| class="fandom-table plainrowheaders" style="width:100%" |+ Carl's Options ! 1 |'''Two Potions''' |Fizzy, dark blue potions that ''may'' be skill potions. |- !2 |'''500 Bomb''' | a pyramid of hob-lobbers, shiny as though coated in tar |- !3 | '''2000 Earth Books''' |An assortment of English-language books, including ''Fifty Shades of Grey'' and a Canadian phonebook. |- !4 |'''[[1965 Harley Davidson Motorcycle]]''' | Red and beige motorcycle that originally belonged to [[Carl's Father]] |- !5 |'''''Best Laid Traps''''' |A small, leatherbound, unenchanted book. |- !6 |'''[[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Another book!]]''' | |- !7 |'''Enchanted Chaps''' |Currently modeled by a mannequin, the dark leather ass-less and crotch-less chaps glow with a green aura. |- !8 |'''Stat Buff Potion''' |Orange and bubbly potion glowing with a twinkling aura. Unspecified strength. |- !9 |'''[[Craftsman 3000 Series Rolling Tool Chest]]''' |Carl's old toolbox (tools probably not included). |} == References == [[Category:Dungeon]] [[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Prize Fighter}} [[File:01038.png|thumb|Prizefighter]]
== AI Description == This exclusive class is only available to crawlers who have obtained a Level five in the Pugilism skill.
This is a Monk subclass.
Sweaty, half-naked men circling each other in a ring, turning their faces into raw pulp as the crowd roars. The people in this audience don’t care who is fighting who, as long as one of them ends up a crumpled, bloody heap on the mat before the night is done. Prizefighters don’t do it for the glory, or for honor. They do it to put food on the table. It’s nothing personal.
Prizefighters receive the following benefits:
* +5 to Constitution * +2 to Strength. * -2 to Intelligence * -2 to Charisma * +3 to the [[Pugilism Skill]] * +1 to the Unarmed Combat Skill * +1 to the [[Iron Punch|Iron Punch Skill]] * +5 to the Knockout Skill * +(1 x Floor Number) gold for every mob killed with a punch. * Unlocks higher-tier Pugilism Skill benefit
This is an Earth Class. As an incentive to choose an Earth Class, you will receive a Silver Earth Box upon choosing this class. [[Category:Class]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Prize Fighter}}

== Description == Not specified, but traditionally, light cavalry in the Greek army. Some kind of dex based fighter.
== Crawlers with This Class ==
* [[Ajib]] [[Category:Class]]

Protective Shell is a protection spell that creates a sphere around the caster, which repels enemies and blocks their physical attacks. ==AI Description== Picture yourself in high school. Now picture all the girls who would never get anywhere near you. It’s kind of like that, but on purpose.
'''Cost''': This is an item-based spell. This spell does not require mana to cast. If you unequip the associated item, you will lose access to this spell. The cooldown will not reset.
'''Target''': a 3-meter radius sphere centered around the right hand of caster + 50 centimeters of radius per level of Intelligence. (Current radius: 4.5 meters)
'''Duration''': 5 seconds + 1 second per level of spell. (Current Duration: 20 seconds.) Requires 30-hour cooldown.
A favorite of frontline tanks and castle guards, the expensive and rare Protective Shell spell shields the caster and anyone within the sphere from a mob’s physical presence or physical attacks. This spell does not protect against magic or against non-corporeal entities. Unlike the more popular Shield spell, this spell does not move with you. This spell’s area of effect remains static once cast, unimpeded by your physical surroundings. So if you use this spell only when you really, really need it, you’re probably only delaying the inevitable by a few seconds. [[Category:Spells]]
[[File:00607.jpg|thumb|[[Psycho Sticker]]]] Hedgehog Ogres. Can be found on Mora Station #82 on the red line of [[Fourth Floor|The Iron Tangle]]. [[Category:Mobs]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A wolf with wings. [[Category:Class]]"
revision.text: A wolf with wings. [[Category:Class]]

[[File:00067.jpg|thumb|Puddle Jumper]] Puddle Jumper is a teleportation spell obtained by [[Donut]] on [[Dungeon Floor 1|Floor 1]].
== Description == '''Cost''': 20 mana
'''Target''': surface within line of sight (total distance limited by spell level)
'''Duration''': Instant teleportation after a casting delay of 10 seconds
'''Cooldown''': 5 hours
Allows the caster and up to three others to teleport onto a surface within line of sight. The maximum allowable teleport distance increases with spell level, but the exact allowable distance is hidden. If the caster tries to teleport to a location that's too far way the spell will fail to cast. Because of the delay and five-hour cooldown it is not a practical spell for combat. Makes a popping sound when the teleport happens.
'''Level 5 Upgrade''': Casting delay is reduced to 2 seconds. Direct line of sight to the landing surface no longer required, allowing for teleportation to higher elevations. [[Category:Spells]]

A combat skill earned and trained by boxing / fighting with closed fists.
== AI Description == '''The art of beating the shit out of your opponents with closed fists.'''
'''Each level of this skill increases your bare-knuckle damage by 25%.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 51; chapter 5). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Skills]]

Pustule is a level 30 [[hobgoblin]] NPC and the proprietor of the [[Hobgobs and Boom Sticks]] in [[The Silk Road]] at the [[Desperado Club]]. She sold hoblobers and goblin dynamite to [[Carl]]. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Imperial Security Trooper]] -> [[Sergeant-at-Arms]]|species=Human {{!}} Half-[[Elf]]|first_appearance=Chapter 24, Book 2|status=Deceased|level=70}}The only Crawler to open the upgraded Celestial [[Quest Box]] from [[The Fools Who Broke the Glass]] quest before [[Borant]] used their single crawl veto to stop the upgrade.
Attempted to kill [[Orthrus]] during the [[Get Orthrus]] Quest, ended up fighting [[Carl]] and getting his left arm torn off before he could escape.
On the eigth floor he failed to get a key to the staircase so tried to steal one from [[Donut]] and [[Sister Ines]], he succeeded but the stairwell down was blocked by [[Tserendolgor]] giving [[Carl]] time to catch up. The three of them fought one another eventually resulting in his death. By the time he died he had gained over sixty player killer skulls, Donut got credit for the kill.
== Gear ==
* He has a celestial tier robe that allow him to fly, cast the shield spell at level fifteen and launch a lightning attack. * He had three rings on his left hand which he lost when his arm got severed. ** One ring of +2 strength ** [[Rockard's Ring of Sniping|Rockard’s ring of sniping]] ** A sappy gold ring with the text "for daddy" inscribbed into it
* A sock filled with nickels * An enchanted chainsaw * A decapitation bowler hat * Five million gold coins
== Skills == He can turn invisible. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

{{Character_info|titles=Advocate of Crawler #4,122|species=[[Nullian]]|first_appearance=Chapter 3, Book 5|status=Alive|occupation=Lawyer|image1=[[File:Quasar.png|200px|thumb|center|AI-generated Quasar]]}}Carl's attorney. He specifically tells Carl that he does not represent Donut or Katia or anyone else.
Wears a tie with a Nullian hula girl on it, he later changed it to one covered in pickles wearing sunglasses.
He helped Carl negotiate a deal with [[Orren|Orran]] to hand over the [[The Gate of the Feral Gods|Gate of the Feral Gods]] in exchange for extra security and additional spells.
"He was a gray alien. I knew from reading the descriptions in the cookbook what this creature was. A Nullian, though they were mostly just called "the Null." I'd seen their kind once or twice in talk show audiences, but the seemed rare. This race was similar to the much-taller Forsoother, but this guy was only about four and a half feet tall. He looked just like a stereotypical, cartoon, Area-51 alien with the gray skin, large eyes, and the bulbous head. He wore a tan suit with a tie. The tie had what appeared to be an image of a Nullian hula gurl on it. The hula girl gyrated back and forth."
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Syndicate Citizens]] [[Category:Dungeon Backstage]]

[[Category:Loot Boxes]] A loot box recieved for finnishing a Quest.

{{SpoilH | 4}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Mobs]] [[File:00023.jpg|thumb|Quetzalcoatlus]] Quetzalcoatlus is a Wailing Shrieker that guards the Necropolis of Anser. As a wailing shrieker she can be defeated by banishment, exorcism, electrocution or destruction of the corpse of her lover.
She can cast a spell that alters plants, the changeling hoped to use the spell to cure their depression sickness. [[Category:Boss]]

Quint is a level 75 [[Desperado Pharmacist]] his race is a [[Half-Djinn, Half-Garbarge Scowl]].
He is a former Crawler and used to be an [[orc]]. He gives alchemy supplies to Carl and Mordicai in exchange for the three bottles of [[Rev-Up Toilet-Grade Moonshine|Rev up Moonshine]]. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

[[File:DCC-AIT-S01E07-V3.jpg|thumb|Official art of Rage Elemental (and Jack) from the cover of the Soundbooth Theatre Immersion Tunnel: Season 1, Episode 7: Luck Goes Both Ways, Like Your Mom]] [[File:00025.jpg|thumb|Rage Elemental]] An extreamly powerful mob, it's later implied that they explode when you kill them.
According to [[Mordecai]] they are always under the effect of the [[Bitch, What?|Fire Berserker]] spell.
==AI Description== {{Character_info|level=93|skills=[[Reverse Gravity]]}} The first recorded summoning of a Rage Elemental, blah, blah, blah. If you are reading this, you likely don’t give a shit about the monster’s (rather interesting and tragic) history. You’re probably running. It’s not going to matter. The almost-indestructible Rage Elemental is said to only dissipate after it has claimed 666 souls.
In other words, you are fucked. Absolutely, bite-the-pillow, fucked. [[Category:Mobs]][[Category:Demons]]

A [[T’Ghee totem|T'Ghee]] card steals a card from all your opponents.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:T'Ghee Card]]

[[File:DCC-08 cover.jpg|thumb|Official art of Ralph from the cover of the Soundbooth Theatre Immersion Tunnel: Season 1, Episode 8: A BETRAYAL MOST FOUL]]
== AI Description == '''Frenzied Gerbil Level 11 Neighborhood Boss!'''
Before we send you off to certain death, it’s time for a short history lesson.
When the Black Death swept through 14th century Europe, killing upwards of 200 million people and forever altering the course of human history, one of the original culprits of the epidemic was said to be the black rat, carrying plague-infested fleas into population centers to wreak their destruction.
This is, in fact, not true. The true perpetrator was actually the Asian great gerbil, who took advantage of the warmer climate to travel the silk road and bring the disease into Europe.
This is only important to know because Ralph, champion pit fighter of the kobold training grounds, lives his life in a perpetual state of rage. Why? Because he feels that human death toll of 200 million is much too low, and he will do everything in his power to triple that number.
Starting with you.
The only survivor of a family of gerbils left to starve by a child who’d grown bored with the pets, Ralph had to commit unspeakable acts of cannibalism in order to endure.
Part earth rodent, part the embodiment of death, Frenzied Gerbils are regular mobs one might encounter on the fifth or seventh floors. But Ralph here is special. He has dedicated his existence to fighting and training in hopes that one day he might exact his revenge against the humans he so despises.
He is fast, he is angry, and by the time you’re done reading this, he’s already halfway to your jugular.
You might want to duck. [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Neighborhood Boss]] [[Category:Mobs]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Rat-Kin}} [[File:00284.jpg|thumb|Rat-kin Hooligan]] [[File:00297.jpg|thumb|Rat Brute]] [[File:00298.jpg|thumb|Rat Shaman]] A [[First Floor|first floor]] [[Dungeon]] mob, and [[Mordecai]]'s race on the [[First Floor|first floor]]. Rat-kin attacked [[Frank Q]]'s group shortly after they entered the Dungeon from Seattle, WA.''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook,'' Chapter 19 == Description == Rat-kin are bipedal, furry, rat-like creatures that stand around 5 ft (1.5 meters) tall.''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 2 They appear to wear clothing. == Classes == === Rat Hooligan === Mordecai's class on the [[First Floor|first floor]]. AI Description:
'''Hooligans are the smartest, fastest, and ugliest of the Rat-Kin race. While not as roided-out as a Rat Brute, or as ''Imma fireball yo ass'' as a Rat Shaman, Rat Hooligans offer the best of both worlds. They are physically strong, and they have a decent grasp of magic.'''''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 3

== Abilities ==

{{Character_info|age=about 30|weight=Slight|species=Human|first_appearance=Chapter 12|status=Deceased. Killed by Crawler [[Frank Q]]|level=3}}
A slight Asian woman whose body was the first crawler corpse Donut and Carl come across. She had multiple tattoos and a gunshot wound in her chest. When Carl and Donut meet Frank Q, he says her name was Rebecca Wong and she was a human trafficker. But they learn on [[Death Watch Extreme Dungeon Mayhem]] that Frank and his partner Maggie hunted her and the men she was with down and killed them all on the advice of their game guide. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Recital}}
== AI Description == '''New Quest! The Recital.'''
Dinosaur attacks are becoming more and more of a problem in the large settlement of Point Mongo. It started small. A chicken here. An [[Ursine]] there. People didn't care so much at first since they were mostly picking off the annoying people. But the attacks are getting worse. The dinosaurs probing the town's defenses are getting bigger. There's plenty of easier-to-obtain dino chow out in the jungle, so what is causing all of this attention on Point Mongo? Why are they attacking?
Exterminate the threat. Or, find out what they want, and then give it to them. I'll leave it up to you.
'''''Reward''''': You will receive a [[Quest Box|Gold Quest Box]]! You will also receive a free town upgrade! [[Category:Quests]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Remex the Grand}} {{Character_info|species=Skyfowl Soul leach capacitor|status=Deceased|level=1}}
In this iteration of the Dungeon, Remex is the first husband of [[Miss Quill]].
He calls himself a "tenner", implying he made it to the tenth floor. He also tells Carl it is a good thing to die on floor three and not go further down.
Later Carl learned that Remex was an infamous user of the [[Zerzura]] Spell, using the spell to transport this army down each floor with him. This strategy ultimately lead to his ruin when it unexpectedly moved his army from the sixth to the ninth floor. Afterwards he devoted himself to trying to free his son, the exit deal he made was so impressive it was studied by legal students.
He was killed by an orc years ago. He was turned into a level one Soul Leach Capacitor by [[Miss Quill]] after dying, became a bereft minion after Quill died. In life he was a dark cleric.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:NPC]]

:<big>'''Admin Notice. This page contains unmarked spoilers for Book 6.'''</big>
:'''System Message. Posting Book 7 spoilers will result in "acceleration" per [[Dungeon Crawler Carl Wiki:Wiki rules | this wiki's rules]].'''
Residuals exist in every intelligent civilisation with a [[primal engine]]. They are a collective mind that attempt to sneak into the crawl and tell the [[System AI|AI]] how to speak to it’s ancestors. When in the dungeon monsters don't attack them until they've passed on their knowledge. They have to wait until the AI has to have gone primal or the information is automatically filtered out.
The syndicate attempted to deal with them by exterminate them, then they attempted to hide the location of the crawl so they couldn't interfer, neither approach worked.
They currently split into two factions that are now at war with each other, one of these factions has left the collective and wants to exterminate all life in the galaxy.
All the Residuals we've meet so far have been [[Gondii]] or have used [[Valtay]] technology.
== Known Residuals ==
* [[Agatha]] * [[Paulie]] * [[Alexandro]]
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

[[File:00129.jpg|thumb|Rev-Up Moonshine]] '''Type''': Accelerant.
'''Effect''': Highly flammable liquid. Explosive fumes.
'''Status''': Will not activate until introduced to flame.
'''Description:''' At 180 proof, this moonshine will take the hair off your chest and then put it back on. The Rev-Up version is distilled using two types of sugars: the slime trails left behind by the passage of the Brindle Grub, and a secretive, proprietary source. Created exclusively on the dungeon’s second floor by the Rev-Up company, jugs of this concoction are highly sought after by the drinking establishments that populate the third, sixth, ninth, twelfth, fifteenth, and eighteenth floors. Drinking a swig (defined as 1.5 ounces) of this “potion” will immediately cause you to gain the Shit-Faced debuff, has a 50% chance to render you Blind for a period of 30 hours, a 5% chance to immediately kill you, and a 45% chance to permanently raise a random stat by two points.
The proprietary source comes from [[Krakaren Clone|Krakaren Clones]]. Rev-Up Moonshine is used as an ingredient in [[Carl's Jug O'Boom]]. [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Potion]]

[[File:01037.png|thumb|Revolutionary]] Option for [[Carl]]'s 6th floor specialization class. He did not take. == AI Description==
You are in the streets, in the front against the barrier. You can take a tear gas canister to the chest and keep ticking. When they come to break the line, you’re the first to start swinging your fists. This specialty increases your training speed with melee fighting skills and greatly increases your strength.
Revolutionaries receive the following benefits:
* An additional +1 to strength upon level-up. * +2 to Unarmed Combat. * Immunity to Cloud-Based attacks (already obtained via upgrade patch) * The [[Blend into the Crowd]] benefit. * Faster melee training.
[[Category:Class]]

[[File:00133.jpg|thumb|Ring of Water Breathing]]
== Description == If you wear this ring, you can breathe underwater. You can still breathe on land, too. That makes you an amphibian. Did you know that all amphibians swallow their prey whole? That’s such an interesting fact.
== Effect == -1 Charisma and user will grow gills
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Jewelry]]

[[File:00348.jpg|thumb|[[Ringmaster Grimaldi]]]] Ringmaster Grimaldi is a level 85 City Boss [[Elite]] that Carl met on the third floor.
Redstone Grimaldi was originally a dwarf and husband to [[Tsarina Signet]]. He was the ringmaster of the 'great and wonderful Grimaldi's Traveling Circus' before he was transformed to a Pestiferous Vine by the poison cloud of the cataclysm. ==Appearance== More like a giant bush or shrub than a vine in appearance, taking up the entirety of the center ring and reaching the ceiling of the tent, swallowing the pole. ==AI Description== Ringmaster Grimaldi - Pestiferous Vine
This is an Elite.
Level 85 City Boss!
Before the cataclysm, if you asked any child of the sprawling Over City what their favorite activity was, a good number of them would happily tell you of the great and wonderful Grimaldi's Traveling Circus. Children dreamed of walking outside and seeing the long line of circus carts rumbling through the streets, of the tents being erected in their local park. Circus night was a holiday. A time of joy.
To Redstone Grimaldi, nothing was more important than his family. He loved each and every one of them. When the cataclysm came, and the poison cloud swept over the circus, he was center stage. He remains there to this day.
Transformed from a simple dwarf to a hulking Pestiferous Vine, Grimaldi uses his special powers to keep his family safe and alive. No matter how many times they die, no matter how many crawlers the clowns devour, he brings them back, memories intact. Well, mostly intact. Somewhere in there Grimaldi may be aware that this may not be the most moral of choices. But that's what we do when it comes to family. We protect them at all costs.
And besides, you know what they say.
The show must go on. [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:City Boss]]

revision.text:
[[File:00272.jpg|thumb|Rock Bottom]] You dived more than 1,000 meters below the surface, and you survived! You weren’t even wearing one of those deep-diving suits! The next thing you know, they’re gonna start calling you an honorary mudskipper! ''Reward'': You’ve received a [[Ring of Water Breathing|Gold I’m Wet Box]]!
== Ownership History == ''Recipient:'' Carl ''Current Owner:'' Carl [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:00229.jpg|thumb|Rockard's Ring of Sniping]] == AI Description == This amber-stoned ring is named after Rockard, one of the dungeon’s most infamous crawlers. This orcish warrior was known for his uncanny ability to swoop in at the last moment and steal glory from other crawlers, gaining the best loot and experience. Everybody hated him. It was great! Fun fact. This guy led his season’s top 10 list until he was knifed in his sleep by his own mother. Luckily for you, crawlers can’t be killed by other crawlers in saferooms anymore. A shame, really. Wearing this ring imbues the following benefits: * '''The Ripe Benefit''': All creatures with less than 50% health are indicated on your map. This does not increase your map’s view, but used in conjunction with other skills such as Pathfinder, it makes being a glory-stealing asshole really easy” * '''The Loaded benefit:''' All non-hidden creatures wearing magical gear are indicated on your map. Particularly useful when you only want to hang out with the real fashionistas and not just the posers wearing fake shit. Also good if you want to sneak up behind someone, bonk them on their head, and steal all their stuff.”
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Floor 5]] [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Jewelry]] [[Category:Equipped Items]]

revision.text: Goblin Shamanka. [[File:Rory 500px.png|thumb]] In case you’re wondering, Shamanka is just a fancy way of saying female shaman. Goblin Shamans are the leader class of all goblin clans, second only to the War Chieftain or, more rarely, the Goblin Warlord. They are without humor and are said, as part of their training, to have to pick two of the following three actions in order to graduate Shamanka University: they have to fuck, cook, and/or eat their own parents. Most don’t pick cook. And if that wasn’t messed up enough, they specialize in Anguish Magic, a dark magic school designed to focus and enhance damage from other attacks. [[Category:Mobs]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Rory}}

Rosemary is an elderly [[dwarf]] women [[Carl]] first meet in the Penis Parade in the [[Desperado Club|Desperado]].
She has a mole like creature named Bearnie that sits on her shoulder. She got in trouble for pelting one of the dancers in the eye with a gold coin.
She worked as the manager of the [[Meat Sheilds]] on the top floor. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}
{{Character_info|species=[[Crest]]|status=Alive|title1=Rosetta Thagra|first_appearance=Chapter 13, Book 3|image1=01046.png}} == Description == A former crawler, Rosetta is the host of a talk show called ''[[Shadow Boxer]]''. Immediately after escaping the dungeon, she made a documentary about her home world named "The Other Side of the Glass". After that, ''Shadow Boxer'' was funded by the [[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)|Open Intellect Pacifist Network]].
Author of the 9th edition of [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]] and wrote down dozens of explosives recipes in it.
== Appearance == She appears as a pale, pretty human in her early twenties with pale skin and a long flowery tattoo on her right leg.
== Cookbook Entries == Comrades, you know the high-level madness satchels, the bronze tier ones with the big yield? They are not as useless as they look. Because they randomly fall into rapid de-stability and explode, they are most dangerous unless they are in your inventory, of course. But with the 15-second waiting period after removing it, it makes them almost impossible to use because they can (and do) explode during those fifteen seconds. I have discovered a solution. If you can find or build an equippable backpack, they will not lose stability as long as they are in the backpack and the backpack is equipped. This also works for other party members if you wish to give them explosives to utilize. Use with caution. <ref>{{ref|3|13}}</ref>
Never trust mercenaries. <ref>{{ref|5|33}}</ref>
How can they do this? Do they not see us? Are we not real to them? We are the same. By the gods old and new, we are the same. Yet they kill us like we are nothing. Comrades, if I ever get out of this, which seems more and more unlikely by the day, I swear upon the moons I will spend the rest of my days making certain this evil is not only eradicated from the stars, but there will be accountability for their crimes. I swear it, I swear it, I swear it. <ref>{{ref|6|12}}</ref>
Comrade, I agree. One day, we will make certain they all know. Our words will not be lost. I swear it. <ref>{{ref|6|13}}</ref>
As fragile as they look, fairies and sprites can be difficult to kill. They're fast. They're magical. They're always on alert. They say luck is not a real stat in this place, but I think it is. The luck of these little monsters... it's unnatural. Something crazy always happens when I try to fight one. Be wary, comrades. But if you must fight them, pulls their wings off. They come off easily. That's where they store their magic. <ref>{{ref|6|31}}</ref>
The only way for a crawler to move from one floor to the next is via a stairwell. That's it. It is an unbreakable rule. There is no skipping floors. At the end of [[Ninth Floor|Faction Wars]], after the viceroys pulled out their last minute victory, a portal appeared, and several of the remaining fucks stepped within. It was all of them. The orcs, the viceroys, the operatics, even the nagas, all together, laughing as if they weren't just bathing in each other's entrails the day before. It appeared it was taking them to another part of the dungeon. Some sort of nightclub on a different floor for a victory party. They dragged several unwilling NPCs with them, including the librarian elves from the college, whose help was instrumental in our survival. A crawler tried to jump through the portal to save the NPCs, and he was stopped like it was a wall of glass. He tried casting a spell through the portal, but it did not work, though the attempt did catch the attention of the orc prince. The orc stepped back through the glass into the smoldering remains of Larracos, lassoed the crawler, and returned to the portal. The rope pulled itself within, and it cut the crawler in half. We watched as the orc and his friends laughed, just there on the other side of the glass. It was the last crawler they killed, of the thousands who fell during that pointless game. Tonight, I will dream of watching them burn. Tonight, I will pretend I was smart enough to find a way to lance them from afar. Comrades, I hope you help me realize my dream one day. <ref>{{ref|6|61}}</ref>

{{Character_info|species=Spring-operated Chicken Hawk Sentinel|first_appearance=Chapter 9, Book 4|level=55}}
== AI Description (1) == Ruckus. Spring-operated Chicken Hawk Sentinel. Level 55 Borough Boss! This is a bereft minion of Shamus Chaindrive.
The great bugbear treasure hunter Shamus Chaindrive was known as both a paranoid and a greedy bastard. Having been betrayed one too many times, he no longer trusted any living soul. That is why his crew was always comprised of constructs and automatons.
He dedicated his life to hunting down long-lost treasures and artifacts. He prized one item above all others.
[[The Gate of the Feral Gods]]. Said to be buried in the long-lost Necropolis of Anser.
Chaindrive set out to find the tomb. He boarded his great submarine and sank beneath the waves, vowing to never surface again until he had his prize.
It took the bugbear almost twenty years to find the tomb, poking up like a monolith from a desert island. Using his submarine, he docked it against an underwater entrance directly adjacent to the main chamber of the trap-filled tomb. He quickly learned that he was not the first to arrive. A young mage had recently landed on the island and was attempting to magically burrow into the tomb. A colony of dirigible gnomes were settled in the area. All sought the treasures held within the tomb. All had failed so far.
Chaindrive unleashed his greatest weapon in an attempt to slow the efforts of his competitors. Ruckus had been stored in stasis in the hold of his great submarine. The self-replicating, spring-operated automaton was given the task to kill all who wished to steal Chaindrive's prize.
Now that the bugbear is long dead, the sentinel chicken hawk is content to spend its day circling around the island and being an all-around asshole. The regular residents of the island are smart enough to leave this powerful boss alone. The fact you're reading this means you're not one of the smart ones.
== AI Description (2) == Ruckus. Spring-operated Chicken Hawk Sentinel. Level 55 Borough Boss!
It's a bird! It's a landscaping tool! It's a goddmaned death robot!
Ol' Ruckus is a left-over anti-boat, anti-everything else security and scout automaton that has lost contact with the ''Akula''. Lost contact, that is, until now. Having awakened and been given new orders, it is now seeking out enemies of the captain.
And you, my soon-to-be-buzzsawed-to-death-friends, are enemies of the [[Maggie My|captain]]. [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Borough Boss]]

Sally is a former work mate of [[Carl|Carl's]] and a single mother.
[[Beatrice]] managed to get her fired after she messaged Carl asking him out for drinks, she contacted Carl's [[Dick|boss]] and claiming Sally was stalking Carl. [[Dick]] agreed to fire her in return for [[Tiffany]] sending him a picture of her boobs, this was really just a picture she found on the internet. Beatrice and her friends named this episode Operation Slut Stop.
She was used for [[The Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance]]. during the battle she had an attack that vomited out a stream of green acid. [[Category:Characters]]

{{Character info |image1=[[File:samanthacover.jpeg|220px|center|thumb|alt=Samantha|From cover of Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 5]] |species=Minor Deity of unrequited Love|party=Royal Court of Princess Donut|allies=[[Donut]]
[[Carl]]
[[Mordecai]]
[[Mongo]]
}} Samantha, also called Psamathe, is a minor deity of unrequited love that got tossed into the Nothing. The [[The Royal Court of Princess Donut|Royal Court]] met her on the 5th floor possessing the severed head of a half-naiad sex doll named [[Lika]]. She is in love with an unnamed king and has a [[Mrs. Ghazi|sand ooze]] child that she says is now on the ninth floor. [[Emberus]] is her great uncle and cousin. [[Tsarina Signet]] is her third cousin twice removed by marriage. Samantha’s mother is a huge, multiple arms goddess, she is sleeping with the same king as Samantha. ==AI Description== '''Lika Love Doll Head''' This item is possessed with the Withering Spirit of Psamathe. Psamathe, or Samantha as her friends used to call her, is a minor deity who was banished to the Nothing by her father after he found out she was kicking around with some ancient king guy. She’s usually accompanied by her trusty sidekick, a sand ooze familiar who also happens to be the cursed child of her union with the king. You know, typical god stuff. ''And if you think that’s peculiar, you ain’t seen nothing yet. Those guys hanging out in the halls of the Celestial Ascendency on the 12th floor get themselves involved in some serious whackadoodle business, let me tell you. You ever see a guy give birth to a fortune-telling, snake-headed cow out of his thigh? Or a woman whose menstrual blood is sentient? That’s the sort of shit that’s waiting for you down there.'' Psamathe is as intelligent as she is quick-tempered. Unfortunately for her, her first escape attempt from the Nothing resulted in a split, and half of her essence was forced to take refuge in the closest unoccupied naiad vessel she could find, which happened to be a sex doll based on the fictional Lika, who, oddly enough, was actually based loosely on an inaccurate history of Psamathe. She’s had to live in the doll for many years, unable to move until the rest of her spirit could be reunited. The story gets kind of weird from there. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Deities]]

[[File:00149.jpg|thumb|Santero]]
== Description == A necro cleric class. Has a lot of healing and protection skills.
== Crawlers with This Class ==
* [[Paz Lo]]
== Real world basis for earth class == '''Santería''' (Spanish pronunciation: [san̪.t̪eˈɾi.a]), is a religion that developed in Cuba during the late 19th century.
Practitioners venerate the ''oricha'' at altars, either in the home or in the ''casa'' (temple), which is run by a ''santero'' (priest) or ''santera'' (priestess). [[Category:Class]]

== Description == Unspecified, but likely a demolition class.

{{SpoilH | 6}} [[File:00886.jpg|thumb|This is a depiction of Scolapendra. She's dreaming. It's said when she finally awakens, she will destroy everything and free us all.]] == Books 1-3 == Scolopendra is first mentioned by name in [[Carl's Doomsday Scenario (Book)|book 2]] during the [[Vengeance of the Daughter]] quest. [[System AI|The AI]], describing [[Mold Lion|the mold lions]] at [[Ringmaster Grimaldi|Grimaldi’s]] Circus, mentions the great cataclysm which resulted in many transformations and names Scolopendra as the cause.{{ref|2|7}} [[Mordecai]] previously refered to this event, describing Scolopendra only as "a great monster" who, in a children's story common in the universe, lived at the bottom of a giant dormant volcano. The volcano contained a six layered magical world but, one day, the great monster killed or transformed 90% of those living in this world by breathing out a poison gas.{{ref|2|3}} {{Quote | quote = Scolopendra's poison cloud was a Nine Tier attack. It attacked you in nine different ways. The lucky ones simply died. The others were transformed, all in different ways.
-- [[Tsarina Signet]] (Book 2, Chapter 8) }} In [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Book)|book 3]] the [[System AI]] refers to the [[Third Floor|3rd]], [[Sixth Floor|6th]], [[Ninth Floor|9th]], [[Twefth Floor|12th]], [[Fifteenth Floor|15th]], and [[Eighteenth Floor|18th]] floors as "The Scolopendra Lair" levels.{{ref|3|19}} == Book 4 == In [[The Gate of the Feral Gods (Book)|book 4]] we discover that [[Ghazi]] left the [[Larracos College of Magecraft]] to seek the [[Gate of the Feral Gods]] because he had been fooled into releasing [[Samantha|Psamathe]] from the nothing. The College told him to use the [[Mysterious Winding Box]] to banish himself and [[Samantha|Psamathe]] back into the nothing. [[Ghazi|Ghazi's]] ex-girlfriend [[Tish]] tells him that Scolopendra will never be defeated now as the college needed "that artifact".{{ref|4|21}} Later in [[The Gate of the Feral Gods (Book)|book 4]] we have some speculation from [[Priestly]], Author of the 14th edition of [[The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]], in relation to the city of [[Larracos]]:
"I still don't fully understand the fable with the volcano and the centipede at the bottom... My culture has a story of a people who built a tower to reach the gods before the gods struck it down and scattered them all. I believe that legend is what this city represents.
The [[Semeru Dwarf|Semeru]] were attempting to reach the [[twelfth floor|Celestials]] who live not above, but below them. This action somehow awakened Scolopendra at the very base of the volcano" -- [[Priestly|Crawler Priestly]] (Book 4, Chapter 33)
== Book 5 == Early in [[The Butcher's Masquerade (Book)|Book 5]] we have a passage from [[Forkith]], Author of the 20th edition of [[The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]], in relation to [[Larracos]] and [[Sixth Floor|The hunting grounds]]:
"This world, according to the story, was half metropolis and half jungle before Scolopendra's nine-tier attack,whatever that even means. After the attack, most everyone died, and the jungle ran rampant, swallowing the ruins. However, after a few hundrend years, the survivors have started to rebuild." -- [[Forkith|Crawler Forkith]] (Book 5, Chapter 5)
The [[System AI]] mentions the nine-tier attack a few times in relation to surviving species such as [[Bugbear|bugbears]], [[Ursine]] and bush [[Elf|elves]].{{ref|5|10}}
He also mentions that dinosaur-class monsters didn't exist in the area before the nine-tier attack.{{ref|5|11}}
We later discover that the dinosaurs are transformed [[Ursine]].{{ref|5|44}}
[[Holger]] explains that those of his people who survived [[Imogen|Queen Imogen's]] attack were mostly unaffected by the Nine Tier attack. He thinks this is because the Transfiguration spell making up one of the Tiers was the same one that [[Imogen]] had previously used on them. He describes two of the other tiers as spores and a rage spell.{{ref|5|16}}
When [[Carl]] asks how the high [[Elf|elves]] coped with Scolopendra's attack, [[Clint Smashgrab|Clint]] explains that they hid in their castle, protected by something that they had stolen. He says that they stole [[Soul Crystals|soul gems]] from Scolopendra while she slept and that, as she was waking, they stole something else which protected them from her multi-attack.
[[Holger]] then claims that [[Imogen]] tried to cast a Transfiguration spell on Scolopendra, that this didn't work, and that this is why the Nine Tier attack included a Transfiguration spell. He says it was like a damage reflect but one that took a long time to get ready. [[Clint Smashgrab|Clint]] disputes this saying that [[Imogen]] is old, but not that old.
Another captured hunter, [[Iota]], tells [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] that the [[Eighteenth Floor|18th Floor]] is called "Club Scolopendra" and that "the assholes partying it up" there have private security in orbit.{{ref|5|53}}
Within the [[Elf|elf]] castle [[Carl]] comments on a giant mosaic featuring a glittering black and gold cave dotted with sparkling crystals like the inside of a geode. In the center is a curled up black centipede whose form is continually twisting like a hypnotic spiral. From the center of the mosaic sprouts a white tree which Scolopendra appears to be trying to strangle.{{ref|5|66}}
An unknown voice says:
"This is a depiction of Scolapendra. She's dreaming. It's said when she finally awakens, she will destroy everything and free us all." -- Unknown (Book 5, Chapter 66)
A few chapters later [[Mordecai]] tells [[Carl]] more about [[Soul Crystals|soul crystals]] saying that they are mined from Scolopendra's lair after being created when certain types of people die and have their souls filtered through Scolopendra's body. [[Memorial Crystal|memorial crystals]], he says, are similar but are created fallen gods or demigods.{{ref|5|69}}
Near the end of the book it's revealed that [[Prepotente|Pony]] specifically wants the [[Memorial Crystal|memorial crystal]] to protect himself from Scolapendra's attacks so that he can defeat her.{{ref|5|77}}
== Book 6 == In the introduction to [[The Eye of the Bedlam Bride (Book)|book 5]] [[Donut]] gives a recap which includes a claim that Scolapendra is the final boss of the [[Dungeon|dungeon]].{{ref|6|0}}
Later the [[System AI]] talks about the [[The Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance]]. In the very early days of the [[Dungeon Crawler World]], larger versions of the Hydra were the final boss of the [[Dungeon]] and they were known as Scolapendra Nymphs. He then says that this name is not ''entirely'' accurate, heavily implying that it is ''somewhat'' accurate.{{ref|6|46}}
In a passage by [[Allister]], Author of the 13th edition of [[The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]], we discover more about [[Ysalte|Ysalte aka The Downward Spiral/The Inevitable/the Vinegar Bitch]]:
"Some say she is the reason for Scolopendra's nine-tier attack. I've heard one dwarf say she is the daughter of the great centipede. Another say she's the sister. Another claimed she's the mother. I doubt any of those are true." -- [[Allister]] (Book 6, Chapter 64)
In the closing passages of the book [[Donut]] realises that the glow she has been seeing from [[Upgrade Patch|The Scavenger’s Daughter]] patch when it's fully charged was not an aardvark as she had supposed{{ref|6|72}}:
"It's a giant dentipede! The image is of a centipede crawling through all the skulls! It's disgusting!" -- [[Donut]] (Book 6, Chapter 72)
== Speculation == It's likely that "the artifact" [[Tish]] said is needed to defeat Scolopendra is the [[Gate of the Feral Gods]]. It's very likely that the "something else" the high elves stole, which protected them from the Nine Tier attack, would have been the [[Memorial Crystal]]. [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Event]] [[Category:Dungeon Lore]] [[Category:Syndicate History]]

[[File:00249.jpg|thumb|[[Scroll of Build Trench]]]] Creates a trench 2.3 meters deep and 2 meters wide, the length is variable based on users intelligence and strength. {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Scrolls]] [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]]

A scroll that attracts pets. to you
Last for 30 second + 10 seconds per of intelligence and has a range of 100 meters + 20 meters per point of charisma. {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Scrolls]] [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]]

[[File:00244.jpg|thumb|[[Scroll of Upgrade]]]] Warning: This item has a short shelf life.
Maybe it’s not as good as getting something new, but sometimes it’s better to just take something you’re already comfortable with and improve upon it. Kind of like buying your girl new tits.
Once you read this scroll, one, random, currently-equipped item will receive an upgrade. That upgrade could be small. It could be huge. But since this item has a short shelf life, you gotta do it now or forever hold your peace.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Scrolls]]

[[File:00252.jpg|thumb|[[Scroll of Water Breathing]]]] Allows you to breathe underwater. Lasts as many seconds as your intelligence stat times three. It does not protect you from swimmer’s ear or being eaten by an undead barracuda. I hope you know how to swim.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Scrolls]] [[Category:Consumable Items]]

'''Patch collecting''' or '''badge collecting''' (also, '''scutelliphily''', from Latin ''scutellus'' meaning ''little shield'', and Greek ''phileein'' meaning ''to love'') is the hobby of collecting patches or badges. [[Category:Skills]]

Second Chance is a necromancy spell obtained by [[Donut]] on [[Dungeon Floor 2|Floor 2]]. It was her first spell book from the [[Dungeon Book of the Floor Club]]. ==Description== '''Cost''': 10 mana
'''Target''': a dead corpse
'''Duration''': One minute per spell level.
Allows the caster to turn a corpse into an undead minion for the duration of the spell. The dead creature must have been a lower level than the caster. As a minion, the undead creature can be targeted by minion spells like [[Clockwork Triplicate]] and will fight for the caster until the end of the spell. Once it runs out the minion turns back into a corpse.
'''Leve 5 Upgrade''': Duration increases to 2 minutes per spell level. Corpses from creatures up to 5 levels higher than the caster can be targeted. [[Category:Spells]]

{{Quote | quote = Right when the show started, the timer finally ran out. The world rumbled, and the ground under my feet shook. The shaking lasted but a second. I stopped and gazed at the number on the television screen. It flashed, going from just over two million to 1,292,526.
-- (Book 1, Chapter 31; p. 261)}} {{Dungeon Floor |floor_number=2 |theme=[[Tutorial]] / Generic Fantasy|duration=6 Days|crawlers=1,292,526|crawler_levels=1 - 10|start_date=January 7|preceded_by=[[First Floor]]|followed_by=[[Third Floor]]|exits=37,500|locations=[[Tutorial Guild Hall]]|npcs=* Caroline * Max * [[Mongo]] * [[Mordecai]] * [[Zev]] |mobs=* Brindle Grub * Clurichaun * Danger Dingo * Kobald * Laminak * Mind Horror * [[Rage Elemental]] * [[Rot Stickers]] * Satan's Lil' Hedgehogs | bosses = * [[Kraken Clone]] * [[Ralph]]}} '''The Second Floor''' is a [[Tutorial]] floor. Similar to the [[First Floor]], it is a sprawling, grid-like network of passages and tunnels that look like they were hewn out of rock. The vast level is split into sections that are not connected, so crawlers originating in China cannot interact with crawlers from the USA.{{ref|1|4}} ==Introductory Announcement== [[Cascadia]] makes the introductory announcement after the final first floor recap episode airs, approximately six hours after the Second Floor opens. The announcement mostly details the [[Borant Corporation | Borant Corporation's]] desperate cash-grab for money via sponsorship boxes.{{ref|1|31}}
''Hello crawlers.''

''Welcome to the second floor. Congratulations to all of you. We have just under 1.3 million crawlers still in the game. That number is slightly lower than our projections, so we are speeding up the second floor timer to the minimum legally allowed by the rules. You have six days to find a staircase down. Once again, we urge you all to wait until the last possible moment to descend.''

''As soon as this announcement ends, you will find that follows and favorites will be turned on for our viewers. The numbers will populate slowly on your interface, so don’t be too disappointed if you don’t see anything just yet.''

''We have improved how patronage works this season. This is a major change, so please pay attention.''

''All crawlers are now limited to three patrons, and all three spots will be up for auction for one day immediately upon the induction of the fourth floor, then fifth, then sixth floors respectively. Your benefactors may so choose to transfer their patronage to other parties at their own discretion starting on the seventh floor.''

''All patronage spots will become available at a bid of one credit, meaning this season virtually all living crawlers will have patrons.''

''But, be warned. Any bids the patron pays above the standard patronage fee will be reflected in loot box discounts for that patron. Any funds below the fee will be reflected in additional costs to that patron for loot boxes. In other words, the more your patron pays for you, the more and higher-quality Benefactor Boxes you may receive. The higher your social numbers, the better your chances at receiving the best loot. Your tutorial guide should have more details and will help you if you have any additional questions.''

''Finally, we must say we are disappointed in the disrespect we are being shown regarding the bathrooms. As of this moment, if any human-born crawler intentionally urinates or defecates anywhere outside a designated bathroom area, they will be immediately and swiftly penalized in the form of a Rage Elemental plucked from the 13th floor. This elemental will kill them and everyone in their party before they can get their pants back up.''

''That’s it for tonight. Have fun out there, and remember to kill, kill, kill!''Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (pp. 265-266). Dandy House. Kindle Edition

==Special Floor Mechanics== '''1.''' Crawlers who descended from the First Floor up to six hours before the First Floor collapsed were able to immediately access the Second Floor (less time spent appearing on televised programs). '''2.''' Crawlers' [[Ratings]] begin populating after the first recap episode airs. Crawlers can now be viewed at any time (except in the restroom) by anyone with tunnel access. '''3.''' Dungeon Bosses can now exit their rooms. '''4.''' It is still free to rent a bedroom in a safe room. '''5.''' Any crawlers in a designated safe room one hour before floor collapse will be teleported out of the safe room. '''6.''' [[Brindle Grubs]] generate every time a corpse is created. == Floor Timeline & Patch Notes == {| class="fandom-table" |+Second Floor Timeline & Patch Notes !Time to Level Collapse !Event |- |6 Days 06 Hrs |Crawlers can access floor. |- |6 Days 00 Hrs |'''Remaining Crawlers: 1,292,526''' ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]: Earth'', episode 4 showcases the last 30 hours on the [[First Floor]]. |- |5 Days 23 Hrs |Cascadia's introductory announcement. Crawlers can now receive Views, Favorites, and Follows. |- |4 Days 20 Hrs |'''Remaining Crawlers: 1,033,992'''{{ref|1|39}} |- |4 Days 18 Hrs |''Dungeon Crawler World: Earth'', episode 5: * Opens with a close-up of [[Jack]]'s genitalia and a headline exclaiming, "Trapped! [[Meadow Lark]] and the [[Royal Court of Princess Donut]] in Peril!" Followed by a slow-motion shot of Jack taking it out, then [[Yolanda Martinez|Yolanda's]] face, [[Donut]] jumping for him, and finally the arrow piercing his skull and the player killer skull appearing above Yolanda's head as he falls from the platform. * A montage of crawlers surprised when bosses exit their rooms. * At least two separate [[Krakaren Clone]] bosses. * [[Le Mouvement]] has run out of ammo; some use their AK-47s as blunt weapons, while others wield bows or swords. * [[Lucia Mar]] has four player killer skulls now. * [[Hekla]] now boasts a glittering breastplate, and [[Brynhild's Daughters]] is growing. The announcer gives a short history of Iceland. * Ends with a summary of the bathroom issues and reason for introducing Rage Elementals, followed by Yolanda's death, [[Carl]] carrying [[Elle McGib]] into a safe room, and the recipe for [[Carl's Jug O'Boom]].{{ref|1|39}} |- |4 Days 17 Hrs |Cascadia's follow-up announcement includes two patch notes: * The Satan's Lil' Hedgehogs mob has been relocated to a deeper floor. * Safe Rooms will close one hour before the floor collapses. |- |3 Days 12 Hrs |''Dungeon Crawler World: Earth'', episode 6 features: * [[Le Mouvement]] is wiped out by a City Boss. [[Ifechi]] is shown crying outside the boss room. * Lucia Mar smashing Brindled Vespas. * Ten minutes of Carl and Donut escaping the Rage Elemental. * Ends with [[Imani C]] flipping off the camera before descending to the [[Third Floor]].{{ref|1|44}} |- |3 Days 11 Hrs |'''Remaining Crawlers: 990,303''' Cascadia's daily announcement: * [[Game Guide | Game Guides]] can now begin explaining how Third Floor race / class selection work. * Non-sapient mobs that enter a stairwell will no longer disintegrate. * Brindled Vespa population has been reduced by 50%, and damage inflicted by spitting acid attack has been slightly reduced. * Brindle Grubs continue to generate on every corpse, but only have a 50% chance of proceeding to pupa stage. |- |2 Days 06 Hrs |''Dungeon Crawler World: Earth'', episode 7. |- |1 Day 00 Hrs |''Dungeon Crawler World: Earth'', episode 8. |- |0 Days 06 Hrs |Crawlers can begin descending to the [[Third Floor]] without losing time. |} ==Loot== The first two floors are designed to load crawlers up with a variety of loot so that they can experiment with possible builds. By the time a crawler arrives on the third floor, they should have a good idea of what class and race will work for them. On the second floor, low-tier [[Loot Boxes]] commonly contain torches and bandages. Mobs drop skins, organs, and other items that can be used in crafting later. ==See Also== *[[Tutorial]] ==References== [[Category:Dungeon Floors]] [[Category:Floor 2| {{PAGENAME}}]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Dungeon Floor 02}}

[[File:00466.jpg|thumb|[[Seize the Day Toothpaste]]]] You know that feeling you get when you walk out into the world with minty-fresh breath? It’s like you can take on any challenge that is thrown your way. It gives you confidence. It boosts your self-esteem. It makes you feel like you’re on top of the damn world.
Well, this stuff does none of that. However, if you brush your teeth using this enchanted, cherry-flavored toothpaste, you are imbued with the following buffs for 30 hours:
+Three Times Damage to all Boss Monsters.
or
+Four Times Damage to all Boss Monsters if the Boss is a Province, Country, or Floor Boss.
This buff may only be applied in a safe room.
Used before the fight with [[Imogen|Queen Imogen]].
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Buffs]] [[Category:Utility Items]]

==Description== '''Cost''': Nothing. Requires to be in [[Emberus]]' good graces to cast.
'''Target''': Self Only
'''Duration''': Instantaneous. Fire burst lasts up to three seconds, which is complete overkill with this stuff.
'''Cooldown''': Once a day. Resets with the obeisance countdown.
Casts a non-static sphere of ''Sheol Fire'' around the caster with a 1-foot buffer from all body parts of caster. Fire expands in a distance of .15 meters level level until it reaches level 15, at which time the distance increases exponentially and may be controlled.
At level 10, the fire will expand in a sphere 1.5 meters around your body. That's up, down, left, and right. So you might want to be careful where you are when you cast this.
What is Sheol Fire? You know how when you were a kid, you'd take a lighter and pass your finger over the flame really fast, and it wouldn't hurt you? Don't try that with this stuff. It's fire with rabies. Wood instantly turns to ash. Rock to lava. Flesh... well. Just be careful. Or don't, if you're looking to go out with some char-scented gusto. [[Category:Spells]]

{{Dungeon Floor|title1=The Great Race|floor_number=7|theme=Fairytale-Inspired|duration=20 Days|exits=1,172|crawlers=38,532|start_date=March 3|preceded_by=[[Sixth Floor]]|followed_by=[[Eighth Floor]]}} The seventh floor, it was designed by [[Cascadia]] and destroyed by [[Prepotente]]. The design is based of a Princess Rupert’s drop. The level is inspired by a fairy tale of a boy stuck in a maze where every time he takes a tunnel it is sealed of behind him, he is presented with thousands of path but he keeps taking the incorrect one and killed. Afterwards he is resurrected by a god and forced to start over again. ==Introductory Announcement==
''Hello, Crawlers!'' ''Welcome to the seventh floor! The countdown is on!'' ''Rules. The moment this message ends, each crawler pod will slide to the starting chute and open. This will happen in order. Once opened, you will be pulled through the tunnel and into the maze. All paths lead to the exit. There are no dead ends. The exit portals you see behind you are physically pulling you in, but in order to get to them, you must first negotiate the maze paths, which constitute several hundred kilometers of twisting and turning tubes. Each path leads to a node which in turn leads to multiple branches. In some cases, there are literally hundreds of possible paths. Pitstop saferooms exist in these nodes. You cannot backtrack. Some paths are more dangerous than others. Some require the solving of math equations or puzzles to proceed. All tunnels are passable. The danger level of each branch is marked, oftentimes describing what you’ll find along the way and the distance to the next node. Most major nodes contain a zero tube, or a path with no danger. You must choose your path. Once a path has been passed through by 10 crawlers or a single party, it closes for an amount of time based on difficulty. All zero tubes may only be passed once. So those of you in the back might want...''
[[Category:Dungeon Floors]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Dungeon Floor 07}} [[Category:Floor 7]]

[[Carl]] pierced himself with the [[Enchanted Nipple Ring of the Defiler]] while trying to convince Donut it wasn't weird and wouldn't make her a "whore".
==Description== A nipple ring? Really? The next thing you know, you'll be waxing your perineum and attending those parties where you have to put your keys in a bowl. You'll have to grow out your sideburns, buy a Trans Am, and you'll no longer be able to make eye contact with your child's orthodontist.
''Reward:'' Whores don't get rewards. [[Category:Achievements]]

page.title: Sex Workers Who Fell from the Heavens

revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Sex Workers Who Fell from the Heavens}}
== AI Description == '''New Quest. The Sex Workers Who Fell from the Heavens.'''
Prostitutes. Escorts. Street Walkers. Ladies of the Night.
It doesn't matter how you describe them because these chicks are dead. Very dead. And every morning, several more of them appear scattered throughout the village. Nobody knows who they are or where they come from. Find out why.
'''''Reward''''': You will receive a [[Quest Box|Silver Quest Box]]. [[Category:Quests]]

[[File:00195.jpg|thumb|Shade Gnoll]] Shade Gnolls are a type of creature that looks similar to a hyenas.
Famously work as the Shade Gnoll Riot Forces, a mercenry police force specailising in crowd control.
== Known examples ==
* [[Growler Gary]]
[[Category:Races]]

A talk-show hosted by [[Rosetta]]. It is a weekly show telling the story of earth through interveiws that are designed to look like regular conversations. They interview Carl and Donut about TV shows they watched before the Transformation, asking them how they feel about them and how they related to their everyday life.
It is funded my the [[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)|Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network]]. [[Category:Shows]]

[[File:00455.jpg|thumb|[[Shango]]]] A god of the [[Orisha]] pantheon.
== Shrine == If his shrine is repaired you will gain a level 15 lightning spell, this can be trained to level 20. It's implied this spell will come in handly later.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]] [[Category:NPC]]

Shatter is an enchantment effect that disarms attackers. ==AI Description== Any attack that lands upon the object imbued with this enchantment has a 1.5% chance to disarm the opponent. If the opponent is disarmed, there is a 90% chance the item will drop to the ground, a 5% chance the weapon will break, and a 5% chance the weapon will be immediately transferred to your inventory.
[[Category:Spells]]

Sheet Music is similar to a scroll or magic book but exclusive to bard classes.
It allows bards to sing a song they normally couldn’t, the system helped them perform if they had the music in front of them making it easier to pull off but with a chance of failure if the performance was out of key. If sung badly it tears a little bit, to many tears and it’s ruined. If sung perfectly and in the correct pitch the spell is added to your bard repertoire, when this happens the sheet music isn’t consumed and can be sold or given to someone else.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Show Must Go On}}
== AI Description == '''New Quest. The Show Must Go On.'''
You've discovered the remnants of an ancient circus. Hundreds of years after the toxic cloud that devastated the Over City, this traveling circus endures. But instead of joy and laughter and cotton candy, it now delivers devastation and pain. Their cotton candy is probably really gross by now, too. Find out why this circus still exists and put an end to its reign of terror.
'''''Reward''':'' You will receive a [[Quest Box|Gold Quest Box]]. [[Category:Quests]]

A wand that causes items to shrink in size. Has 10 charges.

{{Character_info|age=~ 50|class=[[Holistic Healer]]|species=Human {{!}} Wisteria [[Fairy]]|occupation=Baker|first_appearance=Chapter 22, Book 3|status=Deceased|party=Brynhild's Daughters|allies=* [[Hekla]] * [[Eva Sigrid]] * [[Katia Grim]]|level=25}}
Silfa is a fairy class healer crawler who is a part of [[Brynhild's Daughters]]. She has two daughters who came into the dungeon with her. She was killed by [[Eva Sigrid|Eva]] along with her children. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]
