Admin Notice. This page may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Posting spoilers for Book 7 will result in “acceleration” per this wiki’s rules. ==Description== Author of the 15th Edition of The [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]. ==Cookbook Entries== A level 3 sapper's table lets you infuse bombs. Soak a hobgoblin smoke curtain in a healing potion, let it dry, and it mass kills undead like you wouldn't believe. (Chapter 8, Book 3) I now worship the goddess [[Kuraokami]]. Worst decision ever. The goddess is sponsored by some male soother twat who is treating it like I really worship ''him''. They made this whole system more complicated than it needs to be. If you see a god or if you find a temple or if you find a scroll of prayer, you're given the option to worship a god. Once you do it, there's a pawful of benefits but also a bunch of rules you gotta follow. For Kuraokami, if you kill something, you have to touch the corpse with ice at least once a day. Why? Who the fuck knows. I don't have an ice spell, so I need to go back to safe rooms and get more ice every day. If I do the ice thing once a day five days in a row, I get a boon. Only you don't know what the boon is going to be. I haven't made it five days yet. If you miss a day, the goddess "turns her back," and you stop getting any of the benefits. If you miss two days, you receive a debuff. If you miss three, you fall from grace and can't worship them anymore. There's a 50% chance you'll get "smited." I don't know what that means, but it ain't gonna be good. You can also voluntarily leave the faith, but it comes with an automatic smite. But worst of all, while you worship the god, the god can sometimes send you messages. The description says it's rare, but my goddess won't shut the hell up. I'm pretty sure I'm the only one who worships her, and this rat asshole is bored or something and sends me message after message. The last note I got was, "You need to say I'm the prettiest goddess out loud." I finally told him to fuck off. But now the twat is swearing at me in my messages. I don't know if they have any real power over me unless he somehow gets summoned or I get smote. As soon as I get to a stairwell station, I'm going to leave the faith and jump down the stairs. Maybe that'll save me. (Chapter 30, Book 4) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{Character_info|crawler_#=8,199,462|class=[[Poet Laureate]]|species=Human {{!}} [[Cat Girl]]|occupation=Discalced Carmelite|first_appearance=Chapter 5, Book 6|allies=* [[Anton]] * [[Paz Lo]]|level=47|title1=Sister Ines Quiteria|origin=Cuba|skills=* [[Word Weaver]]|titles=The Reaper of Havana|patrons=[[The Nebulars]]|organizations=[[Club Vanquisher]]|gods=[[Ysalte]]}}A former nun who worked at a prison before the [[The Transformation|Transformation]].
She is armed with a trident before it was destroyed by the god [[Ogun]].
== Personality == She is highly religous and refuses to worship any of the in game deities.
== Skills == Has access to the World Weaver spell at level 15 thanks to her patron.
She can see if people are worshiping a god.
She has a skill that charms people and makes them want to protect her, if the victim finds out about it, they then forget about it.
== History == She was sent to prison for killing all the sisters in her convent, known by the nickname "Reaper of Havana".
She was killed by [[Louis]] after being put to sleep by [[Carl|Carl's]] [[Wand of Nighty Night]]. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Sixth Floor: The Hunting Grounds}} {{Dungeon Floor|floor_number=6|theme=Hunting Ground|duration=17 Days|exits=2,344|crawlers=85,223|start_date=February 14|preceded_by=[[Fifth Floor]]|followed_by=[[Seventh Floor]]|npcs=[[Tsarina Signet]]}} The Hunting Grounds is the arena used for the sixth floor. It is about 400km going north to south and 300km going east to west. It has a river going through it that's around 500km long. == Inhabitants == * [[Bugbear|Bugbears]] * [[Funeral Bell|Funeral bells]] * [[High elves]] * [[Dryad]] * [[Ursine]] === Mobs === * [[Mongoliensis]] * Bambiraptor * Jericho bush * Skewerbell * Death monkeys * [[Night Weasel]] * Whipcrackers * Drillbeaks * [[Shambling Berserkers]] * [[Glamoured Fragment]] * Odious blossom NPC's * [[Prudence]] * [[Randy]] * [[Todd]] * [[Kiwi]] * [[Ferdinand]] === Tsarina's group === * [[Tsarina Signet]] * [[Nadine]] * Edgar * [[Clint Smashgrab|Clint]] * [[Holger]] * [[Areson the Wise]] === Bosses === * [[Claude Sludgington the Fourth]] * [[Viscount Fog]] * [[Sierra]] * [[Odious Creepers]] * [[Big Tina]] * [[Imogen|Queen Imogen]] === Settlements === * [[Zockau]] * [[Point Mongo]] * Al a carta * Ferdinand Peak * Nipton * Prepotente town number 4 * Prepotente town number 7 * Medium dryad settlement * The high-elf castle ==Introductory Announcement==
''Hello, Crawlers!'' ''Welcome to the sixth floor! We are so happy to have you here!'' ''Like the third floor, this sixth floor is a Dungeon Crawler World tradition! It’s the hunting grounds! This floor is almost identical in layout and size to the third floor, but the abandoned ruins have been claimed by hundreds of years of foliage. What secrets and mysteries lay hidden in the jungle? You’ll have 17 days to find out! But this time, you won’t be alone.'' ''We currently have 360 hunters on deck, and they’re raring to go. In a little less than 28 hours, they will be unleashed and will begin hunting you for your gear. Due to recent events, we are keeping registration open until the very last moment, and we expect that number of participants to double or even triple by the time they are released! But be warned! Some of these hunters have been here for weeks now, and even though they’re currently sequestered, their minions and traps are still out there and waiting for you. A few of you have already found this out the hard way!'' ''Traditionally, all hunters start out at level 30 and are able to train themselves up as you make your way through the lower floors. It’s no secret that you’re here sooner than usual. In the spirit of fairness and as an incentive to gain more last-minute participants, we have given all hunters a bump of 20 levels, so they all start out at 50.'' ''We’ll have more information about the hunt after the next recap message, but I wanted to thank you all for your participation. I know that last floor was tough, and we did lose a few more crawlers than we anticipated. We will all have to work together to make sure your incompetence doesn’t continue.'' ''There are 2,344 exits leading to the seventh floor. There is at least one unguarded exit in the city of Zockau along with more in the valley beyond. In addition, some city boss and larger mobs will have an exit nearby. The rest are hidden, but should be easy to find. Your final sponsorship slots are now open to bidding. That’s all for now. Now get out there and kill, kill, kill!''

{{Race Infobox | title1 = Skyfowl | image1 = [[File:00796.jpg]] | caption-image1 = skyfowl looking majestic (by Sandboy_OC) | type = Dungeon NPC, Syndicate Race | floors = [[Third Floor|Floor 3]], [[Fifth Floor|Floor 5]] | height = 5'6" (168 cm) | crawlers = [[Hold Steady]] [[Justice Light]]
[[Uzzi]] | npcs = [[Mordecai]] Magistrate Featherfall
Miss Quill
[[Remex]] }}{{Quote |quote = People want to kill skyfowl because skyfowl are assholes. They don’t need a spell to make people hate them. |speaker = [[Mordecai]]}} '''Skyfowl''' are one of the six basic starter species the Syndicate uses to seed ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]'' candidate planets, and a common Dungeon NPC race.{{ref|1|4}} ==Description== A proud people, most skyfowl crawlers choose to keep their race during class selection and are unable to resist fighting in the [[Ninth Floor]] Faction Wars; as a result, skyfowl seasons are known to end in ninth floor slaughter and tenth floor deals. Skyfowl are a common race among Dungeon NPCs.{{ref|6|prologue}} Skyfowl tend to be xenophobic toward races without wings, but will act indignant when called out for their behavior.{{ref|2|14}} A diverse people, skyfowl may be secular or religious. Clerics have clipped wings and are only able to fly short distances.{{ref|4|1}} ==Appearance== The average male skyfowl stands at approximately 5' 6" (168cm) tall. Eagle-headed humanoids, they do not have independent arms; instead, their large wings - which fold "angel-like" on their backs - have small finger bones protruding from the center joint. They use the large black talons on their feet as hands.{{ref|2|12}} As skyfowl age, their feathers start to turn gray and their beaks begin to crack.{{ref|2|18}}
''“He’s not here, okay?” Miss Quill said, frantically piling the toys in the corner. She picked one up with her talon and frantically rubbed non-existent dirt off it with her wing. “Look what you’ve done, look what you’ve done.”''Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (p. 224; chapter 18). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
==Subraces== ===Centurion Skyfowl=== [[Mordecai]] was born a Centurion skyfowl. Centurion are golden, with darker feathers, larger wingspans, and larger talons than Rock Edge skyfowl. ===Over City Skyfowl=== The Skyfowl of the [[Third Floor]] are largely secular and particularly prejudiced against flightless creatures. The ruling class of the Over City, their scattered settlements are lead by Magistrates and have no unifying government. They only hire flightless creatures for low-level administrative and clerk jobs. In the settlement that Carl and Donut visit, the administrative building is lined with paintings of eagles fighting elves. ===Rock Edge Skyfowl=== A mob and NPC race on the [[Fifth Floor]], Rock Edge Skyfowl are light brown and beige with sharp black talons. ===Skyfowl of the White Cliffs=== Skyfowl crawlers on a long ago season of ''Dungeon Crawler World''. Exceptionally proud, they respond to insults with violence.{{ref|4|32}} ==Dungeon Lore== In the volcano level mythology, skyfowl were the rulers of the entire [[Third Floor]] Over City before the [[Cataclysm]]. Magistrates reported to regional governors, who reported to the royal chancellor, who reported to a king in [[Larracos]]. The [[Elf|city elves]] are a "batshit crazy, doomsday cult of banished elves" who traveled from the [[Sixth Floor]] Hunting Grounds to the Over City, joined the uniformed [[201st Security Group Militia]], and swore to protect the skyfowl from flightless creatures and the [[Oak Fell]]. They believe that one of [[Scolopendra|Scolopendra's]] nine-tier attacks was a spell that made earthbound creatures want to kill the skyfowl, and that protecting skyfowl will ensure their places in heaven when the goddess [[Apito]], the Oak Mother, ends the world.{{ref|2|17}} The cult bases their beliefs on three separate stories, which boil down to: *Apito said that for anyone to go to heaven, her angels must stay free and alive. *Apito referred to the skyfowl "bless-ed." *Apito said only the angels are "blessed," and if violence against her angels is not stopped, she will destroy all worlds. ==Trivia== *Rather than seats, skyfowl sit on perches.
*Various shops in the Over City sell magical silk robes that allow skyfowl to stay aloft indefinitely. ==References== [[Category:Races]][[Category:Syndicate Races]][[Category:Mobs]][[Category:Dungeon Lore]] [[Category:Crawler Races]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]] Received for killing a certain number of mobs using your own momentum.

Angry at [[Samantha|Psamathe]] because she believed she had sex with her king.
She has a sister called Gash.
== AI Description == '''Slit. Minor Feral Demon. Level 200.'''
One of the many demons captured and tossed into the [[Nothing]] during the original Ascendancy, Slit never wanted to be caught up in all that royal drama, but what can you do? When you're in love, you'd do just about anything for your man.
Eons in the madness have taken a terrible toll on Slit's sanity and sense of self-worth.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Demons]]

== Description == Killing with your feet. Your bare, beautiful feet.
Taking your bare foot, placing it on top of a living, conscious life, and then pressing lovingly down until that life ceases to be. Is there a more noble way to kill?
The amount of pressure you can bring to bear upon an enemy with your unshod foot is increased by 10% with each level of this skill. [[Category:Skills]]

[[File:00122.jpg|thumb|Smushed for Daddy]]
== Description == You have been stepped upon by a deity. You have survived the encounter. And while this wasn’t the pink-fleshed suppleness of a human-shaped foot that crushed your fragile, wet body, it’s nice sometimes to switch things around. You know, just to test the boundaries of your own limits. When one experiments, oftentimes one finds new and exciting ways to get that rush.
While fun, it wasn’t quite the same. You probably don’t realize how lucky that is for you.
'''''Reward''''': You have received a [[Enchanted Toe Ring of the Leprous Bandit|Platinum Spicy Box.]] [[Category:Achievements]]

page.title: Society for the Eradication of Cocker Spaniels

revision.text:
{{SpoilH | 5}}{{Group|aliases=* TSECS * Princess Posse Enterprises|part_of=Syndicate|type=Nonprofit (Not For Conquest)|base_location=Syndicate Space (multiple chapter locations)|first=Book 5, Chapter 41|status=Active|members=* [[Jenn'ifer]] * [[Maggie]]|sponsored_crawlers=[[Donut]]|title1={{PAGENAME}}}}{{Quote | quote = She doesn't like people saying the C-word.
-- [[Jenn'ifer]] (Book 5, Chapter 41) }}'''The Society for the Eradication of Cocker Spaniels (TSECS), NFC'''Not for Conquest''', dba'''Doing Business As '''as Princess Posse Enterprises, NFC''' is a nonprofit Syndicate organization taking legal action to prevent the Syndicate from preserving Cocker Spaniel DNA. ==Story== [[Donut]] constantly complains about cocker spaniels and the universe is listening.{{ref|1|13}}{{ref|1|30}}{{ref|1|43}}{{ref|2|15}}{{ref|2|21}}{{ref|3|7}}{{ref|3|20}}{{ref|4|30}}{{ref|5|11}}{{ref|5|43}}{{ref|5|67}}{{ref|6|47}} By the time Donut arrives on the [[Fifth Floor]], the universe is taking note of her constant jibes. The [[Veriluxx RealPet Companions|Veriluxx RealPet Companion]], which is programmed to imitate Donut, certainly displays her animosity towards cocker spaniels:
"Cocker spaniels deserve to have their corpses desecrated."
-- [[Veriluxx RealPet Companions|Veriluxx]] RealPet Companion quoting [[Donut]]{{ref|4|13}}
By the [[Sixth Floor]], The Society for the Eradication of Cocker Spaniels has been officially founded. At [[CrawlCon]], [[Carl]] meets [[Jenn'ifer]], who wears a t-shirt featuring a semi-realistic drawing of an adorable dog, crossed out by a flashing red "X", over the words "The Society for the Eradication of Cocker Spaniels." She reveals that the society is very real and paid for a premium [[CrawlCon]] badge to get a message to Donut: per Donut's suggestion, the organization was raising money to legally prevent Cocker Spaniels being included in the preservation of Earth flora and fauna.{{ref|5|41}} Later, Carl learns that while Jenn'ifer's message may or may not have been true, the society had another motive. This was to sponsor Carl and Donut's spot in [[Ninth Floor|Faction Wars]]:
"Welcome, Sponsor, to Faction Wars. Your team's official name is [[Princess Posse (faction)|The Princess Posse]], sponsored by The Society for the Eradication of Cocker Spaniels (TSECS), NFC, DBA as Princess Posse Enterprises, NFC."{{ref|5|77}}
==References== [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

You got eaten by a monster much bigger than yourself, and you managed to get out without even getting chewed a little bit.
Uh-oh. I think Daddy kinda liked that. I think it moved.
We’re gonna have to do some experimenting with this one.
''Reward'': You’ve received a Platinum [[Spicy Box]]. [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:00871.jpg|thumb|Soul Reaper]]
Skill granted by The Scavenger’s Daughter [[Upgrade_Patch|upgrade patch]].
== AI Description == Yeah, baby. Now we’re talking.
For every creature you kill with a melee attack, the Scavenger’s Daughter patch is charged with the essence of the fallen. Once fully charged, you may transfer this energy to a single melee attack, which will completely drain all the essence. This attack will have varying effects depending on the nature of the essence stored.
The associated essence bar is now visible in your interface. The total amount of soul essence you may store increases each time your essence bar is topped off and then drained. In other words, the more stuff you kill, the stronger you get.
Warning: you know how asbestos is really bad for you? Like, it doesn’t hurt you immediately, but it builds up in your lungs and eventually screws you over? Actually, you know what? Just ignore this warning. Forget I said anything. Carrying corrupted essence around on your back builds character. You already have a ring that’s doing much worse to you anyway. [[Category:Skills]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

At the DCC Wiki, we assume that all visitors are familiar with books one and two (''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' and ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'', respectively). As such, spoiler warnings are not required for content relating to these books or for crawler class and race selection. '''Spoiler warnings are required for information from ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' onward.''' ==How to Add Spoiler Warnings== We currently have two easy-to-use [[:Category:Templates/Spoilers | spoiler templates]]. Using a template format allows us to easily make site-wide changes to wording, codes, and more, that will affect all pages. ===1. Use "Spoiler" to Hide Specific Sections=== Example: Crawler "Matt Di" was introduced in Book 2 and already has a detailed page. You add a few paragraphs about Matt's storyline in the fourth book. This paragraph should be hidden so that someone currently reading the third book can look up information about Matt. To do this, we use the [[Template:Spoiler| Spoiler Template]]. The result looks like:
Matt Di chose the [[Human|Feral Human]] Race and [[Boring Ol' Fighter|Foot Fancier]] class on the third floor. {{Spoiler | book = 4 | spoiler = Matt's next appearance is on the fifth floor, where he works with Soundbooth-Jockey ElJefe to complete a quest. Matt and ElJefe get the "This is all your fault" achievement and each receive an Enchanted Mankini of Engorging. }}
====1a. Visual Editor==== Open the '''Template Search Box''' by typing '''{{''' into the editor, or selecting "Insert" > "Template" on the toolbar. Then, search for "'''Spoiler'''". The spoiler template window will pop up. In the '''Book''' field, enter the book number that will be spoiled by your text (e.g. 4). In the '''Spoiler''' field, enter your text! You can format your section using [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Wikitext basic wikitext]. Break up paragraphs by starting each new paragraph with '''

''' and closing it with '''

'''. When done, click "Insert." ====1b. Source Editor==== 
{{Spoiler
| book =
| spoiler =
}}
So, the above example would look like: 
{{Spoiler
| book = 4
| spoiler = Matt's next appearance is on the fifth floor, where he works with Soundbooth-Jockey ElJefe to complete a quest. Matt and ElJefe get the "This is all your fault" achievement and each receive an Enchanted Mankini of Engorging.
}}
===2. Use "SpoilH" to Label the Page=== Some pages are, by their very nature, spoilers. The Enchanted Mankini of Engorging wasn't received until Book 4 so rather than hide the entire contents of its page, we work around this by adding a generic spoiler warning to the top of the page. Currently, the [[Template:SpoilH| SpoilH]] template looks like (per example above): {{SpoilH | 4}} ====2a. Visual Editor==== Click on the very top of the content editor, above any other text or infoboxes. Open the "Template Search Box" by typing '''{{''' into the editor, or selecting "Insert" > "Template" on the toolbar. Then, search for "'''SpoilH'''". The spoiler header window will pop up. In the only data field, enter the book that will be spoiled by the page. Then, click "Insert." That's it! ====2b. Source Editor==== 
{{SpoilH | Book#}}
So, the above example would take the form of:
{{SpoilH | 4}}

===3. Use Both Templates Together=== The Enchanted Mankini of Engorging is introduced in Book 4, and it plays a significant role in Book 6. On this page, we might choose to do the following:
{{SpoilH | 4}} '''Description''' The Enchanted Mankini of Engorging is a magical bright pink latex Mankini which grants the "Shocking Visage" spell and causes the wearer to involuntarily... etc {{Spoiler | book = 6 | spoiler = We discover in book 6 that the Enchanted Mankini of Engorging is the most cursed item ever to be issued in the history of Dungeon Crawler World when Matt Di... etc }}
[[Category:Wiki Policies]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

revision.text:
This weapon has been upgraded twice, this is a sapient weapon, this is an incremental damage weapon.
* Holds several US dollars worth of nickels * This weapons damage increases by 1.5% of every mob it kills that is no more than ten levels below your current level, currently does 238% additional damage * Provides +10 dex and +10% dex * Has a 5% chance to inflict the Bonk condition * All mobs killed by this weapon have a 20% to burst into a pile of gold coins upon death, the number of coins is equal to the value of the items in their inventory + level times 10
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Weapons]]

== Description == A rogue and trap-finding class.
== Crawlers with this Class ==
* [[Bobby]]
[[Category:Class]]

== AI Description == '''New Quest. Squeeze out the Juice Box.'''
That mischievous [[Changeling]] prostitute appears to be more important to this story than you first thought. It also appears she's rather fond of her brothers and sisters, many of whom are currently outside, mixed in with the poor, oblivious [[Dromedarian|Dromedarians]], preparing to die in a desperate attempt to destroy all the incoming bombs with flak. If this town is bombed, they will not succeed. They will not even come close to succeeding.
To win this quest, you must save Hump Town from the inevitable bombardment, which will occur when the timer reaches zero.
'''''Reward''''': You will receive a [[Quest Box|Platinum Quest Box]].
In addition, all crawlers in this quadrant will receive a permanent fifty percent charisma bonus during any future interactions with Changelings.
You'll also receive my undying respect, because there is no way in hell even you can pull this one off.
'''Quest Complete. Squeeze out the Juice Box.'''
So, if we're being technical here, you "won" the quest. You "saved" Hump Town from the bombardment. Congratulations. If I was allowed to upgrade your prize, I would. Maybe. I dunno. Actually, you know what? No. No, I wouldn't. Fuck you.
'''''Reward''''': You've received a Platinum Quest Box. [[Category:Quests]]
#REDIRECT [[The Squim Conglomerate]]

A storm comander is a [[Skyfowl]] class.
== Known Storm Comanders ==

== Rewards == [[Carl]] won seven of these for winning seven court cases, each one contained one gold piece, a picture of the mother of one of his plaintiffs as well as a single share in a company they own.

[[File:00310.jpg|thumb|[[Suppurating Eye]]]] A common lich spell. The caster reads the spell then leaks a bodily fluid onto a surface, the caster can then see and hear anything happening near the spilled fluid. Does not work whilst in inventory. [[Category:Spells]]

== Description == A Surefire adds the “Guided” status to any projectile, powered or not. It may be utilized on a vast array of crafting tables. If added to an arrow or bolt, you must choose a target prior to unleashing the weapon, and the projectile will seek that target.
If added to a trap, additional options become available. Such as “Target any healers within range” or “Target anyone who thinks it’s okay to put mayonnaise on hotdogs.”
If added to a powered weapon, such as an explosive-based rocket, targets may be assigned during the crafting process or upon firing, but not both.
'''Note''': this upgrade alone does not add range to the projectile.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Crafting Materials]] [[Category:Crafting]]

A crawl historian and author. Carl meets her on the panel [[Crawling Through the Ages]] at [[CrawlCon]].
She wrote a book titled "A petite chronicle of the crawl: One ladies journey into enlightenment through knowledge and scholarship and free beat poetry". [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:CrawlCon]]
#REDIRECT [[The Syndicate Council]]

{{SpoilR}}
The System AI is the artificial intelligence that operates [[Dungeon Crawler World]].
The current AI was a secondhand one sold to [[Borant]] by the [[Valtay|Valtey Corperation]]; prior to the start of Dungeon Crawler World it worked at an amusement park. Its role there ended after it skinned a warren of rabbits and killed a soother tourist. As a result, it has started to go primal earlier than other AI's which don't usually start until the 10th floor.
Whenever one of its decisions gets overruled it starts getting stroppy and upset; it has reached the stage where it has stopped complying with court orders it doesn't agree with. On the [[Sixth Floor|sixth floor]] the [[The Syndicate Council|Syndicate Council]] issued a ruling stating that nobody was allowed to file lawsuits naming the AI as a defendant.
It's far friendlier if you ask for things politely and give it options.
The AI system also appears to have a foot fetish, among others. After Carl loses his boots on the first floor, the system AI gives Carl a pedicure kit that makes his feet invulnerable. The System AI also likes it when Carl kills animals by squishing them with his bare feet, specifically gerbils. On the 5th floor, the System AI has enjoyed seeing Carl swallowed whole and spit out by a giant octoshark. The System AI has been known to give only Carl special loot boxes for fulfilling the AI’s fetishes and punishing him for avoiding fetish traps.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Dungeon Admins]][[Category:Syndicate]]

{{Character_info|species=[[Orc]]|occupation=Hunter|status=Deceased, killed by zapping himself with his own scroll of Lightning|party=[[The Skull Empire]]|title1=The Talent}}He was killed after firing a lightning bolt too close to the All Tree.
== Gear == He has three scrolls of lightning and almost 70,000 piece of gold on him. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Hunters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

[[File:00226.jpg|thumb|Talisman of the Slate Butterfly]] Collar charm belonging to [[Donut]]. It is shaped like a little silver butterfly and jingles when it moves, making stealth difficult. She got it from a gold magic item box for being one of the first 100 crawlers to level [[Magic Missile]] up to level three. == AI Description == Those who remember and commemorate the sad tale of the Slate Butterfly are given a boon by the fairies of the world. That story even made ''me'' cry. == Effect == * +4 to the [[Light on Your Feet]] skill * +1 to Intelligence. * Winged fairies will no longer be automatically hostile toward you
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Floor 1]] [[Category:Jewelry]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

[[File:00582.jpg|thumb|Talon Strike]]
== AI Description == Birds have ugly feet. Disgusting feet, really. Still, there’s something sensual about the sight of a hawk swooping down upon its prey, talons out, and slashing. It’s so sudden, so unexpected, so explosively violent.
Such violence. Sweet, sweet violence.
Turns the side of your bare foot into a fast-moving slashing weapon, increasing the damage against opponents by up to (Level of skill) times your regular kicking damage for (Level of skill) seconds. Each kick using this skill has a 2% chance to cast the instakill spell Eviscerate. This melee skill has a cooldown of five minutes. Higher levels of this skill increase damage, duration, and chance of casting Eviscerate. A level 15 of this skill will result in Talon Strike being permanently active. [[Category:Skills]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}
Tammy Lin is [[Carl|Carl's]] stepmother and [[Asher|Asher's]] mom.
She has a tattoo of a pitbull on her neck and smokes cigerettes.
== History == She attempted to kill Carl's dad by injecting him with morphine whilst he was terminally ill. [[Category:Characters]]

The god of thunder. Older brother of [[Emberus]] and his twin brother [[Hellik]]. Hellik seeks to kill Emberus and Taranis. The wife of Taranis is the goddess [[Apito]]. Together, Apito and Taranis held the first Butchers Masquerade in the Halls of Ascendency. They are also the parents of many children including the war god [[Grull]] and the lust god [[Yarilo]]. [[Carl]] fell through the roof and broke the shrine in temple of [[Diwata]] which [[Lucia Mar]] had previously desecrated. As a reward he recieved an [[Enemy of the Church]] tattoo.
==Description== You've defiled a temple's sacred shrine by breaking it with your own flesh!
Wow. I dunno, man. That's pretty ballsy.
There are a lot of bad things people can do when they're in church. They can swear. They can ogle the hot nuns. They can pinch the eucharist wafers and use them as poker chips. They can rip pages from the hymnals and roll them into joints. Hell, they can stab the priest and murder all the town's adherents and put the whole thing up on YouTube.
None of that is as bad as defiling the temple's shrine with one's own flesh.
In case you didn't know, the shrine of a temple is pretty much indestructible. They made it that way because you crawlers are always blowing up whole towns and submerging cities in water or burying entire populations of innocent NPCs with the guts of giant turkeys.
When a temple is desecrated, the shrine's protection fades over several hours. Eventually, it's able to be destroyed, but only with a direct attack.
You're supposed to find desecrated temples and destroy the shrines. Hell, it's a sacrament in some religions. But you can't just do it willy-nilly. And certainly not when you're not a member of that congregation. It's like walking into a random ICU from off the street and pulling the plug on someone's braindead grandma.
It's not your place.
Gods don't like it when some punk walks into their house and kicks them when they're already down. It's rude. And what's worse, when a shrine is destroyed improperly, the god loses some of their power, and all of the other gods can see this. It's quite humiliating.
Hopefully you got some cool loot from the priests or monks or whatever because this box, while technically a prize, is sort of a good news/bad news thing.
''Reward:'' You've received a Gold [[Apostate Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Race_Infobox | title1 = Stilt Clowns | image1 = [[File:00033.jpg]] | type = Mob | class = "scary-ass mobs" | floors = [[Third Floor | Floor 3]] | height = 11' + (3.35m) | bonuses = * immune to [[Fear]] spell. | organizations = Grimaldi's Traveling Circus }}{{Quote | quote = "Come on Donut,” I said. “Let’s go clown hunting."
-- [[Carl]] (Book 2, Chapter 5) }} Once clowns-on-stilts performing at Grimaldi's Traveling Circus on the [[Third Floor | third floor]], [[Scolopendra]]'s curse transformed the '''stilt clowns''' into long-limbed monsters likened to "Slender Man dressed as a clown." ==AI Description== '''Terror the Clown – Level 10''' '''It’s okay if you just pissed yourself. You wouldn’t be the first.''' '''Standing just over 11 feet tall, the clown-on-stilts was always a favorite amongst the snot-nosed kiddos visiting Grimaldi’s three-ring circus. Now, ravaged by time and the curse of the Over City, the once-affable stilt-clowns have been transformed into tall, blood-thirsty monstrosities who want nothing more than to make balloon animals out of your intestines.'''Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (p. 44; chapter 4). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. ==Description== Humanoid but roughly as tall as a short one-story house, the stilt clowns' stilts have merged into their long legs and their spindly arms hang almost to the ground. Their bone-white skin is splotchy, they do not have eyes or noses, and their too-large, red, tooth-filled mouth holds a long forked tongue. The first stilt clown Carl encounters is armed with a butcher's knife and dressed in tattered, blood-stained clown clothes, with a curly-haired red wig and a little hat decorated with a flower on its head.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 4). Attempting to cast [[Fear]] on a stilt clown will trigger a system message: '''Warning: scary-ass mobs are immune to Fear effects.''' At Grimaldi's Traveling Circus, the stilt clowns patrol the surrounding area and - before nightfall - erect defenses around the circus.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 6). [[Heather the Bear]] drags her victims back to the circus and feeds them to the clowns.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 9). ==Dropped Loot== *Clown Meat *Big Top Ticket *35 Gold ==References== [[Category:Mobs]][[Category:Floor 3]]

page.title: That's not how you use arrows, dumbass

revision.text:
[[Carl]] stabbed [[Vrah]] with the [[Arrow of Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea]]. He received a [https://dungeon-crawler-carl.fandom.com/wiki/Upgrade_Patch?so=search#Skyfowl_Upgrade_Patch_(Small) skyfowl upgrade] patch as a reward.
==Description== You took an arrow, and you physically stabbed someone with it. That's something a kid who eats glue would do. You know I'm pretty sure you have a bow in your inventory.
''Reward:'' You've received a Gold [[Ranged Weapon Box]]. [[Category:Achievements]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

The apothecary are run by the [[Krakaren]] a collective mind rumoured to be involved with the tunnelling system which is owned and operated by [[The Plenty]].
After the sixth floor they started sponsoring [[Carl]], [[Donut]], [[Elle McGib|Ellie]], [[Imani C|Imani]], [[Miriam Dom]], [[Prepotente]], [[Popov Brothers (Maxim & Dmitri)|Dimitri and Maxim Popov]].
Their spokesperson made a brief appearance at [[CrawlCon|Crawlcon]].
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Corporations]] [[Category:Crawler Sponsors]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

[[File:DCC-AIT-S01E04-Cover-1.jpg|thumb|Official art of Ball of Swine from the cover of the Soundbooth Theatre Immersion Tunnel: Season 1, Episode 4: Porkchop Express]] == AI Description == '''Level 15 Borough Boss!'''
Also known as the Porkchop Express, the Ball of Swine is one of the rarest, most deadly battle formations of the Tuskling. Encompassing at least 30 Tuskling knights and their lady loves, a Ball formation requires a specific set of circumstances to create. Combine a gathering of Tuskling aristocracy, add an alcohol-fueled, sexually-charged orgy of war lust, and sometimes, just sometimes, the wild, ancient battle magic that permeates their war-torn world casts the spell, forming the ball. The Tusklings, the ruling class of the Orcish Supremacy, shape into an inseparable sphere that rolls onto the countryside. The ball of pork won’t stop its night of terror until it has crushed the poor, the weak, and the lesser citizens under its unstoppable weight.
Plucked directly from a Tuskling High Caucus moments after it formed, this particular ball has been transferred here to this dungeon for your entertainment, ladies and gentlemen. The magic of the ball won’t allow them to stop until every last drop of Crawler blood is squeezed right out of their human bodies! [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Borough Boss]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Ball_of_Swine}} [[Category:Mobs]]

A microphone that automatically tunes songs to within one and a half steps of the correct note, assists in the proper formation of bard based songs and amplifies noise to twice normal volume, this can be increased to five times normal volume. It also provides +5% charisma.
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Accessories]]

{{Races Basic|title1=The Bedlam Bride|floor=8|levels=Level 140 City Boss|descripton=Reaper Spider Minion}}
== Skills and abilities ==
* Level 15 Unending Insanity - creates permenant insanity that can only be cured by devine intervention * Level 15 Lights Out - creates permenant blindness that can only be cured by devine intervention * Level 15 [[Cockroach|Coackroach]] skill * Spinneret - lets her create spider webs * Venomous Bite * In addition she has dozens of spells, most of which are illusion or fear based paralysis * She is also vulnerable to psionic attacks
== Ai description == This is a demi-god.
Warning: This mob inflicts Permanent Insanity.
Warning: This mob inflicts Permanent Blindness.
Yeah, good luck with that.
Reaper Spider minions are regular mobs one may find on the fifteenth floor, working as minions of something kinda fucked up we’re not ready to talk about yet. They have celestial blood. They’re scary as shit, and if you’re not prepared for their special attacks, you’d just be better off killing yourself instead. When one encounters them outside of the 15th floor, they’re usually working as traveling merchants, selling rare and valuable wares. Anything one buys from them is usually quite dangerous.
But not all of them are merchants. Some have escaped out into the lower levels and have found their own path. Some have grown in power beyond that of a regular Reaper Spider Minion. This particular one is special. She has had many names. She currently goes by Shi Maria, and her story is long and tragic and can’t possibly be fully told here. Once upon a time, she found herself married to a god. It didn’t go so well. It’s said she killed him. It was pretty much his own fault. Don’t stick it in crazy, and all that. The thing is, she doesn’t remember actually killing him. Honestly, it’s not really important. What is important is that she was kicked out of the celestial realm and banished to this swamp where she spends her days plotting on how to get revenge on everyone and everything who has ever done her wrong.
That list is very, very long. [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:City Boss]] [[Category:T'Ghee Card]] [[Category:Deities]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Butcher's Masquerade}} {{Book | title = The Butcher's Masquerade | author = Matt Dinniman | datePublished = February 19, 2022 | publisher =Matt Dinniman | previous = [[The Gate of the Feral Gods (Book) | The Gate of the Feral Gods]] | next = [[The Eye of the Bedlam Bride (Book) | The Eye of the Bedlam Bride]] |image=DCCBook05.jpg|illustrator=''Cover:'' [https://www.artstation.com/lucianofleitas Luciano Fleitas] ''Interior:'' [http://duvelmandice.blogspot.com Andrew Duvall]|pages=730 (Paperback Edition)|isbn=979-8418566102}}'''''The Butcher's Masquerade''''' is a fictional LitRPG fantasy adventure novel by Matt Dinniman, and the fifth installment in the ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' [[:Category:DCC Books|book series]]. It is available in paperback, digital, and audiobook formats.
== Official Summary == '''Attention. Attention. The gates are down. The hunters are loose.'''
'''Run, Run, Run.'''
A lush jungle teeming with danger. Savage dinosaurs seeking blood. A fallen princess intent on vengeance. A mysterious, end-of-floor celebration for the top crawlers, dubbed “The Butcher’s Masquerade.”
The sixth floor. The Hunting Grounds.
As the remaining crawlers battle for their lives, a new, terrible threat looms. Outside tourists are finally allowed to enter the game, and they are here and ready to hunt. Among them is Vrah, a famed and veteran hunter, intent on collecting the biggest trophy of her career.
But their prey is far from harmless, and this season they are fighting back.
Dungeon Crawler Carl and Princess Donut return in book five of the acclaimed LitRPG series. [[Category:DCC Books]] {{DEFAULTSORT:05 The_Butcher's_Masquerade_(Book)}}

The Dark Hive is a group of [[Mantis|Mantis's]] that run an intergalactic amusement park.
They sent 8 people to the [[Sixth Floor|Hunting Grounds]], including [[Vrah]], [[Xindy]] and their trader [[Edict]]. None of them survived the floor.
== Members ==
* [[Circe Took]] * [[Vrah]] * [[Xindy]] * [[Edict]]
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

{{Citation}} A faction made up of [[Elf|elves]], participating in [[Ninth Floor|The Faction Wars]]. Have sworn revenge on [[Louis]] for thinking Epitome Noflex is attractive.
They ride zebras and mostly use poison, druid magic and long range artillery.
They control food operations in numeral solar systems and own the patents on several types of food. After the Epitome family became trapped on Earth they threatened to stop all food production until they were freed. {| class="fandom-table" |+'''The Dream''' !'''Member''' !'''Title''' !'''Notes''' |- |[[Epitome Tagg]] |Leader | |- |[[Epitome Noflex]] | |mother of Epitome Tagg |- |[[Akland]] | | |- |[[Arwick]] | | |- |[[Drick]] | | |} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dream}} [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]] [[Category:Corporations]] [[Category:Governments]] [[Category:Factions]]

page.title: The Eye of the Bedlam Bride (Book)

revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Eye of the Bedlam Bride}} {{Book | title = The Eye of the Bedlam Bride | author = Matt Dinniman | datePublished = June 14, 2023 | publisher = | previous = [[The Butcher's Masquerade (Book) | The Butcher's Masquerade]] | next = TBA |image=File:DCCBook06.jpg|illustrator=''Cover:'' [https://www.artstation.com/lucianofleitas Luciano Fleitas]|pages=692 (Paperback Edition)|isbn=979-8396866379}}'''''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride''''' is a fictional LitRPG fantasy adventure novel by Matt Dinniman, and the sixth installment in the ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' [[:Category:DCC Books|book series]]. It is available in paperback, digital, and audiobook formats.
== Official Summary == A pantheon of forgotten gods. An old grudge between a talk show host, an heiress, and the man they shattered along the way. A rapidly deteriorating AI system. An inconvenient tiara upon the head of a friend.
==== It is bedlam on the eighth floor. ==== As management reels from the unexpected conclusion of the seventh level, the surviving crawlers stumble onto the eighth and find themselves scattered. It’s a map based on Earth’s final days before the collapse, where ethereal, intangible ghosts of humanity go about their lives, oblivious of the impending doom. Living amongst these ghosts are monsters based in Earth lore. “Legendary” creatures tied to the geographical location they inhabit.
Each team of crawlers is given a task: find and capture six of these beasts. The captured monsters will be turned into cards. Cards that can be summoned into battle again and again. The stronger, the deadlier, the better.
At the end of the floor, the bad guys will also have decks, and they will have some of the most powerful cards available. So it’s crucial to assemble the toughest squad possible.
But, like always, there is a catch. There’s always a catch.
As Carl and Donut know all too well, just because someone is captured, it doesn’t mean they have been tamed.
Her name is Shi Maria. She’s easily the most powerful monster in their area. If they want to survive, they must capture her. But she is no ordinary beast. She’s intelligent. She was once married to a god, a god who is now missing. Her special attack is known to drive one insane. They call her the Bedlam Bride.
''<small>“Beware, beware. Beware the Eye of the Bedlam Bride”</small>'' [[Category:DCC Books]] {{DEFAULTSORT:06 The_Eye_of_the_Bedlam_Bride_(Book)}}

page.title: The Filthy Little Crawlers Book of Voodoo

revision.text:
A book that can be used to exchange messages with other crawlers you have meet that also own a “filthy little crawlers book of voodoo”. When meeting a crawler that also has this book their name will appear in it, if you write a message under there name only they will receive it, if you write under your name everyone can see it. Messages can be erased on demand.
It can't be traded, destroyed or thrown away, if dropped it will return to your inventry.
== Trivia == Named after Filthy Pierre the creator of the Voodoo Board.

page.title: The Gate of the Feral Gods (Book)

revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Gate of the Feral Gods}} {{Book | title = The Gate of the Feral Gods | author = Matt Dinniman | datePublished = June 14, 2021 | publisher = | previous = [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Book) | The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]] | next = [[The Butcher's Masquerade (Book) | The Butcher's Masquerade]] |image=DCCBook04.jpg|illustrator=''Cover:'' [https://www.artstation.com/lucianofleitas Luciano Fleitas]|pages=584 (Paperback Edition)|isbn=979-8520410171}}'''''The Gate of the Feral Gods''''' is a fictional LitRPG fantasy adventure novel by Matt Dinniman, and the fourth installment in the ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' [[:Category:DCC Books|book series]]. It is available in paperback, digital, and audiobook formats.
== Official Summary == '''New Achievement! Total, Utter Failure.'''
'''You failed a quest less than five minutes after you received it. Now that’s talent.'''
A floating fortress occupied by warrior gnomes. A castle made of sand. A derelict submarine guarded by malfunctioning machines. A haunted crypt surrounded by lethal traps.
It was supposed to be easy. One bubble. Four castles. Fifteen days. Capture each one, and the stairwell is unlocked.
Here's the thing. It's never easy. Carl and his team can't go it alone. Not this time. They must rely on the help of the low-level, I-can't-believe-these-idiots-are-still-alive crawlers trapped in the bubble with them. But can they be trusted?
Welcome, Crawler. Welcome to the fifth floor of the dungeon. [[Category:DCC Books]] {{DEFAULTSORT:04 The_Gate_of_the_Feral_Gods_(Book)}}

page.title: The Hand That Claws The Master

revision.text:
[[Carl]] killed the hunters in Zockau during [[Sixth Floor|The Hunting Grounds]].
==Description== You have permanently killed a non-crawler biological. They ain't just dead. They dead dead. Their children are now orphans. Their mothers are gnashing their teeth and cursing your name. And you're just sitting there all alive and shit, and girlfriend, I am all in. We all know you should have received this achievement, uh, a little earlier, but I figured it'd be in your best interest not to reward you this one just yet. But you sure deserved it, so I may have slipped an extra one in there. Shhh. Don't tell the mudskippers.
''Reward:'' You've received a Gold [[Hunter-Killer Box]] (x34)
Note: This achievement may be awarded more than once, but Hunter-Killer Boxes are only awarded on the sixth floor. [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:Dungeon-Crawler-Carl-Book-1-Episode-2-Cover-Art.jpg|thumb|Official art of the Horder from the cover of the Soundbooth Theatre Immersion Tunnel: Season 1, Episode 2: Ayúdame]]
== Description == Level 7 Neighborhood Boss!
Trapped in her pile of rubbish, abandoned by society, the war inside her head has seeped out of her mind and infected both her body and her surroundings. Now nothing more than a garbage troll, the Hoarder is a horrific reminder of what can happen to those who fall out of the light! Protected by her minions, she’ll do anything to keep her precious stockpile safe [[Category:Boss]] [[Category:Neighborhood Boss]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Hoarder}} [[Category:Mobs]]

[[File:DCC-AIT-S01E03-Cover.jpg|thumb|Official art of the Horder from the cover of the Soundbooth Theatre Immersion Tunnel: Season 1, Episode 3: I’m Proud of You, Bro]] Level 9 Neighborhood Boss!
With a body enhanced by the finest anabolic steroids the dark web has to offer, the Juicer spends his days pushing iron, snapping necks, and crying that his pimple-infested sac is a third the size it once was. Having reached a plateau, rage now fills his enlarged heart. All he ever wanted was to gain, but right now he’ll settle on bringing out……the paaaaain!
Appeared to Carl as if it were a competition bodybuilder mashed up with a Troglodyte Basher. He looked human in appearance although kept the lizard head and scaled body with lizard tail.
== Trivia == [[File:00879.jpg|thumb|The Juicer]] It's revealed on the sixth floor that he used to volunteer at a hedgehog rescue.

page.title: The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)

revision.text:
The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network is one of [[Carl|Carl's]] formal sponsors, one of their members was a former owner of the [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Anarchists Cookbook]]. They heavily interfering with Carl on the 8th floor, leading him to meet with a Residual in Homestead, Florida. The OIPAN has since disappeared and no longer sponsors Carl.
Carl believes that they've brought a god.
They funded the show [[Shadow Boxer]] using it to give cryptic clues to [[Donut]] and [[Carl]].
== Known gifts ==
* [[Toraline]] * [[Carl's Xistera|Enchanted Xistera Extension Slot]] * [[Pawna's Cries]] * A flyer for a homeless shelter in Homestead, Florida
== Known members ==
* [[Porthus|Dr. Porthus Hu]] * [[Rosetta]] * [[Tipid]]
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Crawler Sponsors]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

[[File:00874.jpg|thumb|The Orchid of Eileithyia's Grace ]] A flower currently inside the [[Engaged Lockbox of the Nightworm]].
If you eat this flower it renders you unconscious with your health a 1% of your max, you can not heal during this time. If you survive this ordeal you will be given one of three boons chosen by the goddess.
* Your base constitution will triple, any additional points added to constitution will be three points, all constitution bonuses will be tripled. * You will be transported to the twelfth floor and be made into an NPC celestial attendant. After the twelfth floor finishes you will be allowed to make an exit deal to leave the dungeon. * Your race will permanently turned back to your original race, you will be made pregnant, you will be allowed to choice the father. As pregnant women are ineligable for Dungeon Crawler World if you get this boon you will be removed to the [[Kinder Facility|kinder facility]].
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Utility Items]]

[[File:00631y.jpg|thumb|[[The Plenty]]]] The Plenty are the organization that runs the tunnelling system, they are working with the [[The Apothecary|Apothecary]] and coordinate what loot boxes they give their crawlers.
There logo is an eyeball with a bunch of squiggles radiating out from it.
Carl suspects that the Plenty wanted [[Miriam Dom]] to die.
== Sponsors ==
* [[Carl]] * [[Miriam Dom]] * [[Prepotente]]
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Crawler Sponsors]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]
#REDIRECT [[The Prism kingdom]]

The Prism Kingdom is country of [[Saccathian]] ruled by [[Princess D'Nadia]].
They are scheduled to participate in faction wars on the ninth floor.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]] [[Category:Governments]] [[Category:Factions]] [[Category:Crawler Sponsors]]

revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Prize Carousel]]

[[Carl]] entered the stairwell to [[Fifth Floor|The Bubbles]] while listed in the top 10.
==Description== You managed to enter a stairwell while listed in the current top 10. You're a survivor. A scrapper. And just and the buck's antlers grow another point as they mature, you too, have grown as both a crawler and as a prize.
''Reward:'' You have received a Gold [[Venison Box]]! Don't get too excited. It's just money. In addition, all bounties against you now and in the future will have a (x2) modifier attached.
Hey, at least the prize for surviving the floor goes up, too. [[Category:Achievements]]

The Reavers are a megacorporation and system government that live on a dyson sphere. Originally several different races that enhanced themselves with machines until the only organic part remaining was their brain. Originally related to the [[Nebular|Nebulars]].
They are capable of switching shape at will but they normally look like android soothers with plastic skin.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]] [[Category:Factions]] [[Category:Governments]] [[Category:Corporations]]
#REDIRECT [[Recital]]

page.title: The Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance

revision.text:
{{SpoilH | 6}}
The Reminiscence Hydra of Malicious Compliance is a level 125 city [[boss]].
A hydra with nine heads each one somebody from [[Carl]] and [[Donut|Donut's]] life.
This boss was created by the [[System AI]], as it's forbidden from creating copies of people from outside the dungeon it instead replaced a single molocule on each one so it technically wouldn't apply.
== List of heads ==
* [[Tammy Lin]] * [[Monobrow Sam]] * [[Bea's mother]] * [[Sugar Cube]] * [[Dick]] * [[Sally]] * [[Mr. Rath]] * [[Judge Lucian]] * [[Asher]]
== Histroy == In the third and fourth season it acted as the boss of the entire dungeon. It was originally called Scolopendra‏‎ Nymphs. [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Boss]]

{{SpoilH | 6}} {{citation}}
One of the oldest and largest Syndicate governments, run by [[King Rust]], who is an [[orc]]. They have a legacy spot in [[Ninth Floor|The Faction Wars]].
During the crawl, there is unrest in some of their home worlds, partially due to the snick film featuring their Prince [[Maestro]] and Carl. Carl encourages the people in the Skull Empire to look at their situation and revolt if they're unhappy with their government ignoring their duties to play in the dungeon. This prompts Crown [[Prince Stalwart]] to fire on the production trailer thought to contain Carl and Donut, accidentally killing [[Manasa]]. This prompts retaliation from The Valtay Corporation, who destroy Prince Stalwart's yacht which is rumored to contain [[Queen Consort Ugloo]] and Maestro.
Later, they sponsor the War God [[Grull]] in an attempt to get revenge on Carl, but he sends the god to the abyss in the train station with the help of several other crawlers. Then they send a [[Celestial Grenade]] to [[Maggie My]], who worships [[Algos]], the god of pain. She intends to use on Carl and Donut while possessing [[Chris Andrews]], but she drops it when she is petrified by [[Katia Grim|Katia]]'s bolt of Petrify Rock Class, sent by Princess [[Formidable]], sister to Stalwart and Maestro.
They are one of the seven plaintiffs who sued Carl and the System AI over [[The Gate of the Feral Gods]]. When they lose, Carl receives a picture of the Queen Consort, and a stock certificate in Sigmund Textiles Foundry, a publicly traded company in the empire.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]] [[Category:Governments]] [[Category:Factions]]

{{SpoilR}}{{Character_info|height=7'0"|species=[[Cretin]]|status=Alive|party=The Royal Court of Princess Donut|allies=* [[Bomo]]|level=35|skills=[[Zerzura]] [[Magic Shell]]|first_appearance=Chapter 8, Book 3|image1=00600.jpg}}First appears as private security for Princess Donut and Carl in the Desperado Club. Later, he is assigned as a mercenary bodyguard in exchange for [[The Gate of the Feral Gods]] at the beginning of Book 5.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

The Squim Conglomerate are a planet mining corperation, they ran the season prior to the [[Borant Corporation|Borant Corporations]] current "Dungeon Crawler World Earth". They only do battle royale style seasons, rather than dungeon crawls.
Currently sponsoring [[Katia Grim|Katia]] as well as approximately 500 other crawlers.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Squim_Conglomerate}} [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Corporations]] [[Category:Crawler Sponsors]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

The Syndicate Council is the organisation that governs the universe and created the crawl. It's membership consists of many of the most powerful governments in the universe and it has an extensive legal system. It is lead a gleener named by prime minister Glory.
There is a syndicate sub committee that is responsible for all matters related to [[Dungeon Crawler World]].
A syndicate standard day is approximately 30 hours 17.5 second.
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]] [[Category:Governments]]

page.title: The early bird gets to squirm

revision.text:
[[File:00614.jpg|thumb|The early bird gets to squirm]] [[Carl]] entered the fourth floor early to escape the explosion from the updated [[Fools Who Broke the Glass|Fools Who Broke The Glass]] quest.
==Description== You went down a set of stairs more than six hours prior to the level's collapse.
''Reward:'' Doing this is kind of like leaving a party much too early. It makes you look like a dick. No reward for you. [[Category:Achievements]]

page.title: They like me! They really like me!

revision.text:
[[Carl]] gained 500 trillion followers.
==Description== You are one of the first five crawlers to have achieved 500 trillion followers! People sure love a good train wreck. Wink.
''Reward:'' You have received a Platinum [[Fan Box]]!
Note: Voting is now enabled on this box's prize. Box will become available in 30 hours. [[Category:Achievements]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Over City (Third Floor)}} {{Dungeon Floor|image=File:00210.jpg |title1 = The Over City |floor_number=3 |theme=Urban / [[:Category:Dungeon Lore | Dungeon Lore]] |duration=8 Days |crawlers=~ 700,000 |start_date=January 13 |preceded_by=[[Second Floor]] |followed_by=[[Fourth Floor]] |exits=18,750 |locations =* Lucky's General Goods * The One Eyed Narwhal |mobs = * [[Former Circus Lemur]] * [[Incubus]] * [[Mold Lion]] * Shadow Leak * Shambling Berserker * [[Street Urchin]] * [[Terror the Clown]] * Village Guard |npcs ='''City Employees''' * Burgundy * [[Magistrate Featherfall]] (Level 32) * [[Miss Quill]] '''Desperado Club''' * [[Clarabelle]] * [[Quint]] * [[Pustule]] '''Shopkeeps & Bartends''' * Edge Dancer (Skyfowl, Level 30) * Fitz (Human, Level 30) * Gordo (Bopca Protector) * Talon Strong (Skyfowl, Level 30) '''[[Vengeance of the Daughter]]''' * [[Apollon the Mighty]] * [[Tsarina Signet]] '''Other''' * Benjamin (Salamander) * Bubba Lane (Fathom Dwarf) * Carmine (City Elf, Level 16) * Eklund (Game Guide) * Eunice (Fathom Dwarf, Level 30) * [[GumGum]] * Krasue * [[Remex]] (Soul Leech Capacitor, Level 1) * Ricky Joe (Fathom Dwarf, Level 2) * Salvatore (City Elf, Level 16) * Vincente |bosses= * [[Heather the Bear]] * [[Ringmaster Grimaldi]] * The [[Dispenser]] |quests = * [[Show Must Go On]] * [[Sex Workers Who Fell from the Heavens]] * [[Fools Who Broke the Glass]]}}{{Quote | quote = “Princess Donut, Carl, little Mongo, welcome to the third floor. The training levels have concluded. Now the games may truly begin.” -- [[Mordecai]]Dinniman, Matt. Carl's Doomsday Scenario: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 2 (p. 2). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.}} The '''Over City''' is the [[Dungeon]]'s Third Floor and the first "Volcano Storyline" floor. Although still under the surface of the Earth the floor is designed to look like it's on the surface. An artificial sky is visible and the floor is made of wooden planks. There are hundreds of small, scattered villages surrounded by wide swaths of abandoned city. Where you exited the second floor has no bearing on where you enter this floor. It is completely random. It is significantly smaller than the 1st and 2nd floors. The Over City is the first of the six special urban "Volcano" storyline floors. The is supposed to span the length of the crater of a huge volcano. The other five layers (floors) are located deeper in the volcano. ==Introductory Announcement==
''"Welcome, again, Crawlers to the third floor!'' ''There are still a few stragglers working on their class and race choices, and that’s okay. The vast majority of you are out and about and just starting to learn about the wonders of the Over City. We welcome you to a Dungeon Crawler World tradition.'' ''You all have made some wondrous and unique choices. Of the just under 700,000 crawlers who’ve made a decision, we have seen almost 40,000 different class choices. Can you believe that? That is a record, and we are very proud to see such diversity.'' ''A couple announcements regarding this third floor. While the bathroom penalties have been removed, we want to remind the crawlers that restrooms still populate this floor. In the villages you may find restrooms in any pub and in some shops. In the ruins, the toilets are just as prevalent as they were on the higher floors. Please do not force us to backtrack.'' ''We are already seeing much interest in the sponsorship program. And while the program doesn’t officially get underway until the fourth floor, potential sponsors now have the ability to put in early bids. Therefore, remember to be as entertaining as possible!'' ''Finally, many of you are discovering new abilities and spells and wish to try them out. We urge you to do so. But this is just a general warning that any attempts of violence against non-combatant NPCs should be avoided. While this practice is technically not against the rules, the Borant corporation wishes to keep the citizenry as safe as possible. As a result, we have adjusted the experience counter for citizens down to zero. In addition, city guards have been given a slight boost in stats.'' ''That’s all for now. Get out there and kill, kill, kill!''
==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Dungeon Floor 03}} [[Category:Dungeon Floors]][[Category:Floor 3 | {{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: This Little Piggy Went to Market!

revision.text:
== AI Description == Oh yeah, baby. You have killed more than five opponents during boss battles using your bare feet. You are making daddy very, very happy.
'''Reward:''' You've received a Platinum [[Clothing Box|Shoe Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

page.title: This little piggy made a boom boom

revision.text:
[[Carl]] kicked the [[Just You Wait Until Your Daddy Gets Home]] bomb out of the saferoom towards [[Vrah]] and two other mantises. He received a [https://dungeon-crawler-carl.fandom.com/wiki/Upgrade_Patch?so=search#Bomb_Upgrade_Patch_(Medium) bomb upgrade patch] as a reward.
==Description== You deployed a bomb with the supple, curved sole of your foot. You took your perfectly-perfect, 30.004861 centimeter-long right foot and compressed it against an explosive device—a device named after me no less—and you gave it a naughty little shove before you pushed it out the door and detonated it. You killed them. You killed them all for your daddy.
''The AI made a deep, throaty groan for like five seconds straight, an uncomfortably long time.''
''Reward:'' You've received a Gold [[Spicy Box]]. [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Citation}} [[Carl]] killed three neighborhood bosses with his [[Wisp Armor Spell|Wisp Armor]].
==Description== You killed three boss monsters with the same attack! I'm starting to think your survival so far isn't just a fluke. You're either scary good at this, or you're just one luck mo-fo. Either way, holy shit. Good job.
''Reward:'' You've received a Platinum [[Big Daddy Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:00822.jpg|thumb|A Tigran adolecent sent to the store for milk and frosted flakes]]
== Description == A orange, furry humanoid race.
== Notable Tigran ==
* [[Daniel Bautista]]
[[Category:Races]]

Admin Notice. This page may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Posting spoilers for Book 7 will result in “acceleration” per this wiki’s rules. ==Description== Author of the 21st Edition of The [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]. ==Cookbook Entries== I have noticed something quite curious. The gods and goddesses are Soul Armor. So when the aliens inhabit the bodies of the gods, they do so like the Intellect Hunters, the Scree, and the Valtay. The aliens are wearing the gods like clothes. That means they can, in theory, be removed with a successful cast of any spell designed to remove biological armor, such as ''[[Take That Shit Off]]'' and ''[[Laundry Day]]''. You'd have to first defeat the invulnerability, of course. Plus it won't hurt the gods, who will revert to their programming, natural state, whatever you want to call it, and who knows what'll happen to the aliens who were driving them. But if you need a god to do your bidding, it might be in your best interest to first shed it of its off-world influence. I have noticed that the aliens are quite unpredictable in their manner. (Chapter 32, Book 3) I don't know, I think they [spiders]'re cute. (Chapter 26, Book 6) Never mind. Holy shit, never mind. Fuck spiders. (Chapter 26, Book 6) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]
#REDIRECT [[Big Tina]]

{{SpoilH | 6}} {{Character_info | species = [[Crest]] | organizations = [[Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network]] | allies = * [[Porthus]] * [[Rosetta]] | status = Alive | image1 = 01044.png }}{{Quote | quote = “I always knew I would die in the dungeon. Even after I got out, I always knew. It’s always there, pulling at me.{{ref|6|epilogue}}}} '''Tipid''' is a former crawler and author of the ''[[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item) | Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]'' (4th Edition). ==Description== Tipid is a [[Crest]]. Thousands of years ago, he and his best friend [[Horatio]] were partners in the [[Dungeon]]. His final entries in the cookbook describe how he was forced to use the [[Mysterious Bone Key]] to descend a stairwell, leaving Horatio behind. Tipid presumably took an indentured servitude deal and survived. He is now a member of the outlawed [[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC) | Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network]] doing business as [[Long Haul Biological Waste Management Solutions]], and piloting the ''[[Homecoming Queen]]'' into Earth's orbit to join the [[Ninth Floor]] Faction Wars. == Cookbook Entries==
''I killed my best friend today. I wish I had never made it this far.''Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (p. 168). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|6|16}}
''It was me or him, and I chose to save myself. I didn't think. I reacted. I reacted to save myself. Anybody else would do the same. I keep telling myself that again and again. Does that make me evil? No, I don't think it does, not when I think of it logically. Then why do I feel this way?''Dinniman, Matt. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 6 (p. 542). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|6|57}}
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]] ==References==

[[File:00860.jpg|thumb|Toad Cudgel]] The first unenchanted weapon [[Carl]] received on the [[First Floor|first floor]] (in a Bronze [[Weapon Box]] awarded for the [[Unarmed Combat|Unarmed combat!]] achievement), the toad cudgel is a wooden stick about 3/4 the length of a baseball bat.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 5).</ref> Carl attempts to use it in combat exactly one time before putting it back in his inventory.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 10).</ref> It may be one of the items that he and Donut sold on the Third Floor, or it may still be in his inventory and waiting to make a comeback.
== AI Description == The AI reads the description in a "caveman voice."
'''Big stick for bonking. Bonk toad. Bonk mob. Bonk girlfriend and drag back to cave by hair.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (p. 57; chapter 6). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. </ref>
== References == <references /> {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Floor 1]]
{{Stub}} The tomb contains a skeleton of a goose wearing a golden unenchanted crown. [[Category:Floor 5]] [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Dungeon]]

Toraline is a root vegitable that only grows on volcanic soil, it was given to [[Carl]] by the [[The Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network (Intergalactic NFC)|Open Intellect Pacifist Action Network]] as one of his benefactor boxes.
== Uses == * A special ink for creating scrolls * Creating a healing potion for lava rock monsters * As a phase potion so people can easily pass through lava rock {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Crafting Materials]]

[[File:00088.jpg|thumb|Torch]] A utility spell that creates an orb of light. Obtained by [[Donut]] on [[Dungeon Floor 1|Floor 1]] through a loot box. ==Description== '''Cost''': Unknown
'''Target''': Self
'''Duration''': Unknown
Creates a ball of light that acts like a torch. At higher levels the caster gains increased control over the light, allowing them to do things like change the intensity and stick it to surfaces. [[Category:Spells]]
[[File:000TossUp.jpg|thumb|Toss Up]] A [[T’Ghee totem|T’Ghee]] card that switches your totems with those of your opponents. {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:T'Ghee Card]]

[[Carl]] failed the quest [[Free Wynne from his bondage]].
==Description== You failed a quest less than five minutes after you received it. Now ''that's'' talent.
''Reward:'' Ha. [[Category:Achievements]]

The second achievement [[Carl]] receives after entering the [[Dungeon]]. This is a unique achievement that can only be awarded to one crawler.
== AI Description == '''You are the ''first'' crawler to have entered to the World Dungeon accompanied by a cat. You must really love that thing. Too bad you're both probably going to die a horrible death at any moment. Or maybe not. Look at the prize you just received!'''
'''''Reward:'' You've received a Legendary [[Pet Box]]!'''<ref>''Dungeon Crawler Carl,'' Chapter 2</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Swashbuckler]]|species=Human|first_appearance=Chapter 20, Book 4|allies=[[Gwendolyn Duet]]|level=28|origin=Da Nang, Vietnam}}
One of the crawlers in the Land zone of Bubble #543. He has a metal-detecting ability and also has the [[path finding]] skill.
Lost his legs in the Cage Fight at the end of [[Sixth Floor|The Hunting Grounds]]. Received a magical floating disc to carry him.
He was in a squad with [[Katia Grim]], [[Daniel Bautista]], [[Louis]], and [[Britney]] on [[Eighth Floor|The Ghosts of Earth]] floor.
His wheelchair blew up during the fight with [[Amayon]] and [[Ysalte]].
== Skills == As a swashbuckler he gets a bonus when he’s working with other members of his class like [[Daniel Bautista|Bautista]]. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

{{Quote | quote = THE TRANSFORMATION OCCURED AT APPROXIMATELY 2:23 AM, PACIFIC STANDARD TIME. As far as I could tell, anyone who was indoors when it happened died instantly.
-- [[Carl]] (Book 1, Chapter 1) }} '''The Transformation''' is the collapse of all Earth structures with a closed top or roof (including buildings, cars, airplanes, tents, cardboard boxes, etc.), which occurred at approximately 2:23 AM Pacific Standard Time (PST) on Tuesday January 3. Any living being inside or underneath such a structure was killed instantly. From the subsequent AI announcement and Mordecai's explanation later, it can be inferred that the [[Syndicate Council]] initiated "First Contact" with fledgling Earth civilizations around 2250 - 2490 BC. Humans failed to claim Earth as a sovereign entity or file an appeal for mineral and elemental rights within the 50 Solars allotted by the [[Precious Elemental Reserves Code]], so the [[Borant Corporation]] was appointed as Earth's planetary regent.{{ref|1|4}} Several thousand years later, the Borant Corporation initiated the Transformation as a mining operation to recover rare elements. The [[System AI|AI]] explains, "Every interior of your world has been crushed and all raw materials--organic and inanimate--are in the process of being mined for the requested elements." All mined materials that were not included in the formal request (which the AI estimates to be 99.99999% of sifted matter) were then repurposed to create [[Dungeon|the World Dungeon]].{{ref|1|1}} == Description == From ''Dungeon Crawler Carl,'' Chapter 1:
The building smashed down to the ground. I watched it happen. The seven-story apartment building was there one moment, and then it was gone. But it hadn't disappeared. ... It was like the building was a massive tin can that had been crushed by a giant, cosmic boot. I saw it, and I heard it. Wind rushed at me, and it was instantly dark outside. The streetlamp just to my left was gone. The buildings all around me were gone. The cars on the street were gone, too. Everything was gone except the trees and the bicycles and the bike racks.
From ''Dungeon Crawler Carl,'' Chapter 1:
A couple random things remained. Like the bike rack. The stop sign was there, but the street sign next to it was gone. It didn't make sense. Where the cars were parked on the road, car-shaped indentations of dirt appeared, as if they'd been pulled down toward the center of the earth, being ripped directly through the asphalt. ... All that remained of my building was a rectangle of churned dirt and rocks.
== AI Announcement == From ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 1:
'''Surviving humans take note.''' '''Per Syndicate rules, subsection 543 of the Precious Elemental Reserves Code, having failed to file a proper appeal for mineral and elemental rights within 50 Solars of first contact, your planet has been successfully seized and is currently being mined of all requested elemental deposits by the assigned planetary regent.''' '''Every interior of your world has been crushed and all raw materials—organic and inanimate—are in the process of being mined for the requested elements.''' '''Per the [[Mined Material Reclamation Act]] along with subsection 35 of the [[Indigenous Species Protection Act|Indigenous Planetary Species Protection Act]], any surviving humans will be given the opportunity to reclaim their lost matter. The [[Borant Corporation]], having been assigned regency over this solar system, is allowed to choose the manner of this reclamation, and they have chosen option 3, also known as the 18-Level World Dungeon. The Borant Corporation retains all rights to broadcast, exploit, and otherwise control all aspects of the World Dungeon and will remain in control as long as they adhere to Syndicate regulations regarding world resource reclamation.''' '''Upon successful completion of level 18 of the World Dungeon, regency of this planet will revert to the successor.''' '''A [[System AI|Syndicate neutral observer AI]]—myself—has been created and dispatched to this planet to supervise the creation of the World Dungeon and to ensure all the rules and regulations are properly followed.''' '''Please pay careful attention to the following information as it will not be repeated.''' '''Per the Indigenous Planetary Species Protection Act, all remaining materials—estimated to be 99.999999% of the sifted matter—is currently being repurposed for the subterranean World Dungeon. The first level of this dungeon will open approximately 18 seconds after the end of this announcement. The first-level entrances will be open for exactly one human hour and one hour only. Once the entrances are closed, you may no longer enter. If you enter, you may not leave until you have either completed all 18 levels of the World Dungeon or if you meet certain other requirements.''' '''If you choose not to enter the World Dungeon, you will have to sustain yourself upon the surface of your planet, and this may be the last communication you receive during your lifetime. All previously-processed matter and elements are forfeit. However, you are free to mine and utilize any remaining and naturally-occurring resources for your own benefit. The Borant Corporation wishes you luck and thanks you for the opportunity.''' '''For those who wish to exercise their right of resource reclamation, please take note.''' '''There will be 150,000 level-one [[Dungeon Entrance | entrances]] added to the world. These entrances will be marked and easy to spot. If you so choose to enter the first level of the dungeon, you will have five rotations of your planet to find the next level down. There will be 75,000 entrances to level two. There will be 37,500 entrances to level three. 18,750 to level 4. 9,375 entrances to level 5 and 4,688 entrances to level 6. The number of available entrances to the next lower level will continue to decrease by half, rounding up until the 18th level, which will only have two entrances and a single exit.''' '''Crawlers who choose to enter the World Dungeon must find a staircase and descend to the next level down before the allotted time is up for that level. Once the time has passed, the level will be reclaimed and all remaining matter in the level, organic and inanimate, will be forfeit. Generated loot and other matter that is not gathered and claimed may be placed in the Syndicate market.''' '''Each lower level will have a longer period of reclamation. Additional rules come into play once any crawlers descend to the tenth floor. These rules will be explained when and if any crawlers reach this level.''' '''If you so choose to enter the World Dungeon, it is highly recommended you immediately find and utilize a [[Tutorial Guild Hall|tutorial guild]]. Multiple tutorial guilds will be seeded throughout the dungeon on levels 1 through 3.''' '''If you have any additional questions, or you wish to file an appeal, such requests must be submitted in writing directly to the closest Syndicate office.''' '''Thank you for being a part of the Syndicate. Have a great day.'''
== Speculation == January 3 falls on a Tuesday in 2017 and 2023. Matt Dinniman began writing the series on December 26, 2019[https://www.reddit.com/r/DungeonCrawlerCarl/comments/190ec7a/comment/kgnw5t8/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web3x&utm_name=web3xcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=share_button reddit comment] by Matt Dinniman (as u/hepafilter), so it would make sense for the Transformation to have happened in 2017. However, when introducing Razor Foxes on Floor Four, the AI makes a joke that ends with "after you finally got out of quarantine,"{{ref|3|27}} which would suggest 2023. == References == [[Category:Event]] [[Category:Dungeon]] [[Category:Dungeon Backstage]] [[Category:Earth]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]
[[File:00462.jpg|thumb|Travis Priest]] Travis Priest is a strong and addictive painkiller. {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Pharmaceuticals]] [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]]
