A lot of people say crawlers who use this spell are chickenshit cowards. But then again, those same people are sitting at home covered in Cheeto dust watching this show while wearing pajamas.
This spell automatically triggers all passage, motion, heat, and weight-based traps in a certain radius.
This spell is one of those good news, bad news situations. If you have your intelligence high enough, you can automagically trigger every trap in the quadrant with the snap of the finger. Blades will fall. Bombs will explode. Electrodes will zap. It’s great fun.
Here’s the catch. This triggers the traps. It doesn’t disarm them. If you don’t know why that might be bad, then you’re probably gonna die anyway, so I wouldn’t worry about it. == Cost == This is an item-based spell. This spell does not require mana to cast. If you unequip the associated item, you will lose access to this spell. The cooldown will not reset.
== Target == A 10-meter radius sphere centered around the right hand of caster + 10 meters of radius per level of Intelligence.
== Duration == Instantaneous. [[Category:Spells]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Tripper Spell}}

Oh, these fuckers. With an intelligence just shy of an oft-dropped toddler, the standard [[Troglodyte|troglodyte]] pygmy warrior would be harmless if it wasn’t so damn fast. Or venomous.
Found on Floor One. [[Category:Mobs]]
A smoke bomb, costs 30,000 gold for a set of twelve. [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Explosives]] {{Navbox Items}}

{{Citation}}[[File:00165x.jpg|thumb|Tsarina Signet]] Tsarina Signet is an [[Elite]] that Carl first met on the third floor.
Her father is [[King Finian]] and her mother is dead following the revolution. After her sister, [[Imogen|Princess Imogen]], had taken power, Imogen attempted to eradicate all of his half blood children to solidify her claim to the throne forcing Tsarina to flee and join the circus.
She is afflicted with some unknown cursed that prevents water from touching her.
She was invited to the [[Butcher's Masquerade]] by the goddess [[Apito]]. During the ball she sacrificed herself so [[Carl]] and his fellow crawlers could escape the [[Butcher's Masquerade|Butcher’s Masquerade]], summoning her tattoos to attack Imogen before getting pulled into the Nothing.
== Abilities == She's a summoner but her battle squad require a blood sacrifice to power them, the more powerful the sacrifice the stronger they become. She is not allowed to kill them herself and the target has to receive a life threatening injury she attempted to use [[Carl]] for this but he managed to survive.
She has access to heirloom magic, including the level 15 Water Lily spell which can paralysis a target and puts them to sleep, the effect lasting until Tsarina cancels, if Tsarina dies the target dies too.
== Appearance == She has horns and is covered in animated tattooes.
== AI Description == Half Naiad, Half High-Elf Summoner. Level 60
This is an Elite.
The High-Elf King Finian, leader of the Liana Sector of the [[Sixth Floor|Hunting Grounds]], was such a horny bastard, it was said he’d bedded women from over 5,000 different races during his rule. Most scholars agree this has to be an exaggeration considering King Finian’s harelip and obsession with knitting, but nonetheless, at least one of these trysts did take place, resulting in the unique combination of half [[Naiad]], half [[High Elf]]. Considering the Naiad Confederacy’s tendency to drown outsiders and the High Elves’ inclination to hunt down and murder any mongrel child of the late king, Signet here has probably had a tough life. Maybe that’s why she ran away and joined the circus.
'''WARNING''': This is a fairy-class NPC. Creatures of this class inflict 20% more damage against you due to your goblin pass. [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]]

[[Category:Characters]] {{Character_info | class = [[Crisper]] | species = Human {{!}} [[Dog Soldier]] | image1 = Tserendolgor by QuirkyCorgi.png | origin = Mongolia | occupation = Model | first_appearance = Chapter 31, Book 3 | level = 27 }}
Tserendolgor first appears in chapter 31 of Book 3. She is described as a walking, talking German Shephard. She's known by the nickname "Ren".
Managed to get a pet [[Tummy Acher]] named [[Garrett]] on the sixth floor and used him to win the pet show championship at the [[Butcher's Masquerade‏‎]].
== Relationships == [[Donut]] distrusts her due to her being a dog.
== Appearance == She wears a vietnam era helmet with hole cut out for her ears and has a necklace with a paw print on it.
== Gear ==
* An enchanted flamethrower named Velma * Knife of frozen tears * Self destruct wrist bracelet
== History == She was born in Mongolia but lived in Paris where she worked as a super model, her and her dog were stabbed by a jealous ex boyfriend resulting in her spending a year in hospital before returning to Mongolia. The dog died in the attack.
Her and her team failed to get a key on the eigth floor and she committed suicide rather than steal [[Carl]] and [[Donut|Donut's]] key. Before she died she gave Garrett to Carl and lied to Donut saying that she was trying to steal her experience the first time they meet and that she cheated in the pet show. [[Category:Crawler]]

{{Character_info|age=middle-aged|species=Human|occupation=Stand-up comedian|first_appearance=Chapter 19, Book 2}}
One of the guests on [[Danger Zone with Ripper Wonton]], he insulted Donut and lost a verbal sparring match with her. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Syndicate Citizens]]
Tuesday Two For One is a heavily pierced goblin that works as a prostitue in the [[Desperado Club|Desperado club]], [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

==AI Description== When it comes to the Tuskling, their titles are about as accurate as their dating website photos. The once-mighty warriors conquered the Orcish Supremacy hundreds of years ago, defeating all the other clans. They are now shells of the mighty warriors they once were. The honorarium “Knight” roughly translates to “Overweight, alcoholic bureaucrat who spends his days making new laws to oppress the poor and his nights drinking and getting pegged.” Knights and their slightly-more dangerous female counterparts, Tuskling Courtesans, are only worthy adversaries when they come together to form an ancient, Tuskling battle formation known as a “Ball of Swine. [[Category:Mobs]] [[Category:Races]]

'''The Tutorial''' is the process by which new crawlers gain access to the full [[HUD / Crawler Menu|HUD and Crawler Menu Interface]]. It is conducted by the Guildmaster of a [[Tutorial Guild Hall]], and is only available on the [[Dungeon | Dungeon's]] First, Second, and Third Floors.
==Overview== Immediately after [[The Transformation | the Transformation]], a surface-level AI announcement introduces the Dungeon as a means to regain control of the planet. The AI encourages any prospective crawlers to find a Tutorial Guild Hall as soon as they can after entering the Dungeon.<ref>{{ref|1|1}}</ref>
Crawlers need an Intelligence score of at least 2 to qualify for the tutorial; otherwise, they will not unlock their Menu and will be classified as a pet.<ref name=":1">{{ref|1|4}}</ref> The tutorial takes approximately 2-3 hours to complete. Afterwards, the Guildmaster who administered the Tutorial becomes the crawler's registered [[Game Guide]].
===In the Books=== When the tutorial begins, the Guildmaster's right hand glows for a moment and the Crawler receives the notification: "'''You have been granted access to the Crawler Menu'''." The crawler's vision blinks and reappears with the expanded HUD.<ref name=":1" /> The Guildmaster teaches the crawler how to open and close menus and the minimap before introducing the crawler to the Player Stats tab, Ratings tab, Health menu, Skill menu, Magic menu, Hotlist, Party menu, Inventory, and then (if applicable) Pet menu. ''(Note: Specific information on the HUD and all menus can be found on the [[HUD / Crawler Menu]] wiki page.)''
Crawlers are taught a [[Heal|simple healing spell]] while learning about the Magic Menu, and are instructed to place the healing spell in the first slot of their hotlist.<ref name=":1" /> When the crawler is introduced to their Inventory, they are given a [[Healing Potion|Standard Healing Potion]] to add to the hotlist as well, and then told to open their Loot Boxes. Most crawlers enter the tutorial with 2 or 3 loot boxes.<ref name=":2">{{ref|1|5}}</ref>
===In the Soundbooth Theater Cinematic Audio=== Although the tutorial follows the same general format in Soundbooth Theater's Cinematic Audio series, the tutorial is ''not'' guided by the Guildmaster. Instead, the Guildmaster rolls out an old TV and plays a video narrated by a too-narrow human man who constantly fake-laughs and changes position.<ref>[https://soundbooththeater.com/shop/audiobooks/dungeon-crawler-carl-book-1-episode-1-thank-you-for-volunteering-immersion-tunnel/ "Thank You for Volunteering - Immersion Tunnel."] ''Dungeon Crawler Carl,'' season 1, episode 1, presented by Soundbooth Theater Cinematic Audio.</ref> Not to break the just-the-facts-ma'am format of the wiki, but it's a fun spin on the tutorial if you're designing a homebrew DCC campaign.
==References== <references />
[[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]] [[Category:Dungeon]] [[Category:Floor 1]] [[Category:Floor 2]] [[Category:Floor 3]]

Tutorial Guild Halls are safe rooms unique to the [[First Floor|first]], [[Second Floor|second]], and [[Third Floor|third]] floors of the [[Dungeon]]. They are marked by signs, and are managed by [[Game Guide|Guildmasters / Game Guides]]. ==AI Notifications==
'''Tutorial Guild Hall''' '''This is a Safe Zone.''' '''Warning: level timers are still active.'''Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 25). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.
Discovering a Tutorial Guild Hall sign unlocks the "[[You've discovered and read an official dungeon sign]]" achievement. Entering the hall unlocks the "[[You've entered a guildhall!]]" achievement. == Description == Carl and Princess Donut are only able to access [[Mordecai]]'s Guild Hall. Mordecai's Guild Hall is his personal space. On the [[First Floor|first floor]], half of the room is dominated by Mordecai's bed and a fireplace; the other half of the room contains a worn rug and six classroom chairs.Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 3). In the Soundbooth Theater Cinematic Audio, the room also contains an old television, which is used in the tutorial."Thank You for Volunteering - Immersion Tunnel." ''Dungeon Crawler Carl,'' season 1, episode 1, presented by Soundbooth Theater Cinematic Audio. https://soundbooththeater.com/shop/audiobooks/dungeon-crawler-carl-book-1-episode-1-thank-you-for-volunteering-immersion-tunnel/ On the Third Floor, there are also beds in case the crawler decides to make a significant race change.Dinniman, Matt. ''Carl's Doomsday Scenario'' (chapter 1). ==References== [[Category:Locations]] [[Category:Floor 1]] [[Category:Floor 2]] [[Category:Floor 3]] [[Category:Dungeon]] [[Category:Dungeon Mechanics]]

[[File:00161.jpg|thumb|Twinkle Toes]] A cheap spell that makes a minion run really fast for as many seconds as the caster's intelligence level. Obtained by [[Donut]] in a platinum quest box on [[Fifth Floor|Floor 5]]. [[Category:Spells]]

page.title: Two Chicks at the Same Time

revision.text:
== AI Description == You killed two mobs at once using only their own bodies against each other. On a brutality scale of ''Bambi'' to ''Martyrs'', that is a solid ''Seven''.
'''Reward:''' You've received a Gold [[Brawler's Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Weather Engineer]]|species=Human|first_appearance=Chapter 6, Book 4|allies=* [[Low Thi]] * [[Mike Barnes]] * [[Morris]] * [[Bobby]]|level=26|status=Deceased, killed by [[Chris Andrews]] possessed by [[Maggie My]]}}
One of the crawlers in the Subterranean Quadrant of Bubble #543. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}
A T'Ghee totem is a card that allows a crawler to store and comand a mob. It's created by getting a mobs health down to five percent then planting a flag in them.
T'Ghee cards where central to [[Allister|Allister's]] religion before being appropriated by the [[Dungeon]].
== Carl and Donut's deck ==
=== Totems ===
* Haroldo the Monk Seal * [[Raul the Crab]] * <s>[[Asojano]]</s> (combined) * <s>Uzi jesus</s> (combined) * Lazarus A-Bang-Bang * Skyler Spinach the ghommid splitter * Yola * Shi Maria the spider
=== Utility Cards ===
* Time extend * Two strength increasing “stout card” * Mana increasing “[[Blue Stuff]]” card * Two speed increasing “[[grease lightning]]” card * Combo (consumable)
=== Snare ===
* [[Hobble]] (consumable) * Hole in the bag (mana draining) * [[Damnation]] * Lamp
=== Mystic ===
* Theif * Force discard card
=== Special === * [[Flee]] (consumable)
== Other Cards ==
* [[Glow Up]] * [[Peekaboo]] * [[To Hell With Ya]] * [[Precision]] * [[Alpha Male Carl]] * [[King Croissant]] * [[Snatched]] * [[Cripple]] * [[Temporary shield]] * [[Forced Play]] * [[Toss Up]] * [[Midnight Express (T'Ghee Card)|Midnight Express]] * [[Raid Stash]] * [[Timeless]]
{{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:T'Ghee Card]]

[[File:00881.jpg|thumb|Ultimate Extreme Power]] [[Carl]] killed [[Miss Quill]] and gained control of a Medium Skyfowl Settlement.
==Description== Easy there, Charlemagne. This is only a medium settlement. It's not like you've conquered most of Europe. But you have killed this town's acting Magistrate. You know what that means? Welcome to the wonderful world of public administration.
''Reward:'' You've received a Platinum [[Tyrant Box|Tyrant's Box]]! You have also gained control of the Medium Skyfowl Settlement. Good luck, Magistrate. [[Category:Achievements]]

page.title: Ultra-Stabilized Size-Adjustable Race-Adjustable Alleviating Sleep Apparatus

revision.text:
{{Citation}} == Description == This is a bed upgrade in the party's personal space. It allows for a full rest after a period of only two hours of sleep. Imparts 30 hours of [[Good Rest]] bonus. It cost 250,000 Gold but was obtained by the Royal Court with an upgrade coupon.
The Good Rest bonus adds 10% to all stats and allows for 10% higher experience and skill training. It is one of the party's daily buffs. The buff won't show properly in the crawlers menus as buffs, this has been a persistent bug for several seasons. They can however see it directly on the effected stats. Doughnut uses this to her advantage by learning spells she otherwise wouldn't have the spell points to cast.
[[Category:Personal Space Upgrades]] [[Category:Items]]

The sixth achievement [[Carl]] receives upon entering the [[Dungeon]]. Presumably, all crawlers who entered the [[First Floor|first floor]] without a weapon received the same achievement and prize box.
== AI Description == So. You just gonna waltz right into something called a "World Dungeon" and you're not even going to bring a weapon? You're either braver than you look, or you're just an idiot. Good luck with that, Van Damme.
'''Reward''': You've received a Bronze [[Weapon Box]]!<ref>''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 2</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

Patches can be sewn into [[Enchanted Anarchist’s Battle Rattle]] to upgrade the item.
''Warning: Upgrade patches are fleeting items. You may remove them, but they will be destroyed in the process.''
{{Item|title=Patch|type=Armor Upgrade}}
== Earth Upgrade Patch (Small) == [[File:00659.jpg|thumb|Earth Patch]] This patch depicts the planet Earth, which is currently under the regency of the Borant System.
Ahh, the planet earth. A whole lot of culture. A whole lot of spunk. So many dumbasses.
If this upgrade patch is affixed to an eligible garment, it will imbue the following upgrades:
* +5% to Strength. * Immunity from cloud-based attacks. '''Source''': [[Soft Vore]] Achievement - Platinum Spicy Box
== Skyfowl Upgrade Patch (Small) == [[File:x00661.jpg|thumb|Skyfowl Patch]] This patch depicts the twelve flaming arrows the great Skyfowl hero Radiant Star shot into his grandfather in order to end the frozen time that plagued their world.
If this upgrade patch is affixed to an eligible garment, it will imbue the following upgrades:
* +5% to Dexterity. * +5% damage to all ranged projectiles. '''Source''': [[That's not how you use arrows, dumbass|That's Not How You Use Arrows, Dumbass]] Achievement - Gold [[Ranged Weapon Box]]
== Bomb Upgrade Patch (Medium) == [[File:Fde7969b 104e0366.jpg|thumb|Bomb Patch]] This patch is finely made from Spider Reaper Minion thread silk.
It’s a bomb. You blow shit up all the time. It’s appropriate you have a patch depicting it. This patch is finely made, which means all below upgrades are enhanced.
If this upgrade patch is affixed to an eligible garment, it will imbue the following upgrades:
* +11% to Constitution. * +6% damage to all explosives. * +2 to the Dangerous Explosives Handling Skill. * +15% Discount from traveling Spider Reaper Minion merchants. '''Source''': [[This little piggy made a boom boom|This Little Piggy Made a Boom Boom]] Achievement - Gold [[Spicy Box]]
== The Midnight Epicure Upgrade Patch (Medium) == [[File:00666.jpg|thumb|The Midnight Epicure Patch]] Ah, yes. The Midnight Epicure. The Caprid Who Devours the Sky. This scary-ass fable is used to terrify children across the universe. Eat your dinner, or the Midnight Epicure will come eat it for you. He will not be satisfied by the meal and will in turn devour every child in the home. Best draw a picture of him and put it in your window to let him know you’re on to his tricks.
I’m pretty sure this fairy tale was devised by Big Therapy in order to keep themselves in work.
Over the cycles, the rather disturbing symbol of the Midnight Epicure, which is really just a racist caricature of an adult Caprid, developed into a ward against all night evils.
If this upgrade patch is affixed to an eligible garment, it will imbue the following upgrades:
* Protection against Vampirism. * Protection against Lycanthropy. * +25% Magical damage against all sapient undead. '''Source''': Gold [[benefactor box]] from [[The Plenty]]
== Peace Upgrade Patch (Small) == [[File:00668.jpg|thumb|Peace Patch]] This patch depicts a peace symbol. Ahh, isn’t that cute?
Fuck off, dirty hippie. Go be smelly somewhere else. The Grateful Dead sucked anyway. And so does Phish.
If this upgrade patch is affixed to an eligible garment, it will imbue the following upgrades:
* Neutral mobs are less likely to fall into aggro. * +10% to Dexterity. * +10% skill in playing the bongos. '''Source:''' gold [[Pacifist Box]] for completing the seventh floor without killing anything.
== The Scavenger’s Daughter (Back Patch) == [[File:00670.jpg|thumb|The Scavenger's Daughter Patch]] Upgrade Patch. Back Patch.
This is a divine item.
This is a unique item.
This is a fleeting item.
You may only affix one back patch at a time.
This patch depicts a pile of scary skulls, all stacked up nice and neat. I wonder if there’s a story there?
If this upgrade patch is affixed to an eligible garment, it will imbue the following upgrades:
All patch stat point benefits are doubled.
In addition: * +25 points to Dexterity. * +25 points to Strength. * You will receive a notification every time a deity enters the area. * The Climb benefit. * The [[Soul Reaper]] benefit. * The [[Mysterious Bone Key]] benefit. * This patch will imbue additional, varying benefits when it is in the presence of divine entities.
Warning: Upgrade patches are fleeting items. You may remove them, but they will be destroyed in the process.
Warning #2! This is a divine item. This means it gains differing abilities, buffs, and possibly debuffs depending on your proximity to certain deities and demons. It makes for new and exciting combinations!
'''Source:''' Celestial [[Predator box|Predator Box]] for killing all the hunters on the sixth floor.
== Book burners patch (medium) == [[File:00671.jpg|thumb|Book Burners Patch]]. *Plus 15% intelligence * The [[Book Burner]] benefit '''Source:''' Gold [[Talk of the Town Box]]
== Upgrade Patch (Small) == [[File:00672.jpg|thumb|Spider Minion Merchant Patch]] This upgrade patch depicts a traveling Reaper Spider Minion merchant. These guys are known for their sense of humor, and I highly recommend the first thing you do the next time you meet one is to insult them. They’ll love it.
Affixing this patch to an eligible garment will imbue the following benefits:
Access to the Midnight Market. Safety or Sanity not guaranteed.
You will receive a notification if any traveling merchants are nearby.
Plus 5% to Dexterity.
Warning: Upgrade patches are fleeting items. You may remove them, but they will be destroyed in the process. [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Equipped Items]] [[Category:Patches]] {{Navbox Items}}

{{Citation}} {{Stub}} == Description == An upgrade to the kitchen in the Royal Palace. Three cabinets are along one of the walls in the kitchen that correspond to breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They synthesize the desired dish and adapt to a crawler's tastes. Supposedly there can be a "bug" where it will start spitting out the same thing every time if you order the same dish two days in a row. Carl describes the food it makes a "not bad, but not great either. The Bopca food is better." Katia and Donut were less pleased.
Upon eating a meal, the following buff notification appears:
'''“You are full! Your warm tummy increases your healing speed by 5%. It decreases debuff times by 5%. It lowers all indirect damage by 5%.”'''
The buff lasts for 30 hours. It is one of the party's daily buffs. [[Category:Personal Space Upgrades]] [[Category:Status Conditions]][[Category:Items]]

{{Stub}} {{Citation}} == Description == Automatic shower in the Royal Palace that adds +10% to all base stats and lowers "Detectability" for 30 hours. It is one of the party's daily buffs. [[Category:Personal Space Upgrades]] [[Category:Status Conditions]] [[Category:Items]]

[[Carl]] used his [[Protective Shell]] spell to launch Claude Sludgington the Fourth, a Level 65 Borough Boss Eryops Gigantis.
==Description== You caused a Rooted-in-Place boss monster to move. That's no easy feat. You then killed that monster. Pretty impressive. Hope you remember how you did it.
'''''Reward''''': You already got a boss box. This achievement is the reward. [[Category:Achievements]]

A [[slate]], which is an orange alien shaped like a piece of chewing gum. He was never a crawler, but was a [[Game Guide|game guide]] and occasional [[Manager Benefit|manager]] for 200 seasons before the crawl starting using ex-crawlers. He runs a talk show called ''[[Uptown Hal Talks Tactics]]''. Carl meets him on the panel [[Crawling Through the Ages]] at [[CrawlCon]]! [[Category:CrawlCon]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Syndicate Citizens]]

{{Character_info|first_appearance=|party=|allies=|class=[[Storm Comander]]}} Uzzi was [[Mordecai|Mordecia's]] brother and former team mates along with [[Chaco]] and [[Hold Steady]].
He was killed by Chaco using the [[Dart of Ophiotaurus]] so they could complete a puzzle and escape the 11th floor. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Aliens]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]]

[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]] {{Character_info|class=[[Gut Rearranger]]|species=Human {{!}} [[Kuhli]]|origin=Ukraine|occupation=Cosmetic surgeon|title1=Vadim Zbar|level=28|status=Deceased, killed by jellyfish in Sea quadrant of Bubble #543}}Also known as Doctor Vadim. Was a cosmetic surgeon with lots of billboards and TV commercials. He was infamous for having impregnated many of his clients, and is rumored to have 50 children.
Covered in sheaves containing daggers.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Valtay Corporation}} [[File:00011.jpg|thumb|Valtay present Dungeon Crawler World: Earth]] The Corporation that installs [[gondii]] into people's bodies upon death. They were [[Carl|Carl's]] first sponsor, this ended after the Borant Corporation stopped running the crawl.
They were a major beneficiary of [[Borant Corporation]]'s bankruptcy, gaining a 51% stake in the company and taking over [[Dungeon Crawler World]].
After taking over they wanted to remove the [[Dungeon Leaderboard|top ten crawlers]] and replace them with people they've picked.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Valtay_Corporation}} [[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Corporations]] [[Category:Crawler Sponsors]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

Vampires are a race that are required to drink large amounts of blood to survive. If a crawler is infected by vampirism and makes it to a staircase the infection becomes permanent and they gain a title.
== Features == They can gain a wide variety of spells and abilities including the ability to fly and change shape. They also get enhanced intelligence and strength.
[[Category:Races]]
[[File:00079.jpg|thumb|Vape shop counter jockey]] Vape Shop Counter Jockey is a class, it's features aren't yet known. [[Category:Class]]
{{Stub}} Veeka is a hunter, she got called out by the [[System AI]] because she locked herself in a saferoom crying and masturbating. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Hunters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:The Vengeance of the Daughter}}
== AI Description == '''New Quest. The Vengeance of the Daughter.'''
'''Part One of Two.'''
[[Tsarina Signet]], exiled half-daughter of the Naiad has finally come home. Her kingdom, once flourishing and beautiful, has become marred by infighting and a sloppy revolution that cut off the head of the government and left the body flailing.
Signet has returned and wishes to reclaim her mother's crown. Or at the very least, put a proper government in place. In order to do that, she must assassinate the current leaders of the Naiad Confederacy, who are holed up in their fortress at the former river palace of the Naiad, now dubbed "Fort Freedom."
Help Signet assault Fort Freedom and establish revenge against her mother's assassination.
'''''Reward''''': You get to move on to part two. In addition, every survivor of the assault against the Confederacy will be 20% more willing to follow your orders. I bet that number will go up even more if you complete the second half of the quest.
'''Part Two of Two.'''
Tsarina Signet has taken back her family's castle only to find the place in ruins and the Confederacy in tatters. Her people have regressed to a time before society taught them that eating everybody they meet is just rude. They are nothing better than selfish, wild animals, reminiscent of those creatures who crawl over each other to purchase televisions on Black Friday each year. Signet has a long road ahead of her to reunite her people.
But that shit's boring, and we ain't gonna make you do have anything to do with it. We're still on the revenge track, and we're going to fast forward to the good stuff.
The true culprit in all of this are the murderous and xenophobic high elves. And since King Finian is now dead, your target is Tsarina Signet's half-sister, Queen [[Imogen]]. The reclusive, pure-blooded mage rarely ventures from her chambers deep in the impenetrable high elf castle. She does, however, make an appearance at the yearly party the high elves throw for the most elite citizens of their empire.
The same party you will be invited to should you remain one of the game's top players.
Help Signet kill Queen Imogen. Destroy the stranglehold the high elves have on the Hunting Grounds. Only then will the daughter find her revenge.
Fair warning. This one won't be nearly as easy as the last.
'''''Reward''''': Upon killing Queen Imogen, the contents of the High Elf Castle will become available to loot. There's a rumor they have something hidden within that will protect from one of Scolopendra's attacks. That, plus a metric fuck ton of other good shit. [[Category:Quests]]
[[Category:Loot Boxes]]

Created by [[Veriluxx RealPet Companions]], this is a commercial hosted by a [[Forsoothed]] man named [[Gravo]] and woman named [[Liddi]] to be shown to low income families at fueling depots and waystations. [[Category:Shows]]

Verlluxx real pet Companions are a company that manufactures pet robots. They're linked to a soother lending fund named Veritan Linkage that advocates for the enslavement for those that can't afford their taxes. Closely allied to [[Borant Corporation|Borant]] and the [[Bloom]].
They are currently sponsoring [[Donut]].
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Corporations]] [[Category:Crawler Sponsors]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]]

{{Character_info|species=[[Cretin]]|occupation=Bodyguard|first_appearance=Book 4, Chapter 7|party=|image1=00604.jpg|status=Alive|organizations=[[Desperado Club]]}}Very Sullen is a [[cretin]] working as a bodyguard in the [[Desperado Club]]. His face is thinner than the other cretin guards' faces, and his eyes are tiny emotionless dots. He rarely (if ever) speaks.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''The Butcher's Masquerade'' (chapter 3).</ref> Although not verified in the text, he is most likely 7 foot tall, level 35, and wearing a tuxedo, like the other cretin guards.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (p. 127; chapter 8).</ref>
He is hired to guard [[Katia Grim|Katia]] in the Desperado Club beginning on the fifth floor.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Gate of the Feral Gods'' (chapter 7).</ref> Shortly after the Princess Posse arrives on the sixth floor, he becomes Katia's full-time mercenary bodyguard.<ref name=":0" />
== References == <references /> [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

{{SpoilH|6}} '''The Viceroys''' are a Syndicate race and government. They regularly participate in the Faction Wars as the [[Madness]].
{{Group|aliases=The Madness|part_of=Syndicate|type=Government|base_location=Syndicate Space|first=Book 6, Chapter 21|status=Active}}
==Description== Marked by featureless white masks, Viceroys specialize in horrific battlefield spells and necromancy. They regularly join the [[Ninth Floor]] Faction Wars as "The [[Madness]]," and although they have not won in a few years, they often claim victory.<ref name=":0">{{ref|6|21}}</ref> They won in [[Rosetta | Rosetta's]] year.<ref>{{ref|6|61}}</ref> Another contributor to the [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]] wondered if the viceroys were biological, as no one had seen one die.<ref name=":0" />
Outside of the [[Dungeon]], the Viceroy's government allows its citizens to vote on all government expenditures, including Faction Wars expenses.<ref>{{ref|5|77}}</ref> Their system is known for cheap medical procedures, and is often visited by non-Syndicate citizens and Syndicate residents living outside of the inner system (which has free health care).<ref name=":0" />
==Appearance== Viceroys wear a blank white mask.
Viceroys are humanoid aliens with long, thin bone-white necks and bulky bodies. Under the mask, their tusked faces are bone-white. They bleed red.<ref name=":0" />
==Story== After [[Carl]] flooded Larocos, a viceroy team was eaten by a shark.<ref>{{ref|6|35}}</ref>
==References== <references />
[[Category:Groups]] [[Category:Syndicate Organizations]] [[Category:Governments]] [[Category:Factions]] [[Category:Races]]

Viper Queen is a class that allows users to shoot poison blobs. [[Donut|Princess Donut]] briefly had this class on [[The Great Race|the seventh floor]] via her [[Former Child Actor]]'s [[Character Actor]] skill. [[Category:Class]]

[[File:00163.jpg|thumb|Visionary]] A mage class, the exact details aren't yet known.
== Known Visionary's ==
* [[Popov Brothers (Maxim & Dmitri)|Dmitri Popov]] [[Category:Class]]

{{SpoilH | 5}}{{Character_info | first_appearance = Book 5, Chapter 47 | species = Unknown | status = Unknown Presumed Dead }} '''Volteeg''' is a former crawler and author of the ''[[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]'' (7th Edition). They contributed only a single entry to the cookbook, in which they lamented the loss of a loved one. ==Cookbook Entry==
''I miss her. I miss her so goddamn much. Is it worth it? To survive this place with her gone? No. No, I don’t think it is.''
''This is Volteeg’s first, last, and only entry in the cookbook. Fuck everything about this place.''Dinniman, Matt. The Butcher's Masquerade: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 5 (p. 430). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.{{ref|5|47}}
==Speculation== *Given that the Cookbook enters the [[Dungeon]] only after certain criteria have been met, so typically on later levels, it is likely that the person Volteeg misses had entered the Dungeon with them. *Note that this entry immediately precedes [[Carl | Carl's]] final interaction with [[Miriam Dom]]. ==References== [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

{{Glossary Entry | Title = Vorpal | Definition = '''Vorpal''' is a condition that means the target has been deputized by the gods to fight demons.
Any race or creature can be vorpal, and the condition may be hidden until a demon is nearby. Vorpals can sense demons and attract demon aggro, and grow stronger and angrier the closer they are to demons. They explode if they think they'll lose a fight. They will eventually dissipate and return to the celestial realm after feeding on demon blood.<ref>{{ref|6|33}}</ref>}}<noinclude>[[Category:Status Conditions]][[Category:Keywords]]</noinclude>

{{Stub}} {{SpoilH | 5}}
{{Character_info|titles=Mayor of Zockau|species=[[Mantis]]|occupation=Hunter|first_appearance=Chapter 5, Book 5|party=[[The Dark Hive]]|allies=* [[Xindy]]|level=74|highest_stat=Dexterity}}Vrah is a participant of the [[Sixth Floor|hunting grounds]], during her time there she managed to kill both [[Bogdon Ro]] and [[Langley]]. A few seasons back he got into a fight and killed a fellow hunter.
She managed to summon [[emberus]] to Zockau and made all the guards worship him.
She was stabbed by [[Carl]] with the [[Arrow of Enthusiastic Double Gonorrhea]] and only cured after her mother sponsored the goddess [[Diwata]] and used the goddess to sleep with her.
She is immune to cloud based poisons. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Hunters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

page.title: Wait, Bosses Can Leave Their Rooms?

revision.comment: Eekz moved page [[Walk on list]] to [[Walk-On List]] without leaving a redirect
revision.text:
{{SpoilH | 4}}
'''The Walk-On List''' is a list of "Natives" (i.e. individuals who survived the [[Transformation]] but did not enter the [[Dungeon]]) that the ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]'' production company would like to transform into special Dungeon Bosses to devastate the season's most popular crawlers.<ref name=":0"/><ref>{{ref|5|18}}</ref>
The list is technically illegal, as is the practice of abducting Natives, so the abductions are normally carried out by freelance bounty hunters.<ref name=":0">{{ref|4|epilogue}}</ref>
A few seasons before ''Dungeon Crawler World: Earth,'' a Syndicate holo drama about the Walk-On List stirred up rights organizations and political controversy. Nothing came of it.<ref name=":0"/>
== References == <references />
[[Category:Dungeon Backstage]]

Wall of Fire is an escape spell obtained by [[Donut]] on [[Fifth Floor|Floor 5]].
== Description == '''Cost''': 15 mana
'''Target''': area around the caster
'''Duration''': unknown
At level one, it creates a 10-meter long, 2-meter high wall of magical fire. If the spell is cast on a flammable surface, the surface will catch fire once the spell ends. The fire can very easily go out of control.
According to Mordecai, it is a common spell that can be very powerful at higher levels. [[Category:Spells]]

== AI Description == {{Character_info|height=7' 0"|species=[[Sai]]|occupation=Firefighter|first_appearance=Chapter 32, Book 6|organizations=[[Desperado Club]]|level=101}} '''Walter - Sai. Level 101 Guard of the Larracos level of the Desperado Club'''
The Sai are quite serious about their guard duties, mostly because it's the only gig they can really get. They used to be firefighters, but firefighting in a war zone is a good way to make yourself almost extinct. So, they migrated into the Desperado Club and now are known as the ever-present guards of the bottom* floor of the Desperado. Focusing on their duties distracts them from all those urban legends about their armor being too itchy. These creatures aren't really known for their intelligence, but they're generally good guys, loyal until the end. That's what makes them good guards. They don't care about rules or laws or morals. They just do what they're told.
If they charge, get the hell out of the way.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Desperado Club Employees]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A box related to wands. [[Category:Loot Boxes]]"
revision.text: A box related to wands. [[Category:Loot Boxes]]
[[File:00250.jpg|thumb|[[Wand Recharge Scroll]]]] A scroll that recharges a wand. {{Navbox Items}} [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Scrolls]]

[[File:00542.jpg|thumb|War Criminal]]
== AI Description == You have killed more than 20 non-combatants in a single attack!
Question: What’s the only thing standing between an innocent child and a happy, fulfilling life?
Answer: You. The answer is you.
'''Reward''': You’ve received a Gold [[Asshole's Box|Asshole’s Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]
[[File:00341.jpg|thumb|Warlock]] Magic based class, provides -1 to constitution. [[Category:Class]]

revision.comment: Eekz moved page [[Glossary:Warrior's]] to [[Warrior's]] without leaving a redirect
revision.text: {{Glossary Entry | Title = Warrior's | Definition = '''Warrior's''' is an item keyword indicating that the magical item will only work if equipped by someone wielding a sword.<ref>{{ref|6|49}}</ref>}} <noinclude>[[Category:Keywords]]</noinclude>

[[Category:Loot Boxes]] [[File:00228.jpg|thumb|Weapon Box]]The Weapon Box is a [[:Category:Loot Boxes|Loot Box]] common on the [[First Floor|first floor]]. Although a [[Ranged Weapon Box|Ranged Weapons Box]] is given out on the [[Sixth Floor|sixth floor]], the basic "Weapon Box" is never mentioned again after the [[Dungeon Crawler Carl (Book)|first book]]; instead, unenchanted weapons are distributed to crawlers on deeper floors in low-tier [[Adventurer Box|Adventurer Boxes]].
== Bronze Weapon Box == Distributed as a reward for unarmed combat on the [[First Floor|first floor]], these are bronze-colored boxes approximately half the size of a military foot locker.<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 5).</ref> They contain unenchanted basic weapons.
=== Sample Loot: ===
* [[Toad Cudgel]], a blunt weapon that looks like a stunted baseball bat.<ref name=":0" /> * '''Poker,''' a wrought-iron fireplace poker.<ref name=":0" />
=== Related Achievements: ===
* [[Unarmed Combat]] * [[You've killed a mob with your bare fucking hands!|You've killed an armed mob with your bare fucking hands!]]
== Platinum Weapon Box == Distributed to the (10) crawlers who killed the first Borough Boss within 30 hours of entering the Dungeon, these boxes contained enchanted ranged weapons.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''Dungeon Crawler Carl'' (chapter 14).</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Floor 1]]
[[File:00221.jpg|thumb|Weapon oil: Weeping wound]] Applied to an edged weapon this oil grants a bleed effect. [[Category:Items]] [[Category:Consumable Items]] [[Category:Potion]] {{Navbox Items}}

[[File:00449.jpg|thumb|Weather Engineer]]
== Description == Unspecified
