revision.comment: Eekz moved page [[Welcome to the neighborhood]] to [[Welcome to the Neighborhood! Achievement]] without leaving a redirect: housekeeping
revision.text:
{{SpoilH | 3}}
[[File:00613.jpg|thumb|Welcome to the neighborhood]]'''Welcome to the neighborhood!'' is an Achievement awarded for purchasing a [[Personal Space]].
The doorway to the personal space opens as soon as the achievement fades away. If multiple party members purchase a personal space, the space is titled "Conjoined Personal Space of Team [Name]."<ref name=":0">{{ref|3|2}}</ref>
==AI Description== You have bought a home! It's every man's dream to someday own a place where he can fap in peace. No more filthy roommates not doing the dishes or making up excuses as to why they can't pay the rent. No more landlord who shows up without notice and conceals hidden cameras in the smoke detectors. It's all smooth sailing from now on.
''Reward:'' You're a homeowner now. That is the reward. That and taxes and having to deal with Kenneth the megalomaniac HOA president.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 3 (p. 42). Dandy House. Kindle Edition. </ref>
==Story== [[Carl]] and [[Donut]] receive this achievement on the [[Fourth Floor]]. Their conjoined personal space is promptly named the [[Royal Palace of Princess Donut]].
==References== <references />
[[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Personal Spaces]]

An [[:Category:Achievements|Achievement]] for receiving the "[[Good Rest]]" buff for the first time. [[Carl]] receives this achievement on the [[Fourth Floor]] after sleeping on the [[Ultra-Stabilized Size-Adjustable Race-Adjustable Alleviating Sleep Apparatus]].
== AI Description == '''New achievement! Well-Rested!'''
'''You managed to sleep so well that you woke up feeling refreshed and full of energy. You are ready to take on the world and make some monster’s mother cry because her only child was ruthlessly slaughtered by a bright-eyed and bushy-tailed Crawler.'''
'''''Reward:'' You now receive the Good Rest bonus every time you sleep in this bed. This buff adds 10% to your base stats plus a 10% bonus to experience and skill training for 30 hours. Monster mothers now cry 10% more when you kill their babies.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook'' (pp. 48-49; chapter 3). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>
== References == <references />
[[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 4]]

[[Carl]] reached 100 in his strength stat.
==Description== Your base strength is now over 100. Rawr!
Get thee to Chippendales!
''Reward:'' You've received an upgrade!
''Admin message:''
You have been given a permanent upgrade. You have three choices. You have three minutes to pick. Choose wisely. Your choices are:
* Swole - From not on, every one point of Strength you add as a result of a level-up stat is actually two points. This is not retroactive, nor does it apply to equipment-based upgrades. * Prison Bitch - You have an addition 20% strength bonus when fighting hand-to-hand with someone whose base strength is lower than yours. * Stepson - All kicks and foot-based attacks have an automatic 15% chance to inflict Ouch per hit. [[Category:Achievements]]

revision.comment: Created page with "== AI Description == You have been struck with and survived the dreaded ''Reverse Gravity'' Spell. Well, you fared better than Albert II, the first earth mammal to reach space alive. He was a rhesus monkey, in case you're wondering. He went up just fine. He didn't stick the landing. '''Reward:''' You can now tell people you're more durable than a monkey named Albert. [[Category:Achievements]]"
revision.text:
== AI Description == You have been struck with and survived the dreaded ''Reverse Gravity'' Spell. Well, you fared better than Albert II, the first earth mammal to reach space alive. He was a rhesus monkey, in case you're wondering. He went up just fine. He didn't stick the landing.
'''Reward:''' You can now tell people you're more durable than a monkey named Albert. [[Category:Achievements]]

== AI Description == '''New Quest. Where the Red God Glows'''
THIS IS A GROUP QUEST. All Crawlers currently within bubble number 543 will receive this quest.
''Your party has been designated Host of this Group Quest.''
No parties may opt-out of this quest.
Did you ever read the book ''Where the Red Fern Grows''?
Oh, it's great. It's about this kid who saves up his money to buy a couple of coonhounds. Little Ann and Old Dan. And there's a naughty cat involved. A bunch of stuff happens.
Anyway, did you ever notice this strange phenomenon when it comes to earth books about dogs? They always die in the end. Always. What kind of sick, sadistic fuckers are you?
Puppies shouldn't ever share a world with pain. Yet here we are. Thanks, earth culture.
[[Orthrus]] the giant puppy is getting shocked in the ass by a constant barrage of lightning. He's also getting bitten over and over in the ankles by a bunch of tenacious sharks. It's starting to hurt. Poor little guy. His health is going down.
His death will be the fault of all of you. Especially Crawler [[Carl]], who callously shoved the poor puppy into a bubble much too small and much too dangerous for him.
If Orthrus dies, the full-powered god [[Emberus]] will turn this bubble into a kiln. Good luck getting to the stairwell if that happens.
If the puppy survives the lightning storm and escapes the sharks, odds are pretty good you'll die anyway. But at least you'll die knowing you shed this world without ever causing harm to a defenseless puppy.
Oh, except Crawler [[Maggie My]]. She once ran over a baby Labrador with her Chevy Tahoe. What a bitch!
'''''Reward''''': It's a surprise.
'''Quest Complete! Where the Red God Glows!'''
You removed the puppy from danger! Hurray!
For everybody who was involved in this quest who actually didn't do anything, shame on you. The next time you're in mortal danger, I hope you remember this moment when nobody comes out of nowhere to save your ass. At least you all get the same reward.
'''''Reward''''': [[Dumber of the Flunkies|A new quest!]] [[Category:Quests]]

You have allowed a feral god to enter your current realm. That is the equivalent of dropping a grenade down your pants and shouting “Yolo!”
Here’s a fun fact. Other gods don’t like feral gods. They’ve been thrown into the [[Nothing]] for a reason. They tend to react to this sort of thing, depending on who you’ve brought out.
''Reward'': Whatever is about to happen is going to hit the ''[[Dungeon Crawler World]]'' blooper reel for sure. [[Category:Achievements]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A spell that makes someone attack themselves. [[Category:Spells]]"
revision.text: A spell that makes someone attack themselves. [[Category:Spells]]

The fifth achievement [[Carl]] receives upon entering the [[Dungeon]]'s [[First Floor|first floor]]. [[File:00080.jpg|thumb|Why aren't you wearing pants?]]
== AI Description == You entered the dungeon wearing no pants. Dude. Seriously?
'''Reward''': You've received a Gold [[Apparel Box]]!<ref>''Dungeon Crawler Carl'', Chapter 2</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

== AI Description == {{Character_info| image1 = 00866.jpg|species=Grease Gremlin|level=19|status=Deceased, spider ghoul}} Iron Tangle Steam Engine Train Technician.
Not all gremlins are bad or evil. Not all of them glory in the tearing of flesh and the rending of bone. Some prefer more quiet activities, such as boiler repair and heavy engineering. Then there are Grease Gremlins, who could go either way. The only thing keeping this guy from attacking you is that "Sensitivity Training" class human resources made him take in order to secure this job. As long as you don't abuse him or his beloved trains, you'll probably be fine. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

The '''Manual of Style''' is a set of guidelines to ensure consistency across articles and prevent duplicate pages. We encourage all contributors, old and new, to browse this section and our [[Spoiler Policy]] before editing. __TOC__ == Naming Conventions == In the process of cataloging, categorizing, and reorganizing articles, we found numerous duplicated pages with varying amounts of information. To prevent further confusion and rework, we are instituting the following naming conventions: ;Double-Check. :Before creating a new article, [[Special:Search]] the keywords to verify that the article does not already exist. If it does exist and the title is misspelled or does not fit our naming conventions, you can flag it with the correct title by opening the ''Source Editor''' and typing '''{{delete | Rename: correct name}}''' at the top of the page. An admin will come along and sort it out. ''(For more information on how this works, see {{t|delete}}.)'' **'''Note:''' ALL DUNGEON FLOORS HAVE PAGES. ;Don't start with articles (e.g. "The") :While "The" makes the title more epic, it creates chaos in the database. So, if you want to make a page for "The Mankini of Engorging," the page name would be "Mankini of Engorging". ;Do not capitalize prepositions or articles in a page name. These include but are not limited to: ** and ** at ** by ** for ** from ** in ** of ** on ** or ** the ** to ;Do not capitalize file extensions. :Always use lowercase for .jpg, .png, .gif, etc. ;Capitalize every word in the title (except those listed above). :Even if the title is not capitalized in the book, such as in an achievement, this simply prevents duplication and prevents confusion over whether the title should be capitalized. If an editor links to "Mankini of Engorging" on Matt Di's page, but the item's page name is "Mankini of engorging", the link will appear broken on Matt Di's page. ;Use Character's names, not titles. :For the sake of consistency, the page name should be the character's given name and not their title (e.g. "Donut" rather than "Princess Donut"). == Formatting Articles == We try to maintain a semi-consistent format across articles. ;Top Level Summary :Above any header, there should be a succinct 1-2 sentence summary of the topic. The subject should be mentioned by name, and the first instance of the subject's name should be in bold.
'''Matt Di''' is a Crawler from Earth.
;Quotes :'''Decorative Quotes.''' Use these only once, at the very top of the page. Note that For best results, you can Insert > Template > Quote in Visual Editor or type '''{{Quote | quote = your quote -- [[Speaker]] (Book #, Chapter #)}}''' in Source Editor.
:'''All other quotes.''' All other quotes should be entered as inline quotes or, if more than a few lines, formatted as blockquotes. Of course, if the decorative quote would make a bigger impact (as in the [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)]]), then use the decorative quote.
:All quotes should be properly attributed to the source material. ;Citations :Always include a "References" header and references list at the bottom of the page. Not sure how? Ask an admin! ;Links to other pages. :The first time the subject of another page is mentioned, it should be linked. The page should be clearly identified so that the reader knows what it links to (e.g. "The neighbor's dog, [[Angel]], bit down" versus "[[Angel | the neighbor's dog]] bit down"). Subsequent mentions of the topic do not need to be linked. == Suggested Standardized Article Categories == This is not a hard and fast list; however, we recommend using the Infoboxes and Navboxes where available. === Characters === * '''Character_info''' Infobox * '''Description'''. An overview of this character and their personality. * '''Appearance'''. If I wanted to illustrate this character, what details would I need? * '''History'''. * '''Story'''. Remember to abide by our [[Spoiler Policy]] and take advantage of our awesome spoiler tools! * '''Progression'''. The character's levels, stats, and gear, broken up by book or by floor. Once again, remember our Spoiler Policy. * '''Trivia'''. For the weird facts that don't fit anywhere, like the exact size of Carl's foot. * '''Speculation'''. Theories that make sense based on stated evidence (preferably in the section) but cannot be supported or verified by the text. Note that our two protagonists, [[Carl]] and [[Donut]], have their own categories and more page options than other characters. === Items === * '''Items infobox.''' * '''AI Description.''' What the AI ''says'' the item does. * '''Description'''. What the item actually does, and how it works. * '''Appearance'''. If I wanted to illustrate this item, what details would I need? Sometimes this will be covered in description. * '''Operation'''. For digging deep into how something works, like the [[Goblin Copper Chopper]]. * '''Story'''. Relevance to the story so far. * '''Trivia'''. * '''Speculation'''. * {{t|Navbox Items}} <-- add to the bottom of every items page, below the references. [[Category:Wiki Policies]]

[[Carl]] drank a trick pitcher of lemonade [[Bonnie]] made thinking it would help him fight [[Denise]] the goose.
==Description== Oh, I'm sorry. Did you think this was an important potion?
Magic doesn't work, dumbass. It's lemonade!
''Reward:'' It really is delicious. Too bad you're about to splatter against the roof of the catacombs. [[Category:Achievements]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A mage class that specialises in wind magic. [[Category:Class]]"
revision.text: A mage class that specialises in wind magic. [[Category:Class]]

Wisp Armor is a protective spell that blocks a portion of incoming damage form magic-based attacks. == AI Description == '''Cost''': 5 Mana
'''Target''': Self Only
'''Duration''': 5 minutes + 1 minute per level of spell. Requires 5 minute cooldown.
Surrounds your body with tendrils of light. While ineffective against physical attacks, this spell negates 75% of incoming damage from magic-based attacks. Provides temporary immunity to mind-control effects. Higher skill levels increase both effectiveness and duration. It also makes you look all wispy and ethereal and druid-like. A great spell to have if you’re a club kid or trying to bang a vegan. [[Category:Spells]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Flesh Mechanic]]|species=[[Dirigible Gnome]]|first_appearance=Chapter 6, Book 4|status=Deceased, killed by [[Low Thi]] in Subterranean zone of Bubble #543.|level=50}}He was held hostage and used as collateral to prevent the Dirigible Gnomes from bombing [[Hump Town]].
== AI Description == The Dirigible Gnomes were once a peaceful race. All they ever wanted were two things. One, to figure out how the world worked. And two, to be left alone.
In order to escape a busy, teeming world filled with competing intelligent species, all of whom loved to wage war, the Dirigible Gnomes learned how to take to the clouds, building a variety of airships and floating settlements, allowing them to escape any sort of trouble.
But as we all know, trouble doesn't care if you want to be found.
The history of the Dirigible Gnomes is long, complicated, and tragic. But the end result is the inevitable result of all peaceful races. They were forced to choose between fighting or being wiped out. They chose to fight.
Wynne is the great and favored uncle of [[Commandant Kane]] of the Dreadnaught ''[[Wasteland]]''. He is a Flesh Mechanic, a healer gifted with the ability to bring the dead back to life, if only temporarily. He is being held as hostage by the Dromedarians, as a guarantee of peace. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Blood Tracker]]|species=[[Mantis]]|occupation=Hunter|first_appearance=Chapter 5, Book 5|status=Deceased, killed by Carl's guided missiles in Zockau|party=[[The Dark Hive]]|allies=[[Vrah]]}}Zindy was a hunter that was killed by Carl, her mother, [[Circe Took|Circe]], hosted a panel at [[CrawlCon]].
She was meant to take over from her [[Vrah|sister]] and become the hives next top hunter. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Hunters]] [[Category:Aliens]]

Yarilo is the god of lust. Ghazi wished for Yarilo to grant him a boon that would make Lika fall in love with him. Ghazi attempts to summon Yarilo, but instead the goddess Psamanthe ([[Samantha]]) duped him and pretended to be Yarilo. Yarilo was in attendance at the first Butcher's Masquerade and was the god who broke the peace seal. As punishment, Apito sent him to the Nothing. [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]]

[[Carl]] talked his way out of fighting [[Ringmaster Grimaldi]] - Pestiferous Vine.
==Description== You initiated a boss battle, and it somehow ended with neither of you dead. What a disappointment you are. What a goddamned smear.
''Reward:'' Pussies don't get prizes. [[Category:Achievements]]

A goddess who is part of the [[Orisha]] pantheon. She almost made it to the [[Halls of Ascendancy]] by herself.
== Shrine == If her shrine is repaired she will give each squad a special card. [[Eileithyia|Eileithya]] will also grant a single boon to each participant.
== AI Description == '''Goddess of Rivers Yemaya. Level 250.'''
'''This is a locked deity. She will not be sponsored this season.'''
'''This goddess is a retainer of [[Eileithyia]].'''
'''Warning: This is a deity. She is invulnerable on this floor.'''
''This goddess is in her own temple. Temple appearance rules apply. That means watch the fuck out.''
Yemaya was once the goddess of all oceans, all bodies of water big and small. But she was more than that, too. She was the queen of love and the bringer of life. But, eventually, her people died off, her temples crumbled, and she was forgotten by all except her dear friend, the goddess Eileithyia, who wished every day that her old friend could someday come back from the land of the forgotten.
Now that Yemaya has re-ascended into the Halls, she will have a lot of work to do to make certain nobody ever forgets her name again. She's an unlikely candidate to claim the throne, but she would work tirelessly for her good friend Eileithyia, should she desire such a burden. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Deities]] [[Category:NPC]]

A race with three genders, all three of which are required to reproduce. The women, children and unintelligent third gender live together. The males are forced out when they reach maturity, they often work as mercenaries or bounty hunters but can't work with others of their kind unless they fight. Some of the males are castrated.
== Known Yenk ==
* [[Bravvo]] * [[Ikicha]]
[[Category:Races]]

{{Character_info|age=~50|height=4'11"|species=Human|origin=Wenatchee, Washington|occupation=Certified Nurse Aide|first_appearance=Chapter 22|status=Deceased, killed by [[Rage Elemental]] on [[Second Floor|the second floor]]|party=Meadow Lark|level=9|title1=Yolanda Martinez 13|image1=00020.jpg}}Yolanda Martinez is a nurse who worked at [[Meadow Lark]] eldercare facility.
== Gear == She was armed with a bow with a quiver over her shoulder that almost reached the ground. She was dressed in medical scrubs.
== Trivia == The rest of Meadowlark later named their [[Safehome Yolanda|safe room]] after her. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

Admin Notice. This page may contain spoilers. Read at your own risk.
Posting spoilers for Book 7 will result in “acceleration” per this wiki’s rules. Author of the 10th edition of [[Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Item)|The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook]]. Wrote many philosophical essays. == Entries == Reading the words of those who have come before me, I know them. You, reading this. I know you, too. You are me. That is who this book finds. I have been alone my whole life. I have been surrounded by my hive, yet I have been alone. That is okay, I now know. It is acceptable to have your own thoughts, your own mind, despite what they say. But it is also acceptable to be alone and want the strength of the hive. There is no shame in that. No contradiction. That is what this book attempts. To make a hive of those who will never cross paths, except in these pages. Yet sometimes this book is not enough. You sometimes want more. You want to belong. Again, there is no shame. There is no shame in wanting to be alone yet also wanting the comfort and the strength of your brethren. But more importantly, there is no shame in wanting to protect those who are your hive, even if you never knew them. For they are yours, and they are being taken. It is us or it is them. There is consolation in dying in the pursuit of justice, no matter how small or big that death is. (Chapter 15, Book 3) [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Former Crawlers]] [[Category:Anarchists]] [[Category:Aliens]]

page.title: You're the reason why daddy drinks

revision.text:
[[Carl]] stepped on and smushed at least 50 gerbils after relenting to the [[System AI|System AI's]] want for him to squish things with his bare feet.
==Description== You have, for an unspecified reason, raised the ire of the System AI. You have corrected the issue, and everything is back to normal. The acceleration action has been suspended. This time.
Good boy.
''Reward:'' You've received a Gold [[Makeup Sex is the Best Sex Box]]. [[Category:Achievements]]

page.title: You've discovered and read an official dungeon sign

revision.text:
[[Carl]] receives this achievement after reading the "[[Tutorial Guild Hall|Tutorial Guild]]" sign on the [[First Floor|first floor]].<ref name=":0">Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 20). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref> Presumably, most crawlers received the same achievement and reward when they found [[Tutorial Guild Hall|tutorial guilds]].
== AI Description == '''New achievement! You’ve discovered and read an official dungeon sign.'''
'''Wow. You can read. Whoopie.'''
'''''Reward:'' All official dungeon signage will now be highlighted and easier to spot. Nearby guilds will appear on your minimap.<ref name=":0" />'''
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

[[Carl]] earns this achievement after finding and entering a [[Tutorial Guild Hall]] on the [[First Floor|first floor.]]
== AI Description == '''New achievement! You’ve entered a guildhall!'''
'''Congratulations. You know how to open doors.'''
'''''Reward:'' That sense of fulfillment you feel? That’s reward enough.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (pp. 50-51; chapter 5). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>'''
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

page.title: You've inflicted damage on a mob

revision.text:
[[Carl]] receives this achievement after engaging in combat for the first time on the [[First Floor|first floor]]. Presumably, all crawlers receive this achievement the first time they fight a mob.
== AI Description == '''New achievement! You’ve inflicted damage on a mob.'''
'''Hopefully it won’t hit back!'''
'''''Reward:'' It’s probably going to hit back.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 50). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

[[Carl]] receives this achievement after killing his first [[Goblins|mob]] on the [[First Floor|first floor]].
== AI Description == '''New achievement! You’ve killed a mob!'''
'''You’re a murderer! He probably had a family!'''
'''''Reward:'' You can now gain experience. Get enough of it, and you might even go up a level.'''<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 50). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

page.title: You've killed a mob with your bare fucking hands!

revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:You've killed an armed mob with your bare fucking hands!}}
Carl receives this achievement on the [[First Floor|first floor]], at the same time he receives the "[[You've killed a mob!]]" achievement.
== AI Description == '''New achievement! You’ve killed an armed mob with your bare fucking hands!'''
'''Holy crap, dude. That’s kinda fucked up.'''
'''''Reward:'' You’ve received a [[Weapon Box|Bronze Weapon Box]]!<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 50). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>'''
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

[[Carl]] discovered a city boss, Ringmaster Grimaldi.
==Description== ''But you can sure die trying.''
You have discovered a city boss!
That's right. Let me say that again for the assholes in the back.
A.
CITY.
FUCKING.
BOSS.
Welp. If you gonna go, you might as well do it with style.
Just an FYI. As of this moment in the current season of ''Dungeon Crawler World'', not a single Crawler has faced a city boss and survived. And for good reason. Only a complete moron would voluntarily put themselves in a situation where they had to fight one of the most powerful monsters on the level.
''Reward:'' A lot of people are probably going to watch you die. That's a better prize than most of us get. [[Category:Achievements]]

page.title: You Crossed a Line You Didn't Even Know Was There

revision.text:
[[Carl]] used the [[Enchanted Night Wyrm’s Ring of Divine Suffering|Ring of Divine Suffering]] for the first time.
==Description== You used an artifact of Divine Suffering for the first time. Hopefully there aren't any unintended and unadvertised side effects of using such a powerful and evil magical item. Don't mind that tingle at the back of your mind. It's probably nothing.
''Reward:'' You've received a [[The Nightworms Nasty Little Web of Suffering|Gold Junkie's box]]. [[Category:Achievements]]

page.title: You Know Everyone Can See You Right Box

revision.text: {{stub}} [[Category:Loot Boxes]]

== AI Description == You have killed an infant! An ''infant''!
Okay, okay. Unless you’re a complete psychopath, we know you probably didn’t wake up this morning and tell yourself, “Today is the day I’m going to slaughter a child.” Well let us put your mind at ease. All children mobs who die within this dungeon don’t actually perish. They’re transferred to a holding area where they’re safe and treated nicely and gently until they can be reunited with their loving parents at the end of the season.
Feel better? Good.
'''Reward''': These past twenty seconds, when your conscience started to ease? That was your reward. It was also a lie. That baby is dead, and it’s dead because of you. You’re totally going to hell.
You’ve also received a Bronze [[Asshole's Box|Asshole’s Box]]. [[Category:Achievements]]

== AI Description == A mob has been injured because of something you purposely left lying around the dungeon. From scattered Legos to spiked pits to buckets of flesh-devouring Skinner Ants to dimensional rifts that instantly boil all the blood in one's body, the art of trapmaking has a celebrated and storied history in the annals of ''Dungeon Crawler World''.
So if you're going to do it, you better do it right. Whatever it was that gave you this achievement, it was probably something stupid. This will help you make the next trap more... exciting.
Remember, if you don't make it titillating, we will.
'''Reward:''' You've received a Gold [[Sapper's Box]]! [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:01036.png|thumb|You found stairs]]
== AI Description == You have found a stairwell down to the next floor. They say the cream rises to the top. So what does that say about you?
'''Reward:''' This barely qualifies as an achievement. Your reward is that you're alive to read this. [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Quote | quote = Kids shouldn’t be in here. Youth assistants shouldn’t be here. It’s really strange. <small>-- [[Mordecai]] (Book 5, p. 362).</small> }}
Youth assistants are a relatively new position. Stationed at the [[Kinder Facility|kinder facility]] on the planet's surface, they look after children who descended the dungeon stairwells after the [[The Transformation|transformation]] but were deemed too young to enter the [[dungeon]].<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Butcher's Masquerade'' (chapter 37).</ref>
This season, youth assistants are [[Borant Corporation|Borant]] employees and located in Mumbai, India.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. ''The Eye of the Bedlam Bride'' (chapter 19).</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Dungeon Backstage]]

page.title: You’ve killed a mob a higher level than yourself!

revision.text:
Carl earns this achievement after his first [[Goblins|goblin]] encounter on the [[First Floor|first floor]].
== AI Description == '''New achievement! You’ve killed a mob a higher level than yourself!'''
'''You’re getting the hang of this. Don’t let it get to your head.'''
'''''Reward:'' You’ve received a [[Adventurer Box|Bronze Adventurer Box]]!<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Dungeon Crawler Carl: A LitRPG/Gamelit Adventure (p. 50). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>'''
== References == <references /> [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Floor 1]]

Ysalte is the goddess of hopelessnes and insanity, she is also known as The Vinegar Bitch. She is worshiped by the Semeru dwarfts of Laracos, their name for her is “The Downward Spiral”. She often makes an appearance near the end of the [[9th floor]]. She is a water and earth goddess and only has a single temple in the entire dungeon.
She is known to kill any crawler that comes near her and there are no records of her being worshipped by crawlers.
[[Amayon]] is her former boyfriend and father of her child, she attempted to leave but he stopped her. He is also his retainer.
Her motives are unknown but she is currently being sponsored by the [[Nebular]].
== History == Her summoning on the fifth floor was blocked due to the risk of extinction.
She was killed by [[Paz Lo|Paz]] at the end of the eigth floor by using [[Katia Grim|Katia's]] [[Bolt of Ophiotaurus]].
== Appearance == She is a young female dwarf carrying a pickaxe, she wears a helmet with a sparking candle on it. Her face occasionally flickers like a television screen.
== AI Description == '''Goddess of Hopelessness and Insanity Ysalte. Level 250.'''
'''This god is sponsored by Pontifex Shine of the Nebular Balance.'''
'''Warning: This sponsor is ''not'' currently inhabiting the shell of this deity. She will speak and react as per her regular nature. Considering who this is, that's some bad fucking news for you guys.'''
'''Warning: This is a deity. She is invulnerable on this floor.'''
''This goddess has been temporarily summoned to this location due to a special boss battle event and will return to the Ascendancy upon completion of the event.''
The earliest citizens of Larracos always worshipped Ysalte, which is fitting. She hasn't always been considered the Goddess of Hopelessness and Insanity. First it was of the Dirt. Then it was of Tears. It's a recent thing that they started calling her something else. The Downward Spiral. The Vinegar Bitch.
Her downfall mirrors that of the citizens of Larracos, who have embraced the deity in all her forms.
That's what happens when everything you know is upended, and everything is taken from you. First they vilify you. Then they separate you. Then they blame you for what they're doing to you. Then they hunt you. It's the step after which is important.
The one where they start to fear you.
Ysalte has a special place in her heart for the outcasts, for those whose minds are being devoured by the world around them. She takes no new worshippers, beyond the citizens of Larracos. But she is known to be a great patron of the arts and is one of the few deities who will sponsor a bard or a performer. She asks nothing in return, though occasionally her gifts are more than what they seem, and some may even carry a curse.
The story of this goddess, like that of many of her kind, is long and a little sad. At this point, how it began isn't nearly as important as how it will end. She is half-sister and niece to her former lover, [[Taranis]]. Threatened with the Nothing by [[Apito]], she fled to Sheol. She has since returned to the Halls of Ascendancy, where she is feared and reviled by all.
She is not considered someone who wishes to lead, which makes her a dangerous and cunning contender for the Ascendancy throne.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:NPC]] [[Category:Deities]]

{{Character_info|age=Teenager|species=Human|origin=Seattle|first_appearance=Chapter 43|status=Deceased, strangled|allies=* [[Frank Q]] * [[Maggie My]]|level=1}}
Daughter of [[Maggie My]] and [[Frank Q]]. Advised by their game guide to kill other players, but refuses, even as her parents stalk and kill eight, including [[Rebecca W]].
Injured when Frank Q takes a lit stick of dynamite from a booby-tapped rat corpse left by [[Carl]]. Strangled to death by Maggie My. It was later revealed that she was using the [[Enchanted Night Wyrm’s Ring of Divine Suffering]] when she was injured which made it impossible to heal her wounds.
== Relationships == She didn't get on well with her parents and was running away from home when the dungeon was created. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawler]]

{{Character_info|class=[[Beastmaster]]|species=[[Atoll]]|occupation=Hunter|first_appearance=|status=Deceased|party=|allies=|level=66}} Hunter, killed by his own traps when Carl cast ''[[Tripper]]''. He was the final Hunter on floor 6.
He hunts for the survival of the [[Atoll]], using the money to pay for the upkeep of his habitat as their races has limited employment opportunities. Without the money from hunting crawlers his community would have to agree an indentureship with another system.
His [[Night Weasel|night weasel]] mobs attacked [[Carl]] as he entered the floor.
He managed to collect twenty five crawlers sculpts.
==Gear== He owns a trappers bandoleer.
He got a Drop Sheild and an Invisibility Pack from the prize counter.
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Hunters]] [[Category:Aliens]]
[[File:00540.jpg|thumb|Zebani HR manager]] Human-looking but with a blue tinge to their skin. [[Category:Races]]

== Description == This spell transfers a town or city and all the NPC's inside it to a random location one floor down (on the [[Scolopendra|Scolopendra Level]]s, it skips to the next Scolopendra Level). It has a five-minute cast, and can only be used at the end of a floor. When the town lands, it kills everything it lands on, which is immediately respawned as a [[Child of Inpewt]]. The Children actively hunt everyone in the town and the caster until they are all dead. Any townspeople killed also turn into Children.
"This spell always leads to carnage. Everybody likes carnage when it's not them." -Quasar, Page 35, Chapter 3 of [[The Butcher's Masquerade]]
== Famous Users == [[Remex]] the Grand [[Category:Spells]]

{{Character_info | species = [[Kua-Tin]] | height = 2' (61 cm) | occupation = Assistant Communication Representative | first_appearance = Book 1, Chapter 36 | party = | organizations = The [[Borant Corporation]] | allies = * [[Donut]] | status = Alive }}{{Quote | quote = Hi, Carl. I’m watching. The whole universe is watching. We’re all rooting for you.<ref>Dinniman, Matt. Carl's Doomsday Scenario: Dungeon Crawler Carl Book 2 (p. 101). Dandy House. Kindle Edition.</ref>}} '''Zev''' is the [[Royal Court of Princess Donut]]'s "Outreach Associate" or PR agent.
== Description == Zev works in the [[Borant Corporation]] communications department as a low-ranked liaison between her company and privately-produced shows that want to feature crawlers.<ref name=":0">{{ref|1|36}}</ref> She monitors her clients, coordinates their show appearances, hosts focus groups to gather viewers' opinions, and has the power to sign official documents on her clients' behalf.<ref name=":1">{{ref|1|37}}</ref><ref name=":4">{{ref|2|11}}</ref> As a [[Kua-Tin]] who is not a member of the controlling political party, the [[Bloom|Bloom]], she struggles to advance her career, but she tries to put her clients' best interests first.
[[Donut]] and Zev quickly bond over their shared love of scripted Earth television, and begin chatting nonstop.<ref>{{ref|1|39}}</ref> They plan to write an intergalactic version of ''Gossip Girl'' together after Donut leaves the Dungeon.<ref>{{ref|2|23}}</ref>
== Appearance == The first time Zev ventures into the Dungeon (appearing in the room with a ''pop''), she kits herself out in full-body armor because there are no [[Protections | protections]] for staff on the first three floors: a round glass helmet filled with bubbling water piped from a bulky backpack, and a white mesh "spacesuit."<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{ref|2|15}}</ref><ref>{{ref|2|16}}</ref> At all times, even in armor, she is required to wear a badge indicating that she is not a member of the Bloom.<ref name=":0"/>
==History== Zev has been in Earth's orbit for fifteen years with nothing to watch but Earth programs. She is particularly fond of ''Gossip Girl'' and ''Riverdale.''<ref name=":0" /> She tried to write a ''Gossip Girl'' fanfic, but it didn't receive many hits.<ref name=":3" />
== Story == Not long after meeting [[Carl]] and [[Donut]], Zev makes the mistake of warning Carl about the [[Rage Elemental]] over chat and is censured by the [[System AI]] for "Cheating."<ref name=":1" /> She successfully appeals the ruling and clears her record, but notes, "Once the AI notices you, it's difficult to get it to un-notice you, so I have to be extra careful from now on."<ref name=":3">{{ref|1|44}}</ref>
On the [[Third Floor]], Zev continues to keep Carl and Donut apprised of public opinion. She helps Carl negotiate with the ''[[Vengeance of the Daughter]]'' producers, and -- intentionally or not -- clues him into Donut and Mongo's predicament by saying, "It's amazing. Both of these dramas playing out at the same time."<ref name=":4"/> Although she can'not tell them anything about the greater universe that they don't already know, Zev does her best to give Carl and Donut as much information as possible without breaking the rules.<ref>{{ref|2|12}}</ref>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Dungeon Admins]] [[Category:Syndicate Citizens]]

{{SpoilH | 6}}{{Character_info | class = [[Boring Ol' Mage]] | species = Human | first_appearance = Book 6, Chapter 32 | age = Late 50s | organizations = [[Desperado Club]] | allies = * [[Emir Akbas]] | status = Alive | level = 52 | skills = [[Mute]] }} '''Zeynep''' is a crawler from the middle east. She and [[Carl]] trade fist bumps on the [[Eighth Floor]].
==Description== Zeynep is a middle aged middle eastern woman whose crawler ID is similar enough to those of her three other party members that [[Carl]] suspects they entered the [[Dungeon]] together. She may also be in a party with [[Burcu]].
Carl finds her, [[Emir Akbas]], and two younger women dancing together in the [[Desperado Club]] shortly before executing the assassination. Zeynep is the only member of her four-person group to trade contact info with him, and ultimately casts [[Mute]] on Emir to prevent him from attacking Carl.<ref>{{ref|6|32}}</ref>
==References== <references/>
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Crawlers]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]][[Category:Floor 8]]

{{Character_info |image1=00587.jpg |origin=China |occupation=Warehouse Worker |first_appearance=Book 1, Chapter 42 |allies=* [[Li Jun]] * [[Li Na]] * [[Carl]] * [[Donut]] * [[Katia Grim]] |species=Human |class=[[Earth Mover]] |skills=[[Dirt Clod]] |level=28 (Book 3, Chapter 32) |guild = [[Safehome Yolanda]]}} '''Zhang''' is a crawler from China. He is partied with [[Li Na]] and [[Li Jun]].
==Description== On Earth, Zhang and his best friend Li Jun worked together at a warehouse in China. They entered the [[Dungeon]] with their warehouse manager and Li Na, who Zhang has a crush on. On the [[Second Floor]], Zhang and Li Jun appear on ''[[Death Watch Extreme Dungeon Mayhem]]'' with [[Carl]], who gives them advice that allows them to save their party.<ref name=":0"/> The group are now unwavering allies of the [[Royal Court of Princess Donut]], but neither Zhang nor Li Jun are willing to tell Carl when his plans are terrible.<ref name=":2">{{ref|3|32}}</ref>
Zhang chooses to remain [[Human]] during [[Third Floor]] race selection, and takes the mage/tank-combo [[Earth Mover]] [[Class]].<ref name=":1">{{ref|3|31}}</ref>
== Appearance == Zhang is bald. By the Fourth Floor, he is equipped with glowing, black and gold segmented armor.<ref name=":1"/>
==Story== Zhang, Li Jun, their manager, and Li Na defeat a neighborhood boss during their first week in the Dungeon. The four-person group is boxed in between hatching [[Brindle Vespa]] and [[Troglodyte]]s on the [[Second Floor]] when a [[Time Freeze Spell]] hits them and Zhang and Li Jun are teleported onto the [[Maestro | Maestro's]] show, ''Death Watch Extreme Mayhem''. Zhang wants to use their two "teleport points" to rescue Li Jun and Li Na from the impossible situation, sacrificing himself, before Carl whispers instructions to escape the situation and manipulates the Maestro into sending the men back before the spell expires. Abruptly teleported back to the fight, Zhang is the first to react; he barks orders at Li Jun, grabs their severely injured manager, and the group shoulder their way passed the lizards and to safety.<ref name=":0">{{ref|1|42}}</ref>
{{Spoiler | book = 3 | spoiler = Their group grows to twelve members before they meet Carl again on the [[Fourth Floor]] Iron Tangle. At some point in the past two floors, Zhang received a [[Shrink Wand]], which he previously used to choke a monster to death with its own collar, and to shrink an oncoming train, killing every mob on board. He gained six levels, a [[Boss Box]], and a multi-kill box for doing so. After Carl saves their group for a second time, Zhang gifts him the wand a single charge left.<ref name=":1"/> He, Li Jun, and Li Na are instrumental in orchestrating the finale on the Fourth Floor. Zhang pilots the portal cart.<ref name=":2"/>}}{{Spoiler |book = 4 | spoiler = In the [[Fifth Floor]] Bubbles, Zhang's team close in on their final quadrant (an underwater castle) with just under five days remaining on the timer.<ref>{{ref|4|20}}</ref> After Carl begins using the [[Gate of the Feral Gods]], Zhang uncharacteristically descends the stairs but leaves Li Jun and Li Na behind to report on the neighboring bubble.<ref>{{ref|4|33}}</ref>}}{{Spoiler |book = 5 | spoiler = Zhang's team works with [[Katia Grim | Katia Grim's]] team on the [[Sixth Floor]] Hunting Grounds, helping her track down [[Eva Sigrid]]. He participates in the Butcher's Masquerade, and enters the talent show with Li Jun and Li Na; they juggle knives in a circle.<ref>{{ref|5|73}}</ref> Zhang is rendered unconscious in the final battle against [[Imogen | Queen Imogen]], but is able to proceed to the Seventh and Eighth Floors.<ref>{{ref|5|77}}</ref>}}{{Spoiler |book = 6 | spoiler = Zhang's team chooses Beijing for the first phase of the [[Eighth Floor]], and joins [[Safehome Yolanda]] after the [[Guilds]] system. In the third phase, they arrive at the Soho Building after the [[Battle of Beijing]], and meet [[Lucia Mar]] in the stairwell. She gives them the [[Doggy Door]] personal space upgrade. Zhang, Li Jun, and Li Na proceed to install it in [[Imani C]]'s room and use it to carry out Carl's "suicide mission."<ref>{{ref|6|63}}</ref> Carl puts Zhang in charge of using Carl's new Shrink Wand, and Zhang only uses two charges before returning it to Carl.<ref>{{ref|6|72}}</ref>}}
==Progression== ===Second Floor=== When Zhang appears on ''Death Watch'', he does not have an obvious weapon. His stats are: *Level: 7 *Constitution: 15 *Strength: 8
===Fourth Floor=== Li Jun is now Level 28 and equipped with unidentified enchanted armor.<ref name=":1"/> He knows [[Dirt Clod]] and has immunity to acid attacks.
===Sixth Floor=== Li Jun demonstrates an ability to extend the timers on unconscious mobs.
==References== <references/>
[[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Earth Crawlers]] [[Category:Crawlers]]
